ArmErgometer.name: Arm Ergometer
ArmErgometer.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp handle bars. Select "quick start" or enter program.
ArmErgometer.comments: Adjust height of arm crank shaft to shoulder height. Adjust length of crank to allow elbow to extend, yet opposite arm to remain just in front of body. Intensity can be altered by resistance and speed (revolutions per minute).

BurpeeAdvanced.name: Burpee (advanced)
BurpeeAdvanced.preparation: Stand upright with arms to sides.
BurpeeAdvanced.execution: Bend over and squat down. Place hands on floor, slightly wider than shoulder-width. While holding upper body in place, buck hips ups slightly by extending knees and hips, then immediately kick legs back. Land on forefeet with body in straight, plank position.
BurpeeAdvanced.comments: Perform push-up by lowering body to floor by bending arms to sides. Push body back up by extending arms while maintaining straight body position.

BackPedal.name: Back Pedal
BackPedal.preparation: Stand facing away from running lane with foot planted back. Bend over at hips with legs and arms bent.
BackPedal.execution: Run backward through running lane while keeping torso bent over. Keep upright and land on balls of feet.
BackPedal.comments: Perform Back Pedal on open area with even surface to avoid accidents. Consider setting up pathway of unobtrusive markers to guide runner.

Burpee.name: Burpee
Burpee.preparation: Stand upright with arms to sides.
Burpee.execution: Bend over and squat down. Place hands on floor, slightly wider than shoulder width. While holding upper body in place, buck hips ups slightly by extending knees and hips, then immediately kick legs back. Land on forefeet with body in straight, plank position. Keeping upper body in place buck hip up and rapidly pull legs forward under body returning feet in original position. Rise up to original standing posture.
Burpee.comments: Intensity can be increased by executing exercises faster. Phases include:

CrabWalk.name: Crab Walk
CrabWalk.preparation: Sit on floor facing direction of crawling path. Place arms back to each side and bend knees so hands and feet are on floor. Raise hips off of floor.
CrabWalk.comments: Standard hand position is typically pointing out to sides, however, hands can also point back as shown. Intensity is normally increased by crawling faster. Although not commonly performed, crawling up long incline surfaces (eg: grassy hill side) would also make exercise more challenging. Also see

ClimbMill.name: Climb Mill / Tread Wall
ClimbMill.preparation: Face wall. Grasp handholds above head and position feet on lower holds.
ClimbMill.execution: Climb wall by continuously grasping higher handholds and positioning feet onto higher holds below.
ClimbMill.comments: Step down when finished. Apparatus shown uses bodyweight with sensors to move wall downward as participant climbs. Speeds of wall's descent can be preset but it also adjusts to participant's speed. Turn of wheel changes angle of wall from easy slope to severe overhang. Although many more articulations are used in climbing, only most commonly used movements to raise body weight (eg: hip extension) or larger body segments (eg: hip flexion) are listed.

ButtKick.name: Butt Kick
ButtKick.preparation: Lean forward slightly with staggered stance. Bend arms to sides.
ButtKick.execution: Jog while pulling heels up high towards glutes. Keep body upright with head up, arms to sides, and hands relaxed. Continue until specific distance is covered or desired number of kicks have been completed.
ButtKick.comments: This drill can be used as either

BearCrawl.name: Bear Crawl
BearCrawl.preparation: Kneel on hands and knees facing crawling path. Raise knees off of floor, but keep hips low.
BearCrawl.execution: Crawl forward while keeping hips low.
BearCrawl.comments: Intensity is normally increased by crawling faster. Although not commonly performed, crawling up long incline surface (eg: grassy hill side) would also make exercise more challenging. Also see somewhat similar movement on machine:

CrabWalkBackward.name: Crab Walk (backward)
CrabWalkBackward.preparation: Sit on floor facing away from direction of crawling path. Place arms back to each side and bend knees so hands and feet are on floor. Raise hips off of floor.
CrabWalkBackward.comments: Standard hand position is typically pointing out to sides, however, hands can also point back as shown. Intensity is normally increased by crawling faster. Although not commonly performed, crawling up long incline surfaces (eg: grassy hillsides) would also make exercise more challenging. Also see

CycleCrossTrainer.name: Cycle Cross-Trainer
CycleCrossTrainer.preparation: Sit on seat with feet on pedals and grasp handle bars. Select "start".
CycleCrossTrainer.execution: Pedal while alternating handle bars back and forth.
CycleCrossTrainer.comments: Adjust seat so knees are short of full extension. Intensity can be altered by resistance and speed (revolutions per minute).

Cycling.name: Bicycling
Cycling.preparation: Set saddle height to allow for slight knee flexion (bend) of leg when fully extended (when foot is at 6 o’clock). Position one foot on ground and other foot on pedal positioned high and forward. While establishing balance on bike, push pedal downward with foot. Raise other foot off of ground and place it on opposite pedal.
Cycling.execution: Continue to push pedal with foot (power foot) by extending hip and knee to propel bike forward while opposite foot (recovery foot) maintains contact with other pedal. Once the recovery foot is in position, push pedal with opposite foot to continue cycle. Repeat this sequence of power and recovery alternating between sides to keep the bike in motion while maintaining balance.
Cycling.comments: Adjust seat so knees are just short of full extension.

EllipticalCrossTrainer.name: Elliptical Cross-Trainer
EllipticalCrossTrainer.preparation: Step on pedal platforms and grasp handlebars on each arm lever. Select "quick start" or enter program.
EllipticalCrossTrainer.execution: Pedal forward while alternating the arm levers back and forth.
EllipticalCrossTrainer.comments: Pedaling backward can be performed for variety or for active recovery. Intensity can be altered by resistance/speed (strides per minute). Lower resistance allows for greater speed which increases exercise intensity. Also see

EllipticalGlider.name: Elliptical Glider
EllipticalGlider.preparation: Step on pedal platforms and grasp handle rails. Select "quick start" or enter program.
EllipticalGlider.execution: Pedal forward by placing weight on one foot while allowing the other foot to move forward on opposite pedal. Alternate with opposite side until momentum allows continued forward rotation.
EllipticalGlider.comments: Avoid transferring body weight onto handle bars. Pedaling backwards can be performed for variety or for active recovery. Intensity can be altered by resistance/speed (strides per minute). Lower resistance allows for greater speed which increases exercise intensity. Also see

MBSplitJump.name: Medicine Ball Split Jump
MBSplitJump.preparation: Stand with one foot forward and other foot back with knees initially bent only slightly. Hold medicine ball with both hands near chest. Dip body down by bending legs more.
MBSplitJump.execution: Jump up while extending ball upward. Quickly reposition legs, and land with feet in opposite positions. Immediately pull ball back to chest while dipping body down by bending legs just short of rear knee making contact with floor. Keep torso upright and hip of rear leg straight. Repeat sequence with opposite leg movement. Continue jumps by while alternating leg positions.
MBSplitJump.comments: are required, so hip of rear leg can extend back without pulling upper body forward.

GauntletStairClimber.name: Stepmill
GauntletStairClimber.preparation: Step onto stairs and grasp hand rails. Select "quick start" or enter program.
GauntletStairClimber.execution: Climb stairs to keep pace with machine.
GauntletStairClimber.comments: Avoid transferring body weight onto handle bars. Intensity can be altered by increasing speed (steps per minute). Also see

EllipticalTrainer.name: Elliptical Trainer
EllipticalTrainer.preparation: Step on pedal platforms and grasp handle rails. Select "quick start" or enter program.
EllipticalTrainer.execution: Pedal forward by placing weight on one foot, allowing the other foot to move forward. Alternate with opposite side until momentum allows continued forward rotation.
EllipticalTrainer.comments: Avoid transferring body weight onto handle bars. Pedaling backwards can be performed for variety or for active recovery. Adjustments to the incline shift emphasis to certain muscle groups displayed on console. Intensity can be altered by resistance/speed (strides per minute). Lower resistance allows for greater speed which increases exercise intensity. Also see

Grapevine.name: Grapevine
Grapevine.preparation: Stand with right side facing intended path, feet slightly apart and knees slightly bent.
Grapevine.execution: Hop off of left foot and step right foot slightly forward and to right of where left foot was placed. As right forefoot makes contact with ground, step left leg behind right foot. Hop up off of ground with left foot and pull right leg back underbody while pulling left knee up high. Hop up off of right foot and step left foot across front of where right foot was placed. Continue movement pattern to desired point or duration by crossing trailing leg over, stepping back into place, crossing trailing leg behind, and stepping back into place. If desired, repeat in the opposite direction so that left leg leads.
Grapevine.comments: The Grapevine is a lateral movement drill typically used as warm-up drill. The movement involves moving sideways with feet crossing in front and behind each other. Keep knees bent, shoulders relaxed, and head up. Start slow and build up pace. Intensity may be increased by performing drill more quickly. Also known as Carioca.

HighKneeRun.name: High Knee Run
HighKneeRun.preparation: Stand with left front slightly in front of other foot. Lean forward and place left arm back and right arm forward.
HighKneeRun.execution: Lift right knee high and step forward while swinging left arm up and right arm back. Propel body upward and forward by extending left leg. Lower right leg while beginning to raise left knee while pulling left arm back and right arm forward. Land on extended right leg. Continue movement on opposite side, alternating quickly between sides.

Jog.name: Jog
Jog.preparation: Lean forward with staggered stance, left leg bent forward and right leg extended back. Bend arms to sides of body.
Jog.execution: Swing right knee forward while left leg extends back and remains in contact with ground. In unison to leg movement, swing left bent arm forward and right bent arm back. Extend right leg forward as left heel rises off ground.
Jog.comments: Extend left foot as left hip and knee terminate extension propelling body forward as both feet are no longer in contact with ground. Begin to swing left arm back and right arm forward. Continue to extend right knee in preparation for initial landing while raising left heel toward buttock. Right foot makes contact with ground, then right knee bends as it quickly travels underneath body.

JumpRopeDoubleRotation.name: Jump Rope: Double Under
JumpRopeDoubleRotation.preparation: Grasp jump rope handles on each side. Initiate
JumpRopeDoubleRotation.execution: or start with rope behind body and swing rope from behind overhead.
JumpRopeDoubleRotation.comments: Jump and swiftly swing rope around body and under feet twice before landing. Repeat.

JumpRopeFrontCross.name: Jump Rope: Criss Cross
JumpRopeFrontCross.preparation: Grasp jump rope handles on each side. Initiate
JumpRopeFrontCross.execution: or start with rope behind body and swing rope from behind over head.
JumpRopeFrontCross.comments: As rope travels forward in front of body, cross arms downward in front of hips and jump over rope. Keep arms crossed while rope swings up behind body. As rope travels forward in front of body, uncross arms back out to sides and jump over rope and repeat.

JumpRopeHeelTap.name: Jump Rope: Heel Tap
JumpRopeHeelTap.preparation: Grasp jump rope handles on each side. Initiate
JumpRopeHeelTap.execution: or start with rope behind body and swing rope from behind overhead. Continue swinging rope front of body, down to floor.
JumpRopeHeelTap.comments: Heel tap may also be performed without first hop, going directly into heel tap without intermediate step. Hop heights should be minimal, just enough to clear the rope, maximize jump rope efficiency, and decrease joint impact. Intensity can be altered by increasing speed of movement.

JumpRopeLateralHop.name: Jump Rope: Boxer Step
JumpRopeLateralHop.preparation: Grasp jump rope handles on each side. Initiate
JumpRopeLateralHop.execution: or start with rope behind body and swing rope from behind overhead.
JumpRopeLateralHop.comments: Swing rope in front of body, down to floor. Hop up as rope travels under foot and land over to left side, left foot lands then right foot touches. Swing rope around body and hop over rope again landing to right side, right foot lands then left foot touches. Continue jumps hopping side to side.

JumpRopeKeltic.name: Jump Rope: Keltic Step
JumpRopeKeltic.preparation: Grasp jump rope handles on each side. Initiate
JumpRopeKeltic.execution: or start with rope behind body and swing rope from behind overhead. Continue swinging rope front of body, down to floor.
JumpRopeKeltic.comments: Hop heights should be minimal, just enough to clear the rope, maximize jump rope efficiency, and decrease joint impact. Intensity can be altered by increasing speed of movement.

JumpRopeSideSwingAlterHop.name: Jump Rope: Alternating Hop Side Swing
JumpRopeSideSwingAlterHop.preparation: Grasp jump rope handles on each side. Initiate
JumpRopeSideSwingAlterHop.comments: Hop onto one leg, same side as swing. Hop on other leg, same side swing. Continue jump and swing pattern hopping side to side.

JumpRopeSingleHop.name: Jump Rope: Basic Hop
JumpRopeSingleHop.preparation: Grasp jump rope handles on each side. Initiate
JumpRopeSingleHop.execution: or start with rope behind body and swing rope from behind overhead. Body weight should be balanced on the balls of the feet, with knees slightly bent.
JumpRopeSingleHop.comments: Swing rope in front of body, down to floor. Hop as rope travels under feet, and repeat.

JumpRopeStep.name: Jump Rope: Jog Step
JumpRopeStep.preparation: Grasp jump rope handles on each side. Initiate
JumpRopeStep.execution: or start with rope behind body and swing rope from behind overhead. Swing rope in front of body, down to floor.
JumpRopeStep.comments: Swing rope in front of body, down to floor. Hop on one leg as rope travels under foot. Repeat by alternating legs.

JumpRopeSingleLegHop.name: Jump Rope: Alternating Leg Hop
JumpRopeSingleLegHop.preparation: Grasp jump rope handles on each side. Initiate
JumpRopeSingleLegHop.execution: or start with rope behind body and swing rope from behind over head.
JumpRopeSingleLegHop.comments: Swing rope in front of body, down to floor. Hop on one leg as rope travels under foot and repeat with same foot. Alternate successive hops between opposite foot. Repeat.

JumpRopeSingleLegCrissCross.name: Jump Rope: Single Leg Criss Cross
JumpRopeSingleLegCrissCross.preparation: Grasp jump rope handles on each side. Initiate
JumpRopeSingleLegCrissCross.execution: or start with rope behind body and swing rope from behind overhead. Stand on one foot (base foot) with other foot up off of floor.
JumpRopeSingleLegCrissCross.comments: As rope travels forward in front of body, cross arms downward in front of hips and jump over rope with base foot. Keep arms crossed while rope swings up behind body. As rope travels forward in front of body, uncross arms back out to sides and jump over rope with base foot and repeat.

JumpRopeToeTap.name: Jump Rope: Toe Tap
JumpRopeToeTap.preparation: Grasp jump rope handles on each side. Initiate
JumpRopeToeTap.execution: or start with rope behind body and swing rope from behind overhead. Swing rope in front of body, down to floor.
JumpRopeToeTap.comments: Hop heights should be minimal, just enough to clear rope, maximize jump rope efficiency, and decrease joint impact. Intensity can be altered by increasing speed of hops.

JumpRopeTwistingHops.name: Jump Rope: Twister
JumpRopeTwistingHops.preparation: Grasp jump rope handles on each side. Initiate
JumpRopeTwistingHops.execution: or start with rope behind body and swing rope from behind overhead. Bodyweight should be balanced on the balls of the feet, with knees slightly bent.
JumpRopeTwistingHops.comments: Swing rope in front of body, down to floor. Hop as rope travels under feet. Repeat hops while progressively turning lower body so feet and knees are pointed to one side while upper body's orientation remains unchanged throughout movement. Rotate lower body so feet and knees are pointing to opposited side. Continue hoping over rope while progressively rotating lower body from side to side.

JumpSideSwing.name: Jump Rope: Side Swing
JumpSideSwing.preparation: Grasp jump rope handles on each side.
JumpSideSwing.execution: Throw rope back and under to one side. As rope travels upward from behind then throw rope downward and front of body diagonally to opposite side. Pattern can be repeated on opposite side alternating between sides.
JumpSideSwing.comments: Side swing is used to initiate adequate revolution speed before initiating jumps. Just before rope swings downward in front of body, arms can separate to each side so rope travels under feet.

JumpingJack.name: Jumping Jack
JumpingJack.preparation: Stand with feet together, knees slightly bent, and arms to sides.
JumpingJack.execution: Jump while raising arms and separating legs to sides. Land on forefoot with legs apart and arms overhead. Jump again while lower arms and returning legs to midline. Land on forefoot with arms and legs in original position and repeat.
JumpingJack.comments: Intensity can be increased by jumping faster.

MiniTramp.name: Mini Tramp
MiniTramp.execution: Jump up and land in center of mini tramp allowing knees and hips to bend. Immediately jump back up and repeat.
MiniTramp.comments: Handles may be used until balance or technique problems are resolved.

LadderMill.name: Ladder Mill (Jacob's Ladder)
LadderMill.preparation: Secure belt cable attachment around waist with cable in back. Climb onto ladder by stepping onto rung near bottom and grasp rung closer to middle top.
LadderMill.execution: Climb ladder by stepping up and grasping one rung at a time.
LadderMill.comments: Intensity can be increased by climbing faster, or higher on ladder since greater cable tension permits rungs to travel downward at greater speed. A weighted vest can also be worn to increase difficulty. To come to a stop, climb more slowly lower down on rungs, then step down onto ground. Also known as Jacob's Ladder.

Kayak.name: Kayak Machine
Kayak.preparation: Sit on seat with handlebar shaft between legs and feet on angled platforms to each side. Select resistance and push "quick start" or enter program. Grasp handlebars with a comfortably wide grip and bring them to an upright position.
Kayak.execution: Pull down and back with left arm while pushing up and forward with right arm, across body's centerline. Complete stroke by pull-down and back with right arm while pushing up and forward with left arm, across body's centerline.
Kayak.comments: Maintain relatively erect posture throughout session. Increase rate of stroke if weight stack approaches lower position. Likewise, decrease rate of stroke if weight stack approaches upper position. Intensity can be altered by resistance and rate of stroke (strokes per minute). To adjust resistance select resistance on weight stack. As alternative exercise,

LVStairClimber.name: Stair Climber
LVStairClimber.preparation: Step onto pedal platforms and grasp handrails. Select "quick start" or enter program.
LVStairClimber.execution: Place weight on one pedal and allow other pedal to raise. Before lower lever hits bottom or upper lever hits top, alternate with opposite movement. Repeat.
LVStairClimber.comments: Avoid transferring body weight onto handlebars. Intensity can be altered by increasing speed (steps per minute). Also see

MountainClimber.name: Mountain Climber
MountainClimber.preparation: Place hands on floor, slightly wider than shoulder width. On forefeet, position one leg forward bent underbody and extend other leg back.
MountainClimber.execution: While holding upper body in place, alternate leg positions by pushing hips up while immediately extending forward leg back and pulling rear leg forward underbody, landing on both forefeet simultaneously.
MountainClimber.comments: Intensity can be increased by stepping faster.

RecumbentCycle.name: Recumbent Cycle
RecumbentCycle.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp handlebars on sides. Place feet on pedals. Select "quick start" or enter program.
RecumbentCycle.comments: Adjust seat so knees are short of full extension. Intensity can be altered by resistance and speed (revolutions per minute).

RecumbentCrossTrainer.name: Recumbent Stepper Cross Trainer
RecumbentCrossTrainer.preparation: Sit on seat, place feet on pedal platforms and grasp lever bars.
RecumbentCrossTrainer.execution: Push left foot lever down allowing right foot lever to raise up while pulling left handle and pushing right handle. Move in opposite pattern and continue alternating between sides.
RecumbentCrossTrainer.comments: The seat swivels and the armrest lifts up to allow easier access. Adjust seat so knees are short of full extension. Adjust length lever bars to allow elbow to extend yet opposite arm to remain just in front of the body. Intensity can be altered by resistance and speed (steps per minute). To increase resistance push lever forward and down. To decrease resistance pull lever backward and up.

RecumbentCycleCrossTrainer.name: Recumbent Cycle Cross Trainer
RecumbentCycleCrossTrainer.preparation: Sit on seat with feet on pedals and grasp handlebars. Select "start".
RecumbentCycleCrossTrainer.execution: Pedal while alternating handlebars back and forth.
RecumbentCycleCrossTrainer.comments: Adjust seat so knees are short of full extension. Intensity can be altered by resistance and speed (revolutions per minute).

RecumbentStepper.name: Recumbent Stepper
RecumbentStepper.preparation: Select resistance and push "quick start" or enter program. Lay back on incline with hips between handlebars. Grasps handlebars on sides and place feet on pedal platforms. Push both foot levers down by extending legs to raise weight stack. Allow one foot lever to raise up by bending hip and knee of one leg.
RecumbentStepper.execution: Push foot lever back down while simultaneously allowing opposite foot lever to raise up, alternating foot levers up and down.
RecumbentStepper.comments: Increase rate of stepping if weight stack approaches lower position. Likewise, decrease rate of stepping if weight stack approaches upper position. Intensity can be altered by resistance and rate of stepping (steps per minute). To adjust resistance select resistance on weight stack. Make and model shown is Stairmaster Crossrobics 1650 LE.

RecumbentUprightCycle.name: Recumbent Upright Cycle
RecumbentUprightCycle.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp handlebars on sides. Place feet on pedals. Select "quick start" or enter program.
RecumbentUprightCycle.comments: Adjust seat so knees are short of full extension. Intensity can be altered by resistance and speed (revolutions per minute). Apparatus is between an

RecumbentEllipticalCrossTrainer.name: Recumbent Elliptical Cross Trainer
RecumbentEllipticalCrossTrainer.preparation: Sit on seat, place feet on pedal platforms and grasp lever bars.
RecumbentEllipticalCrossTrainer.execution: Push left foot lever forward allowing right foot lever rotate back while pulling left handle and pushing right handle. Move in opposite pattern so pedals continues to rotate forward, alternating movement between sides.
RecumbentEllipticalCrossTrainer.comments: Adjust seat so knees are short of full extension. Adjust length lever bars to allow elbow to extend yet opposite arm to remain just in front of the body. Intensity can be altered by resistance and speed (steps per minute).

Rider.name: Rider
Rider.preparation: Sit on seat. Place feet on pedals and grasp handlebars.
Rider.execution: Extend hips and knees while pulling handlebars back to sides. Return to original position and repeat.
Rider.comments: Keep chest high, particularly at end of pulling phase (top position). Rider movement borders on weight-bearing at top of movement (legs extended). Intensity can be altered by lever adjustment and speed (strokes per minute).

RowErgometer.name: Row Ergometer
RowErgometer.preparation: Sit on seat. Position and secure feet on platform. Grasp handlebar with both hands, overhand grip. With legs extended, pull handlebar to midsection, forearms horizontal.
RowErgometer.execution: Make sure handlebar is anchored on hook within reach before feet are strapped. Intensity can be altered by damper setting and speed (strokes per minute). Faster wheel spins creates greater wind resistance on fan blades. Damper setting is like gears on a bicycle.
RowErgometer.comments: Choose a damper setting that is most comfortable. Rowing with damper setting too high will reduce your output and may increase risk of injury. Watch center display for power output or speed.

RowErgometerCanoe.name: Row Ergometer (canoe stroke)
RowErgometerCanoe.preparation: Sit on seat. Position and secure feet on platform. Grasp handlebar with mixed grip, overhand grip on one side and underhand grip on side. With legs extended, pull handlebar to midsection.
RowErgometerCanoe.execution: Make sure handlebar is anchored on hook within reach before feet are strapped. Intensity can be altered by damper setting and speed (strokes per minute). Faster wheel spins creates greater wind resistance on fan blades. Damper setting is like gears on a bicycle.
RowErgometerCanoe.comments: Choose a damper setting that is most comfortable. Rowing with damper setting too high will reduce your output and may increase risk of injury. Watch center display for power output or speed. Also see

Run.name: Run
Run.preparation: Lean forward with staggered stance, left leg bent forward and right leg and hips slightly bent behind body. Position right arm slightly forward and left arm back to sides of body.
Run.execution: Swing right knee forward while left leg extends back and remains in contact with ground. In unison to leg movement, swing left bent arm forward and right bent arm back. Extend right leg forward as left heal rises off ground. Extend left foot as left hip and knee terminate extension propelling body forward as both feet are no longer in contact with ground. Begin to swing left arm back and right arm forward. Continue to extend right knee in preparation for initial landing while raising left heel toward buttock. As right foot makes contact with ground continue to pull left heel toward buttock. Allow right knee to bend as it quickly travels underneath body. As left knee begins to be pulled forward, left arm continues to travel back behind body while right arm continues to swing forward. Repeat running pattern with movements on opposite sides, alternating between sides. Continue running until specific distance is covered or prescribed time has elapsed.
Run.comments: Running involves running faster than 6 mph (~10 kmph) whereas

Shuffle.name: Lateral Shuffle
Shuffle.preparation: Stand with right side facing intended path in athletic position: wide stance with knees, hips, and arms bent, chest up.
Shuffle.execution: Step sideways in direction of intended path with right leg. Sidestep with left leg and push off second side step with right leg before landing left leg. Continue for shuffling pattern to desired point.
Shuffle.comments: Start slow and build up pace. Intensity is normally increased by shuffling faster or taking wider strides so that plant of trailing foot occurs beyond point at which leading foot had just left. Also known as Side Shuffle.

SideLunge.name: Side Lunge
SideLunge.preparation: Stand facing 90° to left with right side in direction of intended path.
SideLunge.execution: Step out with right leg toward direction of intended path. Lunge down by flexing right knee and hip while bending torso forward and extending arms forward. Stand and lunge to left side in same manner. Stand up and turn 90° to right toward intended path and take one step with left leg. Swing right leg forward and pivot body back 90° to original orientation by pivoting on left forefoot. Planting right foot away out toward direction of intended path. Continue pattern of stretching to both sides, rotating, stepping forward, rotating back in position. Repeat until marked distance is covered, specified time has elapsed, or set number of repetitions have been completed.

SkiErgometer.name: Ski Ergometer
SkiErgometer.preparation: Place wrists through straps, up through undersides of loops, then grasp handles with each hand. Stand with shoulder width stance with bent arms in front and hands slightly above head.
SkiErgometer.execution: Pull both cable handles downward by extending shoulders, flexing spine, and bending legs. Extend arms downward and slightly back at bottom of stroke. Return to original position by extending body and arms upward. Repeat.
SkiErgometer.comments: Machine simulates nordic skiing. Heels can come off ground at top of motion. Staggered stance places more emphasis on

SkateMachine.name: Skate Machine
SkateMachine.preparation: Place hands on bar and step into pedals. Select coarse, effort, time, and push start. Place hands on bar for support.
SkateMachine.execution: Slightly bend supporting leg and hip while pushing opposite pedal off to side. Glide extended leg back and repeat opposite motion when foot returns near center. Repeat by pushing off from side to side.
SkateMachine.comments: Hands may be kept off of handlebars, either swing arms from side to side or

SkiMachCords.name: Ski Machine (cords)
SkiMachCords.preparation: Step on pedal platforms and grasp a rope grip in each hand.
SkiMachCords.execution: Kick and glide pedal platforms back and forth while swinging arms along sides. Swing arms so constant tension is maintained on arm swinging down, extending forward arm as

SkiMachRails.name: Ski Machine (rails)
SkiMachRails.preparation: Step on pedal platforms and grasp sliding grips on rails in each hand.
SkiMachRails.execution: Kick and glide pedal platforms back and forth while sliding grips along rails back and forth as far as possible.
SkiMachRails.comments: When familiarizing yourself with this movement, practice the lower and upper movements separately. Intensity can be altered by resistance and speed (strides per minute). To increase flywheel resistance, turn knob clockwise.

Skip.name: Skip
Skip.preparation: Stand facing direction of intended path bent.
Skip.execution: Take a leaping step forward with first leg and plant foot on floor. Bring second leg forward and kick knee high so that first leg leaves floor, allowing whole body to be thrown upward and forward. Plant foot of first leg on floor as second time while second leg still remains up with knee bent. Step forward with second leg and repeat sequence on opposite side. Continue bounding and hopping pattern, alternating between sides to desired point.
Skip.comments: Arms move in sync with skip, particularly when knee is thrown upward, opposite arm lifts forward. Start with modest skips when beginning. Intensity is increased by bounding and hopping higher and further.

Sprint.name: Sprint
Sprint.preparation: Lean forward with staggered stance, left leg bent forward and right leg and hips slightly bent behind body. Extend left arm back alongside body and bend right arm under shoulder. Push off explosively with both legs.
Sprint.execution: Swing right knee forward quickly while left leg extends and remains in contact with ground. In unison to leg movement, swing left bent arm forward while swinging right bent arm back. Continue to pull right knee forward and upward while driving left leg back so extended left leg and torso form straight line angled forward approximately 45°.
Sprint.comments: Extend left foot as left hip and knee terminate extension propelling body forward as both feet are no longer in contact with ground. Begin to swing left arm back and right arm forward. Also extend right leg in preparation for initial landing while beginning to pull left heel toward buttock. Right foot makes initial contact with ground on outside edge ball of foot. As weight of body is transferred to ball of foot, continue to pull left heel toward buttock. Right foot quickly travels underneath body with supporting knee slightly bent. As left knee begins to be pulled forward, left arm continues to travel back behind body while right arm continues to swing forward.

SprintToTurn.name: Sprint to Turn
SprintToTurn.preparation: Lean forward with staggered stance, left leg bent forward and right leg and hips slightly bent behind body. Extend left arm back alongside body and bend right arm under shoulder. Push off explosively with both legs.
SprintToTurn.execution: Sprint and attempt to accelerate as quickly as possible toward turn-around line or cone. Decelerate just before crossing line or approaching cone. Run around cone or quickly change direction immediately after crossing line. Sprint back to starting point, again attempt to accelerate as quickly as possible. Sprint without further deceleration until passing over initial starting line.
SprintToTurn.comments: Sprinting on balls of feet, as opposed to toes, creates maximum push off on ground and forward acceleration. During the acceleration phase, keep foot’s point of contact slightly behind center of mass. Overstriding in acceleration phase places foot’s point of contact too far forward thereby slowing speed. Therefore begin with slightly shorter steps while extending length and speed of each stride throughout acceleration phase. During deceleration phase, heels can make initial contact with ground.

SwimBackStroke.name: Swim: Back Stroke
SwimBackStroke.preparation: Float on back looking up with arms extended down sides of body. Keep legs extended with toes pointed.
SwimBackStroke.execution: Kick legs up and down in alternating flutter motion while keeping feet extended. With arms straight, raise arm up out of water and back behind shoulder. Arm enters water with pinky side of hand entering first. Other arm exits to perform backwards arc motion. Submerged arm should powerfully pull through water down to side with hand slightly cupped. Submerged arm bends and straightening until reaching side of thigh before exiting water. Continue alternating rotation of arms while continuing to kick legs.
SwimBackStroke.comments: Keep head in neutral position, facing ceiling as body rotates from side to side. Although shoulders and hips rotate together, shoulders rotate further thereby producing spinal lumbar rotation. Pull in abdomen to flatten back while eliminating arching. Knees are kept under water with toes making small splash during flutter while emphasizing powerful hip musculature for added propulsion. Arms submerge in circle motion under the water to propel body backwards. With elbow positioned high, initiate pull phase of stroke by pressing downwards with forearm before pulling out from side of body. Breathe as needed since face is out of water. At least one breath should be taken per stroke, typically inhaling during one arm arc and exhaling during other arm arc.

SwimBreastStroke.name: Swim: Breast Stroke
SwimBreastStroke.preparation: Float facing prone in the water with body extended. Extend arms forward with hands downward and together. Position face forward yet slightly downwards.
SwimBreastStroke.execution: Turn thumbs downward, round hands, and pull straight arms apart and out to sides. Before elbows pass each side of shoulders, pull arms downward and inward by flexing elbows and internally rotating shoulders (ie: elbows kept high). Quickly raise head out of water by arching spine while pulling elbows to sides of body and hands together under chest. Inhale and pull abdomen in while keeping back straight and hips as close to surface of water. With palms facing together and elbow tucked in, push arms forward and fully flex knees while allowing hips to flex and slightly abduct. Lower head into water and kick backwards with feet angled outwards and backwards. Extend body and pull legs together and point feet. Exhale on the recovery phase and repeat.
SwimBreastStroke.comments: Sequence of phases include: 1) pull, 2) breath, 3) kick, and 4) glide. During kick, push water backwards with soles of feet to propel body forward. Ankle circle during kick occurs through knee internal rotation and ankles plantar flexion. Slowest part of stroke is pulling head in and out of water since it produces no forward propulsion, therefore it should be performed as quickly as possible, only as long as it takes to inhale. To reduce drag and keep streamlined, practice quick leg movement and attempt to keep hips high throughout stroke even when pulling head out of water. That will require powerful leg muscles, flexible spine, conditioned erector spinae, and flexible hip flexors.

SwimButterfly.name: Swim: Butterfly
SwimButterfly.preparation: Float prone with body extended in the water facing downward to bottom of pool. Position straight arms forward with one hand place on other. Initiate dolphin kick by driving from hip kicking down until hip reach full extension. Kick quickly down with feet pointed and ankles flicking at end. Kick up by relaxing hips and bring heels to surface of water by slightly bending knee.
SwimButterfly.execution: While moving body in fluid wave motion, simultaneously raise straight arms from sides out of water and move arms forward just above water line. Lower straight arms to each side of head into water while repositioning head 90° downward. Scoop water with outward facing hands and elbows positioned high. Pull arms underneath body, pushing body forward, and extending them through to hips. Accelerate arms up and out of water from sides of hip and repeat stroke.
SwimButterfly.comments: Two kicks should be performed during each arm cycle, one at start of arm pull and one towards end of arm pull. Keeping feet under surface of water. Enter hands into water slightly wider than shoulder width (11 and 1 o’clock). Elbow bends slightly as they pass under body. As needed, push down on water through stroke and lift head out of water and inhale, keeping chin close to waterline. Butterfly technique is considered more difficult than any other stroke due to it being a short axis stroke, requiring greater strength and endurance. It also requires greater coordination and timing that other strokes.

SwimFreestyle.name: Swim: Freestyle
SwimFreestyle.preparation: Float prone with body extended in the water facing downward to bottom of pool. Extend right arm straight forward with palm downward and elbow pointed to side. Position left arm extended back to side. Kick in alternating pattern with legs fairly straight. Kick forcefully from hip while straightening leg as extended foot moves downward. As foot returns upwards, allow knee to bend slightly and ankle to bend slightly.
SwimFreestyle.execution: Rotate torso leftward away from right forward extended arm while raising left extended arm to side out of water allowing it to bend slightly as it exits water. As left arm is raised out of water, turn head to left side so head is facing side of pool with mouth out of water. Inhale through mouth under left arm while moving it forward overhead. Return head to face bottom of pull as soon as possible and slowly breath out through nose or mouth. Continue reaching forward with left arm and position palms downward with wrists slightly higher than finger tips and bent elbow higher than wrist. Just before torso rotates to neutral downward position, pull right arm downward underneath body, with fingers cupped and extended in same direction while keeping right elbow pointed outward. Gently place left hand into water, placing finger tips first. Keep left elbow high as arm enters water. With left arm pointing forward and elbow pointing outward, lift right extended arm out of water from side of body. Continue extending right arm to side, pushing backwards. Repeat stroke with opposite sides, alternating between sides.
SwimFreestyle.comments: One kick should be completed per arm cycle. Keep ankles slightly relaxed to assist in propulsion. Kick hard on down-kick and more relaxed on up-kick.

Tapioca.name: Tapioca
Tapioca.preparation: Stand with right side facing intended path, feet slightly apart and knees slightly bent. Begin to pull right arm back and extend left arm forward. Bend and turn right leg outward, positioning heel off ground momentarily.
Tapioca.execution: Begin to pull left arm back and extend right arm forward. Place right foot on ground so foot points outward while placing bend leg left inward in front of right leg. While lifting heel of right foot, place left foot on ground in front of right foot so both feet point to right. Begin to pull right arm back and extend left arm forward. Rotate right leg inward then hop and turn on left foot landing on forefoot with both legs together with knees and feet pointing to left. Step left foot back behind right foot. Begin to pull right arm back and extend left arm forward. Hop up from left rear foot and pull right leg back landing on forefoot while lifting left leg forward. Repeat movement pattern to desired distance or duration. If desired, repeat in the opposite direction so that the left leg leads.
Tapioca.comments: Tapioca is a lateral movement drill which can be used as warm-up drill. The movement involves shuffling sideways while rotating lower body from side with arms swinging in opposition. Keep knees bent, shoulders relaxed, and head up. Start slow and build up pace. Intensity may be increased by performing drill more quickly. Also see Grapevine or Carioca.

TreadClimber.name: Tread Climber
TreadClimber.preparation: Step onto deck of tread climber and grasp rails. Attach safety tether. Select "quick start" or enter program.
TreadClimber.execution: Step onto walking belt of upper treadle and allow foot to travel toward back of machine as it lowers. As other treadle rises, swing opposite leg forward and step onto its belt. Again, allow foot travel to back of machine as treadle lowers. Repeat walking pattern, keeping pace with machine.
TreadClimber.comments: Hands can be placed lightly on rails for balance. Avoid transferring body weight or 'hanging' onto handlebars. Maintain close distance from console stepping forward on each treadle. Intensity can be altered by treadle travel and speed (mph or kmph). Cylinders can be adjusted so treadles depress easier or harder according to body weight and desired intensity. Also stepping nearer front of treadles allows them to depress downward more freely. Treadles should not bottom out. Adjusting hydraulic cylinder dial closer to maximum settings permits greater treadle travel resulting in more intense workout. Adjust dial toward minimum setting until achieving comfortable amount of travel, displace enough to absorb the impact of stepping motion, approximately 3 inches.

TreadmillRun.name: Treadmill Run
TreadmillRun.preparation: Step onto deck of treadmill and grasp rails. Straddle belt by standing on sides of treadmill. Attach safety tether. Select "quick start" or enter program.
TreadmillRun.comments: Maintain close distance from console. Hand can be placed on rail to regain balance. Avoid transferring body weight or 'hanging' onto handlebars. Intensity can be altered by incline and speed (mph or kmph).

TreadmillWalk.name: Treadmill Walk
TreadmillWalk.preparation: Step onto deck of treadmill and grasp rails. Straddle belt by standing on sides of treadmill. Attach safety tether. Select "quick start" or enter program.
TreadmillWalk.comments: Maintain close distance from console. Hand can be placed on rail for balance. Avoid transferring body weight or 'hanging' onto handlebars. Intensity can be altered by incline and speed (mph or kmph). Spinal rotation occurs during brisk walking.

TreadmillWorkStationWalk.name: Treadmill Walk (workstation)
TreadmillWorkStationWalk.preparation: Step onto deck of treadmill. Place forearms on padded edge of desk so fingers can be comfortably placed on computer keys. Start treadmill from computer.
TreadmillWorkStationWalk.execution: Walk on treadmill at comfortable pace allowing for adequate concentration on computer work.
TreadmillWorkStationWalk.comments: Avoid leaning on desk. Intensity can be altered by incline and speed (mph or kmph).

UprightCycle.name: Cycle Ergometer
UprightCycle.preparation: Sit on upright cycle seat with feet on pedals and grasp handlebars. Select "quick start" or enter program.
UprightCycle.comments: Adjust seat so knees are just short of full extension. Intensity can be altered by resistance and speed (revolutions per minute).

WalkingLunge.name: Walking Lunge
WalkingLunge.preparation: Stand upright with arms to sides.
WalkingLunge.execution: Step forward with right leg and bend left arm. Land on heel, then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg makes contact or is almost in contact with floor. Stand on forward leg with initial assistance of rear leg and lower and straighten left arm down to side. Lunge forward with left leg with same movement pattern. Repeat by alternating lunge with opposite legs.

VersaClimber.name: Climber
VersaClimber.preparation: Hold handlebars. Step one foot on lower foot pedal, and one foot on higher foot pedal, making both feet level with each other. Adjust handles to chin height. Turn machine on.
VersaClimber.execution: Push one foot pedal down and pull down same-side handlebar, allowing opposite foot pedal and handlebar to rise. Alternate movement on opposite side and repeat.
VersaClimber.comments: On models with variable resistance (LX, SM, CM, SRM, TS), adjust to

WaveMachine.name: Wave Machine
WaveMachine.preparation: Step onto back platform with arms extended forward and hands on handles. Step onto first pedal platform. As pedal platform sinks to side place other foot on opposite pedal platform. Select "quick start" or enter program.
WaveMachine.execution: Shift body weight onto highest pedal platform allowing hip and knee to straighten as it sinks outward. Simultaneously allow opposite knee and hip to flex as its pedal platform rises inward. Shift body weight to opposite side with opposite movement. Repeat.
WaveMachine.comments: Hands may be kept off of handlebars. If handles are used, avoid transferring too much body weight onto handlebars. Exercise can be performed bent over with hands-on forward base of handles to emphasize glute involvement or arms in stride with movement with no contact with handles. Begin at higher resistance for warm-up. Intensity can be increased by decreasing resistance thereby increasing speed (steps per minute). Also see

Subscapularis.name: Subscapularis
Subscapularis.comments: All heads of subscapularis have their largest internal rotation moment arm (approximately 2.5 cm) and torque generation at 0° abduction. As abduction angle increases, moment arms of inferior and middle heads stay relatively constant, while moment arm of superior head progressively decreases until it is about 1.3 cm at 60° shoulder abduction (Otis JC, et al. 1994). However, no significant difference in upper subscapularis activity was observed during shoulder internal rotation exercises at 0°, 45°, or 90° adduction (Kadaba MP, et al. 1992; Decker MJ, et al. 2003).

180JumpTurns.name: 180° Jump Turns
180JumpTurns.preparation: Stand with feet shoulder width apart or slightly wider. Squat down slightly by bending knees and hips.
180JumpTurns.execution: Jump up while turning body and throwing arms up in direction of turn. Turn 180° in air. Land in athletic position facing opposite direction. Immediately jump and turn 180° in opposite direction returning to starting position.
180JumpTurns.comments: Maintain athletic position during each land. Arms movement can assist in jumps.

360JumpTurn.name: 360° Jump Turn
360JumpTurn.preparation: Stand with feet shoulder width apart or slightly wider. Squat down by bending knees and hips. Pull arms back.
360JumpTurn.execution: Jump up while turning body and throwing arms up and in direction of turn. As body travels upward, pull arm away from direction of turn toward other shoulder. Temporarily cross legs and turn 360° through air. Land in squat position with arms forward and stand. Repeat movment in opposite direction.
360JumpTurn.comments: Alternative method is to squat down positioning bent right arm under shoulders while left arm is pulled back. Pull left arm forward and right arm back while jumping up. Tuck bent arms toward waist while turning clockwise 360° through air. Alternatively,

360JumpTurns.name: 360° Jump Turns
360JumpTurns.preparation: Stand with feet shoulder width apart or slightly wider. Squat down by bending knees and hips. Pull arms back.
360JumpTurns.execution: Jump up while turning body and throwing arms up and in direction of turn. As body travels upward, pull arm away from direction of turn toward other shoulder. Temporarily cross legs and turn 360° through air. Land in squat position with arms forward and stand. Immediately repeat movement for at least two consecutive repetitions. Continue movement in succession in opposite direction.
360JumpTurns.comments: Alternative method is to squat down positioning bent right arm under shoulders while left arm is pulled back.

90JumpTurns.name: 90° Jump Turns
90JumpTurns.preparation: Stand with feet shoulder width apart or slightly wider. Bend knees and hips slightly.
90JumpTurns.execution: Jump and turn 90°. Land in athletic position facing side direction. Immediately jump and turn 90° in opposite direction returning to starting position.
90JumpTurns.comments: Jump facing from front to side as fast as possible. Maintain athletic position during each land. Arms movement can assist in jumps.

AlternateBoundSingleArm.name: Alternate Bound (with single arm action)
AlternateBoundSingleArm.preparation: Begin by jogging to initialize momentum.
AlternateBoundSingleArm.execution: Push off with right foot and reach forward with left arm while bring right leg forward with knee bent and thigh parallel to ground. Extend right leg back and keep it extended for duration of push-off. Hold this extended stride for short time and land left foot. Drive right leg forward to front bent position and extend left leg back while left arm reaches forward in same manner. Continued bounding for length or duration of the drill.
AlternateBoundSingleArm.comments: Drill is exaggerated running movement. Bound forward into air as high as possible by emphasizing high knee lifts. Focus on pushing against ground from landing through takeoff attempting to maintain hang time. Each stride should have an aesthetic glide or float pattern appearing effortless yet demonstrate power during take off.

AlternateBoundDoubleArm.name: Alternate Bound (with double arm action)
AlternateBoundDoubleArm.preparation: Begin by jogging to initialize momentum.
AlternateBoundDoubleArm.execution: Bring right foot forward while pushing off with left foot. As right thigh travels upward parallel to ground, forcefully bring both arms forward to help propel body forward (aka: gather forward). As left leg comes through, extend right leg back and keep it extended for duration of push-off. Hold this extended stride for short time while quickly pulling both arms behind body. Land left foot and drive right leg forward while bringing both arms forward. Extend left leg back and bring arms back. Continued bounding for length or duration of the drill.
AlternateBoundDoubleArm.comments: This drill is somewhat of exaggerated running drill. Bound forward into air as high as possible by emphasizing high knee lifts. Focus on pushing against ground from landing through takeoff attempting to maintain hang time. Each stride should have an aesthetic glide or float pattern appearing effortless yet demonstrate power during take off.

AlternatingPlyoPushUpKneesBosa.name: Plyo Push-up Shuffle (on knees and Bosu)
AlternatingPlyoPushUpKneesBosa.preparation: Kneel on mat facing Bosu with convex surface positioned upward. With knees on floor or mat, place left hand on top of Bosu and right hand on floor, slightly wider than shoulder width away. Position upper body off of floor, facing downward with hips straight and arms extended.
AlternatingPlyoPushUpKneesBosa.execution: Lower body until slight stretch is felt in shoulder or chest. Immediately push body up rapidly. As right arm straightens, forcefully push body upward and to opposite side of Bosu. Land right hand on top of Bosu and left hand on floor, slightly wider than shoulder width. Immediately repeat movement alternating between sides.
AlternatingPlyoPushUpKneesBosa.comments: Keep hips and waist straight. As with any plyometric, ensure solid strength foundation is first achieved. Joints, particularly shoulders should be free of biomechanical deficiencies:

AnkleHops.name: Ankle Hop
AnkleHops.preparation: Stand with hands on waist and feet hip-width apart.
AnkleHops.execution: Jump up by rapidly extending ankles. Land on forefeet and Immediately jump up again pushing off primarily using feet with only minimal push-off through knees and hips.
AnkleHops.comments: Avoid contacting ground or floor with heels.

AlternatingPlyoPushUpMB.name: Plyo Push-up Shuffle (on medicine ball)
AlternatingPlyoPushUpMB.preparation: Kneel before medicine ball. Place left hand on top of ball and right hand on floor, slightly wider than shoulder width away. Position upper body above both hands with right arm straight and left arm bent with hand on ball. Straighten body with forefeet back away from ball on floor, shoulder width apart.
AlternatingPlyoPushUpMB.execution: Lower body until slight stretch is felt in shoulder or chest. Immediately push body up rapidly. As right arm straightens and raises above floor, rapidly roll the ball under right hand with the left hand. Land right hand on ball while quickly placing left hand on floor, slightly wider than shoulder width. Repeat movement with ball under right hand. Continue by alternating between sides.
AlternatingPlyoPushUpMB.comments: Keep hips and waist straight. As with any plyometric, ensure solid strength foundation is first achieved. Joints, particularly shoulders should be free of biomechanical deficiencies:

BarrierLateralJump.name: Lateral Barrier Jumps
BarrierLateralJump.execution: Jump sideways to opposite side of barrier. Upon landing, immediately jump to other side.
BarrierLateralJump.comments: Use both upper and lower body movements. Attempt to increase speed of jumps, keeping landings short. Perform multiple jumps in succession.

BosaLateralShuffle.name: Lateral Bosu Shuffle
BosaLateralShuffle.preparation: Stand with one foot on box and other foot off, down by side of box.
BosaLateralShuffle.execution: Jump sideways so opposite foot is on box and the other is off by side of box. Repeat shuffle side to side.
BosaLateralShuffle.comments: Upper body motion can be emphasized by throwing arms ups during leaps. See

BarrierSpeedHop.name: Barrier Speed Hop
BarrierSpeedHop.preparation: Stand facing series of barriers spaced equal distance apart. Lean forward and bend arms to sides.
BarrierSpeedHop.execution: Hop over first barrier using both feet. Land on forefeet, allowing heel to make contact or come near ground. Immediately hop over each successive barrier.
BarrierSpeedHop.comments: Jump using both legs and forefeet to absorb impact and push-off quickly between each jump. Intensity can be increased by hoping faster, increase height of barriers, or spacing barriers further apart. Also known as Double Leg Barrier Speed Hops.

BoxJump.name: Box Jump
BoxJump.preparation: Stand in front of a secured box or platform.
BoxJump.execution: Jump onto box using following steps: swing arms back, bend over at hips, flex knees, swing arms forward and upward, extend hips and knees. Land on box using following steps: pull arms out and downward to sides of body, Lift knees high, swing arms forward, and extend feet forward onto box or platform. Step down off of box or platform.
BoxJump.comments: Rest between each jump is typically provided in effort to maximize jump height. However, jumps can be performed for reps with rests as long as it takes to step down off of box or platform and to get in starting position. Also see

BoxJumpMarch.name: Box Jump March
BoxJumpMarch.preparation: Stand in front of a short box or platform. Place one foot on edge of box.
BoxJumpMarch.execution: Jump up high and land with opposite foot on edge of box and other foot on floor. Immediately repeat.

BoxJumps.name: Box Jumps
BoxJumps.preparation: Stand in front of box or platform with feet about shoulder width apart. Raise arms to initiate arm swing.
BoxJumps.execution: Swing arms back behind sides while squatting down partially. Rapidly swing arms forward and jump onto platform with knees bent. Immediately jump back down to same position and repeat.
BoxJumps.comments: To increase intensity, jump up and down faster or progressively increase platform height.

BoxLateralShuffle.name: Lateral Box Shuffle
BoxLateralShuffle.preparation: Stand with one foot on box and other foot off, down by side of box.
BoxLateralShuffle.execution: Jump sideways so opposite foot is on box and the other is off by side of box. Repeat shuffle side to side.
BoxLateralShuffle.comments: Upper body motion can be emphasized by throwing arms up during leaps. Attempt to increase speed of jumps, keeping landings short. Perform multiple jumps in succession.

BoxMarchHigh.name: Box March (high)
BoxMarchHigh.preparation: Stand in front of a box or platform. Place one foot on edge of box.
BoxMarchHigh.execution: Jump and land with opposite foot on edge of box and other foot on floor. Immediately repeat.
BoxMarchHigh.comments: Move feet from floor and edge of box as fast as possible. Alternate arm position with steps. Also see

BoxLateralJump.name: Lateral Box Jumps
BoxLateralJump.execution: Jump sideways down to side of box. Jump back onto box, then jump down to the other side of the box. Jump back onto the box and repeat.
BoxLateralJump.comments: Upper body motion can be emphasized by throwing arms ups during leaps. Attempt to increase speed of jumps, keeping landings short. Perform multiple jumps in succession.

BoxMarchLow.name: Box March (low)
BoxMarchLow.preparation: Stand in front of a short box or platform. Place one foot on edge of box.
BoxMarchLow.execution: Jump and land with opposite foot on edge of box and other foot on floor. Immediately repeat.
BoxMarchLow.comments: Move feet from floor and edge of box as fast as possible. Alternate arm position with steps. Also see

BoxSquatJump.name: Box Squat Box Jump
BoxSquatJump.preparation: Stand with shoulder width stance facing elevated platform with squat box positioned behind.
BoxSquatJump.execution: Squat down with arms extended forward while attempting to push rear end back as far as possible. Sit back on squat box and rock back until torso is positioned upright. Rock body forward, swing arms forward, and immediately jump off ground onto elevated platform. Land feet on top of elevated platform.
BoxSquatJump.comments: Try to keep knees from traveling forward while reaching rear end back onto squat box. Ideally, knees could be behind ankles (further back than what is shown). In this position, greater stretch reflex can be created through hips (via

BroadJump.name: Broad Jump
BroadJump.preparation: Stand behind line with feet shoulder width apart. Squat down partially and raise arms forward.
BroadJump.execution: Swing arms back behind sides and lean forward. Rapidly swing arms forward and jump forward as far as possible with both feet close together. Land with both feet together with legs bend and stand up.
BroadJump.comments: Avoid falling backwards and maintain position of feet when landing.

BroomstickTwist.name: Broom Stick Twist
BroomstickTwist.preparation: Sit on bench. Position pole on back of shoulders. Place hands or wrists over each side of pole with arms extended.
BroomstickTwist.execution: Rotate torso through waist to one side, then to the opposite side. Repeat.
BroomstickTwist.comments: Start slow, gradually increasing speed throughout set. Perform prescribed repetitions or time. See

BurpeePushup.name: Burpee Push-up
BurpeePushup.preparation: Stand with feet shoulder width or slightly wider apart. Squat down until knees are about 90° and bend over until torso is bent over, not quite to horizontal. Position bent arms just below head.
BurpeePushup.execution: Lean forward and take short dive to floor while kicking legs back behind body. Catch body by placing hands on floor shoulder width or slightly wider. Forefeet support lower body. Lower body to floor by bending arms while keeping body straight. Quickly reverse direction by raising body, again keeping body straight momentarily. Buck hips up and rapidly pull leg forward so feet land on floor under midsection while pulling hands up off of floor so body ends up in original bent-over squatting position. Repeat movement.
BurpeePushup.comments: During dive, Knees, Hips and Spine extend. However knees passive extends through

ButtKickJumps.name: Butt Kick Jumps
ButtKickJumps.execution: Squat down and jump forward as far as possible using double arm swing. In air, pull heels toward buttocks and immediately extend legs for landing. Upon landing, immediately jump forward again using same movement pattern.
ButtKickJumps.comments: Use both upper and lower body movements. Keep landings short. Perform two or more jumps in succession.

ClapPushUp.name: Clap Push-up
ClapPushUp.preparation: Lie on floor face down and position hands on floor, shoulder width or slightly wider. Assume plank position by pushing body up with arms extended, body straight, and toes on floor.
ClapPushUp.execution: Lower body to floor and immediately push body up as fast as possible. As the hands leave ground, rapidly clap hands together and place back to original position, catching body before it falls. Repeat.
ClapPushUp.comments: Keep hips and waist straight. As with any plyometric, ensure solid strength foundation is first achieved. Joints, particularly shoulders should be free of biomechanical deficiencies:

ClapPushUpBall.name: Clap Push-up on Ball
ClapPushUpBall.preparation: Kneel with chest or waist on exercise ball. Dive over top and place hands on floor with arms extended down supporting upper body. While keeping body horizontal, walk hands further away from ball until shins are positioned on top of ball. With arms vertical and straight, support body off of floor with body straight. See suggested
ClapPushUpBall.comments: Lower body to floor and immediately push body up as fast as possible. As the hands leave ground, rapidly clap hands together and place back to original position, catching body before it falls. Repeat.

ConeJumps.name: Cone Jumps
ConeJumps.preparation: Stand facing series of cones spaced equally apart in straight line. Lean forward and bend arms to sides.
ConeJumps.execution: Jump forward over first cone using both feet. Land on forefeet, allowing heel to make contact or come near ground. Immediately hop over each cone in succession, pushing off and landing on forefeet.
ConeJumps.comments: Jump using both legs and forefeet to absorb impact and push-off quickly between each jump. Intensity can be increased by hoping faster, increase height of cones, or spacing cones further apart. Also known as Double Leg Cone Hops.

DepthPushUp.name: Depth Push-up
DepthPushUp.preparation: Kneel on floor between two slightly elevated platforms slightly wider that shoulder width apart. Position hands on floor beside sides of platforms. Position upper body off of floor with arms extended. Straighten body and place forefeet back on floor.
DepthPushUp.execution: Lower body to floor and immediately push body up as fast as possible. As hands leave ground, rapidly place hands on platforms to sides, catching body before it falls. Lower body again. As soon as slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders, immediately push upper body upward. Before upper body falls, immediately remove hands off of platforms and catch body by returning hands back on floor between platforms and repeat.
DepthPushUp.comments: Keep body straight throughout movement. As with any plyometric, ensure solid strength foundation is first achieved. Joints, particularly shoulders, should be free of biomechanical deficiencies:

DepthPushUpDeclined.name: Depth Push-up (feet elevated)
DepthPushUpDeclined.preparation: Kneel on floor between two slightly elevated platforms slightly wider that shoulder width apart. Position hands on floor, beside sides of platforms. Position upper body off of floor with arms extended. Straighten body, placing forefeet back on rear elevated platform.
DepthPushUpDeclined.execution: Lower body to floor and immediately push body up as fast as possible. As hands leave ground, rapidly place hands on platforms to sides, catching body before it falls. Lower body again. As soon as slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders, immediately push upper body upward. Before upper body falls, immediately remove hands off of platforms and catch body by returning hands back on floor between platforms and repeat.
DepthPushUpDeclined.comments: Keep body straight throughout movement. As with any plyometric,

DepthPushUpKnee.name: Depth Push-up (on knees)
DepthPushUpKnee.preparation: Kneel on floor between two slightly elevated platforms, slightly wider that shoulder width apart. With knees on floor or mat, position hands on floor beside sides of platforms. Position upper body off of floor with hips straight and arms extended.
DepthPushUpKnee.execution: Lower body to floor and immediately push body up as fast as possible. As hands leave ground, rapidly place hands on platforms to sides, catching body before it falls. Lower body again. As soon as slight stretch is felt in chest or shoulders, immediately push upper body upward. Before upper body falls, immediately remove hands off of platforms and catch body by returning hands back on floor between platforms and repeat.
DepthPushUpKnee.comments: Keep body straight throughout movement. As with any plyometric, ensure solid strength foundation is first achieved. Joints, particularly shoulders should be free of biomechanical deficiencies:

DepthPushupMB.name: Depth Push-up (on Medicine Ball)
DepthPushupMB.preparation: Kneel before medicine ball. Place both hands side by side on top of ball. Position body in plank position, arms extended straight, chest over ball, body and legs straight, and forefeet on floor, shoulder width apart.
DepthPushupMB.execution: Push body quickly by protracting shoulders and flexing wrists. As hands leave ball, rapidly place hands on floor to side of ball, catching body before it falls. Lower body again until chest makes contact with ball. Forcefully push body up rapidly so hands leave floor. Quickly catch body by returning both hands side by side on top of medicine ball. Repeat.
DepthPushupMB.comments: Keep body straight throughout movement. As with any plyometric, ensure solid strength foundation is first achieved. Joints, particularly shoulders, should be free of biomechanical deficiencies:

DoubleLegBound.name: Double Leg Bound
DoubleLegBound.preparation: Squat partially down and pull arms back behind body to each side.
DoubleLegBound.execution: Swing arms forward and jump high and far. Immediately pull heels to buttocks. Begin to pull arms back just before descent. Cycle into high knee position. Land with feet slightly in front of body and arms behind body to each side. Absorb landing by lowering body to partial squat position. Repeat bounding.
DoubleLegBound.comments: Drill emphasizes optimal lower body running mechanics while incorporating additional ground reaction force. Perform for maximum height, maximum distance, or combination of both. Also known as Double Leg Cycle Hops.

DoubleLegButtKick.name: Double Leg Butt Kicks
DoubleLegButtKick.preparation: Stand with feet shoulder width apart.
DoubleLegButtKick.execution: Squat down slightly with feet flat on floor by bending knees and hips. Jump up and kick back of heels toward buttocks. Land on both forefeet and repeat.
DoubleLegButtKick.comments: Attempt to increase speed of jumps, keeping landings short. Any hip flexion is largely passive due to

HurdleDepthJump.name: Hurdle Depth Jump
HurdleDepthJump.comments: Step forward off edge of plyo box. Pull both arms back and drop to ground. Land on both feet, throw both arms forward, and jump up over hurdle. Pull legs up to clear hurdle. Extend legs forward and down. Land on both feet, bend legs to absorb impact and stand.

HurdleJump.name: Hurdle Jump
HurdleJump.execution: Squat down while swinging both arms back behind body to each side. Swing arms forward and upward. Jump over the hurdle by extending hips, knees, and feet. Pull legs up over hurdle by flexing hips and knees while reaching arms forward. When feet are over hurdle extend legs forward and pull arms down toward sides. Land on both legs, squat down to absorb impact, and stand upright.
HurdleJump.comments: Hurdle should be collapsible in case it is not cleared. Jump requires static

HurdleJumps.name: Hurdle Jumps
HurdleJumps.preparation: Stand facing collapsible hurdles or barriers (12" to 36", 30 to 90 cm) set up in a row.
HurdleJumps.execution: Squat down and jump over hurdle with feet together using a double arm swing. Upon landing, immediately jump over next hurdle.
HurdleJumps.comments: Use both upper and lower body movements. Keep landings short. Hurdles should be collapsible in case they are not cleared. Space hurdles or barriers according to ability. Increase height of barrier as ability improves. Perform 2 or more jumps in succession.

InclinePlyoPushup.name: Incline Plyo Push-up
InclinePlyoPushup.preparation: Place hands slightly wider than shoulder width on close end of elevated platform. Assume inclined plank position by placing forefeet on floor away from platform, shoulder width or slightly narrower. Position body and arms straight, perpendicular to one another.
InclinePlyoPushup.execution: Lower body towards platform by bending arms. In lower position, immediately push body up quickly allowing hands to raise off of platform edge. As body falls backs down, place hands back to original position, catching body before it falls. Repeat.
InclinePlyoPushup.comments: Keep hips and waist straight. As with any plyometric, ensure solid strength foundation is first achieved. Joints, particularly shoulders should be free of biomechanical deficiencies:

KneelingPlyoPushup.name: Kneeling Plyo Push-up
KneelingPlyoPushup.preparation: Lie on floor with knees on padded surface. Position hands on floor shoulder width or slightly wider.  Assume a kneeling plank position, by pushing body up so arms are extended.
KneelingPlyoPushup.execution: Bend arm and lower chest to floor. Immediately reverse direction by throwing body upward by quickly extending arm so hands leaves floor. Catch body and land with hands on floor in original starting position. Repeat.
KneelingPlyoPushup.comments: Keep knees on padded surface. Also keep hips straight throughout movement; upper thighs should be kept inline with torso. Exercise can be performed with

KneelingPlyoPushupWall.name: Kneeling Plyo Push-up (feet against wall)
KneelingPlyoPushupWall.preparation: Kneel on floor with knees on padded surface and feet against floor board or stationary vertical object. With hips straight, position hands under shoulders with arms straight.
KneelingPlyoPushupWall.execution: Bend arm and lower chest near floor. Immediately reverse direction by throwing body upward by quickly extending arm so hands leaves floor. Catch body and land with hands on floor in original starting position. Repeat.
KneelingPlyoPushupWall.comments: Keep feet against floor and knees on padded surface. Also keep hips straight throughout movement; upper thighs should be kept inline with torso. Exercise can be performed

LadderSpeedHop.name: Ladder Speed Hop
LadderSpeedHop.preparation: Stand facing end of agility ladder. Lean forward and bend arms to sides.
LadderSpeedHop.execution: Hop across first ladder rung using both feet. Land on forefeet, allowing heel to make contact or come near ground. Immediately hop over each successive ladder rung until end of ladder is reached.
LadderSpeedHop.comments: Jump using both legs and forefeet to absorb impact and push-off quickly between each jump. Increase intensity by hopping faster. Drill can also be made more challenging by skipping every other or every third rung. Also known as Double Leg Ladder Speed Hops.

KneelingSquatJump.name: Kneeling Squat Jump
KneelingSquatJump.preparation: Kneel on floor with knee pads, feet extended behind body. Begin upright with hips extended.
KneelingSquatJump.execution: Swing arms and hips back. Quickly swing arm forward. As arms continue to travel upward forcefully, extend hips so knees and feet along entire body is thrown upward. Then swiftly pull legs forward and land on feet with arms in front of body. Kneel back down on floor and repeat.
KneelingSquatJump.comments: Knee pads protect skin from abrasions.

LateralBound.name: Lateral Bound
LateralBound.preparation: Stand with feet close together. Bend knees and hips slightly with arms bent to sides or to front. Lift right foot up, slightly off of floor.
LateralBound.execution: Jump far to right side and land right foot with left foot off of ground. Jump far to left side landing on right foot. Continue to bound from side to side.
LateralBound.comments: Attempt to progressively increase speed, length, height, or duration of jumps depending on training goal.

LateralConeHops.name: Lateral Cone Hop
LateralConeHops.preparation: Stand with cone to one side.
LateralConeHops.execution: Jump sideways to opposite side of cone. Upon landing, immediately jump to other side.
LateralConeHops.comments: Use both upper and lower body movements. Attempt to increase speed of jumps, keeping landings short. Perform multiple jumps in succession.

LateralConeJumps.name: Lateral Cone Jumps
LateralConeJumps.preparation: Line up series of cones in straight line. Stand at one end of cone facing sideways.
LateralConeJumps.execution: Jump laterally over first cone, land on both feet between first and second cone, then immediately jump laterally off the ground over the next cone. Repeat until last cone is reached, perform in opposite direction until jumping laterally over first cone in starting position.
LateralConeJumps.comments: Use both upper and lower body movements. Attempt to increase speed of jumps, keeping landings short. Perform multiple jumps in succession. See

LateralLineHop.name: Lateral Line Hop
LateralLineHop.preparation: Stand with feet together to one side of line on floor. Bend hips and knees sightly with arms to sides.
LateralLineHop.execution: Jump to opposite side of line and land on forefeet. Continue jumping from side to side landing on forefeet.
LateralLineHop.comments: Hop side to side of line as quick as possible. Push off of forefeet with feet together.

LongDepthJump.name: Long Depth Jump
LongDepthJump.execution: close to front edge facing measured floor.
LongDepthJump.comments: Step off box landing on both feet behind starting line. Jump off the ground as fast and as far as possible.

LongJumps.name: Broad Jumps
LongJumps.execution: Squat down and jump forward as far as possible using double arm swing. Upon landing, immediately jump forward again.
LongJumps.comments: Use both upper and lower body movements. Keep landings short. Perform 2 or more jumps in succession.

LongSlalomJumps.name: Long Slalom Jumps
LongSlalomJumps.preparation: Stand with both feet together to outside of one of two sets of very short hurdles position in two staggered parallel columns.
LongSlalomJumps.execution: Jump with both feet in alternating diagonal (zigzag) pattern across first hurdle and land on forefeet across to opposite side of hurdle in other column. Continue to land and jump on both forefeet to outside of each short hurdle alternating to adjacent hurdle in opposite row until last hurdle had been reached.
LongSlalomJumps.comments: Take off and land with both forefeet. Keeping landings short. Adjust both arms to gain additional momentum and balance.

LyingDiagonalLegRaiseThrowdownPartner.name: Lying Diagonal Leg Raise Throwdown (with partner)
LyingDiagonalLegRaiseThrowdownPartner.preparation: Lie supine on floor with feet together. Partner stands with feet at each side of head. Grasp partner's legs, just above ankles to each side. Raise legs vertically so partner can bend over slightly to touch feet or ankles.
LyingDiagonalLegRaiseThrowdownPartner.execution: Partner throws legs diagonally toward floor by pushing feet or ankles outward slightly to one side. Immediately lift straight legs back to vertical position by flexing hips. Partner continues to throw legs to floor by pushing feet or ankles away to one side.
LyingDiagonalLegRaiseThrowdownPartner.comments: Continue to hold on to partners legs, just above ankles. Keep legs straight and avoid allowing heels to touch floor. Partner can bend knees in order to more easily bend over particularly if they are taller than participant. Partner can also push feet away to each side, alternating between forward and side leg raises and throws. Also see

LyingLegRaiseThrowdownPartner.name: Lying Leg Raise Throwdown (with partner)
LyingLegRaiseThrowdownPartner.preparation: Lie supine on floor with feet together. Partner stands with feet at each side of head. Grasp partner's legs, just above ankles to each side. Raise legs vertically so partner can bend over slightly to touch feet or ankles.
LyingLegRaiseThrowdownPartner.execution: Partner throws legs toward floor by pushing feet or ankles outward. Immediately lift straight legs back to vertical position by flexing hips. Partner continues to throw legs to floor by pushing feet or ankles away.
LyingLegRaiseThrowdownPartner.comments: Continue to hold on to partners legs, just above ankles. Keep legs straight and avoid allowing heels to touch floor. Partner can bend knees in order to more easily bend over particularly if they are taller than participant. Partner can also push feet away to each side, alternating between forward and side leg raises and throws. Also see

MBAlternatingSideRotationThrowWall.name: Medicine Ball Alternating Side Rotation Throw (against wall)
MBAlternatingSideRotationThrowWall.preparation: Stand with side of body facing wall with feet shoulder width apart. Hold medicine ball at waist level.
MBAlternatingSideRotationThrowWall.execution: Squat down and position ball to side of far hip by rotating shoulders and slightly bent arms away from wall. Quickly rotate torso toward wall driving with legs, hip, waist, and far arm in a slightly upward angle. Release ball so it hits wall approximately head height.
