Quickly step far foot forward so body faces wall with feet approximately shoulder width apart. Catch ball and immediately step opposite leg back so other side faces wall. Repeat.
MBAlternatingSideRotationThrowWall.comments: Start slow and gradually increasing speed. Perform prescribed repetitions or for time. See

MBArchChop.name: Medicine Ball Arch Chop
MBArchChop.preparation: Stand holding medicine ball with hands on each side of ball. Place feet wide apart, pointing approximately 45° outward and knees slightly bent. Bend over and place ball near outside of one foot.
MBArchChop.execution: Raise ball up to side and up over head so torso is upright. Bend over to opposite side and lower ball down to outside of other foot. Repeat with opposite movement, alternating raising and lowering ball back and forth between sides.
MBArchChop.comments: Start slow, gradually increasing speed throughout set. Perform prescribed repetitions or for time. See

MBChestThrow.name: Medicine Ball Chest Throw (with partner)
MBChestThrow.preparation: Stand facing partner, throwing distance apart with one foot forward. First person holds medicine ball with both hands against chest. Partner has arms in front, ready to receive ball.
MBChestThrow.execution: First person throws medicine ball to partner's chest by forcefully extending both arms forward. Partner catches ball in front of chest with both hands, recoils ball toward chest, and immediately throws ball back to first person in same manner. First person catches ball and repeats volley. Continue to throw ball back and forth.
MBChestThrow.comments: Start slow, gradually increasing speed throughout set. Perform prescribed repetitions or for time.

MBChestThrowRebounder.name: Medicine Ball Chest Throw (on rebounder)
MBChestThrowRebounder.preparation: Stand facing medicine ball rebounder with one foot forward. Hold medicine ball with both hands against chest. Bend just enough so ball can be efficiently caught and immediately thrown.
MBChestThrowRebounder.execution: Throw medicine ball near center of rebounder by forcefully extending both arms forward. Catch rebounded ball in front of chest with both hands, recoils ball toward chest, and immediately throw ball to rebounder in same manner. Repeat.
MBChestThrowRebounder.comments: Angle of which one bends over will be dependent upon trajectory of ball, which is affected by various factors, including force of throw, weight of ball, tension and angle of rebounder, distance from rebounder, and angle of throw. Start slow, gradually increasing speed throughout set. Perform prescribed repetitions or for time.

MBChestThrowSitupPartner.name: Medicine Ball Chest Throw Sit-up (with partner)
MBChestThrowSitupPartner.preparation: Two participants face each other and sit on floor facing each other with knees bent. Participants’ feet point toward one another. First participant
MBChestThrowSitupPartner.execution: First participant lies back while holding ball. First participant raises upper body up by first flexing spine and then flexing hips. While completing sit-up, first participant throws ball to partner. Partner catches ball with both hands and executes same sequence. Participant and parter continue to exchange ball.
MBChestThrowSitupPartner.comments: Perform prescribed repetitions or for time. Feet may also be secured under weighted or anchored structure. If feet are not being supported by fixed object, legs may need to be extended somewhat to offer adequate counter balance to upper body.

MBChestThrowWall.name: Medicine Ball Chest Throw (on wall)
MBChestThrowWall.preparation: Stand with feet shoulder width apart in front of wall. Hold medicine ball with both hands against chest.
MBChestThrowWall.execution: Throw medicine ball to wall by forcefully extending both arms forward. Catch ball in front of chest using both hands and repeat.
MBChestThrowWall.comments: Start slow, gradually increasing speed throughout set. Perform prescribed repetitions or for time.

MBChestThrowSitupWall.name: Medicine Ball Chest Throw Sit-up (on wall)
MBChestThrowSitupWall.preparation: Sit on floor facing wall with knees bent. Hold medicine ball with both hands near chest.
MBChestThrowSitupWall.execution: Lie back while hold ball near chest. Raise upper body up by first flexing spine and then flexing hips. While completing sit-up, throw ball toward wall. Catch ball bouncing off of wall with both hands. Reposition ball near chest while laying back. Repeat.
MBChestThrowSitupWall.comments: Perform prescribed repetitions or for time. Feet may also be secured under weighted or anchored structure. If feet are not being supported by fixed object, legs may need to be extended somewhat to offer adequate counter balance to upper body.

MBDiagonalChop.name: Medicine Ball Diagonal Chop
MBDiagonalChop.preparation: Stand holding medicine ball with hands on each side of ball. Place feet wide apart, pointing slightly outward. Bend knees slightly. Raise ball to side of head with arms bent.
MBDiagonalChop.execution: Bring ball downward diagonally around front of body to side of opposite hip by rotating torso and bending forward slightly while pulling ball across body. Immediately return to original position in opposite path by rotating and bring torso back upright while pulling ball to side of head. Repeat chops. Continue movement with ball held near opposite side of head.
MBDiagonalChop.comments: Start slow, gradually increasing speed throughout set. Perform prescribed repetitions or for time. Besides using heavier ball, intensity may be increased somewhat by holding ball slightly further away from body. Since hips are slightly bent, technically some hip adduction / abduction occurs along with internal / external rotation. Knee extension could be considered either dynamic or static since only slight movement occurs under significant resistance.

MBFrontChop.name: Medicine Ball Vertical Chop
MBFrontChop.preparation: Stand holding medicine ball with hands on each side of ball. Place feet wide apart, pointing outward slightly. Raise ball above head with arms bent.
MBFrontChop.execution: Lower ball to front of body. Bend over while continuing to lower ball down and back between legs. Immediately lift ball in opposite path. Stand upright while raising ball up in front of body. Continue to raise ball up over and behind head. Immediately repeat movement.
MBFrontChop.comments: Start slow, gradually increasing speed throughout set. Perform prescribed repetitions or for time.

MBKneelingSideTwistThrowWall.name: Medicine Ball Kneeling Side Twist Throw (against wall)
MBKneelingSideTwistThrowWall.preparation: Kneel on one knee with side of upper leg and body facing wall. Hold medicine ball away from wall at waist or hip height with arms extended.
MBKneelingSideTwistThrowWall.execution: Rotate body toward wall and throw ball against wall at slightly upward angle. Catch ball on rebound. Turn body to original position so medicine ball returns to far side of hip or waist with arms extended. Immediately repeat throws
MBKneelingSideTwistThrowWall.comments: Perform prescribed repetitions or for time. Small yet significant movement occurs through both hips and knee of kneeling leg. See

MBLateralBound.name: Medicine Ball Lateral Bound
MBLateralBound.preparation: Stand with feet close together, holding medicine ball with hands on each side of ball. Bend knees and hips slightly with arms bent to sides or to front. Lift right foot up slightly off of floor.
MBLateralBound.execution: Jump far to right side. Land right foot with left foot off of ground. Position ball forward, away from body. Immediately jump far to left side, landing on right foot. Again, position ball forward away from body. Continue to bound from side to side in same fashion.
MBLateralBound.comments: Ball can also be kept nearer chest without extending arm forward on each land, in which case, shoulder articulation becomes static. Attempt to progressively increase speed, length, height, or duration of jumps depending on training goal.

MBLyingChestThrow.name: Medicine Ball Lying Chest Throw
MBLyingChestThrow.preparation: Participant lies on floor, mat or shallow bench with legs bent. Extend arms upward with hands open, ready to catch ball. Spotter holds medicine ball with both hands at arms length, directly above participant's lower chest.
MBLyingChestThrow.execution: Spotter drops ball above participant's lower chest. Participant catches medicine ball and immediately throws it forcefully upward, extending both arms vertically. Spotter catches ball and repeats.
MBLyingChestThrow.comments: Spotter stand near head to keep ball's fall directly above lower chest. Start slow, gradually increasing speed throughout set. Perform prescribed repetitions or for time.

MBOneArmThrow.name: Medicine Ball One Arm Throw (with partner)
MBOneArmThrow.preparation: Stand facing partner throwing distance apart with left foot forward. First person holds medicine ball with right hand near side of head. Partner has arm up ready to receive ball.
MBOneArmThrow.execution: First person throws medicine ball left of partner's head (partner's right side), forcefully extending arm forward. Partner catches ball with right hand, recoils ball to side of head, and immediately throws ball back to left of first person's head (first person's right side) in same manner. First person catches ball and repeats volley. Repeat by throwing ball back and forth. Continue using left hand to throw to opposite sides.
MBOneArmThrow.comments: Start slow, gradually increasing speed throughout set. Perform prescribed repetitions or for time.

MBOverheadBackwardThrow.name: Medicine Ball Overhead Backward Throw
MBOverheadBackwardThrow.preparation: Stand with feet wider than shoulder width apart. Hold medicine ball overhead with hand on each side of ball.
MBOverheadBackwardThrow.execution: Lower ball with arms straight in long forward arch motion. Squat down and swing ball down between both legs. Immediately lean body back, swing ball forward with arms straight, and extending body and legs. Throw ball back and upward. Walk backwards few steps to reestablish balance.
MBOverheadBackwardThrow.comments: Squat Overhead Backward Throw is considered full body movement. If performing for repetitions or timed duration, throw ball toward solid wall so ball can be more easily retrieved. Throws can also be also be performed for distance on field or in large indoor space.

MBOverheadThrow.name: Medicine Ball Overhead Throw (with partner)
MBOverheadThrow.preparation: Stand facing partner throwing distance apart with one foot forward. First person raises medicine ball above head with arms bent. Partner has arm in front ready to receive ball.
MBOverheadThrow.execution: First person throws medicine ball just above partner's head forcefully, extending both arms forward. Partner catches ball with both hands, recoils ball behind head, and immediately throws ball back to first person in same manner. First person catches ball and repeats volley. Continue to throw ball, back and forth.
MBOverheadThrow.comments: Start slow, gradually increasing speed throughout set. Attempt to throw and catch ball slightly above head instead of in front of head so force of ball can more effectively prestretch muscles (i.e.: catch like model in black shirt). Perform prescribed repetitions or for time.

MBPulloverThrowPartner.name: Medicine Ball Pullover Throw (with partner)
MBPulloverThrowPartner.preparation: Two participants face each other and lie supine on stability ball with feet on floor and knees bent. Participants’ feet point toward one another. First participant holds medicine ball with both hands. First participant positions ball above with arms nearly straight.
MBPulloverThrowPartner.execution: First partner lowers ball back overhead and throws medicine ball forward to partner by forcefully extending shoulder. Partner catches ball over body with arms extended upward. Partner extends ball back behind head and throws ball back by pulling ball overhead to first partner. First partner catches ball over body with arms extended upward and repeats volley to partner.
MBPulloverThrowPartner.comments: Perform prescribed repetitions or for time. Although throw is powered by shoulder extension, dynamic

MBPulloverThrowPartnerStanding.name: Medicine Ball Pullover Throw (with partner standing)
MBPulloverThrowPartnerStanding.preparation: Lie supine on stability ball with feet on floor and knees bent. Hold medicine ball with both hands. Position ball above with arms nearly straight. Partner distances themselves facing legs of participant in position to receive and throw ball back to participant.
MBPulloverThrowPartnerStanding.execution: Lower ball back over head and throw medicine ball forward to partner by forcefully extending shoulder. Partner catches ball and throws ball back. Catch ball and repeat.
MBPulloverThrowPartnerStanding.comments: Partner can either perform same exercise opposite of participant or stand to catch and throw ball back to participant. Perform prescribed repetitions or for time. Although throw is powered by shoulder extension, dynamic

MBPulloverThrowWall.name: Medicine Ball Pullover Throw (against wall)
MBPulloverThrowWall.preparation: Lie supine on stability ball with knees bent and feet on floor facing solid wall. Hold medicine ball with both hands. Position ball above with arms nearly straight.
MBPulloverThrowWall.execution: Lower ball back over head and throw medicine ball on wall. Catch ball and repeat.
MBPulloverThrowWall.comments: Perform prescribed repetitions or for time. Although throw is powered by shoulder extension, dynamic

MBRotationScoopThrow.name: Medicine Ball Rotation Scoop Throw
MBRotationScoopThrow.execution: Stand with feet shoulder width apart or wider. Hold medicine ball in front of body with both hands.

MBRussianTwist.name: Medicine Ball Russian Twist
MBRussianTwist.preparation: Sit on floor with knees and hips bent. Hold medicine ball with both hands. Recline back slightly balancing on hips with bent legs positioned as counterbalance.
MBRussianTwist.execution: Touch ball on floor to one side by turning torso and reaching arms to same side. Touch ball to floor on other side by turning torso and reaching arms to opposite direction. Continue movement by rapidly moving ball from side to side.
MBRussianTwist.comments: Alternative form is to hold ball in front of chest with arms fully extended and parallel to thighs. Rotate upper body to each side, keeping arms in same plane. This alternative form prohibits the ball in making contact with floor at any point in movement. See

MBRussianTwistIntermittentThrowPartner.name: Medicine Ball Russian Twist Intermittent Throw (with partner)
MBRussianTwistIntermittentThrowPartner.preparation: Two participants sit on floor side by side with partner short distance away. First participant holds medicine ball with both hands and reclines back slightly, balancing on hips with bent legs positioned as counterbalance.
MBRussianTwistIntermittentThrowPartner.execution: First participant touches ball on floor to side furthest from partner by turning torso and reaching arms to furthest side. Using similar form, first participant touches ball to floor on side closest to partner then again to side furthest from partner. Upon next twist, first partner throws ball to partner. Partner catches ball and repeats same sequence.
MBRussianTwistIntermittentThrowPartner.comments: Perform prescribed repetitions or for time. See

MBRussianTwistThrowPartner.name: Medicine Ball Russian Twist Throw (with partner)
MBRussianTwistThrowPartner.preparation: Two participants sit on floor side by side with partner short distance away. First participant holds medicine ball with both hands and reclines back slightly, balancing on hips with bent legs positioned as counterbalance.
MBRussianTwistThrowPartner.execution: First participant touches ball on floor to side furthest from partner by turning torso and reaching arms to same side. Using similar form, first participant touches ball to floor on side closest to partner then again to side furthest from partner. Upon next twist, first partner throws ball to partner. Partner catches ball and repeats same sequence.
MBRussianTwistThrowPartner.comments: Perform prescribed repetitions or for time. See

MBRussianTwistThrowWall.name: Medicine Ball Russian Twist Throw (against wall)
MBRussianTwistThrowWall.preparation: Sit on floor with side facing wall and knees and hips bent. Hold medicine ball with both hands. Recline back slightly balancing on hips with bent legs positioned as counterbalance. Position ball just off of floor to side of hip furthest from wall.
MBRussianTwistThrowWall.execution: Throw ball to opposite side onto wall, slightly above head height, by rotating torso and reaching arms toward wall. Catch ball as it bounces off of wall. Return ball to original side by rotating torso and reaching arms away from wall. Repeat.
MBRussianTwistThrowWall.comments: Perform prescribed repetitions or for time. Higher or longer throws further from wall will involve

MBSeatedBackTwistThrow.name: Medicine Ball Seated Backward Twist Throw (with partner standing)
MBSeatedBackTwistThrow.preparation: Sit on floor with legs far apart or sit straddled on bench. Turns torso to one side with reaching hand above other hand, ready to receive ball from behind. Partner stands with medicine ball throwing distance behind slightly over to receiving side.
MBSeatedBackTwistThrow.execution: Partner tosses ball to receiving side. Catch medicine ball and immediately move ball to opposite side by rotating torso. Pull medicine ball beside far hip. Immediately rotate torso back to opposite side and throw ball back to partner. Repeat same sequence. When finished, receive ball from opposite direction and continue.
MBSeatedBackTwistThrow.comments: Start slow, gradually increasing speed throughout set. Perform prescribed repetitions or time. See

MBSeatedTwist.name: Medicine Ball Seated Twist (with partner)
MBSeatedTwist.preparation: With a partner, straddle and sit on bench back to back with space between. Place feet flat on floor. First partner holds medicine ball with both hands.
MBSeatedTwist.execution: Both individuals rotate torso through waist to same side. First partner hands medicine ball to second partner who retrieves ball. Both individuals turn to the opposite side to again exchange medicine ball. Continue to rotate ball to one direction. When finished, repeat opposite direction.
MBSeatedTwist.comments: Start slow, gradually increasing speed throughout set. Perform prescribed repetitions or time. See

MBSeatedTwistMach.name: Medicine Ball Seated Twist (on apparatus)
MBSeatedTwistMach.preparation: Sit on seat facing away from ball ramp. Place feet flat on floor. Hold medicine ball with both hands.
MBSeatedTwistMach.execution: Rotate torso through waist to highest side of ball ramp. Place medicine ball on ramp. Release ball and turn to opposite side. Grasp ball as it travels to other side. Continue to transfer ball to highest side of ball ramp and catch it on opposite side. When finished, adjust ramp to opposite incline and repeat movement in opposite direction.
MBSeatedTwistMach.comments: Start slow, gradually increasing ramp incline, speed, and range of motion. Using heavier ball will also increase difficulty of exercise. Perform prescribed repetitions or time. See

MBSeatedTwistThrow.name: Medicine Ball Seated Side Twist Throw (with partner)
MBSeatedTwistThrow.preparation: With a partner, sit on floor or sit straddled on separate benches. Sit side by side, facing opposite directions approximately 2 meters apart. First person holds medicine ball with both hands.
MBSeatedTwistThrow.execution: First person rotates torso away from partner and pulls medicine ball just behind far hip. First person rotates torso to opposite direction and throws ball to partner. Partner catches ball and executes same sequence. First person catches ball and repeats volley. Continue to exchange ball. When finished, face opposite direction and repeat.
MBSeatedTwistThrow.comments: Start slow, gradually increasing speed throughout set. Perform prescribed repetitions or time. See

MBSideThrow.name: Medicine Ball Side Throw (with partner)
MBSideThrow.preparation: Stand facing partner, throwing distance apart with left foot forward. First person holds medicine ball with both hands near chest, left shoulder slightly forward, right hand behind ball, and left hand in front of ball. Partner has arms forward and shoulders square, ready to receive ball.
MBSideThrow.execution: First person throws medicine ball to partner's chest forcefully, extending right arm and shoulder forward. Partner catches ball with both hands, recoils ball to right of body, and immediately throws ball back to first person's chest in same manner. First person catches ball and repeats volley. Repeat by throwing from left side with right foot and shoulder forward.
MBSideThrow.comments: Start slow, gradually increasing speed throughout set. Perform prescribed repetitions or for time.

MBSideThrowWall.name: Medicine Ball Side Throw
MBSideThrowWall.preparation: Stand facing wall, throwing distance away with left foot forward. Hold medicine ball with both hands near chest, left shoulder slightly forward, right hand behind ball, and left hand in front of ball.
MBSideThrowWall.execution: Throw medicine ball to wall by forcefully extending right arm and shoulder forward. Ball rebounds off of wall. Catch ball with both hands, recoil ball to right of body, and immediately throw ball back to wall, repeating volley. Repeat throwing from left side with right foot and shoulder forward.
MBSideThrowWall.comments: Start slow, gradually increasing speed throughout set. Perform prescribed repetitions or for time. Wall should be impact resistant to avoid structural damage.

MBSideTwistThrowWall.name: Medicine Ball Side Twist Throw (against wall)
MBSideTwistThrowWall.preparation: Stand with side of body facing wall. Position feet wider than shoulder's width apart with knees and hips slightly bent. With both hands, hold medicine ball to front side of hip furthest from wall.
MBSideTwistThrowWall.execution: Rotate body while extending and rotating foot furthest from wall so far leg turns toward wall with foot extended. At same time, rapidly extend arms upward toward wall. Throw ball against wall at slightly upward angle. Catch ball on rebound. Turn body to original position and return medicine ball to far side of hip. Immediately repeat movement.
MBSideTwistThrowWall.comments: Perform prescribed repetitions or for time. See

MBSitUp.name: Medicine Ball Overhead Throw Sit-up (with partner)
MBSitUp.preparation: Two participants face each other and sit on floor facing each other with knees bent. Participants’ feet point toward one another. First participant holds medicine ball with both hands.
MBSitUp.execution: First participant lies back with ball over head and taps ball to floor. First participant immediately throws ball to partner from over head while sitting up. Partner catches ball slightly above and in front of head and repeats steps. Participant and parter continue to volley ball back and forth.
MBSitUp.comments: Perform prescribed repetitions or for time. Feet may also be secured under weighted or anchored structure. If feet are not being supported by fixed object, legs may need to be extended somewhat to offer adequate counter balance to upper body. If upper back does not come completely down at end of movement, abdominal muscles may only be

MBSingleLegChop.name: Medicine Ball Single Leg Chop
MBSingleLegChop.preparation: Stand holding medicine ball with hands on each side of ball. Raise ball above head with arms bent. Raise one foot up off floor.
MBSingleLegChop.execution: Keeping one foot off of floor, lower ball to top of foot by bending over at hip while pulling elevated leg back. Bend supporting knee slightly while reaching down and placing ball on foot. Immediately lift ball in opposite path. Stand upright while raising ball above head. Continue to raise and lower ball on one leg. Repeat by performing movement on opposite leg.
MBSingleLegChop.comments: Start slow, gradually increasing speed throughout set. Perform prescribed repetitions or for time. If hip (ie:

MBSitUpWall.name: Medicine Ball Overhead Throw Sit-up
MBSitUpWall.preparation: Sit on floor facing wall with knees bent. Hold medicine ball with both hands.
MBSitUpWall.execution: Lie back with ball over head and tap ball to floor. Immediately throw ball to wall from over head while sitting up. Ball rebounds off of wall. Catch ball slightly above and in front of head. Continue to volley ball against wall.
MBSitUpWall.comments: Perform prescribed repetitions or for time. Wall should be impact resistant to avoid structural damage. Feet may also be secured under weighted or anchored structure. If feet are not being supported by fixed object, legs may need to be extended somewhat to offer adequate counter balance to upper body.

MBSlamBounce.name: Medicine Ball Slam Bounce
MBSlamBounce.preparation: Stand with feet shoulder width apart. Hold medicine ball with both hands.
MBSlamBounce.execution: Lift ball above head while extending body. Reverse direction and slam ball into ground. Catch ball back with both hands and repeat.
MBSlamBounce.comments: If ball does not bounce, keep hold of it during slams. Downward movements such as Spinal Flexion and Shoulder Extension resists against inertia of ball in attempt to accelerate ball's speed downward.

MBSquatForwardThrow.name: Medicine Ball Squat and Forward Throw
MBSquatForwardThrow.preparation: Stand with feet hip width apart. Hold medicine ball in front of chest with both hands.
MBSquatForwardThrow.execution: Squat down by bending knees and hips and lean forward slightly. Immediately extend body by extending hips, knees, and feet. Throw ball upward and forward, leap forward, and land on both feet with legs bent to absorb impact. Stand upright.
MBSquatForwardThrow.comments: Squat and Forward Throw is considered full body movement. If performing for repetitions or timed duration, throw ball toward solid wall so ball can be more easily retrieved. Throws can also be also be performed for distance on field or in large indoor space.

MBSquatUnderhandForwardThrow.name: Medicine Ball Squat and Underhand Forward Throw
MBSquatUnderhandForwardThrow.preparation: Stand with feet wider than shoulder width apart. Hold medicine ball overhead with hand on each side of ball.
MBSquatUnderhandForwardThrow.execution: Lower ball with arms straight in long forward arch motion. Squat down slightly and swing ball down between both legs. Immediately lean body forward, swing ball forward with arms straight, and extending body and legs. Throw ball forward and upward then jump forward. Land on both feet allowing both legs to bend to absorb impact. Stand upright.
MBSquatUnderhandForwardThrow.comments: Squat Underhand Forward Throw is considered full body movement. If performing for repetitions or timed duration, throw ball toward solid wall so ball can be more easily retrieved. Throws can also be also be performed for distance on field or in large indoor space.

MBSquatOverheadThrow.name: Medicine Ball Squat and Overhead Throw
MBSquatOverheadThrow.preparation: Stand with feet hip width apart. Hold medicine ball with both hands in front of upper chest or face.
MBSquatOverheadThrow.execution: Squat down by bending knees and hips. Immediately squat up by extending hips, knees, and feet. Just before legs completely extend, begin to throw ball upward by extending arms upward. Jump up off ground, straighten arms, and release ball overhead. Land on both feet with legs slightly bent to absorb impact. Stand upright and retrieve ball after it falls to ground.
MBSquatOverheadThrow.comments: Squat and Overhead Throw is considered full body movement. Dynamic spinal extension may occur in some individuals performing maximal attempts. Slight spine flexion may occur during bent over squat position dependent upon participants depth and flexibility. Also, spinal hyper-extension may occur as body extends and leaves ground. Movement can also be performed with successive throws (see

MBSquatsOverheadThrows.name: Medicine Ball Squat and Overhead Throws
MBSquatsOverheadThrows.preparation: Stand with feet hip width apart. Hold medicine ball with both hands in front of upper chest or face.
MBSquatsOverheadThrows.execution: Squat down by bending knees and hips. Immediately squat up by extending hips, knees, and feet. Just before legs completely extend, begin to throw ball upward by extending arms upward. Jump up off ground, straighten arms, and release ball overhead. Land on both feet with legs slightly bent to absorb impact. Stand upright and catch ball as it falls back down. Repeat throwing and catching ball.
MBSquatsOverheadThrows.comments: Squat and Overhead Throw is considered full body movement. Dynamic spinal extension may occur in some individuals performing maximal attempts. Slight spine flexion may occur during bent over squat position dependent upon participants depth and flexibility. Also, spinal hyper-extension may occur as body extends and leaves ground. Movement can also be performed intermittently for greater recovery between throws allowing for greater loads to be used (see

MBStandingTwist.name: Medicine Ball Standing Twist (with partner)
MBStandingTwist.preparation: With a partner, stand facing away from each other, slightly less than a meter away. Place feet wider than shoulder width apart, knees slightly bent. First partner holds medicine ball with both hands.
MBStandingTwist.execution: Both individuals rotate to opposite sides. First partner hands medicine ball from behind to second partner who retrieves ball from behind. Both individuals turn to the opposite sides to again exchange medicine ball from behind. Continue to rotate ball in a figure 8 one direction. When finished, repeat opposite direction.
MBStandingTwist.comments: Start slow, gradually increasing speed throughout set. Perform prescribed repetitions or time. Since hips are slightly bent, technically some hip adduction / abduction occurs along with internal / external rotation. See

MBStandingTwistMach.name: Medicine Ball Standing Twist (on apparatus)
MBStandingTwistMach.preparation: Stand straddling seat and facing away from ball ramp with hips and knees slightly bent. Hold medicine ball with both hands.
MBStandingTwistMach.execution: Rotate body to highest side of ball ramp. Place medicine ball on ramp. Release ball and turn to opposite side. Grasp ball as it travels to other side. Continue to transfer ball to highest side of ball ramp and catch it on opposite side. When finished, adjust ramp to opposite incline and repeat movement in opposite direction.
MBStandingTwistMach.comments: Start slow, gradually increasing ramp incline, speed, and range of motion. Using heavier ball will also increase difficulty of exercise. Perform prescribed repetitions or time. Since hips are slightly bent, some hip adduction / abduction occurs along with internal / external rotation. See

MBStandingTwistSelf.name: Medicine Ball Standing Twist
MBStandingTwistSelf.execution: Stand holding medicine ball in front of body with arms bent. Place feet wider than shoulder width apart, knees slightly bent.

MBTwistThrow.name: Medicine Ball Side Twist Throw (with partner)
MBTwistThrow.preparation: Stand side by side throwing distance apart facing same direction as partner. Position feet wider than shoulder's width apart. First person holds medicine ball with both hands, slightly away from body with arms slightly bent. Partner turns torso toward first person ready to receive ball.
MBTwistThrow.execution: First person rotates upper body with medicine ball completely away from partner. Then he immediately rotates upper body toward partner and releases ball. Partner catches ball and executes same sequence by rotating completely away, then back toward first person. First person catches ball and repeats volley. Continue to exchange ball. When finished, face opposite direction and repeat.
MBTwistThrow.comments: Start slow, gradually increasing speed throughout set. Perform prescribed repetitions or time. See

MBWallShot.name: Medicine Ball Wall Shot
MBWallShot.preparation: Hold ball with both hands close to chest or face. Stand close to wall.
MBWallShot.execution: Squat down with thighs at or slightly lower than parallel to floor. Quickly squat back up and throw medicine ball to target marked on wall, with knees and arms fully extended. Catch ball with arms and knees slightly bent, return to near upper chest or face while descending for next shot. Repeat.
MBWallShot.comments: Typically, men throw at 10' (3 m) target, whereas, women throw at 9' (2.75 m) target. Stay close to wall so ball does not need to bounce horizontally, allowing ball to be caught more efficiently. Feet stay on floor with weight distributed between forefoot and heel throughout most of movement, however, no issues if heels raise slightly. In Crossfit, this movement is known as Wall Ball Shots.

MultipleBoxJumpsProgressive.name: Multiple Box Jumps (Progressive)
MultipleBoxJumpsProgressive.comments: in series spaced apart with room to jump between each box. Stand in front of first box with narrower than shoulder width stance.

MultipleBoxDepthJumps.name: Multiple Box Depth Jumps
MultipleBoxDepthJumps.execution: in series spaced apart with room to jump between each box. Stand in front of first box with narrower than shoulder width stance.
MultipleBoxDepthJumps.comments: Jump to first box landing with both feet, drop to floor then immediately jump to next box. Repeat until last box is reached.

OneArmPlyoPushUpMB.name: Self-assisted Plyo Push-up (on medicine ball)
OneArmPlyoPushUpMB.preparation: Kneel before medicine ball. Place one hand on top of ball and other hand on floor, slightly wider than shoulder width away. Position upper body above both hands with one arm straight on floor and other arm bent with hand on ball. Straighten body with forefeet back away from ball on floor, shoulder width apart.
OneArmPlyoPushUpMB.execution: Lower body until slight stretch is felt in shoulder or chest. Immediately push body up rapidly. Continue to push down on medicine ball as hand on floor leaves ground. Place hand back on floor in original position, catching body as it falls back down toward floor. Continue and repeat.
OneArmPlyoPushUpMB.comments: Keep hips and waist straight. As with any plyometric, ensure solid strength foundation is first achieved. Joints, particularly shoulders should be free of biomechanical deficiencies:

PikeJump.name: Pike Jump
PikeJump.preparation: Stand with feet shoulder width or narrower.
PikeJump.execution: Swinging both arms back to each side and squat down by bending knees and hips. Swing arms forward and jump upward. Immediately kick both legs forward while reaching forward so hands make contact with feet with legs straight. Extend body vertically, land on forefeet, and squat down to absorb impact. Pull arms back and repeat if needed.
PikeJump.comments: Movement can be performed in successive repetitions (see

PikeJumps.name: Pike Jumps
PikeJumps.preparation: Stand with feet shoulder width or narrower. Swinging both arms back to each side and squat down by bending knees and hips.
PikeJumps.execution: Swing arms forward and jump upward. Immediately kick both legs forward while reaching forward so hands make contact with feet with legs straight. Extend body vertically, land on forefeet, and squat down to absorb impact. Pull arms back to sides and repeat movement sequence for required number of repetitions.
PikeJumps.comments: Movement can be performed in successive repetitions as shown or as single rep (see

PlankShuffleMB.name: Plank Shuffle (on medicine ball)
PlankShuffleMB.preparation: Kneel before medicine ball. Place left hand on top of ball and right hand on floor, slightly wider than shoulder width away. Position upper body above both hands with right arm straight and left arm bent with hand on ball. Straighten body and place forefeet back away from ball on floor, shoulder width apart.
PlankShuffleMB.execution: Push upper body up onto ball so right hands is placed on top side of ball next to left hand. Immediately place left hand onto floor slightly wider than shoulder width away. Immediately shift upper body to original side with the opposite movement. Repeat by alternating sides.
PlankShuffleMB.comments: Start slow, gradually increasing speed throughout set. Keep body straight throughout movement.

PlatformDepthJump.name: Box Depth Jump
PlatformDepthJump.execution: close to front edge facing platform.
PlatformDepthJump.comments: Step off box landing on both feet between box and platform. Jump off the ground as fast as possible onto the platform.

QuadrantJumpsDiagonal.name: Quadrant Jumps (diagonal)
QuadrantJumpsDiagonal.preparation: Stand with both feet together in one of two lower sections of quadrant.
QuadrantJumpsDiagonal.execution: Jump forward into upper quadrant then immediately jump diagonally back. Immediately jump forward to other upper quadrant, then diagonally back to starting square. Immediately repeat diagonally crossing pattern sequence.
QuadrantJumpsDiagonal.comments: Perform this exercise as fast as possible while avoiding stepping on lines and maintaining balance and control. Jump and land on forefeet with heels slightly elevated off of floor.

QuadrantJumpsSquare.name: Quadrant Jumps (square)
QuadrantJumpsSquare.preparation: Stand with both feet together in one of two lower sections of quadrant.
QuadrantJumpsSquare.execution: Jump to each square of quadrant in clockwise direction.
QuadrantJumpsSquare.comments: Perform this exercise as fast as possible while avoiding stepping on lines and maintaining balance and control. Jump and land on forefeet with heels slightly elevated off of floor.

SeatedBoxJump.name: Seated Box Jump
SeatedBoxJump.preparation: Sit on squat box facing elevated platform. Position lower legs vertical or ankles slightly forward of knees. Place arms down to sides.
SeatedBoxJump.execution: Swing arms forward. On arm's back swing, begin to lean torso forward. Swing arms forward again, shift body weight onto feet, and jump off ground onto elevated platform. Land feet on top of elevated platform.
SeatedBoxJump.comments: Ideally, knees could be behind ankles (further back than what is shown) when initially seated. In this position, greater stretch reflex can be created through hips (via

ShoulderTapPushUp.name: Shoulder Tap Push-up
ShoulderTapPushUp.preparation: Lie prone on floor with hands slightly wider than shoulder width. Raise body up off floor to plank position by extending arms with body straight.
ShoulderTapPushUp.execution: Lower body to floor. Push body upward by extending arms. Rapidly tap shoulder with opposite hand and place it back on floor. Continue and repeat.

SingleLegBoxDepthJump.name: Single Leg Box Depth Jump
SingleLegBoxDepthJump.execution: or platform. Stand on one leg with other leg elevated or extended forward.
SingleLegBoxDepthJump.comments: Hop forward off box or platform on one foot. Pull arms back to each side and land on one foot. Immediately throw arms forward and jump up to higher box or platform. Land again on same foot, bending leg to absorb impact. Repeat with other leg.

SingleLegHops.name: Single Leg Hops
SingleLegHops.preparation: Stand on one leg with other leg extended back. Squat partially down and pull arms back behind body to each side.
SingleLegHops.execution: Swing arms forward, kick elevated leg forward, and jump forward. Begin to pull arms back just before descent. Land with arms behind body to each side. Absorb landing by lowering body to partial squat position. Continue forward jumps until desired distance is reached. Repeat on other foot.
SingleLegHops.comments: Land on forefoot then come down on whole foot. Arms can be pulled behind body either through sagittal plane, transverse planes, or combination of both directions.

SingleLegHurdleDepthJump.name: Single Leg Hurdle Depth Jump
SingleLegHurdleDepthJump.comments: Step forward off edge of plyo box. Pull both arms back and drop to ground. Land on one foot with other foot held up just above floor, throw both arms forward, and jump up over hurdle. Pull legs up to clear hurdle. Extend legs forward and down. Land on both feet, bend legs to absorb impact and stand. Repeat movement pattern on opposite leg.

SingleLegLateralHop.name: Single Leg Lateral Hop (over line)
SingleLegLateralHop.preparation: Straddle line on floor with arms to sides. Lift foot off of floor by bending knee. Slightly bend hip and knee of supporting leg.
SingleLegLateralHop.execution: Jump to opposite side of line and land on forefoot. Continue to jump side to side landing on forefeet while keeping foot elevated.

SingleLegLateralHopBarrier.name: Single Leg Lateral Hop (over barrier)
SingleLegLateralHopBarrier.preparation: Stand on one leg to one side of cone. Slightly bend hip and knee of supporting leg.
SingleLegLateralHopBarrier.execution: Jump over cone to opposite side, landing on forefoot. Continue to jump over cone from side to side landing on forefeet while keeping foot elevated.

SingleLegSpeedHops.name: Single Leg Speed Hops
SingleLegSpeedHops.preparation: Stand on right leg; lift left foot off of floor by bending knee.
SingleLegSpeedHops.execution: Similar to initiating running movement, lean forward, bend supporting right leg, swing bent left forward, pull left arm back, and bend right arm forward. Instead 'run' on only one leg by hopping forward on right foot. As traveling through air, pull right leg forward and bend left leg back while swinging left arm forward and right arm back. Right forefoot makes contact with floor. As entire foot lands on floor, pull left arm back and right arm forward. Continue hopping forward on right leg using same single-leg 'running' pattern until desired distance is reached. Repeat on other right foot.
SingleLegSpeedHops.comments: Initial hop may or may not resemble

SingleLegVerticalDepthJump.name: Single Leg Vertical Depth Jump
SingleLegVerticalDepthJump.execution: . Stand on one leg with other leg elevated or extended forward slightly.
SingleLegVerticalDepthJump.comments: Hop forward off box on one foot. Pull arms back to each side and land on one foot. Immediately throw arms forward and jump up. Land again on same foot, bending leg to absorb impact. Repeat with other leg.

SingleLegVerticalDepthPowerJump.name: Single Leg Vertical Depth Power Jump
SingleLegVerticalDepthPowerJump.execution: or platform. Stand on one leg with other leg elevated or extended forward.
SingleLegVerticalDepthPowerJump.comments: Bend knee and lift heel of supporting leg and swing arms back. Drop off of box or platform onto forward positioned foot. Land on one foot and bend legs and hips to absorb impact. Throw arms forward and upward, raise knee of lifted leg and extend hip, knee and foot of supporting leg. Jump up by extending body and arms. Touch highest flag with one or both hands. Land on both feet and squat down to absorb impact. Drop arms and stand upright. Repeat movement pattern on opposite leg.

SingleLegVerticalHops.name: Single Leg Vertical Hop
SingleLegVerticalHops.preparation: Stand on one leg; lift other foot off of floor by bending knee.
SingleLegVerticalHops.execution: Quickly squat down by bending knee and hip while extending raised leg back and swinging arms back. Immediately jump upward while swinging raised leg and arms forward and upward. Extend body vertically. Land on either same foot or both feet. Continue jumps for desired number of repetitions then repeat on other leg.
SingleLegVerticalHops.comments: Land on forefoot then come down on whole foot. Either repeat for continuous hops or rest longer between jump for more maximal effort. Alternatively, consider alternating between legs.

SingleLegVerticalJump.name: Single Leg Vertical Jump
SingleLegVerticalJump.preparation: Stand on one leg by elevating other leg behind body with knee bent.
SingleLegVerticalJump.execution: Quickly squat down by bending knee and hip while extending raised leg back and swinging arms back. Immediately jump upward while swinging raised leg and arms forward and upward. Extend body vertically. Lower arms down to sides and land on either same foot or both feet. Bend ankles, knees, and hips to absorb impact. Repeat movement pattern on opposite leg.
SingleLegVerticalJump.comments: Use both upper and lower body movement. Land on forefoot then come down on whole foot.

SingleLegVerticalPowerJump.name: Single Leg Vertical Power Jump
SingleLegVerticalPowerJump.preparation: Stand on one leg under vertical jump flag.
SingleLegVerticalPowerJump.execution: Quickly squat down by bending knee and hip while extending raised leg back and swinging arms back. Immediately jump upward while swinging raised leg and arms forward and upward. Lower arms down to sides and land on either same foot or both feet. Bend ankles, knees, and hips to absorb impact. Repeat movement pattern on opposite leg.
SingleLegVerticalPowerJump.comments: Use both upper and lower body movement. Land on forefoot then come down on whole foot.

SingleLegZigzagHop.name: Single Leg Zigzag Hop
SingleLegZigzagHop.preparation: Straddle line on floor with arms to sides. Lift foot off of floor by bending knee. Slightly bend hip and knee of supporting leg.
SingleLegZigzagHop.execution: Jump on one foot in alternating diagonal (zigzag) pattern across each side of line. Jump and land on forefoot while keeping other foot elevated. Repeat with opposite foot.
SingleLegZigzagHop.comments: Attempt to increase speed of jumps, keeping landings short. Some individuals my exhibit

SlalomJump.name: Slalom Jump
SlalomJump.preparation: Stand with both feet together to one side of extended line.
SlalomJump.execution: Jump on both forefeetfeet in alternating diagonal pattern across each side of line. Continue jumping in zigzag pattern over line moving forward until marked distance is reached or for set time.
SlalomJump.comments: Suggested length of line is approximately 10-15 feet (3-4.5 m) long, but it can be any length. Attempt to increase speed of jumps, keeping landings short. Perform multiple jumps in succession. Also see exercise performed with

SlalomJumpAgilityLadder.name: Slalom Jump (with agility ladder)
SlalomJumpAgilityLadder.preparation: Place Agility Ladder on floor. Stand with your right foot in first box and with left foot outside box.
SlalomJumpAgilityLadder.execution: Jump up with both feet to right and forward direction and land with left foot in box. Immediately push off both feet forward towards left direction to next box and land with right foot in box.
SlalomJumpAgilityLadder.comments: Attempt to increase speed of jumps, keeping landings short. Perform multiple jumps in succession. Movement can also be performed

SpeedHop.name: Speed Hop
SpeedHop.preparation: Stand with both feet together. Lean forward and bend arms to sides.
SpeedHop.execution: Hop forward using both feet. Repeat until desired distance is reached.

SplitJump.name: Split Jump
SplitJump.preparation: Stand with one foot forward and other foot back with knees initially bent only slightly. Dip body down by bending legs more.
SplitJump.execution: Immediately jump upward. Quickly reposition legs and land with feet in opposite positions. Immediately dip body down by bending legs just short of rear knee making contact with floor. Keep torso upright and hip of rear leg straight. Repeat sequence with opposite leg movement. Continue jumps by while alternating leg positions.
SplitJump.comments: are required so hip of rear leg can extend back without pulling upper body forward.

SquatJump.name: Squat Jump
SquatJump.preparation: Stand with moderately wide stance with feet pointing out slightly. Place wrists together and position bent arms in front of body.
SquatJump.execution: Squat down with knees angled outward slightly, same direction as feet. Allow bent arms to be lowered between knees. Immediately jump off ground as high as possible pushing off with forefeet while extending arms overhead. Land and lower body back into squat position. Repeat.
SquatJump.comments: Keep knees pointed same direction as feet.

SquatJumpMB.name: Medicine Ball Squat Jump
SquatJumpMB.preparation: Stand with moderately wide stance with feet pointing out slightly. Hold medicine ball near chest with elbows pointing downward.
SquatJumpMB.execution: Squat down with knees angled outward slightly, same direction as feet. Allow bent arms to be lowered between knees. Immediately jump off ground as high as possible pushing off with forefeet. Land and repeat.
SquatJumpMB.comments: Keep ball near chest and keep knees pointed same direction as feet.

StairCaseDepthJump.name: Staircase Depth Jump
StairCaseDepthJump.execution: close to front edge facing staircase.
StairCaseDepthJump.comments: Step off box landing on both feet between box and staircase. Jump off the ground as fast as possible to highest step.

StairJumps.name: Stair Jumps
StairJumps.execution: Squat down and jump up steps using double arm swing. Upon landing, immediately jump up steps again.
StairJumps.comments: Use both upper and lower body movements. Keep landings short. Increase number of steps jumped each repetition as ability improves. Perform 2 or more jumps in succession.

StandingTripleJump.name: Standing Triple Jump
StandingTripleJump.execution: Stand with both feet behind starting line or with feet staggered, first foot behind starting line and second foot back.

TripleJump.name: Triple Jump
TripleJump.preparation: Stand 17 to 18 strides from block. Run to block.
TripleJump.execution: Hop forward on first leg and land on same foot while keeping second foot elevated off of floor. Hop forward again on first foot and land on second foot. Jump forward on second foot. Bring both feet together with knees parallel to chest while jumping into the pit. Land jump with heels first.
TripleJump.comments: Do not run beyond board during hop. While in air during hop, skip, and jump, throw arms in front of body, no lower than chest and no higher than chin height. See jump in

TuckJump.name: Tuck Jump
TuckJump.execution: Stand straight with feet shoulder width apart.

FixedBar.name: Fixed Bar Back Stretch
FixedBar.execution: Stand facing stationary bar. Grasp stationary bar with one hand approximately waist height.

Doorway.name: Doorway Biceps Stretch
Doorway.execution: Stand at end of wall or in doorway facing perpendicular to wall. Position front of straight arm and palm on surface of wall. Situate arm around same height of shoulder with elbow positioned away from wall.

VerticalJump.name: Vertical Power Jump
VerticalJump.execution: Quickly swing both arms up, then immediately down. Bend over and squat while pulling both arms back behind body to each side. Immediately swing arms forward and upward while raising torso upright and heels slightly off of floor. Raise arms upward while extending hips, knees, and feet. Touch highest flag with one hand. Land on both feet and squat down. Drop arms and stand upright.
VerticalJump.comments: Use both upper and lower body movement. Dynamic spinal extension may occur in some individuals performing maximal attempts. Slight spine flexion may occur during bent over squat position dependent upon participants depth and flexibility. Also spinal hyper-extension may occur as feet leave ground with body extended.

VerticalJumps.name: Vertical Jumps
VerticalJumps.comments: Squat down and jump up as high as possible. Reach up with one or both hands and hit flag. Upon landing, immediately jump up again and attempt to reach higher.

Standing.name: Standing Biceps Stretch
Standing.execution: Clasp hands behind back with palms together. Straighten arms and rotate arms (inside down) so palm turn downward.

VerticalJumpNoReach.name: Vertical Jump (no reach)
VerticalJumpNoReach.preparation: Stand near wall with measurement chart.
VerticalJumpNoReach.execution: Quickly swing both arms up, then immediately down. Bend over and squat while pulling both arms back behind body to each side. Immediately swing arms forward and upward while raising torso upright and heels slightly off of floor. Raise arms upward while extending hips, knees, and feet. As body continues to rise and fall, continue to rotate both arms in circular pattern down and behind then up and forward. Land on both feet and squat down with arms extended forward. Stand upright.
VerticalJumpNoReach.comments: Since jump height can be measured from floor to bottom of feet, legs should be kept extended with feet positioned horizontally at height of jump.

Standing.name: Standing Brachioradialis Stretch
Standing.execution: Cross wrists, point thumbs downward, and clasp hands.

WallPlyoPushup.name: Wall Plyo Push-up
WallPlyoPushup.preparation: Stand in front of wall and place palms on walls, fingers pointing upwards, shoulder width or slightly wider, between upper waist to chest height. Step back so upper body is leaning forward slightly with arms straight. Position feet shoulder width apart or slightly wider.
WallPlyoPushup.execution: Lower body towards wall by behind arms to each side. Before head makes contact with wall, push body away from wall by extending arms, forcefully enough to permit palms to momentarily lose contact with wall. Allow body to fall forward, replacing palms on wall in original position and repeat.
WallPlyoPushup.comments: Keep body straight throughout movement. At bottom position, upper arms flare out approximately 45° from torso to each side.

Lying.name: Lying Chest Stretch
Lying.preparation: Lie prone on mat and place bent arm to side, shoulder and elbow bent 90°. Extend opposite arm out to side of body with hand on floor. Also bend knee of leg opposite of bent arm.
Lying.execution: Roll body onto side of bent arm by pushing onto floor with opposite arm and positioning bent upper leg over straight lower leg until stretch is felt. Hold stretch. Repeat in opposite position.
Lying.comments: Upper chest becomes more stretched with elbow lower. Lower chest and pectoralis minor become more stretched with elbow higher.

PCCrossHand.name: Lever Back Stretch
PCCrossHand.preparation: Sit on seat in forward position with lower legs on shin pad, feet on foot rest. Place hands through wrist straps. Hold upper bar with arms crossed, overhand grip.
PCCrossHand.execution: Push and lower seat back. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite arm position.
PCCrossHand.comments: To intensify stretch, look up or to one side.

PNFSeated.name: PNF Seated Biceps Stretch
PNFSeated.execution: Instruct participant to sit on floor or bench and place arms to behind hips. From behind, grasp participant's wrists, positioning them downward and close together.

Doorway.name: Doorway Front Deltoid Stretch
Doorway.execution: Stand at end of wall or in doorway facing perpendicular to wall. Position palm on surface of wall slightly lower than shoulder. Bend elbow slightly.

Lying.name: Lying Front Deltoid Stretch
Lying.preparation: Lie prone on mat and extend both arms out to sides. Position right arm slightly lower than shoulder. Also bend left knee.
Lying.execution: Roll body onto right side by pushing left hand onto floor. Positioning bent left leg over straight right leg until stretch is felt. Hold stretch. Repeat in opposite position.
Lying.comments: For those who require body to be turned over more to feel adequate stretch, upper leg can positioned back further away from straight leg as shown.

Seated.name: Seated Biceps Stretch
Seated.execution: Sit on floor or mat. Lean back and place hands flat on floor close together behind body with fingers positioned away from body.

Wall.name: Wall Front Deltoid Stretch
Wall.execution: Face away from wall. Bend over and place hands slightly wider than shoulder width as high as possible on wall with fingers positioned upward.

FixedBar.name: Fixed Bar Side Deltoid Stretch
FixedBar.execution: Face stationary bar. Grasp stationary bar with one hand approximately chest height. Rotate body so upper arm is positioned across chest.

SideDelt.name: Side Deltoid Stretch
SideDelt.execution: Position arm across chest. Place opposite hand on elbow.

Wall.name: Wall Biceps Stretch
Wall.execution: Face away from wall. Bend over and place hands close together as high as possible on wall with fingers positioned upward.

Doorway.name: Doorway Chest Stretch
Doorway.execution: Stand at end of wall or in doorway facing perpendicular to wall. Place inside of bent arm on surface of wall. Position bent elbow shoulder height.

Cat.name: Cat Stretch
Cat.execution: Kneel on mat or floor. Place hands shoulder width apart.

PNFChestBehindHead.name: PNF Behind Head Chest Stretch
PNFChestBehindHead.preparation: Instruct participant to sit on floor or bench and clasp hands behind head, facing forward. Stand behind participant and position leg behind their head. Place hands on participant's elbows.
PNFChestBehindHead.execution: Pull participant's elbows back while stabilizing participant's torso with leg. Hold stretch.
PNFChestBehindHead.comments: For more flexible individuals, placing leg behind their knee may not be required to gain leverage as is required with less flexible individuals. See

StraightArm.name: Straight Arm Chest Stretch
StraightArm.execution: With arm extended, position hand on fixed structure shoulder height.

PNFSeated.name: PNF Seated Front Deltoid Stretch
PNFSeated.execution: Instruct participant to sit on floor or bench and place arms to behind hips. From behind, grasp participant's wrists, positioning them wider than shoulder width.

Plow.name: Plow Stretch
Plow.execution: Lie on back and lift legs and hip overhead.

Seated.name: Seated Front Deltoid Stretch
Seated.execution: Sit on floor or mat. Lean back and place hands flat on floor behind body slightly wider than shoulder width with fingers positioned away from body.

FixedBar.name: Fixed Bar Rear Deltoid Stretch
FixedBar.execution: Face stationary bar. Grasp stationary bar with one hand approximately face height. Rotate body so upper arm is positioned across neck.

Squatting.name: Squatting Lower Back Stretch
Squatting.execution: Stand facing hip height fixed bar approximately arm length away. Grasp fixed bar.

BentoverCat.name: Bent-over Cat Stretch
BentoverCat.execution: Bend over with hands just above bent knees.

RearDelt.name: Rear Deltoid Stretch
RearDelt.execution: Position arm across neck. Place opposite hand on elbow.

CatMovement.name: Cat Movement
CatMovement.preparation: Kneel on mat or floor. Place hands shoulder width apart.
CatMovement.execution: Flex spine by hunching back up. Extend spine by arching back. Repeat.

Lying.name: Lying Lower Back Stretch
Lying.execution: Lie supine on floor or mat. Raise both knees and grasp back of thighs behind knees.

PCLowBack.name: Lever Lower Back Stretch
PCLowBack.preparation: Sit on seat in forward position with lower legs on shin pad, feet on foot rest. Place hands through wrist straps. Hold upper bar with overhand grip.
PCLowBack.execution: Push and lower seat back. Hold stretch.

SeatedBentover.name: Seated Bent-over Lower Back Stretch
SeatedBentover.execution: Sit on chair or bench with feet wide apart. Bend over and position shoulders between knees.

SeatedFloor.name: Seated Lower Back Stretch
SeatedFloor.execution: Sit on floor or mat with feet apart and knees bent approximately 90 degrees.

Bentover.name: Pike Straight Leg Calf Stretch
Bentover.execution: There are number of ways to enter into this stretch:
Bentover.comments: Although angle of ankles increase as hands travel closer to feet (requiring less ankle/Gastrocnemius flexibility), angle of hips decreases (requiring more hip/Hamstrings flexibility). As hamstrings are stretched through hip, they pull on gastrocnemius due to intertwining contact hamstrings have on gastrocnemius behind knee.

Lunging.name: Lunging Straight Leg Calf Stretch
Lunging.execution: Stand with one leg far forward and other leg extended back with knees straight. Both feet are positioned directly forward.

FloorBoard.name: Floor Board Straight Leg Calf Stretch
FloorBoard.execution: Face wall with both knees slightly bent. Position fore foot on wall with heel on floor.

SingleLegBentover.name: Single Leg Pike Straight Leg Calf Stretch
SingleLegBentover.execution: Step forward with one front forward. Bend over and place hands on floor well in front of forward foot with arms straight.

Step.name: Step Straight Leg Calf Stretch
Step.execution: Position toes and balls of feet on stair step or calf block with arches and heels extending off. Use railing or wall for balance.

Towel.name: Towel Straight Leg Calf Stretch
Towel.execution: Sit of floor or mat and place towel or band under foot. With both ends of towel or band in each hand, straighten leg with towel under foot.

KneeHug.name: Knee Hug
KneeHug.preparation: Stand on one leg. Raise knee high and grasp shin below knee with both hands.
KneeHug.execution: Pull knee toward body until stretch is felt in hip. Release and step forward with stretched leg. Repeat with opposite leg. Continue by alternating stretch and step between each leg until specific distance is covered or desired number of repetitions have been completed.

Wall.name: Wall Straight Leg Calf Stretch
Wall.execution: Place both hands on wall with arms extended. Lean against wall with one leg bent forward and other leg extended back with knee straight and foot positioned directly forward.

Lying.name: Lying Glute Stretch
Lying.execution: Lie on floor or mat. Bend knees with feet on floor. Cross lower leg over thigh of other leg. Grasp back of thigh of lower leg with both hands.

LyingModified.name: Lying Glute Stretch
LyingModified.execution: Lie on floor or mat. Bend knees with feet on floor. Cross lower leg over thigh of other leg. Grasp foot and knee with both hands.

LyingTowel.name: Towel Lying Glute Stretch
LyingTowel.execution: Lasso lower thigh with towel and lie on floor or mat. Bend knees with feet on floor. Cross lower leg over thigh of lassoed leg. Holding each side of towel position towel under knee.

PCGlute.name: Lever Glute Stretch
PCGlute.preparation: Sit on seat in forward position with lower leg on shin pad, feet on foot rest. Place hands through wrist straps. Hold lower bar with overhand grip. Position ankle on thigh or knee.
PCGlute.execution: Push and lower seat back. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite leg.
PCGlute.comments: Ankle can be placed on top edge of shin pad if it can not be positioned above knee.

LyingWall.name: Lying Wall Glute Stretch
LyingWall.execution: Sit on floor with hip and thigh against wall. Lift back of legs up against wall by pivoting on hips and lying on back. Cross lower leg over thigh of straight leg.

PNFLying.name: PNF Lying Glute Stretch
PNFLying.execution: Instruct participant to lie on floor or mat. Kneel beside participant. Bend participant's knee and hip and rotate leg cross wise. Position outside of participant's knee on nearest shoulder with participants lower leg extended under arm. Position near ankle on participant's opposite lower leg.

StandingGlute.name: Standing Glute Stretch
StandingGlute.preparation: Stand facing close to elevated platform. Place outside of foot on bench with knee bent out to side.
StandingGlute.execution: Lean down, lowering torso toward thighs. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite leg.
StandingGlute.comments: Hands may be placed on elevated platform to maintain balance. Spine may be kept straight. Pelvis may be tilted forward to intensify stretch.

PNFSeated.name: PNF Seated Glute Stretch
PNFSeated.execution: Instruct participant to sit on floor or mat, reclining back with support of both arms behind body, and feet on floor and knees bent. Have them cross their lower leg (just above ankle) over thigh of opposite leg. Position chest on participant's back and grasp participant's lower knee and upper ankle.

ProneGlute.name: Prone Glute Stretch
ProneGlute.execution: Sit on floor or mat with outside of lower leg bent in front so it is approximately perpendicular to body. Place hands on floor in front and extend opposite leg back on floor so knee is toward floor.

Seated.name: Seated Glute Stretch (chair)
Seated.execution: Sit on chair or bench with ankles positioned below knees. Cross lower leg over thigh of opposite leg.

SeatedBentover.name: Seated Bent-over Glute Stretch
SeatedBentover.execution: Sit on floor or mat with outside of lower leg bent in front and inside of opposite lower leg bent to side. Position bottom of forward foot against knee of opposite leg. Place hands on floor in front of forward leg.

SeatedBench.name: Seated Glute Stretch (bench)
SeatedBench.execution: Straddle bench and sit. With one foot on floor, place outside of other foot on bench close to pelvis.

Squatting.name: Squatting Glute Stretch
Squatting.execution: Stand toward fixed bar, approximately waist height. Grasp bar with both hands, arms extended. Bend knees and hips slightly. Cross lower leg over lower thigh of opposite leg.

PNFLyingSingleLeg.name: PNF Lying Hamstring Stretch
PNFLyingSingleLeg.execution: Instruct participant to lie on floor or mat. Kneel beside participant and extend participant's leg upward. Position back of participant's lower leg on nearest shoulder. Position near ankle on participant's opposite lower leg.

SeatedFloor.name: Seated Glute Stretch
SeatedFloor.execution: Sit on floor or mat reclining back with support of both arms behind body. Bend knees approximately 90 degrees with feet on floor. Cross lower leg (just above ankle) over thigh of opposite leg.

WalkingAnkleGrab.name: Walking Ankle Grab
WalkingAnkleGrab.preparation: Stand on one foot. Grasp foot with both hands by raising inside of foot upward with knee pointing outward; opposite hand grasps heal and near hand grasps shin, just above ankle.
WalkingAnkleGrab.execution: Pull foot and lower leg upward until stretch is felt in hip. Release and step forward with stretched leg. Repeat with opposite leg. Continue by alternating stretch and step between each leg until specific distance is covered or desired number of repetitions have been completed.

LVLyingHamstring.name: Lever Lying Hamstring Stretch
LVLyingHamstring.execution: Lie on bench with leg on padded lever and foot against horizontal bar.

LyingSingleLeg.name: Lying Hamstring Stretch
LyingSingleLeg.execution: Lie on back and lift knee up. Grasp behind thigh near knee with both hands. Pull knee close to chest.

SeatedChairSingleLeg.name: Seated Single Leg Hamstring Stretch (Chair)
SeatedChairSingleLeg.execution: Sit on edge of chair or exercise ball. Position heel on floor with knee straight.

LyingTowel.name: Lying Hamstring Stretch (towel)
LyingTowel.execution: Sit on mat or floor with knees bent. Position towel under middle of foot with hands grasping towel on both ends. Lie back and raise leg straight above maintaining grip on towel with both hands.

LyingVerticalHamstring.name: Lying Vertical Hamstring Stretch
LyingVerticalHamstring.preparation: Lie on floor with one leg extending up onto side of wall or column and other leg bent with foot on floor. One way this can be position can be achieved in a single motion is by sitting on floor with back of one shoulder against end of wall or column. Rotate body 90° onto back while swinging one leg up onto side of wall or column, ending up with back on floor and head positioned away from wall.
LyingVerticalHamstring.execution: Straighten elevated knee until slight stretch is felt in back of thigh. If no stretch is felt, slowly straighten bent leg until slight stretch is felt in back of thigh. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite leg on opposite side of wall or column.
LyingVerticalHamstring.comments: Those with greater than average hamstring flexibility may not find this stretch to be effective. In which case, an alternative stretch would be more suitable.

PCHamstring.name: Lever Seated Hamstring Stretch
PCHamstring.preparation: Sit on seat in forward position with lower leg on shin pad, feet on foot rest. Place hands through wrist straps. Hold lower bar with overhand grip.
PCHamstring.execution: Push and lower seat back. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite leg.
PCHamstring.comments: To intensify stretch, hold upper bar. Those with longer upper thigh may need to deliberately keep extended leg straight, position hips further back on seat, or perform alternative stretch.

PNFSeated.name: PNF Seated Hamstring Stretch
PNFSeated.execution: Instruct participant to sit with knees straight on floor or mat. Kneel behind participant and position chest on participant's back. Place hands just above knees from each side.

Seated.name: Seated Hamstring Stretch
Seated.execution: Sit on floor or mat with knees straight.

SeatedBenchSingleLeg.name: Seated Single Leg Hamstring Stretch (Bench)
SeatedBenchSingleLeg.execution: Sit on bench. Place one leg on bench with knee straight.

StandingBenchSingleLeg.name: Standing Single Leg Hamstring Stretch (Bench)
StandingBenchSingleLeg.execution: Place foot on bench or elevation.

StandingCrossLeg.name: Standing Cross Leg Hamstring Stretch
StandingCrossLeg.execution: Stand erect with legs crossed, outsides of feet together. Bend over with rear knee straight.

SeatedChair.name: Seated Hamstring Stretch (Chair)
SeatedChair.execution: Sit on edge of chair or exercise ball. Position heels on floor with knees straight.

SeatedSingleLeg.name: Seated Single Leg Hamstring Stretch
SeatedSingleLeg.execution: Sit on floor or mat with legs apart and knees straight.

PNFLyingCrossover.name: PNF Lying Crossover Stretch
PNFLyingCrossover.execution: Instruct participant to lie on floor or mat. Kneel beside participant. Bend participant's near knee and hip. Place hand on outside of participant's near knee and opposite hand on participant's shoulder.

SoldierKick.name: Soldier Kick
SoldierKick.preparation: Stand and step forward with left foot.
SoldierKick.execution: Next step, extend left arm forward while swinging right leg up so foot touches or comes close to hand. Lower right leg. Repeat with same sequence on opposite side. Continue by alternating between each side until specific distance is covered or desired number of repetitions have been completed.

SoldierKickIntermittent.name: Soldier Kick (intermittent)
SoldierKickIntermittent.preparation: Stand and step forward with left foot.
SoldierKickIntermittent.execution: Next step, extend left arm forward while swinging right leg up so foot touches or comes close to hand. Lower right leg, then take two steps, with left and right legs. Repeat with same sequence on opposite side. Continue by alternating between each side followed by double steps until specific distance is covered or desired number of repetitions have been completed.

Pretzel.name: Seated Pretzel Stretch
Pretzel.execution: Sit on floor or mat with knees straight. Place one foot on floor to outside of other knee. Turn torso toward side of bent knee supporting body with extended arm behind. Place elbow of opposite arm to outside of bent knee.

Standing.name: Standing Hamstring Stretch
Standing.execution: Stand and bend over with knees straight.

SeatedHipInternalRotatorChair.name: Seated Hip Internal Rotator Stretch (chair or bench)
SeatedHipInternalRotatorChair.execution: Sit on chair or end of bench and cross legs with outside of ankle on lower thigh.

SquattingIliotibial.name: Squatting Iliotibial Stretch
SquattingIliotibial.execution: Stand with feet together and side toward wall, arm's length away. Place hand on wall and opposite hand on hip.

StandingIliotibial.name: Standing Iliotibial Stretch
StandingIliotibial.execution: Stand erect with legs crossed, outsides of feet together.

WallIliotibial.name: Wall Iliotibial Stretch
WallIliotibial.execution: Stand with feet together and side toward wall, slightly greater than arm's length away. Place closest hand on wall and opposite hand on hip.

LyingCrossover.name: Lying Crossover Stretch
LyingCrossover.execution: On floor or mat, lie supine with arms extended to sides. Lift one leg straight up.

StandingSingleLeg.name: Standing Single Leg Hamstring Stretch
StandingSingleLeg.execution: Sand with on foot forward and rear foot pointing out. Bend over and brace torso by placing hand just above bent rear knee.

KneelingGroin.name: Kneeling Groin Stretch
KneelingGroin.execution: Kneel with feet pointed out to sides. Place forearms and hands on floor.

LyingIliotibial.name: Lying Iliotibial Stretch
LyingIliotibial.execution: Lie on one side. Position ankle of lower leg over outside of upper thigh. Grasp top ankle or forefoot behind. Reposition side of upper body on floor.

LyingPretzel.name: Lying Pretzel Stretch
LyingPretzel.execution: On floor or mat, lie supine with arms extended to sides. Cross thighs and position foot behind slightly bent leg.

LyingGroin.name: Lying Groin Stretch
LyingGroin.execution: Lie on floor or mat. Place soles of feet together on floor close to body with knees far apart.

SeatedHipInternalRotator.name: Seated Hip Internal Rotator Stretch
SeatedHipInternalRotator.execution: Sit on floor or mat and cross lower leg over thigh of straight leg.

SeatedHipInternalRotatorBentLegUnder.name: Seated Hip Internal Rotator Stretch (bent leg under)
SeatedHipInternalRotatorBentLegUnder.execution: Sit on floor or mat and place extended leg on top of inside of bent lower leg positioned perpendicular.

SidePretzel.name: Side Pretzel Stretch
SidePretzel.execution: Sit on side of thigh on floor or mat with knees bent. Position bent knee of upper leg behind foot of lower leg. Position chest facing floor with both hands on floor; arms somewhat extended and torso nearly inline with upper thigh.

BentoverAdductorMagnus.name: Bent-over Adductor Magnus Stretch
BentoverAdductorMagnus.execution: Stand with one foot on chair or bench. Bend over.

KneelingAdductorMagnus.name: Kneeling Adductor Magnus Stretch
KneelingAdductorMagnus.execution: Kneel with one foot on floor or mat. Position torso to inside of upper thigh with hands on floor.

KneelingSideLunge.name: Kneeling Side Lunge Stretch
KneelingSideLunge.execution: Kneel on floor or mat. Place one foot pointing out and somewhat perpendicular to opposite kneeling leg.

LyingAdductorMagnus.name: Lying Adductor Magnus Stretch
LyingAdductorMagnus.execution: Lie supine on floor or mat. Raise knees and grasp back of thighs behind knees.

SeatedAdductorMagnus.name: Seated Adductor Magnus Stretch (chair or bench)
SeatedAdductorMagnus.execution: Straddle and sit on chair or bench with feet far apart and feet on floor.

LyingGroinTowel.name: Lying Groin Stretch (towel)
LyingGroinTowel.preparation: Loop towel or strap around foot and grasp ends with hand on same side of body. Lie supine on floor or mat with legs bent. With free foot on floor, extend bonded leg vertically while keeping hold of towel or strap. Extend free arm away from body.
LyingGroinTowel.execution: Lower bonded leg out to side while controlling its descent and position with arm. Hold stretch. Repeat on opposite side.

LyingWallGroin.name: Lying Wall Groin Stretch
LyingWallGroin.execution: Sit on floor with hip and thigh against wall. Lift back of legs up against wall by pivoting on hips and lying on back. Place back of legs against wall.

MachSeatedGroin.name: Lever Seated Groin Stretch
MachSeatedGroin.execution: Sit on apparatus with each leg on adjacent platforms.

PCGroin.name: Lever Groin Stretch
PCGroin.preparation: Sit on seat in forward position. Place hands through wrist straps. Hold lower bar with overhand grip. Position soles of feet together on top edge of shin pad.
PCGroin.execution: Push and lower seat back. Hold stretch.

SideLunge.name: Side Lunge Stretch
SideLunge.execution: Stand with feet far apart, toes pointed 45° outward.

PNFBentLeg.name: PNF Bent Leg Groin Stretch
PNFBentLeg.execution: Instruct participant to lie on floor or mat. Ask them to place soles of feet together on floor close to body with knees apart. Kneel close to participant and place hands on insides of participant's knees.

PNFStraightLeg.name: PNF Straight Leg Groin Stretch
PNFStraightLeg.execution: Instruct participant to lie on floor or mat with legs positioned straight up, slightly apart. Grasp participant's ankle from inside.

LyingHipExternalRotator.name: Lying Hip External Rotator Stretch
LyingHipExternalRotator.execution: Lie on floor or mat and with one leg straight and other leg bent approximately 90 degrees out to side.

SeatedAdductorMagnusFloor.name: Seated Adductor Magnus Stretch
SeatedAdductorMagnusFloor.execution: Sit on floor or mat with feet far apart and knees bent approximately 90 degrees. Reach forward grasp bottom of feet.

SeatedGroin.name: Seated Groin Stretch (chair or bench)
SeatedGroin.execution: Sit on end of chair or bench. Place legs as far apart as possible with knees bent approximately 90 degrees and feet flat on floor pointing same direction as knees. Lean over and position upper forearms inside lower thighs near knees.

SeatedGroinApparatus.name: Seated Groin Stretch (on apparatus)
SeatedGroinApparatus.execution: Sit on platform facing adjustable handles. Spread legs apart and place inside of legs on outer surface of padded stumps. Straighten knees, grasp handles, and sit upright.

SeatedGroinFloor.name: Seated Groin Stretch
SeatedGroinFloor.execution: Sit on floor or mat with soles of feet together on floor and close to body. Grasp feet with both hands and position elbows on inside of lower legs.

SeatedSingleLegAdductorMagnus.name: Seated Single Leg Adductor Magnus Stretch
SeatedSingleLegAdductorMagnus.execution: Sit on floor or mat and place outside of flexed leg on floor. Over that leg, position opposite leg with foot flat on floor and back of heel against shin.

PNFSeatedPiriformis.name: PNF Seated Piriformis Stretch
PNFSeatedPiriformis.execution: Instruct participant to sit on floor or mat, reclining back with support of both arms behind body, and feet on floor and knees bent. Have them cross their thighs by placing back of knee on thigh of other leg. Ask them position foot on floor closer to hip. Place your hands on back of participants shoulders or position your chest on participant's upper back and your hands under participant's lower thighs.

SquattingGroin.name: Squatting Groin Stretch
SquattingGroin.execution: Stand with feet pointed approximately 45° outward. Squat down completely with knees pointed outward over toes. Place palms of hands on floor with inside of upper arm positioned against inner thigh.

StandingGroin.name: Standing Groin Stretch
StandingGroin.execution: Stand next to upper thigh height surface off to side. Hold onto elevated surface or other stable structure for balance and place inner side of nearest bent lower leg on elevated surface.

LyingPiriformis.name: Lying Piriformis Stretch
LyingPiriformis.execution: Lie on floor or mat with feet on floor and knees bent approximately 90 degrees. Cross thighs by lacing back of knee on thigh of other leg. Lift legs and hug both thighs locking both hands together behind knee of lower leg.

KneelingHipFlexor.name: Kneeling Hip Flexor Stretch
KneelingHipFlexor.execution: Lunge forward with knee on padded mat. Position foot beyond forward knee. Place hands on knee.

LyingPiriformisMod.name: Lying Piriformis Stretch (single leg)
LyingPiriformisMod.execution: Lie on floor or mat. Lift one leg and grasp ankle and knee with both hands.

PCPiriformis.name: Lever Piriformis Stretch
