PCPiriformis.preparation: Sit on seat in forward position with lower leg on shin pad, feet on foot rest. Place hands through wrist straps. Hold upper bar with overhand grip, both hands left of center. Position left leg extended toward right center.
PCPiriformis.execution: Push and lower seat back. Repeat with opposite leg.
PCPiriformis.comments: Low back may be stretched if hips and low back muscles are tight.

LungingHipFlexor.name: Lunging Hip Flexor Stretch
LungingHipFlexor.execution: Lunge with one foot far behind other foot.

PNFLyingPiriformis.name: PNF Lying Piriformis Stretch
PNFLyingPiriformis.execution: Instruct participant to lie on floor or mat with legs bent. Stand near their feet facing them. Assist them crossing their thighs, placing outside of one knee close to top of their other knee. Bend over participant's hips, position their foot of closest bent leg on your chest or shoulder while grasping their lower leg, in addition to knee of opposite leg with other hand.

SLLungingHipFlexor.name: Sled Kneeling Hip Flexor Stretch
SLLungingHipFlexor.execution: Straddle machine and grasp handles for support. Place foot on lower platform under podium and other lower leg on padded support behind.

SeatedPiriformis.name: Seated Piriformis Stretch
SeatedPiriformis.execution: Sit on floor or mat, reclining back with support of both arms behind body, and feet on floor and knees bent approximately 90 degrees. Cross thighs by placing back of knee on thigh of other leg. Grasp lower leg.

SeatedPiriformisChair.name: Seated Piriformis Stretch (chair or bench)
SeatedPiriformisChair.execution: Sit on chair of bench with feet on floor and knees bent approximately 90 degrees. Cross thighs by placing back of knee on thigh of other leg. Grasp lower leg.

SeatedHipExternalRotator.name: Seated Hip External Rotator Stretch
SeatedHipExternalRotator.execution: Sit on floor or mat and with one leg straight and other leg bent approximately 90 degrees out to side.

Bentover.name: Bent-over Infraspinatus Stretch
Bentover.execution: Place both hands on waist with thumbs facing forward. Bend over so torso is parallel to floor.

Broomstick.name: Broom Stick Infraspinatus Stretch
Broomstick.preparation: Grasp pole at one end and position overhead with other end of pole behind opposite arm. Grasp other end of pole with hand positioned below elbow. Position elbow of lower arm close to height of shoulder.
Broomstick.execution: Pull upper end of pole forward so shoulder is internally rotated. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite arm.
Broomstick.comments: Before pulling pole forward, attempt to orientate pole as vertical as possible and elbow of lower arm as close to lateral of shoulder as possible.

BentoverLungeHipFlexor.name: Bent-over Lunging Hip Flexor Stretch
BentoverLungeHipFlexor.execution: Kneel down and position one leg extended behind. Balancing with hands positioned on floor to sides. Rear knee is extended off floor. Body weight is supported on both forefeet.

LungingBench.name: Lunging Hip Flexor Stretch (on bench)
LungingBench.preparation: Stand facing away from end of bench. Place one leg back on bench making contact with rear forefoot foot and knee.
LungingBench.execution: Slowly lunge forward by continuing to bend forward leg. With chest high, straighten hip of rear leg by driving hips down and forward. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite side.
LungingBench.comments: Legs should be far enough apart to keep knee from traveling too far beyond forward foot. Keep torso upright and forward foot flat on floor. Tensor Fasciae Latae can be emphasized by crossing rear leg inward behind forward leg while keeping hip of rear leg positioned same height of opposite hip.

PCHipFlexor.name: Lever Hip Flexor Stretch
PCHipFlexor.preparation: Flip seat all way back. Stand facing bar with supporting foot slightly forward under, or near apparatus. Grasp handle bars for support. Place top of other foot back on top edge of shin pad.
PCHipFlexor.execution: Squat down with back straight while straightening hip of rear leg by pushing hips forward. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite side.
PCHipFlexor.comments: Keep foot away from fully extended hip to keep emphasis on Iliopsoas. See

LyingHipFlexor.name: Lying Hip Flexor Stretch
LyingHipFlexor.execution: Lie on tall bench with thigh hanging down off end or side of bench. Raise opposite thigh toward side of torso. Hook hand around inside of upper thigh. Grasp elbow with opposite hand and keep arms close to body.

Bar.name: Bar Lat Stretch
Bar.execution: Standing distance facing bar approximately lower chest height. Grasp bar with both hands. Lean body forward so bar is behind/under bar and arms are to sides of head. Feet are keep away from bar.

Standing.name: Standing Hip Flexor Stretch
Standing.execution: Stand facing bench or elevated platform, approximately legs length away. Place one foot on bench or platform.

Prone.name: Prone Infraspinatus Stretch
Prone.preparation: Lie prone on mat or floor. Extend arms out to each side on floor.  Bend elbows 90º and position back of hands to sides of body.
Prone.execution: Lower bend arms toward floor and hold stretch.
Prone.comments: Upper arms will end up perpendicular to torso while forearms will be parallel.

SeatedBentover.name: Seated Bent-over Infraspinatus Stretch
SeatedBentover.execution: Sit on bench or chair. Place both hands on waist with thumbs facing forward. Lean over and rest torso on thighs.

SideLying.name: Side Lying Infraspinatus Stretch
SideLying.execution: Lie supine on mat or floor with knees bent approximately 90 degrees. Position hand under side of waist, palm down.

SeatedSideReach.name: Seated Side Reach Lat Stretch
SeatedSideReach.execution: Sit on bench or floor. Place one arm down to side on bench or floor, slightly behind for support. Put opposite arm overhead.

StandingSideReach.name: Standing Side Reach Lat Stretch
StandingSideReach.execution: Stand with feet far apart. Place one arm on side of thigh. Put opposite arm overhead.

SideLyingTeresMinor.name: Side Lying Teres Minor Stretch
SideLyingTeresMinor.execution: Lie down on side on mat or floor. Position arm on floor with bent elbow positioned forward on mat and hand above elbow. With other hand, grasp back of wrist.

Supine.name: Supine Infraspinatus Stretch
Supine.preparation: Lie supine on mat or floor with legs bent and feet on floor. Bend elbows 90º and position to side of shoulders with back of upper arm on floor.
Supine.execution: Keeping elbows bend at a right angles, push forearms downward toward floor and hold stretch.

LyingBentLeg.name: Lying Bent Leg Oblique Stretch
LyingBentLeg.execution: Lie supine on floor or mat. Bend knees and place feet flat on floor.

Bentover.name: Bent-over Lat Stretch (on chair or bench)
Bentover.execution: Kneel in front of chair on floor or mat. Place inside of crossed arms on end of chair and position head between arms.

LyingCrossover.name: Lying Crossover Stretch
LyingCrossover.execution: On floor or mat, lie supine with arms extended to sides. Lift one leg straight up.

BentoverFloor.name: Bent-over Lat Stretch
BentoverFloor.execution: Kneel on mat or floor. Extend arms well beyond knees and place forearms on floor.

Pretzel.name: Pretzel Stretch
Pretzel.execution: Sit on floor or mat with knees straight. Place one foot on floor to outside of other knee. Turn torso toward side of bent knee supporting body with extended arm behind. Place elbow of opposite arm to outside of bent knee.

SeatedBentLeg.name: Seated Bent Leg Oblique Stretch
SeatedBentLeg.execution: Sit on floor or mat. Lean back slightly and place arms behind body with hands on floor for support. Bend knees and hips and place feet flat on floor.

BenchAngel.name: Bench Angel
BenchAngel.preparation: Lie prone on bench with legs bent and feet on bench. Position arms straight to each side of head pointed away from feet with palms facing up.
BenchAngel.execution: Slowly move arms apart, out to each side, while pushing shoulders down into bench and keeping arms as low as possible. Continue pulling arms toward body until hands are out to sides of hips without allowing shoulders to raise up off bench. Slowly return arms to starting position while keeping shoulder pushed down against bench. Repeat.
BenchAngel.comments: This dynamic shoulder girdle stretch can inprove shoulder mobility, enhance shoulder girdle posture, and decrease risk of injury for those with

Overhead.name: Overhead Lat Stretch
Overhead.comments: Put one arm overhead. Grasp elbow or wrist overhead with other hand.

Doorway.name: Doorway Modified Chest Stretch
Doorway.execution: Stand at end of wall or in doorway facing perpendicular to wall. Place front of shoulder and inside of bent arm on surface of wall. Position bent elbow around same height of shoulder. Position both feet back behind original stance.

PCUnderhand.name: Lever Lat Stretch
PCUnderhand.preparation: Sit on seat in forward position with lower legs on shin pad, feet on foot rest. Place hands through wrist straps. Hold upper bar with underhand grip.
PCUnderhand.execution: Push and lower seat back. Hold stretch.
PCUnderhand.comments: To intensify stretch, look up or to one side.

LungingBench.name: Seated Quadriceps Stretch
LungingBench.preparation: Sit with right thigh and hip on one side of bench or chair. Allow left knee to point down while grasping top ankle or forefoot behind with left hand.
LungingBench.execution: Pull ankle or forefoot to rear end and straighten hip by moving knee backwards. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite side.
LungingBench.comments: Alternatively, hip may be initially extended, then ankle can be slowly pulled towards rear end. With either technique, do not allow knee to flare outward to side.

PNFOverhead.name: PNF Overhead Lat Stretch
PNFOverhead.execution: Instruct participant to stand or sit on floor, chair, or bench and place arm overhead. Standing behind participant, grasp their wrist and position their forearm behind their head.

Supine.name: Supine Lat Stretch
Supine.preparation: Pull arms toward floor and back sides of head. Hold stretch.
Supine.execution: Stretch can also be performed with feet on floor and legs bent if participant is sensitive to spinal hyperextension.

Wall.name: Wall Lat Stretch
Wall.execution: Standing toward wall. Bend over and place palms of hands on wall, approximately shoulder width and waist height.

Lying.name: Lying Shoulder Girdle Stretch
Lying.preparation: Lie supine with soles of feet on floor, hips and knees bent. Bend elbows and position back of arms against floor or mat with elbows to sides.
Lying.execution: Push shoulders, forearms, and back of hand into floor or mat and slowly move arms toward sides of head. Still pushing shoulders and back of arms into floor, slowly arms toward sides.
Lying.comments: This dynamic shoulder girdle stretch exercises rhomboids and trapezius isometrically while stretching pectoralis minor and major. It can be prescribed for

Standing.name: Standing Quadriceps Stretch
Standing.preparation: Stand and touch wall or stationary object for balance. Grasp top ankle or forefoot behind.
Standing.execution: Pull ankle or forefoot to rear end and straighten hip by moving knee backward. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite side.
Standing.comments: Alternatively, hip may be initially extended, then ankle can be slowly pulled towards rear end. With either technique, do not allow knee to flare outward to side. If low back is sensitive to hyperextension, hip should be postured in more neutral position than demonstrated. If knee is not completely flexed,

Towel.name: Towel Shoulder Girdle Stretch
Towel.execution: Grasp large towel or rope with very wide overhand grip, approximately length of arm to opposite elbow. Raise towel over head.

Kneeling.name: Kneeling Quadriceps Stretch
Kneeling.execution: Kneel with knee on padded mat and other foot positioned forward. Place hands on knee. Grasp other hand under top of foot.

Wall.name: Wall Angel
Wall.preparation: Position back against wall. Place feet away from wall, slightly bending hips and knees. Bend elbows and position back of arms against wall with elbows to sides.
Wall.execution: Push shoulders and back of arms and hands into wall and slowly raise arms as high as possible. Still pushing shoulders arms, slowly lower arms to starting position.
Wall.comments: This dynamic shoulder girdle stretch can inprove shoulder mobility, enhance shoulder girdle posture, and decrease risk of injury for those with

PCQuad.name: Lever Quadriceps Stretch
PCQuad.execution: Flip seat all way back. Stand facing bar with supporting foot slightly forward under, or near apparatus. Grasp handle bars for support. Place top of other foot back on top edge of shin pad.

PNFProneLying.name: PNF Lying (prone) Quadriceps Stretch
PNFProneLying.execution: Instruct participant to lie prone on mat or floor. Straddle participant facing toward feet. Knee beside participant with leg extended over or just above participant's hips. Bend participant's near knee and place hand under participant's upper leg and opposite hand on ankle.

ProneLying.name: Lying (prone) Quadriceps Stretch
ProneLying.execution: Lie prone on mat or floor. Grasp top ankle or forefoot behind.

SideLying.name: Lying (side) Quadriceps Stretch
SideLying.execution: Lie on one side. Grasp top ankle or forefoot behind. Pull ankle or forefoot to rear end.

StandingGroinApparatus.name: Standing Quadriceps Stretch (on apparatus)
StandingGroinApparatus.preparation: Stand facing slightly away from adjustable shelf positioned upper thigh to hip height. Grasp support for balance. With assistance from other hand, position foot on shelf behind hip. Grasp supports with both hands and stand upright.
StandingGroinApparatus.execution: Bend supporting knee slightly while positioning hip back closer to heel. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite side.
StandingGroinApparatus.comments: If low back is sensitive to hyperextension, hips should be postured in more neutral position than demonstrated by positioning shelf lower and bending supporting knee more. If knee is not completely flexed,

WalkingQuadStretch.name: Walking Quadriceps Stretch
WalkingQuadStretch.preparation: Stand and step forward with left foot.
WalkingQuadStretch.execution: Standing on left foot, position right foot behind and grasp it with right hand. Pull right heel toward right glute while pulling right knee down and back. Release right foot, step forward with right foot, and repeat on left side while standing on right foot. Continue by alternating between each side until specific distance is covered or desired number of repetitions have been completed.
WalkingQuadStretch.comments: Pull knee in if it initially flares outward to side. This

StandingPlatform.name: Standing Quadriceps Stretch (on platform)
StandingPlatform.preparation: Stand facing slightly away from upper thigh to hip height platform. Position foot on platform behind hip and balance on one leg. Place hands on hips.
StandingPlatform.execution: Bend supporting knee while positioning hip back closer to heel. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite side.
StandingPlatform.comments: If balance is an issue, arms can be extended back so hands can be placed on platform on each side. If knee is not completely flexed,

FixedBar.name: Fixed Bar Rhomboids Stretch
FixedBar.execution: Stand facing very close to stationary bar. Grasp stationary bar with both hands just below chest height.

StandingTowel.name: Standing Quadriceps Stretch (towel)
StandingTowel.preparation: With foot on bench or floor place towel around ankle. Grasp both ends of towel behind ankle with closest hand. Stand on opposite leg and touch wall or stationary object with other arm for balance.
StandingTowel.execution: Pull foot to rear end with towel and straighten hip by moving knee backward. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite side.
StandingTowel.comments: Alternatively, hip may be initially extended, then ankle can be slowly pulled towards rear end. With either technique, do not allow knee to flare outward to side. If low back is sensitive to hyperextension, hip should be postured in more neutral position than demonstrated. If knee is not completely flexed

FloorBoard.name: Floor Board Bent Knee Calf Stretch
FloorBoard.execution: Face wall with both knees slightly bent. Position fore foot on wall with heel on floor.

Kneeling.name: Kneeling Abdominal Stretch
Kneeling.execution: Kneel on floor or mat with hips straight. Place hands on back of hips

Prone.name: Lying (Prone) Abdominal Stretch
Prone.execution: Lie prone on mat or floor. Position hands on floor to sides of shoulders.

Supine.name: Lying (supine) Abdominal Stretch
Supine.execution: Lie supine on mat or floor with arms extended overhead and legs straight.

Towel.name: Towel Bent Leg Calf Stretch
Towel.execution: Sit of floor or mat. With both ends of towel or band in each hand, place towel or band under foot.

Hugging.name: Hugging Stretch
Hugging.execution: Cross both arms and place both hands behind shoulders of opposite arms.

Kneeling.name: Kneeling Calf Stretch
Kneeling.execution: Kneel on lower leg. Place foot of opposite leg flat on floor.

Bentover.name: Pike Bent Leg Calf Stretch
Bentover.execution: There are number of ways to enter into this stretch:

Lunging.name: Lunging Bent Knee Calf Stretch
Lunging.execution: Stand with one leg far forward and other leg extended back with knees straight. Both feet are positioned directly forward.

Doorway.name: Doorway Subscapularis Stretch
Doorway.execution: Stand at end of wall or in doorway facing perpendicular to wall. Bent elbow and place inside of forearm on surface of wall. Position bent elbow just below height of shoulder. Place far leg forward and near leg back.

Kneeling.name: Kneeling Shin Stretch
Kneeling.execution: Kneel on both knees with buttocks over both heels and feet extend back.

Seated.name: Seated Bent Leg Calf Stretch
Seated.execution: Sit of floor or mat. Place heel on floor or mat with bent knee upright. Grasp top of forefoot.

SingleLegBentover.name: Single Leg Pike Bent Leg Calf Stretch
SingleLegBentover.execution: Step forward with one front forward. Bend over and place hands on floor well in front of forward foot with arms straight. Bend rear leg and place rear foot flat on floor.

Step.name: Step Bent Knee Calf Stretch
Step.execution: Position toes and balls of feet on stair step or calf block with arches and heels extending off. Place support leg up to higher steps. Use railing or wall for balance. Bend rear knee.

Wall.name: Wall Bent Knee Calf Stretch
Wall.execution: Place both hands on wall with arms extended. Lean against wall with one leg bent forward and other leg extended back. Bend rear knee slightly, positioned foot directly forward, and place heal to floor.

Trap.name: Upper Trapezius Stretch
Trap.preparation: Grasp wrist or hand from behind and pull arm to opposite side.
Trap.execution: Tilt head away from lowered shoulder by positioning ear toward front of opposite shoulder. Hold stretch. Repeat to other side.

Neck.name: Neck Extensor Stretch
Neck.execution: Bow head forward with jaw shut. Depress chin into top of sternum.

Broomstick.name: Broom Stick Subscapularis Stretch
Broomstick.preparation: Grasp end of pole with one hand. Flip pole over upper arm. Position bent arm to side of body with other end of pole behind arm. Reach across body as far as possible with opposite arm and grasp lower end of pole. Position elbow at height of shoulder with pole positioned on back side of upper arm.
Broomstick.execution: Pull lower end of pole forward and upward so shoulder is externally rotated. Hold stretch. Repeat with opposite arm.
Broomstick.comments: Before pulling pole forward and upward, attempt to orientate pole as vertical as possible and elbow of upper arm as close to lateral of shoulder as possible.

Kneeling.name: Kneeling Wrist Extensor Stretch
Kneeling.execution: Kneel on floor or mat. Flex wrists and place tops of hand on floor with fingers pointing toward knees.

Single.name: Single Arm Wrist Extensor Stretch
Single.execution: With palm facing downward, pull wrist and fingers downward toward forearm.

Lying.name: Lying Shin Stretch
Lying.execution: Lie on one side. Grasp top forefoot behind.

Kneeling.name: Kneeling Wrist Flexor Stretch
Kneeling.execution: Kneel on floor or mat. Place palms of hand on floor with fingers pointing toward knees.

Praying.name: Praying Wrist Flexor Stretch
Praying.execution: Place palms together in front of body. Point fingers toward neck.

Seated.name: Seated Shin Stretch
Seated.execution: Sit on chair or bench and cross lower leg over thigh of opposite leg. Place one hand above ankle and other hand on top of your foot.

Seated.name: Seated Wrist Flexor Stretch
Seated.execution: Sit on floor. Place palms on floor to sides, behind hips with fingers pointing to back.

Single.name: Single Arm Wrist Flexor Stretch
Single.execution: With palm facing downward, grasp underside of fingers with other hand and straighten elbow.

Standing.name: Standing Shin Stretch
Standing.execution: Stand and touch wall or stationary object for balance. Grasp forefoot behind.

Chair.name: Chair Trapezius Stretch
Chair.preparation: Sit on chair slightly angled to right. Position legs far apart with feet on floor. Bend over slightly to grasp back of front right chair leg with left hand.
Chair.execution: Pull up on chair leg by position torso more upright while allowing left shoulder to be pulled downward. Hold stretch. Repeat on opposite side while sitting slightly angled to left.

Overhead.name: Overhead Triceps Stretch
Overhead.execution: Put one arm overhead. Position forearm as close as possible to upper arm. Grasp elbow overhead with other hand.

PNFOverhead.name: PNF Overhead Triceps Stretch
PNFOverhead.execution: Instruct participant to stand or sit on floor, chair, or bench and place arm overhead. Standing behind participant, grasp their wrist and position their forearm against upper arm.

Towel.name: Towel Triceps Stretch
Towel.execution: Grasp near end of towel or rope. Position towel behind head so towel dangles down behind body. Reach behind back or waist with opposite hand and grasp opposite end of towel. Position upper arm close to back side of head.

BBBentOverRow.name: Barbell Bent-over Row
BBBentOverRow.preparation: Bend knees slightly and bend over bar with back straight. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip.
BBBentOverRow.execution: Pull bar to upper waist. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
BBBentOverRow.comments: Torso may be kept horizontal for strict execution. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See

BBCloseGripBentOverRow.name: Barbell Close Grip Bent-over Row
BBCloseGripBentOverRow.preparation: Bend knees slightly and bend over bar with back straight. Grasp bar with shoulder width overhand grip.
BBCloseGripBentOverRow.execution: Pull bar to waist. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BBCloseGripBentOverRow.comments: Torso may be kept horizontal for strict execution. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See

BBUnderhandBentOverRow.name: Barbell Underhand Bent-over Row
BBUnderhandBentOverRow.preparation: Bend knees slightly and bend over bar with back straight. Grasp bar with underhand grip.
BBUnderhandBentOverRow.execution: Pull bar to waist. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
BBUnderhandBentOverRow.comments: Torso may be kept horizontal for strict execution. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See

BWSupineRow.name: Inverted Row
BWSupineRow.preparation: Lay on back under fixed horizontal bar. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip.
BWSupineRow.execution: Keeping body straight, pull body up to bar. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BWSupineRow.comments: Fixed bar should be just high enough to allow arm to fully extend. See

BWSupineRowFeetElevated.name: Inverted Row (feet elevated)
BWSupineRowFeetElevated.preparation: Lay on back under fixed horizontal bar. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Place back of heels on elevated surface.
BWSupineRowFeetElevated.execution: Keeping body straight, pull body up to bar. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BWSupineRowFeetElevated.comments: Fixed bar should be just high enough to allow arm to fully extend. Placing back of heels on elevated surface is optional. This exercise is typically performed without added resistance, although additional weight can be placed on belly or pelvis. Partner can add and remove weight, and keep weight from sliding off belly. Resistance can be reduced by raising bar and positioning heels on floor. See

BWSupineRowHigh.name: Inverted Row (high bar)
BWSupineRowHigh.preparation: Stand facing arms length away from waist to head height horizontal bar. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Position body under bar with legs, hips and spine straight. Arms should be straight, approximately perpendicular to body. Heels should make contact with floor.
BWSupineRowHigh.execution: Keeping body straight, pull body up to bar. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BWSupineRowHigh.comments: Bar height can be adjusted to vary resistance. See

BWSupineRowHips.name: Inverted Row (on hips)
BWSupineRowHips.preparation: Lay on back with belly under fixed horizontal bar. Bend knees and position feet on floor. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip.
BWSupineRowHips.execution: Keeping hips on floor and low back straight, pull torso up to bar. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BWSupineRowHips.comments: Fixed bar should be just high enough to allow arm to fully extend. See

CBInclineRow.name: Cable Incline Row
CBInclineRow.preparation: Sit on incline and place feet on lower bar, or foot platform. Slide hips down by bending knees. Bend over and grasp cable attachment. Slide hips back, positioning knees with slight bend.
CBInclineRow.execution: Pull cable attachment to waist while straightening back upright. Pull shoulders back and push chest forward while arching back. Return until arms are extended, shoulders are stretched forward, and lower back is flexed forward. Repeat.
CBInclineRow.comments: Begin with light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

CBAlternatingHighRow.name: Cable Alternating Seated High Row
CBAlternatingHighRow.preparation: Sit and grasp cable stirrups one with each hand. Lean back slightly allowing arms, shoulders, and torso to be pulled forward under weight on cables.
CBAlternatingHighRow.execution: Pull one cable stirrup to side. Pull shoulder back, push chest forward, and rotate body slightly toward pulling arm. Return until arm is extended and torso faces forward. Pull with opposite arm alternating between each side. Repeat.
CBAlternatingHighRow.comments: Rotation of torso as shown is optional. Quadratus Lumborum and Obliques act as stabilizers if waist is not rotated as demonstrated. Hamstrings and Gluteus Maximus act as stabilizers if seat is not available and legs are propped forward.

CBLyingRow.name: Cable Lying Row
CBLyingRow.preparation: Straddle head of bench and grasp stirrups on two high pulley cables. Lie on bench with stirrups in each hand and arms extended upward.
CBLyingRow.execution: Pull stirrups down to each side of chest until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched upward. Repeat.
CBLyingRow.comments: Pulleys should not be too far apart, as they are on standard cable crossover machines. Stirrups on pulleys should be high enough to allow shoulders to stretch forward when arms extend. Pull shoulder blades together when completing pull. Other rowing exercises should be considered if resistance required begins to exceed upper body weight since back will begin to raise up off of bench.

CBOneArmBentoverRow.name: Cable One Arm Bent-over Row
CBOneArmBentoverRow.preparation: Grasp cable stirrup. Step back away from pulley, with foot on same side as exercising arm, positioned out to side well behind forward foot. Bend over with hand on nearby bar or above knee for support. Keep back straight and knees slightly bent. Allow shoulder with stirrup to be pulled forward.
CBOneArmBentoverRow.execution: Pull cable attachment to side of torso, pulling shoulder back. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched forward. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
CBOneArmBentoverRow.comments: Supporting hand can also be placed on nearby bar, available on some pulley machines. Hamstrings and Gluteus Maximus stabilize near top of movement on forward leg.

CBOneArmHighRow.name: Cable One Arm Seated High Row
CBOneArmHighRow.preparation: Sit slightly forward on platform or secured bench close to cable attachment. Bend forward and grasp cable stirrup with one hand. Slide hips back by positioning knees with slight bend. Allow arm, shoulder, and torso to be pulled forward under weight on cable.
CBOneArmHighRow.execution: Pull cable attachment to side of torso, straightening back and leaning back slightly. Pull shoulder back and push chest forward during contraction. Return until arm is extended and torso is pulled forward. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
CBOneArmHighRow.comments: It is optional to bend lower back forward during stretch and pull it upright during contraction. If torso does not bend forward, Erector Spinae acts as stabilizer muscle. See

CBOneArmKneelingRow.name: Cable Kneeling Row
CBOneArmKneelingRow.preparation: Place right knee on lower pad (positioned to right side) with foot of other leg slightly back out to side and knee slightly bent. Place right forearm on right side of upper pad and grasp handle. Grasp cable stirrup below with left hand. Allow left shoulder to be pulled forward without spinal rotation.
CBOneArmKneelingRow.execution: Pull stirrup up to side until elbow travels beyond surface of back. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched downward. Repeat and continue with opposite side.
CBOneArmKneelingRow.comments: Allow scapula to articulate, but do not rotate torso.

CBOneArmRow.name: Cable One Arm Seated Row
CBOneArmRow.preparation: Sit slightly forward on platform or secured bench in order to grasp cable stirrup with one hand. Position hips back with knees slightly bent   . Allow shoulder with stirrup to be pulled forward.
CBOneArmRow.execution: Pull cable attachment to side of torso, slightly twisting through waist. Pull shoulder back and push chest forward during contraction. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched forward. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
CBOneArmRow.comments: It is optional to bend lower back forward during stretch and pull it upright during contraction. If low back is kept still, Erector Spinae acts as synergist muscle. Also see

CBOneArmStandingLowRow.name: Cable Standing Low Row
CBOneArmStandingLowRow.preparation: Stand to side of low pulley. Place hand on support bar with arm straight. Place foot nearest supporting arm forward with knee slightly bent and opposite foot back. Grasp cable stirrup with one hand, allowing shoulder to be pulled forward under weight on cable.
CBOneArmStandingLowRow.execution: Pull cable attachment to side of torso while pulling shoulder back, arching spine, and pushing chest forward. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is pulled forward. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.

CBOneArmStandingRow.name: Cable Standing Row
CBOneArmStandingRow.preparation: Stand to side of medium height, rotating pulley. Place hand shoulder height or slightly lower on support bar with arm straight. Place foot nearest supporting arm forward with knee slightly bent and opposite foot back. Grasp cable stirrup with one hand, allowing shoulder to be pulled forward under weight on cable.
CBOneArmStandingRow.execution: Pull cable attachment to side of torso while pulling shoulder back, arching spine, and pushing chest forward. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is pulled forward. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
CBOneArmStandingRow.comments: Stirrup handle should be behind supporting bar. Few pulley units have vertical support bar (for supporting hand) far enough back from pulley to allow full range of motion and adequate pulley rotation to allow it to be aligned with line of pull. If pulley unit does not allow for this configuration, consider placing sturdy prop (for supporting hand) in front of pulley, far back enough to allow full range of motion. Also see

BWUnderhandSupineRow.name: Inverted Biceps Row
BWUnderhandSupineRow.preparation: Lay on back under fixed horizontal bar. Grasp bar with shoulder width underhand grip.
BWUnderhandSupineRow.execution: Keeping body straight, pull body up to bar. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BWUnderhandSupineRow.comments: Fixed bar should be just high enough to allow arm to fully extend. See

CBOneArmStrBackHighRow.name: Cable One Arm Straight Back Seated High Row
CBOneArmStrBackHighRow.preparation: Sit on seat or bench. Bend forward and grasp cable stirrup with one hand. Position torso upright allowing shoulder to be pulled forward under weight on cable.
CBOneArmStrBackHighRow.execution: Pull cable attachment to side of torso while pulling shoulder back, arching spine, and pushing chest forward. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is pulled forward. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
CBOneArmStrBackHighRow.comments: If two high pulleys are available, consider using opposite pulley as arm exercised. If pulley is far away enough, it is optional to bend lower back forward during stretch and pull it upright during contraction. See

CBOneArmTwistingHighRow.name: Cable Twisting Seated High Row
CBOneArmTwistingHighRow.execution: Sit on seat or bench. Bend forward and grasp cable stirrup with one hand. Allow shoulder with stirrup to be pulled forward with twist through waist.

CBOneArmTwistingRow.name: Cable Twisting Seated Row
CBOneArmTwistingRow.preparation: Sit slightly forward on platform or secured bench close to cable attachment. Bend forward and grasp cable stirrup with one hand. Slide hips back by positioning knees with slight bend. Allow shoulder with stirrup to be pulled forward with forward bend and twist through waist.
CBOneArmTwistingRow.execution: Pull cable attachment to side, extending and twisting through waist. Pull shoulders back and sit upright while pushing chest forward during contraction. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched forward. Repeat and perform exercise with opposite arm.

BWUnderhandSupineRowHigh.name: Inverted Biceps Row (high bar)
BWUnderhandSupineRowHigh.preparation: Stand facing arms length away from waist to head height horizontal bar. Grasp bar with shoulder width underhand grip. Position body under bar with legs, hips and spine straight. Arms should be straight, approximately perpendicular to body. Heels should make contact with floor with feet about perpendicular to legs.
BWUnderhandSupineRowHigh.execution: Keeping body straight, pull body up to bar. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
BWUnderhandSupineRowHigh.comments: Bar height can be adjusted to vary resistance. See

CBSeatedHighRow.name: Cable Seated High Row
CBSeatedHighRow.preparation: Sit slightly forward on bench or platform in order to   grasp cable attachment. Place feet on vertical platform. Slide hips back positioning knees with slight bend. Allow weight on cable to pull torso forward while stretching arms and shoulders upward.
CBSeatedHighRow.execution: Pull cable attachment to waist and lean back slightly. Pull shoulders back and push chest forward while arching back. Return until torso, arms, and shoulders pulled forward. Repeat.
CBSeatedHighRow.comments: It is optional to bend lower back forward during stretch and pull it upright during contraction. If low back is kept still, Erector Spinae acts as synergist muscle. Also see exercise on

CBSeatedRow.name: Cable Seated Row
CBSeatedRow.preparation: Sit slightly forward on seat or bench in order to   grasp cable attachment. Place feet on vertical platform. Slide hips back positioning knees with slight bend.
CBSeatedRow.execution: Pull cable attachment to waist while straightening lower back. Pull shoulders back and push chest forward while arching back. Return until arms are extended, shoulders are stretched forward, and lower back is flexed forward. Repeat.
CBSeatedRow.comments: Begin with light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

CBStandingTwistingHighRow.name: Cable Twisting Standing High Row
CBStandingTwistingHighRow.preparation: Stand facing high pulley positioned slightly above head level. Grasp stirrup with one hand and step back so arm is straight. With leg of opposite side as loaded arm, plant forefoot far back on floor. Slightly bend knee of forward leg, same direction as foot. Allow shoulder with stirrup to be pulled forward with twist through waist.
CBStandingTwistingHighRow.execution: Pull cable attachment to side of torso and rotate body toward side of pulling arm. Pull shoulder back and push chest forward. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is pulled forward. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
CBStandingTwistingHighRow.comments: In standing position, both spinal rotation and hip rotation contribute to body's rotation. Because rear leg is only supported by forefoot, hip of forward leg is utilized (hip

CBStraightBackInclineRow.name: Cable Straight Back Incline Row
CBStraightBackInclineRow.preparation: Sit on incline and place feet on lower bar, or foot platform. Slide hips down by bending knees. Bend over and grasp cable attachment. Slide hips back, positioning knees with slight bend. Straighten lower back so it is approximately perpendicular to incline.
CBStraightBackInclineRow.execution: Pull cable attachment to waist. Pull shoulders back and lift chest by arching back. Return until arms are extended, back is straight and perpendicular to incline, and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.

CBStraightBackSeatedRow.name: Cable Straight Back Seated Row
CBStraightBackSeatedRow.preparation: Sit slightly forward on bench with feet on foot bar or vertical platform. Grasp close grip cable attachment. Straighten torso   upright and slide hips back so knees are slightly bent.
CBStraightBackSeatedRow.execution: Pull cable attachment to waist. Pull shoulders back and lift chest by arching back. Return until arms are extended, back is straight, and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.

CBWideGripSeatedRow.name: Cable Wide Grip Seated Row
CBWideGripSeatedRow.preparation: Sit slightly forward on platform in order to grasp cable attachment. With awider than shoulder width grip, slide hips back positioning knees with slight bend.
CBWideGripSeatedRow.execution: Pull cable attachment to waist while pulling torso upright.   Pull shoulders back and push chest forward while arching back. Return until arms are extended, shoulders are stretched forward, and lower back is flexed forward. Repeat.
CBWideGripSeatedRow.comments: Begin with light weight and additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

CBWideGripStrBackSeatedRow.name: Cable Wide Grip Straight Back Seated Row
CBWideGripStrBackSeatedRow.preparation: Sit slightly forward on bench or platform in order to grasp cable bar attachment. With wider than shoulder width overhand grip, straighten torso upright and slide hips back until knees are only   slightly bent.
CBWideGripStrBackSeatedRow.execution: Pull cable attachment to waist. Pull shoulders back and lift chest by arching back. Return until arms are extended, back is straight, and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.

CamberedBarLyingRow.name: Cambered Barbell Lying Row
CamberedBarLyingRow.preparation: Lie chest down on elevated bench. Grasp cambered barbell below with overhand grip.
CamberedBarLyingRow.execution: Pull bar to upper waist or lower chest. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
CamberedBarLyingRow.comments: Bench should be high enough to allow shoulders to stretch forward without barbell hitting floor.

DBBentOverRow.name: Dumbbell Bent-over Row
DBBentOverRow.preparation: Kneel over side of bench by placing knee and hand of supporting arm on bench. Position foot of opposite leg slightly back to side. Grasp dumbbell from floor.
DBBentOverRow.execution: Pull dumbbell to up to side until it makes contact with ribs or until upper arm is just beyond horizontal. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched downward. Repeat and continue with opposite arm.
DBBentOverRow.comments: Allow scapula to articulate but do not rotate torso in effort to throw weight up. Torso should be close to horizontal. Positioning supporting knee and/or arm slightly forward or back will allow for proper levelling of torso. Torso may be positioned lower to allow for heavier dumbbell to make contact with floor, if desired.

DBInclineRow.name: Dumbbell Incline Row
DBInclineRow.preparation: Lie chest down on slightly inclined bench. Grasp dumbbells below.
DBInclineRow.execution: Pull dumbbells to sides until upper arm is just beyond height of back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
DBInclineRow.comments: Bench should be high enough to allow shoulders to stretch forward without dumbbells hitting floor. Lying on

LVAlternatingNarrowGripSeatedRow.name: Lever Alternating Narrow Grip Seated Row (plate loaded)
LVAlternatingNarrowGripSeatedRow.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
LVAlternatingNarrowGripSeatedRow.execution: Pull one lever back until elbow is behind back and shoulder is pulled back. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched forward. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.

DBLyingRow.name: Dumbbell Lying Row
DBLyingRow.preparation: Lie chest down on elevated bench. Grasp dumbbells below.
DBLyingRow.execution: Pull dumbbells to sides until upper arm is just beyond horizontal or height of back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
DBLyingRow.comments: Bench should be high enough to allow shoulders to stretch forward without dumbbells hitting floor. Exercise can also be performed on

LVAlternatingSeatedHighRow.name: Lever Alternating Seated High Row
LVAlternatingSeatedHighRow.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with overhand grip.
LVAlternatingSeatedHighRow.execution: Pull one lever handle back until elbow is behind back and shoulder is pulled back. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched forward. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.
LVAlternatingSeatedHighRow.comments: Chest pad should be adjusted to allow shoulders to stretch forward. The seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows.

LVAlternatingSeatedUnderhandRow.name: Lever Alternating Underhand Seated Row
LVAlternatingSeatedUnderhandRow.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
LVAlternatingSeatedUnderhandRow.execution: Pull one lever handle back until elbow is behind back and shoulder is pulled back. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched forward. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.
LVAlternatingSeatedUnderhandRow.comments: Seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows.

LVAlternatingSeatedUnderhandRowH.name: Lever Alternating Underhand Seated Row (plate loaded)
LVAlternatingSeatedUnderhandRowH.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
LVAlternatingSeatedUnderhandRowH.execution: Pull one lever back until elbow is behind back and shoulder is pulled back. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched forward. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.
LVAlternatingSeatedUnderhandRowH.comments: Seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows.

LVAlternatingWideGripSeatedRow.name: Lever Alternating Wide Grip Seated Row (plate loaded)
LVAlternatingWideGripSeatedRow.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
LVAlternatingWideGripSeatedRow.execution: Pull one lever back until elbow is behind back and shoulder is pulled back. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched forward. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.

LVBBBentOverRow.name: Lever Barbell Bent-over Row (plate loaded)
LVBBBentOverRow.preparation: Stand with toes under bar facing fulcrum. Bend knees slightly and bend over bar with back straight. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip.
LVBBBentOverRow.execution: Pull bar to waist. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
LVBBBentOverRow.comments: Exact stance from bar will depend upon height of fulcrum and length of lever. Torso may be kept horizontal for strict execution. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See

LVBentOverRowH.name: Lever Bent-over Row (plate loaded)
LVBentOverRowH.execution: With lever handles to sides, bend knees slightly and bend over with back straight. Grasp lower handles.

LVCloseGripTBarRow.name: Lever Close Grip T-bar Row (plate loaded)
LVCloseGripTBarRow.execution: Bend knees slightly and bend over lever handles with back straight. Grasp parallel lever handles.

LVCloseGripInclineRow.name: Lever Close Grip Incline Row (plate loaded)
LVCloseGripInclineRow.preparation: Lie chest on inclined platform and grasp lever close grip handles.
LVCloseGripInclineRow.execution: Pull lever up as high as possible. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
LVCloseGripInclineRow.comments: Near top arch upper back and pull shoulders back as shown. To maximize back involvement, position body on pad or grip so wrists follow elbows.

LVCloseGripTBarRowLM.name: Lever Close Grip T-bar Row (plate loaded)
LVCloseGripTBarRowLM.execution: Bend knees slightly and bend over lever handles with back straight. Grasp parallel lever handles.

LVInclineRow.name: Lever Incline Row (plate loaded)
LVInclineRow.preparation: Lie chest on inclined platform and grasp lever handles with overhand grip.
LVInclineRow.execution: Pull lever up as high as possible. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
LVInclineRow.comments: Near top arch upper back and pull shoulders back as shown. To maximize back involvement, position body on pad or grip so wrists follow elbows. Some

LVNarrowGripSeatedRowH.name: Lever Narrow Grip Seated Row (plate loaded)
LVNarrowGripSeatedRowH.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
LVNarrowGripSeatedRowH.execution: Pull levers back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
LVNarrowGripSeatedRowH.comments: Seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows. When completing pull, chest slightly and pull shoulder blades together while keeping lower chest on pad. Let shoulders roll forward when arms extend.

LVOneArmBentOverRow.name: Lever One Arm Bent-over Row (plate loaded)
LVOneArmBentOverRow.preparation: Kneel over side of bench facing loaded side of lever bar by placing knee and hand of supporting arm on bench. Position foot of opposite leg slightly back to side, straddling bar. Grasp bar from floor, several inches under barbell plates.
LVOneArmBentOverRow.execution: Pull lever bar up to side until bar contacts shoulder or just until elbow travels behind height of back. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched downward. Repeat and continue with opposite arm.
LVOneArmBentOverRow.comments: Allow scapula to articulate but do not rotate torso in effort to throw weight up. Lever base shown attaches to standard Olympic barbell. Improvising by placing barbell in corner may cause excessive wear on floor and floor board, or wall.

LVOneArmStandingRow.name: Lever One Arm Standing Row (plate loaded)
LVOneArmStandingRow.preparation: Place hand on support bar and grasp lever far forward. Place foot on side of moving arm on foot support and position opposite foot behind.
LVOneArmStandingRow.execution: Pull lever to side while twisting torso toward opposite side. Pull shoulder back and push chest forward during contraction. Return until arm is extended and torso is pulled toward original direction. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
LVOneArmStandingRow.comments: Unique apparatus designed and built by

LVSeatedHighRow.name: Lever Seated High Row (plate loaded)
LVSeatedHighRow.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with overhand grip.
LVSeatedHighRow.execution: Pull lever back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
LVSeatedHighRow.comments: Chest pad should be adjusted to allow shoulders to stretch forward. The seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows. Also see

LVSeatedHighRowB.name: Lever Seated High Row
LVSeatedHighRowB.preparation: Sit on seat and position thighs under pad. Lean  forward  and grasp lever handles above.
LVSeatedHighRowB.execution: Pull lever down while leaning back slightly. As elbows travel to sides, lift chest slightly and pull shoulders and elbows back. Return until arms are extended and body and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
LVSeatedHighRowB.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow for full range of motion. Also see Lever Seated

LVSeatedHighRowC.name: Lever Seated High Row
LVSeatedHighRowC.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with overhand grip.
LVSeatedHighRowC.execution: Pull lever back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
LVSeatedHighRowC.comments: Chest pad should be adjusted to allow shoulders to stretch forward. Also see Hammer Equipment Lever Seated High Row,

LVSeatedLowRow.name: Lever Seated Low Row (plate loaded)
LVSeatedLowRow.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with overhand/neutral grip.
LVSeatedLowRow.execution: Pull levers back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
LVSeatedLowRow.comments: Seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows. When completing pull, lift chest slightly and pull shoulder blades together while keeping lower chest on pad. Let shoulders roll forward when arms extend. See exercise on

LVSeatedRowNoPad.name: Lever Seated Row (no chest pad)
LVSeatedRowNoPad.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp handles with each hand. Place feet on vertically angled platform. Slide hips back with knees slightly bent.
LVSeatedRowNoPad.execution: Pull handles to waist while straightening torso upright. Pull shoulders back and push chest forward while arching back. Return until arms are extended, shoulders are stretched forward, and lower back is flexed forward. Repeat.
LVSeatedRowNoPad.comments: Exercise is performed on apparatus with no chest pad, in contrast to

LVSeatedRow.name: Lever Seated Row
LVSeatedRow.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Push foot lever if available. Grasp narrower parallel grip handles.
LVSeatedRow.execution: Pull lever back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
LVSeatedRow.comments: Chest pad should be adjusted to allow shoulders to stretch forward. The seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows. When completing pull, lift chest slightly and pull shoulder blades together while keeping lower chest on pad. Let shoulders roll forward when arms extend.

LVSeatedRowNoPadPL.name: Lever Seated Row (no chest pad, plate loaded)
LVSeatedRowNoPadPL.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp handles with each hand. Place feet on vertically angled platform. Slide hips back with knees slightly bent.
LVSeatedRowNoPadPL.execution: Pull handles to waist while straightening torso upright. Pull shoulders back and push chest forward while arching back. Return until arms are extended, shoulders are stretched forward, and lower back is flexed forward. Repeat.
LVSeatedRowNoPadPL.comments: Exercise is performed on apparatus with no chest pad, in contrast to

LVSeatedUnderhandRow.name: Lever Underhand Seated Row
LVSeatedUnderhandRow.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
LVSeatedUnderhandRow.execution: Pull levers back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
LVSeatedUnderhandRow.comments: Seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows. When completing pull, lift chest slightly and pull shoulder blades together while keeping lower chest on pad. Let shoulders roll forward when arms extend.

LVSeatedUnderhandRowH.name: Lever Underhand Seated Row (plate loaded)
LVSeatedUnderhandRowH.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
LVSeatedUnderhandRowH.execution: Pull levers back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
LVSeatedUnderhandRowH.comments: Seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows. When completing pull, lift chest slightly and pull shoulder blades together while keeping lower chest on pad. Let shoulders roll forward when arms extend. Also see

LVSeatedUnderhandRowS.name: Lever Underhand Seated Row
LVSeatedUnderhandRowS.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
LVSeatedUnderhandRowS.execution: Pull lever handles back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
LVSeatedUnderhandRowS.comments: Seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows.

LVStraightBackSeatedRowNoPadPL.name: Lever Straight Back Seated Row (no chest pad, plate loaded)
LVStraightBackSeatedRowNoPadPL.execution: Sit on seat with feet positioned on foot bar or platform. Grasp handles with each hand. Position torso upright with knees bent slightly.

LVStraightBackSeatedRowNoPad.name: Lever Straight Back Seated Row (no chest pad)
LVStraightBackSeatedRowNoPad.execution: Sit on seat with feet positioned on foot bar or platform. Grasp handles with each hand. Position torso upright with knees bent slightly.

LVTBarRow.name: Lever T-bar Row (plate loaded)
LVTBarRow.execution: Bend knees slightly and bend over lever handles with back straight. Grasp lever handles with shoulder width to wide overhand grip.

LVTBarRowLM.name: Lever T-bar Row (plate loaded)
LVTBarRowLM.execution: Bend knees slightly and bend over lever handles with back straight. Grasp lever handles with shoulder width to wide overhand grip.

LVWideGripBentOverRowH.name: Lever Wide Grip Bent-over Row (plate loaded)
LVWideGripBentOverRowH.preparation: With lever handles to sides, bend knees slightly and bend over with back straight. Grasp wider handles.
LVWideGripBentOverRowH.execution: Pull lever handles up to sides. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched downward. Repeat.
LVWideGripBentOverRowH.comments: Torso should be kept as close to horizontal while allowing for full arm extension. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See

LVWideGripSeatedRow.name: Lever Wide Grip Seated Row
LVWideGripSeatedRow.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp outer lever handles with overhand grip.
LVWideGripSeatedRow.execution: Pull lever back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
LVWideGripSeatedRow.comments: Chest pad should be adjusted to allow shoulders to stretch forward. The seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows. When completing pull, lift chest slightly and pull shoulder blades together while keeping lower chest on pad. Let shoulders roll forward when arms extend.

LVWideGripSeatedRowH.name: Lever Wide Grip Seated Row (high bar, plate loaded)
LVWideGripSeatedRowH.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
LVWideGripSeatedRowH.execution: Pull levers back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
LVWideGripSeatedRowH.comments: When completing pull, lift chest slightly and pull shoulder blades together while keeping lower chest on pad. Let shoulders roll forward when arms extend.

LVWideLowGripSeatedRowH.name: Lever Wide Grip Seated Row (plate loaded)
LVWideLowGripSeatedRowH.preparation: Sit on seat and position chest against pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip.
LVWideLowGripSeatedRowH.execution: Pull levers back until elbows are behind back and shoulders are pulled back. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
LVWideLowGripSeatedRowH.comments: Seat or grip should be adjusted to allow wrists to follow elbows. When completing pull, lift chest slightly and pull shoulder blades together while keeping lower chest on pad. Let shoulders roll forward when arms extend.

SMBentOverRow.name: Smith Bent-over Row
SMBentOverRow.execution: Bend knees slightly and bend over bar with back straight. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.

STBentKneeInvertedRow.name: Suspended Bent-knee Inverted Row
STBentKneeInvertedRow.preparation: Position suspension handles higher than arms' length above floor. Sit on floor and grasp handles. Hang shoulders under handles with arms straight, back and hips straight, with knees bent and feet flat on floor.
STBentKneeInvertedRow.execution: Pull body up so sides of chest make contact with handles while keeping body straight. Return until arms are extended straight and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
STBentKneeInvertedRow.comments: Handles should be positioned to allow for full arm extension, no lower. Instead of mounting from a seated or lying position, position can be assumed by stepping back with handles grasped in each hand until arms are straight forward. While keeping arms straight and shoulders back, step forward so body reclines back and under suspension handles. Dismounting can be achieved by walking backward until body is upright, minimizing contact with ground. See

STInvertedRow.name: Suspended Inverted Row
STInvertedRow.preparation: Position suspension handles higher than arms' length above floor. Sit on floor and grasp handles. Position body supine hanging from handles with arms straight, shoulders under handles, body straight, and back of heels on floor.
STInvertedRow.execution: Pull body up so sides of chest make contact with handles while keeping body straight. Return until arms are extended straight and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
STInvertedRow.comments: Fixed bar should be just high enough to allow arm to fully extend. See

STPowerPull.name: Suspended Power Pull
STPowerPull.preparation: Grasp suspension handle(s) with one hand. Step back until handle is chest height when held to side of chest. Facing suspension apparatus with feet shoulder width apart, point other arm and its shoulder forward, parallel with angle of strap.
STPowerPull.execution: Rotate body and extended arm, reaching outward while lowering body downward by extending arm holding onto handle. Extend arms and shoulders in-line with suspension strap so body is angled back to one side. Return by raising body back upward in opposite motion, reaching outward and toward suspension strap while pulling handle back to side of chest until body is upright and arm parallel with angle of strap. Repeat and continue with opposite side.
STPowerPull.comments: This exercise can be performed on TRXⓇ style suspension trainer or adjustable length gymnastics rings. Some suspension trainer brands allow independent use of only one handle, whereas, more popular brands require either anchoring unused handle within stirrup of gripped handle or grasping both handles with one hand.

STRow.name: Suspended Row
STRow.preparation: Grasp suspension handles and momentarily step back until arms are extended forward and straight. While keeping arms straight and shoulders back, step forward so body reclines back behind suspension handles. Position body and legs straight at desired angle, hanging from handles with arms straight.
STRow.execution: Pull body up so sides of chest make contact with handles while keeping body and legs straight. Return until arms are extended straight and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
STRow.comments: At higher angles, feet can be placed flat on floor. When angled further back, only heels may contact floor with forefeet raising upward. Dismounting can be achieved by walking backward until body is upright.

WTSupineRow.name: Weighted Inverted Row
WTSupineRow.execution: Lay on back under fixed horizontal bar. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Place back of heels on elevated surface.

BBCurl.name: Barbell Curl
BBCurl.preparation: Grasp bar with shoulder width underhand grip.
BBCurl.execution: With elbows to side, raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
BBCurl.comments: When elbows are fully flexed, they can travel forward slightly allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Exercise can also be performed with

BBDragCurl.name: Barbell Drag Curl
BBDragCurl.preparation: Grasp bar with shoulder width underhand grip.
BBDragCurl.execution: Raise barbell straight up so elbows travel back as elbows flex. Follow contour of hips and waist. As elbows continues to flex, begin bringing elbows forward when forearms rises past horizontal position. Continue upward over chest until forearms are perpendicular. Lower until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
BBDragCurl.comments: Bringing elbows back forward, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical, permits a relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Exercise can also be performed with EZ barbell, in which case, making it also known as

CBAlternatingCurl.name: Cable Alternating Curl
CBAlternatingCurl.preparation: Stand between or facing double low pulleys. Grasp stirrups to each side, palms facing forward.
CBAlternatingCurl.execution: Pull one stirrup up forward and upward toward shoulder while keeping elbow stationary. Return until arm is fully extended. Repeat on other arm, alternating between sides.
CBAlternatingCurl.comments: When elbow is fully flexed, it can travel forward slightly, allowing forearm to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Pulleys should not be too far apart. Also see

CBAlternatingSeatedCurl.name: Cable Alternating Seated Curl
CBAlternatingSeatedCurl.preparation: Sit on seat situated between two low pulleys down to each side. Grasp stirrups in each hand, palms facing forward.
CBAlternatingSeatedCurl.execution: Pull one stirrup up toward shoulder while keeping elbow stationary. Return until arm is fully extended. Repeat with other arm, alternating between sides.
CBAlternatingSeatedCurl.comments: When elbow is fully flexed, it can travel forward slightly, allowing forearm to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Pulleys should not be too far apart. Cables can be positioned under shoulders with ad hoc or customized set up. See

CBBarCurl.name: Cable Bar Curl
CBBarCurl.preparation: Grasp low cable bar with shoulder width underhand grip. Stand close to cable bar.
CBBarCurl.execution: With elbows to side, raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
CBBarCurl.comments: When elbows are fully flexed, they can travel slightly forward, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Platform can be placed in front of feet to rest cable bar in between sets. See

CBCurl.name: Cable Curl
CBCurl.preparation: Grasp low pulley cable bar with shoulder width underhand grip. Stand close to pulley.
CBCurl.execution: With elbows to side, raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
CBCurl.comments: When elbows are fully flexed, they can travel forward slightly, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions.

CBCurlStirrups.name: Cable Curl (with stirrups)
CBCurlStirrups.preparation: Stand between or facing double low pulleys. Grasp stirrups to each side, palms facing forward.
CBCurlStirrups.execution: Pull stirrups forward and upward toward shoulders while keeping elbows stationary. Return until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
CBCurlStirrups.comments: When elbow is fully flexed, it can travel forward slightly, allowing forearm to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Pulleys should not be too far apart.

CBOneArmCurl.name: Cable One Arm Curl
CBOneArmCurl.preparation: Face low pulley and grasp stirrup cable attachment to one side with underhand grip.
CBOneArmCurl.execution: With elbow to side, raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower until arms are fully extended. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
CBOneArmCurl.comments: An alternative method is to stand facing with side of exercise arm toward low pulley. When elbow is fully flexed, it can travel forward slightly allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Also see

CBSeatedCurl.name: Cable Seated Curl
CBSeatedCurl.preparation: Sit on seat situated between two low pulleys down to each side. Grasp stirrups in each hand, palms facing forward.
CBSeatedCurl.execution: Pull both stirrups up toward shoulders while keeping elbows stationary. Return until arms are fully extended and repeat.
CBSeatedCurl.comments: When elbows are fully flexed, they can travel forward slightly, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Pulleys should not be too far apart. Cables can be positioned under shoulders with ad hoc or customized set up. Also see

CBSupineCurl.name: Cable Supine Curl
CBSupineCurl.preparation: Sit on floor with feet or heels against pulley machine. Grasp low pulley cable bar with shoulder width underhand grip. Lie back on floor with arms to sides.
CBSupineCurl.execution: With elbows to side, pull bar until elbows are flexed. Lower until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
CBSupineCurl.comments: When elbows are fully flexed, they can travel upward, slightly allowing forearms to be no more than horizontal in this lying posture. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Also see

DBCurl.name: Dumbbell Curl
DBCurl.preparation: Position two dumbbells to sides, palms facing in, arms straight.
DBCurl.execution: With elbows to sides, raise one dumbbell and rotate forearm until forearm is vertical and palm faces shoulder. Lower to original position and repeat with opposite arm. Continue to alternate between sides.
DBCurl.comments: Biceps may be exercised alternating (as described), simultaneous, or in simultaneous-alternating fashion. When elbow is fully flexed, it can travel forward slightly, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Also see

DBInclineCurl.name: Dumbbell Incline Curl
DBInclineCurl.preparation: Sit back on 45-60 degree incline bench. With arms hanging down straight, position two dumbbells with palms facing inward.
DBInclineCurl.execution: With elbows back to sides, raise one dumbbell and rotate forearm until forearm is vertical and palm faces shoulder. Lower to original position and repeat with opposite arm. Continue to alternate between sides.
DBInclineCurl.comments: This exercise may be performed by alternating (as described), simultaneous, or in simultaneous-alternating fashion. When elbow is fully flexed, it can travel forward slightly, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Also see

LVAlternatingCurl.name: Lever Alternating Curl
LVAlternatingCurl.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp handles with underhand grip.
LVAlternatingCurl.execution: Raise lever on handle until elbow is fully flexed with back of upper arm remaining on pad. Lower handle until arm is fully extended. Repeat with opposite arm. Continue to alternate movement between sides.

DBSeatedCurl.name: Dumbbell Seated Curl
DBSeatedCurl.preparation: Sit on end of bench with dumbbell in each hand and legs together. Position dumbbells with palms facing inward and arms hanging down straight.
DBSeatedCurl.execution: With elbows back to sides, raise one dumbbell and rotate forearm until forearm is vertical and palm faces shoulder. Lower to original position and repeat with opposite arm. Continue to alternate between sides.
DBSeatedCurl.comments: This exercise may be performed by alternating (as described), simultaneous, or in simultaneous-alternating fashion. When elbow is fully flexed, it can travel forward slightly, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions. Also see

LVCurl.name: Lever Curl
LVCurl.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp handles with underhand grip.
LVCurl.execution: Raise lever handles until elbows are fully flexed with back of upper arm remaining on pad. Lower handles until arm is fully extended. Repeat.

BlockSnatch.name: Block Snatch
BlockSnatch.preparation: Stand over barbell on blocks with balls of feet positioned under bar hip width or slightly wider than hip width apart. Squat down and grip bar with very wide overhand grip. Position shoulders over bar with back arched tightly. Arms are straight with elbows pointed along bar.
BlockSnatch.execution: Pull bar up off blocks by extending hips and knees while keeping back arched. When barbell passes knees, vigorously raise shoulders while keeping bar as close to legs as possible. When bar passes upper thighs, allow it to contact thighs. Jump upward extending body. Shrug shoulders and pull barbell upward with arms, allowing elbows to pull up to sides, keeping them over bar as long as possible. Aggressively pull body under bar. Catch bar at arm's length while moving into squat position. As soon as barbell is caught on locked out arms in squat position, squat up into standing position with barbell over head.
BlockSnatch.comments: Bend knees slightly and lower barbell to mid-thigh position. Slowly lower bar with taut lower back and trunk close to vertical. The advanced athlete may

BBPreacherCurl.name: Barbell Preacher Curl
BBPreacherCurl.preparation: Sit on preacher bench placing back of arms on pad. Grasp curl bar with shoulder width underhand grip.
BBPreacherCurl.execution: Raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower barbell until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
BBPreacherCurl.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow armpit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. The long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

BBProneInclineCurl.name: Barbell Prone Incline Curl
BBProneInclineCurl.preparation: Lie prone on incline bench with shoulders near top of incline. Knees can rest on seat or legs can be straddled to sides. From low rack or partner, grasp curl bar with shoulder width underhand grip.
BBProneInclineCurl.execution: Raise bar until arms are flexed. Lower barbell until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
BBProneInclineCurl.comments: The long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

BBStandingPreacherCurl.name: Barbell Standing Preacher Curl
BBStandingPreacherCurl.preparation: Placing back of arms on pad with one foot forward, grasp curl bar with shoulder width underhand grip.
BBStandingPreacherCurl.execution: Raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower barbell until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
BBStandingPreacherCurl.comments: Body should be positioned to allow armpit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. The long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

CBAlternatingPreacherCurl.name: Cable Alternating Preacher Curl
CBAlternatingPreacherCurl.preparation: Grasp cable stirrups with each hand. Sit on preacher bench placing back of arms on pad with palms up.
CBAlternatingPreacherCurl.execution: Raise one stirrup upward toward shoulder of same arm. Lower stirrup until arm is fully extended. Repeat with opposite arm. Continue alternating between arms.
CBAlternatingPreacherCurl.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allowarm pit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arms should remain on pad throughout movement. The long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

CBOneArmPreacherCurl.name: Cable One Arm Preacher Curl
CBOneArmPreacherCurl.preparation: Grasp cable stirrup. Sit on preacher bench placing back of arm on pad with palm up.
CBOneArmPreacherCurl.execution: Raise stirrup upward toward shoulder of same arm. Lower stirrup until arm is fully extended. Repeat.
CBOneArmPreacherCurl.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow armpit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. The long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

CBConcentrationCurl.name: Cable Concentration Curl
CBConcentrationCurl.preparation: Facing low pulley cable, sit on seat or bench with legs apart to each side. Grasp stirrup attachment. Place upper arm against inner thigh.
CBConcentrationCurl.execution: Pull stirrup to front of shoulder until elbow is completely flexed. Lower stirrup until arm is fully extended. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
CBConcentrationCurl.comments: The long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

CBOneArmStandingPreacherCurl.name: Cable One Arm Standing Preacher Curl
CBOneArmStandingPreacherCurl.preparation: Standing behind standing preacher bench and grasp cable stirrup. Place back of arm on pad with palm up.
CBOneArmStandingPreacherCurl.execution: Raise stirrup upward toward shoulder of same arm. Lower stirrup until arm is fully extended. Repeat.
CBOneArmStandingPreacherCurl.comments: Stirrup can be hung from one side of rack for easier access. Feet can be staggered and bent slightly (if needed) to allow armpit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. The long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

CBPreacherCurl.name: Cable Preacher Curl
CBPreacherCurl.preparation: Sit on preacher bench placing back of arms on pad. Grasp cable bar with shoulder width underhand grip.
CBPreacherCurl.execution: Raise cable bar toward shoulders. Lower cable bar until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
CBPreacherCurl.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow armpit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. The long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

CBPreacherCurlStirrups.name: Cable Preacher Curl (stirrups)
CBPreacherCurlStirrups.preparation: Grasp cable stirrups with each hand. Sit on preacher bench placing back of arms on pad with palms up.
CBPreacherCurlStirrups.execution: Raise both stirrups upward toward shoulders. Lower stirrups until arm is fully extended. Repeat.
CBPreacherCurlStirrups.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow armpit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arms should remain on pad throughout movement. The long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

CBProneInclineCurl.name: Cable Prone Incline Curl
CBProneInclineCurl.execution: Lie prone on incline bench with shoulders near top of incline. Knees can rest on seat or legs can be straddled to sides. Grasp cable attachment with shoulder width underhand grip.

CBStandingPreacherCurl.name: Cable Standing Preacher Curl
CBStandingPreacherCurl.preparation: Stand behind preacher bench. Grasp cable bar with shoulder width underhand grip. Position back of arms on pad.
CBStandingPreacherCurl.execution: Raise cable bar toward shoulders. Lower cable bar until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
CBStandingPreacherCurl.comments: Feet can be staggered and bent slightly (if needed) to allow armpit to rest near top of pad.   Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. The long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

DBConcentrationCurl.name: Dumbbell Concentration Curl
DBConcentrationCurl.preparation: Sit on bench. Grasp dumbbell between feet. Place back of upper arm to inner thigh. Lean into leg to raise elbow slightly.
DBConcentrationCurl.execution: Raise dumbbell to front of shoulder. Lower dumbbell until arm is fully extended. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
DBConcentrationCurl.comments: The long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

DBStandingPreacherCurl.name: Dumbbell Standing Preacher Curl
DBStandingPreacherCurl.preparation: With dummbell in hand, arm bent, and palm facing shoulder, place back of arm on pad.
DBStandingPreacherCurl.execution: Lower dumbbell until arm is fully extended. Raise dumbbell until forearm is vertical. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
DBStandingPreacherCurl.comments: Body should be positioned to allow armpit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. Long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

DBProneInclineCurl.name: Dumbbell Prone Incline Curl
