DBProneInclineCurl.preparation: Lie prone on incline bench with shoulders near top of incline. Knees can rest on seat or legs can be straddled to sides. From elevated platform or partner, grasp dumbbell and position palms forward.
DBProneInclineCurl.execution: Raise dumbbells until arms are flexed. Lower dumbbells until arms are fully extended. Repeat.

DBPreacherCurl.name: Dumbbell Preacher Curl
DBPreacherCurl.preparation: Grasp dumbbell and sit on preacher bench. With arm bent and palm facing shoulder, place back of arm down on pad.
DBPreacherCurl.execution: Lower dumbbell until arm is fully extended. Raise dumbbell until forearm is vertical. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
DBPreacherCurl.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow armpit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. Long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

DBStandingPreacherCurlInclineBench.name: Dumbbell Standing Preacher Curl (on incline bench)
DBStandingPreacherCurlInclineBench.preparation: Stand behind incline bench adjusted 45º to 55º. With dumbbell in hand, arm bent, and palm facing shoulder, place back of arm on pad.
DBStandingPreacherCurlInclineBench.execution: Lower dumbbell until arm is fully extended. Raise dumbbell until forearm is vertical. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
DBStandingPreacherCurlInclineBench.comments: Dumbbell Preacher Curl can be performed on back of incline bench if

LVAlterPreacherCurlHigh.name: Lever Alternating Preacher Curl (arms high)
LVAlterPreacherCurlHigh.preparation: Sit on curl machine. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip. Align elbows at same pivot point as fulcrum of lever while placing back of arms up on pads.
LVAlterPreacherCurlHigh.execution: Pull one lever handle toward shoulder. Return handle until arm is fully extended. Repeat with opposite arm. Continue alternating movement between arms.
LVAlterPreacherCurlHigh.comments: Back of upper arms should remain on pad throughout movement. If machine has secondary lever (as shown), elbows can be positioned further away from primary fulcrum. Long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

LVAlterPreacherCurlHighPL.name: Lever Alternating Preacher Curl (arms high, plate loaded)
LVAlterPreacherCurlHighPL.preparation: Sit on curl machine. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip. Align elbows at same pivot point as fulcrum of lever while placing back of arms up on pads.
LVAlterPreacherCurlHighPL.execution: Pull one lever handle toward shoulder. Return handle until arm is fully extended. Repeat with opposite arm. Continue alternating movement between arms.
LVAlterPreacherCurlHighPL.comments: Back of upper arms should remain on pad throughout movement. If machine has secondary lever (as shown), elbows can be positioned further away from primary fulcrum. Long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

LVPreacherCurl.name: Lever Preacher Curl
LVPreacherCurl.preparation: Sit on curl machine placing back of arms on pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip. Align elbows at same pivot point as fulcrum of lever.
LVPreacherCurl.execution: Raise lever handles toward shoulders. Lower handles until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
LVPreacherCurl.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow armpit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. If machine has secondary lever (as shown), it is not as essential to position elbows in-line with the primary fulcrum, as would otherwise be required. Long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

LVPreacherCurlH.name: Lever Preacher Curl (plate loaded)
LVPreacherCurlH.preparation: Sit on curl machine placing back of arms on pad. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip. Align elbows at same pivot point as fulcrum of lever.
LVPreacherCurlH.execution: Raise lever handles toward shoulders. Lower handles until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
LVPreacherCurlH.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow armpit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. If no resistance is experienced during initial range of motion, make sure seat is adjusted to allow for back of arm to be positioned flush against arm pad. If resistance is still not experienced, consider keeping wrists in a slight flexed position to compensate. If machine has secondary lever (as shown), it is not as essential to position elbows in-line with the primary fulcrum, as would otherwise be required. Long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

LVPreacherCurlHighPL.name: Lever Preacher Curl (arms high, plate loaded)
LVPreacherCurlHighPL.preparation: Sit on curl machine. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip. Align elbows at same pivot point as fulcrum of lever while placing back of arms up on pads.
LVPreacherCurlHighPL.execution: Pull lever handles toward shoulders. Return handles until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
LVPreacherCurlHighPL.comments: Back of upper arms should remain on pad throughout movement. If machine has secondary lever (as shown), it is not as essential to position elbows in-line with the primary fulcrum, as would otherwise be required.

LVPreacherCurlHigh.name: Lever Preacher Curl (arms high)
LVPreacherCurlHigh.preparation: Sit on curl machine. Grasp lever handles with underhand grip. Align elbows at same pivot point as fulcrum of lever while placing back of arms up on pads.
LVPreacherCurlHigh.execution: Pull lever handles toward shoulders. Return handles until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
LVPreacherCurlHigh.comments: Back of upper arms should remain on pad throughout movement. If machine has secondary lever (as shown), it is not as essential to position elbows in-line with the primary fulcrum, as would otherwise be required.

LVPreacherCurlNoSeat.name: Lever Standing Preacher Curl
LVPreacherCurlNoSeat.preparation: Stand behind arm pad and face lever handles on opposite side. Place one foot forward under arm pad and opposite foot back on foot bar. Lean over arm pads and grasp   handles with slightly narrower than shoulder width underhand grip. Squat down and position back of upper arms on arm pads.
LVPreacherCurlNoSeat.execution: Raise lever handles toward shoulders. Lower handles until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
LVPreacherCurlNoSeat.comments: Position armpit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. Notice that this machine has secondary lever so elbows are not aligned with primary fulcrum. This particular machine also features weight pack that can be positioned closer or further away from fulcrum thereby making resistance easier or harder. Long head (lateral head) of Biceps Brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of Biceps Brachii since short head enters into

LVPreacherCurlNoSeatPL.name: Lever Standing Preacher Curl (plate loaded)
LVPreacherCurlNoSeatPL.preparation: Stand behind arm pad and face lever handles on opposite side. Place one foot forward under arm pad and opposite foot back on foot bar. Lean over arm pads and grasp handles with slightly narrower than shoulder width underhand grip. Squat down and position back of upper arms on arm pads.
LVPreacherCurlNoSeatPL.execution: Raise lever handles toward shoulders. Lower handles until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
LVPreacherCurlNoSeatPL.comments: Position armpit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. Notice that this machine has secondary lever so elbows are not aligned with primary fulcrum. Also see

STArmCurl.name: Suspended Arm Curl
STArmCurl.preparation: Grasp suspension handles and momentarily step back until arms are extended forward and straight. While keeping arms straight and shoulders back, step forward so body is reclined back. Position palms up or slightly inward.
STArmCurl.execution: Bring handles toward shoulders by flexing arms, while keeping elbows pointed forward. Return by straightening arms and repeat.
STArmCurl.comments: Dismounting can be achieved by walking backward until body is upright. Also known as Suspended Biceps Curl, arguably somewhat of a misnomer. The positioning of arms, with elbows high, places short head (medial head) of Bicep Brachii in

BBReverseCurl.name: Barbell Reverse Curl
BBReverseCurl.preparation: Grasp bar with shoulder width overhand grip.
BBReverseCurl.execution: With elbows to side, raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
BBReverseCurl.comments: When elbows are fully flexed, they can travel forward slightly, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions.

BBStandingReversePreacherCurl.name: Barbell Standing Reverse Preacher Curl
BBStandingReversePreacherCurl.preparation: Place back of arms on pad with one foot forward. Grasp curl bar with shoulder width underhand grip.
BBStandingReversePreacherCurl.execution: Raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower barbell until arm is fully extended. Repeat.
BBStandingReversePreacherCurl.comments: Body should be positioned to allow arm pit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad.

BBReversePreacherCurl.name: Barbell Reverse Preacher Curl
BBReversePreacherCurl.preparation: Sit on preacher bench placing back of arms on pad. Grasp curl bar with shoulder width overhand grip.
BBReversePreacherCurl.execution: Raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower barbell until arm is fully extended. Repeat.
BBReversePreacherCurl.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow arm pit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad.

CBBarReverseCurl.name: Cable Bar Reverse Curl
CBBarReverseCurl.preparation: Grasp cable bar with shoulder width overhand grip. Stand close to cable bar.
CBBarReverseCurl.execution: With elbows to side, raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
CBBarReverseCurl.comments: When elbows are fully flexed, they can travel slightly forward, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions.

CBHammerCurl.name: Cable Hammer Curl
CBHammerCurl.preparation: Grasp cable rope with palms facing inward. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
CBHammerCurl.execution: With elbows to side, raise rope forward and upward with both arms until forearms are vertical. Lower until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
CBHammerCurl.comments: When elbows are fully flexed, they can travel forward slightly, allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions.

CBReverseCurl.name: Cable Reverse Curl
CBReverseCurl.preparation: Grasp cable bar with shoulder width overhand grip.
CBReverseCurl.execution: With elbows to side, raise bar until forearms are vertical. Lower until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
CBReverseCurl.comments: When elbows are fully flexed, they can travel forward, slightly allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions.

CBReversePreacherCurl.name: Cable Reverse Preacher Curl
CBReversePreacherCurl.preparation: Sit on preacher bench placing back of arms on pad. Grasp cable bar with shoulder width overhand grip.
CBReversePreacherCurl.execution: Raise cable bar toward shoulders. Lower cable bar until arm is fully extended. Repeat.
CBReversePreacherCurl.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow arm pit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad. At bottom position, weight stack in use should not make contact with remaining weight stack.

CBStandingReversePreacherCurl.name: Cable Standing Reverse Preacher Curl
CBStandingReversePreacherCurl.preparation: Stand behind preacher bench. Grasp cable bar with shoulder width overhand grip. Position back of arms on pad.
CBStandingReversePreacherCurl.execution: Raise cable bar toward shoulders. Lower cable bar until arm is fully extended. Repeat.
CBStandingReversePreacherCurl.comments: Feet can be staggered and bent slightly (if needed) to allow arm pit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad. At bottom position, weight stack in use should not make contact with remaining weight stack.

DBHammerCurl.name: Dumbbell Hammer Curl
DBHammerCurl.preparation: Position two dumbbells to sides, palms facing in, arms straight.
DBHammerCurl.execution: With elbows to sides, raise one dumbbell until forearm is vertical and thumb faces shoulder. Lower to original position and repeat with alternative arm.
DBHammerCurl.comments: The biceps may be exercised alternating (as described), simultaneous, or in simultaneous-alternating fashion. When elbows are fully flexed, they can travel forward slightly allowing forearms to be no more than vertical. This additional movement allows for relative release of tension in muscles between repetitions.

LVHammerPreacherCurl.name: Lever Hammer Preacher Curl
LVHammerPreacherCurl.preparation: Sit on curl machine placing back of arms on pad. Grasp lever handles and position grips with thumb side up. Align elbows at near same pivot point as fulcrum of lever.
LVHammerPreacherCurl.execution: Raise lever handles toward shoulders, maintaining palms in grip. Lower handles until arm is fully extended. Repeat.
LVHammerPreacherCurl.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow arm pit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad. If machine has secondary lever, elbows can be positioned further away from primary fulcrum.

LVReverseCurl.name: Lever Reverse Curl
LVReverseCurl.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp handles with overhand grip. Position elbows to sides so they are in line with lever's fulcrum.
LVReverseCurl.execution: Raise lever handles until elbows are fully flexed with back of upper arm remaining on pad. Lower handles until arm is fully extended. Repeat.
LVReverseCurl.comments: The biceps may be exercised alternating or simultaneous. If machine does not provide support for back of arm, keep elbows from traveling back, particularly during initial flexion.

BBBehindNeckPress.name: Barbell Behind Neck Press
BBBehindNeckPress.preparation: Grasp barbell with overhand grip from rack or
BBBehindNeckPress.execution: from floor. Position bar behind neck.
BBBehindNeckPress.comments: Press bar upward until arms are extended overhead. Return behind neck and repeat.

LVReversePreacherCurl.name: Lever Reverse Preacher Curl
LVReversePreacherCurl.preparation: Sit on curl machine placing back of arms on pad. Grasp lever handles with overhand grip. Align elbows at near same pivot point as fulcrum of lever.
LVReversePreacherCurl.execution: Raise lever handles toward shoulders. Lower handles until arm is fully extended. Repeat.
LVReversePreacherCurl.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow arm pit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad. If machine has secondary lever, elbows can be positioned further away from primary fulcrum.

BBFrontRaise.name: Barbell Front Raise
BBFrontRaise.preparation: Grasp barbell with overhand grip with elbows straight or slightly bent.
BBFrontRaise.execution: Raise barbell forward and upward until upper arms are above horizontal. Lower and repeat.
BBFrontRaise.comments: Height of movement may depend on range of motion. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule. Alternatively, height just above horizontal may be considered adequate. Elbows may be kept straight or slightly bent throughout movement.

BBInclineFrontRaise.name: Barbell Incline Front Raise
BBInclineFrontRaise.preparation: Grasp barbell with shoulder width overhand grip. Lie supine on upper portion of 45 degree incline bench with legs straight. Position barbell on top of upper thighs.
BBInclineFrontRaise.execution: With elbows straight or slightly bent, raise barbell up and over shoulders until uppers arm are vertical. Lower barbell to upper thigh and repeat.
BBInclineFrontRaise.comments: Movement can also be performed on old fashioned incline bench without seat.

BBReclinedShoulderPress.name: Barbell Reclined Shoulder Press
BBReclinedShoulderPress.preparation: Sit on Incline bench angled at 70° to 80°. Grasp barbell with slightly wider than shoulder width overhand grip from rack. Lean back on reclined back pad with bar positioned near upper chest.
BBReclinedShoulderPress.execution: Press bar upward until arms are extended overhead. Return to upper chest and repeat.
BBReclinedShoulderPress.comments: Reclined position can be used instead of

BBMilitaryPress.name: Barbell Military Press
BBMilitaryPress.execution: barbell from floor with overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder width. Position bar in front of neck.
BBMilitaryPress.comments: Press bar upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower to front of neck and repeat.

BBSeatedMilitaryPress.name: Barbell Seated Military Press
BBSeatedMilitaryPress.preparation: Grasp barbell with slightly wider than shoulder width overhand grip from rack. Position bar near upper chest.
BBSeatedMilitaryPress.execution: Press bar upward until arms are extended overhead. Return to upper chest and repeat.
BBSeatedMilitaryPress.comments: Set barbell on forward rack slightly below shoulder height so bar may be more easily unracked and racked. Position seat so bar does not hit uprights but close enough to easily mount and rack. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

BBShoulderPress.name: Barbell Shoulder Press
BBShoulderPress.preparation: Grasp barbell with slightly wider than shoulder width overhand grip from rack. Position bar near upper chest.
BBShoulderPress.execution: Press bar upward until arms are extended overhead. Return to upper chest and repeat.
BBShoulderPress.comments: Set barbell on forward rack slightly below shoulder height so bar may be more easily mounted and racked. Position seat so bar does not hit uprights but close enough to easily mount and rack. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

BWHandstandPressBench.name: Handstand Push-up (between benches)
BWHandstandPressBench.preparation: Stand facing wall between two benches positioned side by side, slightly apart, and slightly away and perpendicular to wall. Place hands on ends of benches closest to wall. Place forefeet on bench and kick lower body up to handstand position with arms and legs straight. Maintain balance with lower body against wall.
BWHandstandPressBench.execution: Lower head between ends of benches by bending arms. Push body back up to original position by extending arms. Repeat.
BWHandstandPressBench.comments: Benches must be secured to prevent sliding on floor. Also, each benches' base of support should be under edge of bench where hand is placed to prevent bench toppling under body weight. Falling from inverted position may result in very serious injury. Also known as Elevated Handstand Push-up.

BWDeclinePikePress.name: Elevated Pike Press
BWDeclinePikePress.preparation: Stand between two incline benches positioned side by side slightly apart at end nearest head. Place hands on ends of benches and straighten arms. Position forefeet on opposite ends of bench. Raise rear end high up with arms, back, and knees straight.
BWDeclinePikePress.execution: Lower head between ends of benches by bending arms. Push body back up to original position by extending arms. Repeat.
BWDeclinePikePress.comments: Keep knees and back straight. A slight curve (spinal flexion) is acceptable if

BWHandstandPushupParallettes.name: Handstand Push-up (on parallettes)
BWHandstandPushupParallettes.preparation: Stand facing parallette bars. Squat down and grasp bars with elbows bent and tucked. Bend forward, position head low, and kick feet up with legs bent so torso is in forward angled inverted position. While maintaining balance extend legs over body with spine hyperextended.
BWHandstandPushupParallettes.execution: While maintaining body balanced over bars, push inverted body up by extending arms until straight. Lower body down by bending arms until shoulders are close to bars. Repeat.
BWHandstandPushupParallettes.comments: Alternatively, mount can be achieved by bending over bars with knees slightly bent and arms straight, then raising legs up straight overhead. Falling from inverted position may result in very serious injury. Also known as Elevated Handstand Push-up.

CBAlternatingFrontRaise.name: Cable Alternating Front Raise
CBAlternatingFrontRaise.preparation: Stand with low double pulleys behind. Grasp stirrup attachments, one in each hand. Stand away from pulley slightly with arms back somewhat at side and elbows straight or slightly bent.
CBAlternatingFrontRaise.execution: Raise one stirrup forward and upward until upper arm is well above horizontal. Lower and repeat with opposite arm, alternating between arms.
CBAlternatingFrontRaise.comments: Height of movement may depend on range of motion or when stirrup or cable makes contact with underside of forearm. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule. Alternatively, height just above horizontal may be considered adequate. Elbows may be kept straight or slightly bent throughout movement.

BWPikePress.name: Pike Press
BWPikePress.preparation: Kneel on two benches positioned side by side slightly apart at end nearest head. Place hands on ends of benches. With forefeet on opposite ends of bench, raise rear end high up with arms, back, and knees straight. Adjust feet so they are somewhat close to hands while keeping back and legs straight.
BWPikePress.execution: Lower head between ends of benches by bending arms. Push body back up to original position by extending arms. Repeat.
BWPikePress.comments: Pike Press (for front delts) differs from

CBAlternatingSeatedFrontRaise.name: Cable Alternating Seated Front Raise
CBAlternatingSeatedFrontRaise.preparation: Sit on seat above twin cable pulleys. Grasp stirrups on each side. Sit upright with arms straight down to each side with palms facing back.
CBAlternatingSeatedFrontRaise.execution: Raise one stirrup forward and upward until upper arm is well above horizontal. Lower and repeat with opposite arm. Continue by alternating raises between sides.
CBAlternatingSeatedFrontRaise.comments: Height of movement may depend on range of motion or when stirrup or cable makes contact with underside of forearm. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule. Alternatively, height just above horizontal may be considered adequate. Elbows may be kept straight or slightly bent throughout movement.

CBBarFrontRaise.name: Cable Bar Front Raise
CBBarFrontRaise.preparation: Grasp cable bar with overhand grip with elbows straight or slightly bent.
CBBarFrontRaise.execution: Raise cable bar forward and upward until upper arms are above horizontal. Lower and repeat.
CBBarFrontRaise.comments: Height of movement may depend on range of motion. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule. Alternatively, height just above horizontal may be considered adequate. Elbows may be kept straight or slightly bent throughout movement.

CBBarBehindNeckPress.name: Cable Bar Behind Neck Press
CBBarBehindNeckPress.preparation: Stand facing cable bar, mounted on each side to upper waist height narrow double pulley cables. Grasp cable bar with wide overhand grip upper chest height. Stand directly between both cable pulleys with one foot forward and other foot back. Push cable bar over head and position cable bar behind neck or rest on shoulders.
CBBarBehindNeckPress.execution: Press cable bar upward until arms are extended overhead. Return behind neck and repeat.
CBBarBehindNeckPress.comments: Exercise may also be performed seated, straddling bench or on weight chair with back support.

CBBarMilitaryPress.name: Cable Bar Military Press
CBBarMilitaryPress.preparation: Stand facing cable bar, mounted on each side to upper waist height narrow double pulley cables. Grasp cable bar with overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder width. Position cable bar upper chest height. Stand directly between both cable pulleys with one foot forward and other foot back.
CBBarMilitaryPress.execution: Press cable bar upward until arms are extended overhead. Return to upper chest and repeat.
CBBarMilitaryPress.comments: Feet may be positioned shoulder width apart or one foot in front of other with forward leg slightly bent (as shown). Upper chest assists (instead of side delts) since grip is slightly narrower and chest is high with low back arched back slightly.

CBBarShoulderPress.name: Cable Bar Shoulder Press
CBBarShoulderPress.preparation: Stand facing cable bar mounted on each side to upper waist height narrow double pulley cables. Grasp cable bar with wide overhand grip and position upper chest height. Stand directly between both cable pulleys with one foot forward and other foot back.
CBBarShoulderPress.execution: Press cable bar upward until arms are extended overhead. Return to upper chest and repeat.
CBBarShoulderPress.comments: Exercise may also be performed seated, straddling bench or on weight chair with back support. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

CBFrontRaise.name: Cable One Arm Front Raise
CBFrontRaise.preparation: Grasp stirrup attachment. Stand away from pulley slightly with arm back somewhat at side and elbow straight or slightly bent.
CBFrontRaise.execution: Raise stirrup forward and upward until upper arm is well above horizontal. Lower and repeat. Repeat with opposite arm.
CBFrontRaise.comments: Height of movement may depend on range of motion or when stirrup or cable makes contact with underside of forearm. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule. Alternatively, height just above horizontal may be considered adequate. Elbows may be kept straight or slightly bent throughout movement.

CBFrontRaiseRope.name: Cable One Arm Front Raise (with rope)
CBFrontRaiseRope.preparation: Grasp end of Triceps Rope Cable attachment with one hand so that protruding end is in contact with side of hand (thumb and index finger). Stand away from   pulley with arm back at side and elbow straight.
CBFrontRaiseRope.execution: Raise stirrup forward and upward until arm is well above horizontal or cable makes contact with underside of upper arm. Lower and repeat. Repeat with opposite arm.
CBFrontRaiseRope.comments: Height of movement may depend on range of motion or when cable makes contact with underside of forearm. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt within shoulder capsule. Alternatively, height just above horizontal may be considered adequate. However, thumbs up position with external rotation of the shoulder (AKA: 'Open Can') as compared to palms down position with shoulder internal rotation may increase range of motion of shoulder flexion before subacromial impingement is experienced. This positioning also decreases Lateral Deltoid involvement while increasing Clavicular Pectoralis activation.

CBShoulderPress.name: Cable Shoulder Press
CBShoulderPress.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp stirrups from low to medium low position from each side. Position stirrups to each side of shoulders with elbows down to sides and stirrups above or slightly narrower than elbows.
CBShoulderPress.execution: Push stirrups upward until arms are extended overhead. Return stirrups to sides of shoulders and repeat.
CBShoulderPress.comments: Wrists maintain their approximate position above each elbow throughout movement.

CBSeatedFrontRaise.name: Cable Seated Front Raise
CBSeatedFrontRaise.preparation: Sit on seat above twin cable pulleys. Grasp stirrups on each side. Sit upright with arms straight down to each side with palms facing back.
CBSeatedFrontRaise.execution: Raise stirrups forward and upward until upper arms are well above horizontal. Lower and repeat.
CBSeatedFrontRaise.comments: Height of movement may depend on range of motion or when stirrup or cable makes contact with underside of forearm. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule. Alternatively, height just above horizontal may be considered adequate. Elbows may be kept straight or slightly bent throughout movement.

CBStandingShoulderPress.name: Cable Standing Shoulder Press
CBStandingShoulderPress.preparation: Stand between two low to medium height pulleys. Grasp cable stirrups from each side. Position stirrups to each side of shoulders with elbows down to sides and stirrups above or slightly narrower than elbows.
CBStandingShoulderPress.execution: Push stirrups upward until arms are extended overhead. Return stirrups to sides of shoulders and repeat.
CBStandingShoulderPress.comments: Wrists maintain their approximate position above each elbow throughout movement. Feet may be positioned apart to each side or one foot back as shown. Cable pulleys should be much closer together than what is typically found on standard cable cross over setup.

CBTwistingOverheadPress.name: Cable Twisting Overhead Press
CBTwistingOverheadPress.execution: Stand beside low to medium height pulley. Grasp cable stirrup. Position stirrup to front of shoulder with elbow down to side. Place opposite hand on hip. With feet wide apart, squat down slightly.

DBAlternInclineFrontRaise.name: Dumbbell Alternating Incline Front Raise
DBAlternInclineFrontRaise.preparation: Grasp dumbbells and lie supine on upper portion of 45 degree incline bench with legs straight. Position dumbbells downward below each shoulder.
DBAlternInclineFrontRaise.execution: With elbows straight or slightly bent, raise one dumbbell forward, up and over shoulder until upper arm is vertical. Lower dumbbell down to starting position. Repeat raise with other arm, alternating between sides.
DBAlternInclineFrontRaise.comments: Movement can also be performed on old fashion incline bench without seat.

DBAlternatingFrontRaise.name: Dumbbell Alternating Front Raise
DBAlternatingFrontRaise.preparation: Grasp dumbbells in both hands. Position dumbbells in front of upper legs with elbows straight or slightly bent.
DBAlternatingFrontRaise.execution: Raise one dumbbell forward and upward with palms positioned downward until upper arm is above horizontal. Lower and repeat with opposite arm, alternating between arms.
DBAlternatingFrontRaise.comments: Height of movement may depend on range of motion. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule. Alternatively, height just above horizontal may be considered adequate. Elbows may be kept straight or slightly bent throughout movement. Also see

DBAlternatingFullCanSeatedFrontRaise.name: Dumbbell Alternating Full Can Seated Front Raise
DBAlternatingFullCanSeatedFrontRaise.preparation: Sit on end of bench with dumbbell in each hand and legs together. Position dumbbells with palms facing inward and arms hanging down straight.
DBAlternatingFullCanSeatedFrontRaise.execution: Raise one dumbbell forward and upward until upper arm is above horizontal. Lower to original vertical position. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating movement pattern between arms.
DBAlternatingFullCanSeatedFrontRaise.comments: Height of movement may depend on range of motion. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule, which may be slightly higher than which is felt in the

DBArnoldPress.name: Dumbbell Arnold Press
DBArnoldPress.preparation: Stand with two dumbbells position in front of shoulders, palms facing body and elbows under wrists.
DBArnoldPress.execution: Initiate movement by bringing elbows out to sides. Continue to raise elbows outward while pressing dumbbells overhead until arms are straight. Lower to front of shoulders in opposite pattern and repeat.

DBFrontRaise.name: Dumbbell Front Raise
DBFrontRaise.preparation: Grasp dumbbells in both hands. Position dumbbells in front of upper legs with elbows straight or slightly bent.
DBFrontRaise.execution: Raise dumbbells forward and upward until upper arms are above horizontal. Lower and repeat.
DBFrontRaise.comments: Height of movement may depend on range of motion. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule. Alternatively, height just above horizontal may be considered adequate. Elbows may be kept straight or slightly bent throughout movement. Also see

DBAlternatingSeatedFrontRaise.name: Dumbbell Alternating Seated Front Raise
DBAlternatingSeatedFrontRaise.preparation: Sit on end of bench with dumbbell in each hand and legs together. Position dumbbells with palms facing inward and arms hanging down straight.
DBAlternatingSeatedFrontRaise.execution: Raise one dumbbell forward and upward while turning palms downward as soon as dumbbell clears thigh. Continue raising dumbbell until upper arm is above horizontal. Lower and turn palms inward while dumbbells travels past thigh until arm is in original vertical position. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating movement pattern between arms.
DBAlternatingSeatedFrontRaise.comments: Height of movement may depend on range of motion. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule, which may be slightly higher than which is felt in the palms down version. Alternatively, height just above horizontal may be considered adequate. Elbows may be kept straight or slightly bent throughout movement. Also see

DBFullCanSeatedFrontRaise.name: Dumbbell Full Can Seated Front Raise
DBFullCanSeatedFrontRaise.preparation: Sit on end of bench with dumbbell in each hand and legs together. Position dumbbells with palms facing inward and arms hanging down straight.
DBFullCanSeatedFrontRaise.execution: Raise dumbbells forward and upward until upper arms are above horizontal. Lower to original vertical position and repeat.
DBFullCanSeatedFrontRaise.comments: Height of movement may depend on range of motion. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule, which may be slightly higher than which is felt in the

DBOneArmShoulderPress.name: Dumbbell One Arm Shoulder Press
DBOneArmShoulderPress.preparation: Stand with dumbbells positioned near shoulder with elbow below wrists.
DBOneArmShoulderPress.execution: Press dumbbell upward until arm is extended overhead. Lower to side of shoulder and repeat.
DBOneArmShoulderPress.comments: Torso can lean away for balance as shown or torso can maintain upright posture. Also see

DBReclinedShoulderPress.name: Dumbbell Reclined Shoulder Press
DBReclinedShoulderPress.preparation: Position dumbbells to each side of shoulders with elbows below wrists. Lean back on back pad angled 70 to 80 degrees.
DBReclinedShoulderPress.execution: Press dumbbells upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower to sides of upper chest and repeat.

DBSeatedFrontRaise.name: Dumbbell Seated Front Raise
DBSeatedFrontRaise.preparation: Sit on end of bench with dumbbell in each hand and legs together. Position dumbbells with palms facing inward and arms hanging down straight.
DBSeatedFrontRaise.execution: Raise dumbbells forward and upward while turning palms downward as soon as dumbbells clear thighs. Continue raising dumbbells until upper arms are above horizontal. Lower dumbbells and turn palms inward while dumbbells travels past thighs until arms are in original vertical position. Repeat.
DBSeatedFrontRaise.comments: Height of movement may depend on range of motion. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule. Alternatively, height just above horizontal may be considered adequate. Elbows may be kept straight or slightly bent throughout movement. Also see

DBShoulderPress.name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
DBShoulderPress.preparation: Position dumbbells to each side of shoulders with elbows below wrists.
DBShoulderPress.execution: Press dumbbells upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower to sides of shoulders and repeat.

LVAlternatingShoulderPress.name: Lever Alternating Shoulder Press
LVAlternatingShoulderPress.preparation: Set and grasp lever handles to each side with overhand grip.
LVAlternatingShoulderPress.execution: Press one lever upward until arm is extended overhead. Lower to original position. Repeat with opposite arm. Continue by alternating movement between arms.
LVAlternatingShoulderPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

LVBBShoulderPress.name: Lever Barbell Shoulder Press (plate loaded)
LVBBShoulderPress.preparation: Sit on bench with bar positioned in front of shoulders. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
LVBBShoulderPress.execution: Press bar upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower bar to front of shoulders and repeat.
LVBBShoulderPress.comments: Pull head back slightly so bar does not head. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

LVBBBehindNeckPress.name: Lever Barbell Behind Neck Press (plate loaded)
LVBBBehindNeckPress.preparation: Sit on bench with bar positioned behind shoulders, also facing away from fulcrum. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
LVBBBehindNeckPress.execution: Press bar upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower bar behind neck and repeat.
LVBBBehindNeckPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

LVBehindNeckPressH.name: Lever Behind Neck Press (plate loaded)
LVBehindNeckPressH.preparation: Sit back on seat. Grasp lever bars to each side with overhand grip.
LVBehindNeckPressH.execution: Press levers upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower and repeat.
LVBehindNeckPressH.comments: Exercise can also be performed on certain lever shoulder presses by facing away from machine. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

LVFrontRaise.name: Lever One Arm Front Raise
LVFrontRaise.preparation: Stand with lever to side, fulcrum approximately shoulder height and handle just below hip. Grasp lever handle with elbow straight or slightly bent.
LVFrontRaise.execution: Raise lever handle forward and upward until upper arm is well above horizontal. Lower and repeat. Repeat with opposite arm.
LVFrontRaise.comments: Height of movement may depend on individual range of motion. Raise should be limited to height achieved just before tightness is felt in shoulder capsule. Alternatively, height just above horizontal may be considered adequate. Elbows may be kept straight or slightly bent throughout movement. Exercise is performed on

LVOneArmShoulderPress.name: Lever One Arm Shoulder Press (plate loaded)
LVOneArmShoulderPress.preparation: Stand to one side, near loaded end of barbell, opposite of landmine lever. Lift end of barbell and position near shoulder with underhand grip. Stand with feet far apart (leg on same side of loaded arm is back and opposite leg is forward and bent).
LVOneArmShoulderPress.execution: Press end of barbell upward and forward until arm is extended. Lower to shoulder and repeat. Repeat with opposite side.
LVOneArmShoulderPress.comments: Keep back straight when lifting end of barbell from floor. Also see

LVMilitaryPressH.name: Lever Military Press (plate loaded)
LVMilitaryPressH.preparation: Set and grasp lever handles to each side with overhand grip.
LVMilitaryPressH.execution: Press lever until arms are extended upward. Lower and repeat.
LVMilitaryPressH.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

LVReclinedShoulderPress.name: Lever Reclined Shoulder Press
LVReclinedShoulderPress.preparation: Lie on back pad facing up. Grasp lever handles to each side with overhand grip.
LVReclinedShoulderPress.execution: Press lever until arms are extended. Lower and repeat.
LVReclinedShoulderPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

LVReclinedShoulderPressPL.name: Lever Reclined Shoulder Press (plate loaded)
LVReclinedShoulderPressPL.preparation: Lie on back pad facing up. Grasp lever handles on each side with overhand grip.
LVReclinedShoulderPressPL.execution: Press lever until arms are extended. Lower and repeat.
LVReclinedShoulderPressPL.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

LVShoulderPress.name: Lever Shoulder Press
LVShoulderPress.preparation: Set and grasp lever handles to each side with overhand grip.
LVShoulderPress.execution: Press lever upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower and repeat.
LVShoulderPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

LVReclinedShoulderPressParGrip.name: Lever Reclined Parallel Grip Shoulder Press
LVReclinedShoulderPressParGrip.preparation: Lie on back pad facing up. Grasp parallel lever handles on each side.
LVReclinedShoulderPressParGrip.execution: Press lever until arms are extended. Lower and repeat.
LVReclinedShoulderPressParGrip.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

LVShoulderPressH.name: Lever Shoulder Press (plate loaded)
LVShoulderPressH.preparation: Set and grasp lever handles to each side with overhand grip.
LVShoulderPressH.execution: Press lever upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower and repeat.
LVShoulderPressH.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

LVShoulderPressParGrip.name: Lever Shoulder Press (parallel grip)
LVShoulderPressParGrip.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp parallel bar grips in front of shoulders on each side.
LVShoulderPressParGrip.execution: Press lever upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower and repeat.
LVShoulderPressParGrip.comments: Parallel grip can be used for variety or when flexibility does not permit standard overhand grip further back.

SLShoulderPress.name: Sled Shoulder Press
SLShoulderPress.preparation: Set and grasp lever handles to each side with overhand grip.
SLShoulderPress.execution: Press handles upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower and repeat.
SLShoulderPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

SLShoulderPressParGrip.name: Sled Shoulder Press (parallel grip)
SLShoulderPressParGrip.preparation: Sit on seat and grasp parallel bar grips to front of shoulders on each side.
SLShoulderPressParGrip.execution: Press handles upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower and repeat.
SLShoulderPressParGrip.comments: Parallel grip can be used for variety or when flexibility does not permit standard overhand grip further back.

SMBehindNeckPress.name: Smith Behind Neck Press
SMBehindNeckPress.preparation: Sit on bench with bar positioned behind shoulders. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
SMBehindNeckPress.execution: Press bar upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower bar behind neck and repeat.
SMBehindNeckPress.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

SMShoulderPress.name: Smith Shoulder Press
SMShoulderPress.preparation: Sit on bench with bar positioned in front of shoulders. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
SMShoulderPress.execution: Press bar upward until arms are extended overhead. Lower bar to front of shoulders and repeat.
SMShoulderPress.comments: Pull head back slightly so bar does not make contact with head. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

STFrontRaise.name: Suspended Front Raise
STFrontRaise.preparation: Grasp suspension handles and momentarily step back until arms are extended forward and straight. While keeping arms straight and shoulders back, step forward so body reclines back behind suspension handles. Position body and legs straight at desired angle, hanging from handles with arms straight and palms facing downward.
STFrontRaise.execution: Raise arms upward overhead by flexing shoulders with arms straight. Return and lower body back until arms are extended straight forward in original position. Repeat.
STFrontRaise.comments: At higher angles, feet can be placed flat on floor. When angled further back, only heels may contact floor with forefeet raising upward. Dismounting can be achieved by walking backward until body is upright. This exercise can be performed on TRXⓇ style suspension trainer or adjustable length gymnastics rings.

BBUprightRow.name: Barbell Upright Row
BBUprightRow.preparation: Grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly narrower overhand grip.
BBUprightRow.execution: Pull bar to neck with elbows leading. Allow wrists to flex as bar rises. Lower and repeat.
BBUprightRow.comments: Bar can be recieved from barbell rack, standing behind bar mid-thigh height. See

BBWideGripUprightRow.name: Barbell Wide Grip Upright Row
BBWideGripUprightRow.preparation: Grasp bar with wide overhand grip.
BBWideGripUprightRow.execution: Pull bar to neck with elbows leading. Allow wrists to flex as bar rises. Lower and repeat.
BBWideGripUprightRow.comments: Bar can be received from barbell rack, standing behind bar mid-thigh height. See

CBBarUprightRow.name: Cable Bar Upright Row
CBBarUprightRow.preparation: Grasp cable bar with shoulder width or slightly narrower overhand grip. Stand close to cable bar.
CBBarUprightRow.execution: Pull bar to neck with elbows leading. Allow wrists to flex as bar rises. Lower and repeat.

CBLateralRaise.name: Cable Lateral Raise
CBLateralRaise.preparation: With low pulleys to each side, grasp left stirrup with right hand and right stirrup with left hand. Stand upright.
CBLateralRaise.execution: With elbows slightly bent, raise arms to sides   until elbows are shoulder height. Lower and repeat.
CBLateralRaise.comments: Maintain fixed slightly bent elbow position throughout exercise. Stirrup is raised by

CBLateralRaiseClose.name: Cable Lateral Raise (pulleys close)
CBLateralRaiseClose.preparation: Stand facing two low pulleys positioned side by side. Grasp stirrups with each hand. Stand upright with arms staight down to each side.
CBLateralRaiseClose.execution: With elbows slightly bent, raise arms to side until elbows are shoulder height. Lower and repeat.
CBLateralRaiseClose.comments: Maintain fixed slightly bent elbow position throughout exercise. Stirrup is raised by

CBOneArmLateralRaise.name: Cable One Arm Lateral Raise
CBOneArmLateralRaise.preparation: Grasp stirrup cable attachment. Stand facing with side of resting arm toward low pulley. Grasp ballet bar if available.
CBOneArmLateralRaise.execution: With elbow slightly bent, raise arm to side away from low pulley until elbow is shoulder height. Lower and repeat.
CBOneArmLateralRaise.comments: Maintain fixed elbow position (10° to 30° angle) throughout exercise. Stirrup is raised by

CBOneArmUprightRow.name: Cable One Arm Upright Row
CBOneArmUprightRow.preparation: Grasp stirrup on low pulley with overhand grip. Stand with side of arm with stirup away from pulley machine, arm against front of body. Place other hand on ballet bar or side of pulley column for support.
CBOneArmUprightRow.execution: Pull stirup to front side of shoulder with elbow leading. Allow wrist to flex as stirrup is lifted. Lower and repeat.

CBSeatedYRaise.name: Cable Seated Y Raise
CBSeatedYRaise.preparation: On dual pulley seated row machine, sit slightly forward on seat or bench in order to grasp both cable attachments. Place feet on vertical platform. Position torso upright and slide hips back so knees are slightly bent.
CBSeatedYRaise.execution: Raise arms upward and outward to sides in Y configuration while allowing elbows to partially bend. Pull back until elbows are approximately lateral to each ear. Lower stirrups forward and downward until arms are extended straight in front of body. Repeat.
CBSeatedYRaise.comments: Keep torso upright throughout exercise. Stirrup is raised by combining

CBSeatedLateralRaise.name: Cable Seated Lateral Raise
CBSeatedLateralRaise.preparation: Sit on seat above twin cable pulleys. Grasp stirrups on each side. Sit upright with arms nearly straight down to each side.
CBSeatedLateralRaise.execution: With elbows slightly bent, raise arms to side until elbows are shoulder height. Lower and repeat.
CBSeatedLateralRaise.comments: Maintain fixed slightly bent elbow position throughout exercise. At top of movement, elbows (not necessarily dumbbells) should be directly lateral to shoulders since elbows are slightly bent forward. Stirrup is raised by

CBUprightRow.name: Cable Upright Row
CBUprightRow.preparation: Grasp cable bar with shoulder width or slightly narrower overhand grip. Stand close to pulley.
CBUprightRow.execution: Pull bar to neck with elbows leading. Allow wrists to flex as bar rises. Lower and repeat.

CBSeatedYRaiseRope.name: Cable Seated Y Raise (with rope attachment)
CBSeatedYRaiseRope.preparation: Sit slightly forward on seat or bench and grasp ends of rope attachment with hand. Place feet on vertical platform. Slide hips back so knees are slightly bent.
CBSeatedYRaiseRope.execution: With torso upright pull rope upward over head until elbows are approximately lateral to each ear. Lower stirrups forward and downward until arms are extended straight in front of body. Repeat.
CBSeatedYRaiseRope.comments: Keep torso upright while maintaining fixed slightly bent elbow position throughout exercise. Stirrup is raised by combining

CBUprightRowDualPulley.name: Cable Upright Row (dual pulley)
CBUprightRowDualPulley.preparation: Stand between low dual pulleys. Grasp handles with opposite hands - right hand holds left stirrup and left hand holds right stirrup. Stand upright with arms straight and palms facing back (overhand grip), one stirrup in front of other.
CBUprightRowDualPulley.execution: Pull handles up to front of shoulders with elbows leading and cables crossed. Allow wrists to flex as stirrups are lifted. Lower and repeat.
CBUprightRowDualPulley.comments: To prevent cable parts from catching, stand with body turned very subtly to side of cable behind other. Positioning one cable slightly in front of other cable may result in slight asymmetrical movement. Therefore, alternate opposite arm positions every other workout or set. See

CBUprightRowRope.name: Cable Upright Row (with rope attachment)
CBUprightRowRope.preparation: Grasp each side of rope with overhand grip, just under rope ends. Stand close to pulley.
CBUprightRowRope.execution: Pull rope ends to front of shoulders with elbows leading. Allow wrists to flex as stirrups are lifted. Lower and repeat.

CBUprightRowStirrups.name: Cable Upright Row (stirrup attachments)
CBUprightRowStirrups.preparation: Grasp handles of both stirrups with overhand grip. Stand close to pulley.
CBUprightRowStirrups.comments: Pull handles to front of shoulders with elbows leading. Allow wrists to flex as stirrups are lifted. Lower and repeat.

CBYRaise.name: Cable Y Raise
CBYRaise.preparation: Stand facing between low pulleys medium width apart, grasp left stirrup with right hand and right stirrup with left hand. Step back slightly away from pulleys and stand upright with cables crossed in front of hips.
CBYRaise.execution: With elbows slightly bent, raise arms upward and outward to sides in Y configuration until elbows are approximately lateral to each ear. Lower stirrups forward and downward in reverse pattern. Repeat.
CBYRaise.comments: Maintain fixed slightly bent elbow position throughout exercise. Stirrup is raised by combining

CBWideGripUprightRow.name: Cable Wide Grip Upright Row
CBWideGripUprightRow.preparation: Grasp cable bar with wide overhand grip. Stand close to pulley.
CBWideGripUprightRow.execution: Pull bar to neck with elbows leading. Allow wrists to flex as bar rises. Lower and repeat.

DBInclineLateralRaise.name: Dumbbell Incline Lateral Raise
DBInclineLateralRaise.preparation: Grasp dumbbell in one hand. Lie on 30° to 45° incline bench with opposite side of body on incline, arm over top of bench, lower leg positioned on front side of seat, and upper leg on back side of seat. Position dumbbell inside of lower leg, just in front of upper leg.
DBInclineLateralRaise.execution: Raise dumbbell from until upper arm is perpendicular to torso. Maintain slight fixed bend in elbow throughout exercise. Lower dumbbell to front of upper leg and repeat.
DBInclineLateralRaise.comments: In order for lateral deltoid to be exercised, dumbbell must be raised by

DBInclineYRaise.name: Dumbbell Incline Y Raise
DBInclineYRaise.preparation: With dumbbells in each hand, lie prone on 45
DBInclineYRaise.execution: Incline bench with head over top of bench and arms extended down to each side.
DBInclineYRaise.comments: With elbows slightly bent, raise arms with dumbbells upward and outward to sides in Y configuration until elbows are approximately lateral to each ear. Lower dumbbells in reverse pattern until they are below shoulders and repeat.

DBLateralRaise.name: Dumbbell Lateral Raise
DBLateralRaise.preparation: Grasp dumbbells in front of thighs with elbows slightly bent. Bend over slightly with hips and knees bent slightly.
DBLateralRaise.execution: Raise upper arms to sides until slightly bent elbows are shoulder height while maintaining elbows' height above or equal to wrists. Lower and repeat.
DBLateralRaise.comments: Keep elbows pointed high while maintaining slight bend through elbows (10° to 30° angle) throughout movement. At top of movement, elbows (not necessarily dumbbells) should be directly lateral to shoulders since elbows are slightly bent forward. Dumbbells are raised by

DBOneArmLateralRaise.name: Dumbbell One Arm Lateral Raise
DBOneArmLateralRaise.preparation: Position dumbbell in front of pelvis with elbow slightly bent. Grasp stationary object with other hand for support. Bend over with hips and knees bent slightly.
DBOneArmLateralRaise.execution: Raise upper arm to side until slightly bent elbow is shoulder height while maintaining elbow's height above or equal to wrist. Lower and repeat.
DBOneArmLateralRaise.comments: Maintain fixed elbow position (10° to 30° angle) throughout exercise. At top of movement, elbow (not necessarily dumbbell) should be directly lateral to shoulder since elbow is slightly bent forward. Dumbbell is raised by

DBLyingLateralRaise.name: Dumbbell Lying Lateral Raise
DBLyingLateralRaise.preparation: Lie on side with legs separated for support. Grasp dumbbell in front of thigh.
DBLyingLateralRaise.execution: Raise dumbbell from floor until arm is vertical. Maintain fixed elbow position (10° to 30° angle) throughout exercise. Lower and repeat.

DBOneArmSeatedLateralRaise.name: Dumbbell One Arm Seated Lateral Raise
DBOneArmSeatedLateralRaise.preparation: Sit on stool or end of bench with legs together. Position dumbbell to side with elbow slightly bent. Angle torso slightly forward and place free hand on end of thigh for support.
DBOneArmSeatedLateralRaise.execution: Raise upper arm to side until slightly bent elbow is shoulder height while maintaining elbow's height above or equal to wrist. Lower and repeat.
DBOneArmSeatedLateralRaise.comments: Maintain fixed elbow position (10° to 30° angle) throughout exercise. At top of movement, elbow (not necessarily dumbbell) should be directly lateral to shoulder since elbow is slightly bent forward. Dumbbell is raised by

DBOneArmUprightRow.name: Dumbbell One Arm Upright Row
DBOneArmUprightRow.preparation: Grasp dumbbells with palms facing front of thighs. Position other hand for support.
DBOneArmUprightRow.execution: Pull dumbbell to front of shoulder with elbow leading. Allow wrist to flex as dumbbell rises upward. Lower and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.

DBRaises.name: Dumbbell Raise
DBRaises.preparation: Stand and grasp dumbbells with arms to side, palms facing sides of thighs.
DBRaises.execution: Pull dumbbells up to sides of ribs with elbows out to sides. Lower and repeat.
DBRaises.comments: When dumbbells are raised, wrist can be flexed, extended, or keep neutral.

DBSeatedLateralRaise.name: Dumbbell Seated Lateral Raise
DBSeatedLateralRaise.preparation: Sit on end of bench with dumbbell in each hand and legs together. Position dumbbells with palms facing inward and arms hanging down slightly bent.
DBSeatedLateralRaise.execution: Raise upper arms to sides until slightly bent elbows are shoulder height while maintaining elbows' height above or equal to wrists. Lower and repeat.
DBSeatedLateralRaise.comments: Maintain fixed elbow position (10° to 30° angle) throughout exercise. At top of movement, elbow (not necessarily dumbbell) should be directly lateral to shoulder since elbow is slightly bent forward. Dumbbell is raised by

DBUprightRow.name: Dumbbell Upright Row
DBUprightRow.preparation: Grasp dumbbells and stand with palms facing front of thighs.
DBUprightRow.execution: Pull dumbbells to front of shoulder with elbows leading out to sides. Allow wrists to flex as dumbbells rise upward. Lower and repeat.
DBUprightRow.comments: When dumbbells are raised, wrists should be in front or just below of shoulders; elbows should be to sides, not pointing   forward. See

DBSeatedUprightRow.name: Dumbbell Seated Upright Row
DBSeatedUprightRow.preparation: Sit on end of bench with legs far apart. Grasp dumbbell between legs with arm vertical under shoulder. Position torso slightly forward with hand on knee for support.
DBSeatedUprightRow.execution: Pull dumbbell to front of shoulder with elbow leading out to side. Allow wrists to flex as dumbbell rises upward. Lower and repeat.
DBSeatedUprightRow.comments: When dumbbell is raised, wrist should be in front or just below of shoulder; elbow should be to side, not too pointing forward. See

LVBBUprightRow.name: Lever Barbell Upright Row (plate loaded)
LVBBUprightRow.preparation: Stand behind bar mid-thigh height, facing away from from fulcrum. Grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly narrower overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back and stand upright.
LVBBUprightRow.execution: Pull bar to neck with elbows leading. Allow wrists to flex as bar rises. Lower and repeat.

LVExtendedArmKneelingLateralRaise.name: Lever Extended Arm Kneeling Lateral Raise
LVExtendedArmKneelingLateralRaise.preparation: Kneel on shin pads facing machine and grasp lever handles to each side with elbows straight or slightly bent.
LVExtendedArmKneelingLateralRaise.execution: Raise lever handles to sides until elbows are shoulder height. Maintain elbows' height above or equal to wrists. Lower and repeat.
LVExtendedArmKneelingLateralRaise.comments: If elbows drop much lower than wrists, front deltoids become primary mover instead of lateral deltoids.

LVExtendedArmLateralRaise.name: Lever Extended Arm Lateral Raise
LVExtendedArmLateralRaise.preparation: Stand facing machine and grasp lever handles to each side with elbows straight or slightly bent.
LVExtendedArmLateralRaise.execution: Raise lever handles to sides until elbows are shoulder height. Maintain elbows' height above or equal to wrists. Lower and repeat.
LVExtendedArmLateralRaise.comments: If elbows drop much lower than wrists, front deltoids become primary mover instead of lateral deltoids. Torso can also lean forward slightly to keep resistance targeted to side delt.

LVLateralRaise.name: Lever Lateral Raise
LVLateralRaise.preparation: Sit in machine. Situate bent arms between padded lever and sides of body. Grasp handles if available.
LVLateralRaise.execution: Raise arms to sides until upper arms are horizontal. Return and repeat.
LVLateralRaise.comments: If necessary, lean forward slightly to keep elbows directly lateral to body. Also see

LVLateralRaise2.name: Lever Lateral Raise
LVLateralRaise2.preparation: Sit in machine. Situate bent arms between padded lever and sides of body. Grasp handles if available.
LVLateralRaise2.execution: Raise arms to sides until upper arms are horizontal. Return and repeat.

LVLateralRaiseH.name: Lever Lateral Raise (plate loaded)
LVLateralRaiseH.preparation: Sit in machine. Situate bent arms between padded lever and sides of body.
LVLateralRaiseH.execution: Raise arms to sides until upper arms are horizontal. Return and repeat.

SMWideGripUprightRow.name: Smith Wide Grip Upright Row
SMWideGripUprightRow.preparation: Stand behind bar mid-thigh height. Grasp bar with wide grip overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back and stand upright.
SMWideGripUprightRow.execution: Pull bar to neck with elbows leading. Allow wrists to flex as bar rises. Lower and repeat.

SMUprightRow.name: Smith Upright Row
SMUprightRow.preparation: Stand behind bar mid-thigh height. Grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly narrower overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back and stand upright.
SMUprightRow.execution: Pull bar to neck with elbows leading. Allow wrists to flex as bar rises. Lower and repeat.

BBLyingRearDeltRow.name: Barbell Lying Rear Delt Row
BBLyingRearDeltRow.preparation: Lie chest down on elevated bench. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip.
BBLyingRearDeltRow.execution: Keeping upper arm perpendicular to torso, pull barbell up toward upper chest until upper arms are just beyond parallel to floor. Return and repeat.
BBLyingRearDeltRow.comments: If upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunk,

STYShoulderRaise.name: Suspended Y Lateral Raise
STYShoulderRaise.preparation: Grasp suspension handles and momentarily step back until arms are extended forward and straight. While keeping arms straight and shoulders back, step forward so body reclines back behind suspension handles. Position body and legs straight at desired angle hanging from handles with arms straight and palms angled inward.
STYShoulderRaise.execution: Raise arms upward and outward in shape of a Y while keeping arms straight. Return and lower body back in opposite motion until arms are extended straight forward in original position. Repeat.
STYShoulderRaise.comments: At higher angles, feet can be placed flat on floor. When angled further back, only heels may contact forefeet floor with forefeet   raising upward. Dismounting can be achieved by walking backward until body is upright. This exercise can be performed on TRXⓇ style suspension trainer or adjustable length gymnastics rings.

BBRearDeltRaise.name: Barbell Rear Delt Raise
BBRearDeltRaise.preparation: Stand holding barbell behind thighs or hips with arms straight down to sides.
BBRearDeltRaise.execution: Pull barbell behind hips and low back up as far as possible allowing elbows to travel up behind body to each side. Flex wrists near top of movement so bar can be raised higher. Lower until arms and wrists are straight. Repeat.
BBRearDeltRaise.comments: Flexion of wrist can allow for slightly greater range of movement near top, but this movement optional.

BBRearDeltRow.name: Barbell Rear Delt Row
BBRearDeltRow.preparation: Bend knees slightly and bend over bar with back straight, approximately horizontal. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip.
BBRearDeltRow.execution: Keeping upper arm perpendicular to torso, pull barbell up toward upper chest until upper arms are just beyond horizontal. Return and repeat.
BBRearDeltRow.comments: If upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunk,

BWRearDeltInvertedRow.name: Rear Delt Inverted Row
BWRearDeltInvertedRow.preparation: Stand facing horizontal bar positioned waist to lower chest height. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Step back until arms are straight. Walk forward under bar until arms are perpendicular to extended body. With heels on floor, position body at angle under bar with legs, hips and spine straight.
BWRearDeltInvertedRow.execution: Pull shoulders toward bar while keeping body straight, elbows to sides of shoulders, and upper arms perpendicular to torso, until upper arms are parallel to one another, or just beyond. Lower body while keeping elbows positioned high to sides of shoulders until arms are extended straight. Repeat.
BWRearDeltInvertedRow.comments: If elbows fall so upper arms no longer travel perpendicular to trunk,

BWRearDeltInvertedRowHigh.name: Rear Delt Inverted Row (high bar)
BWRearDeltInvertedRowHigh.preparation: Stand facing horizontal bar positioned lower to upper chest height. Step toward bar so chest makes contact. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Raise elbows up to shoulder height. Place feet forward on floor so body is reclined back with legs, hips and spine straight.
BWRearDeltInvertedRowHigh.execution: Lower body while keeping body straight, elbows high, and upper arms perpendicular to torso, until arms are extended straight. Pull shoulders toward bar while keeping elbows up high until upper arms are parallel to one another, or just beyond. Repeat.
BWRearDeltInvertedRowHigh.comments: If elbows fall so upper arms no longer travel perpendicular to trunk,

BWRearDeltInvertedRowHips.name: Rear Delt Inverted Row (on hips)
BWRearDeltInvertedRowHips.preparation: Lay on back with belly under fixed horizontal bar. Bend knees and position feet on floor. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Turn elbows outward to sides.
BWRearDeltInvertedRowHips.execution: Walk forward under bar while pulling upper chest close to bar. With heels on floor, position body at angle under bar with legs, hips and spine straight. Position forearms perpendicular to body, orientated forward. Also, position upper arms perpendicular to body, orientated to each side.
BWRearDeltInvertedRowHips.comments: Keeping hips on floor, low back straight, and elbow pointed out to sides; pull torso up to bar. Return when upper arms are just beyond parallel to one another. Lower body downward until arms are extended straight. Return and repeat.

CBOneArmCrossRow.name: Cable One Arm Standing Cross Row
CBOneArmCrossRow.preparation: Facing shoulder height cable pulley, grasp stirrup cable attachment with one hand, palm orientated down. Step back and turn body inward about 30° to 45° to face extended arm about. Stand back just enough to allow arm to be fully extended with weight raised up slightly.
CBOneArmCrossRow.execution: Pull stirrup back with elbow up at shoulder height until elbow travels just behind shoulder. Keep upper arm horizontal, perpendicular to trunk. Return until arm is fully extended. Repeat.

CBOneArmRearDeltRow.name: Cable One Arm Rear Delt Row
CBOneArmRearDeltRow.preparation: Sit slightly forward on bench or platform in order to grasp stirrup cable attachment with one hand. Straighten torso upright and slide hips back until knees are only slightly bent. Point elbow out to side.
CBOneArmRearDeltRow.comments: Pull stirrup out to side, elbows up shoulder height until elbows travel slightly behind back. Allow wrist to follow elbow. Keep upper arm horizontal, perpendicular to trunk. Return until arm is extended and shoulder is stretched forward. Repeat.

CBOneArmRearLateralRaise.name: Cable One Arm Rear Lateral Raise
CBOneArmRearLateralRaise.preparation: Stand with side to low pulley. Grasp stirrup attachment with hand furthest from pulley. Bend knees slightly and bend over with resting arm to side of low pulley.
CBOneArmRearLateralRaise.execution: Raise arm to side until elbow is shoulder height. Maintain upper arm perpendicular to torso and fixed elbow position (10° to 30° angle) throughout exercise. Lower and repeat. Repeat with other arm.
CBOneArmRearLateralRaise.comments: Upper arm should travel in perpendicular path to torso to minimize

CBRearDeltPull.name: Cable One Arm Reverse Fly
CBRearDeltPull.preparation: Stand with side to shoulder height cable pulley. Grasp stirrup cable attachment with hand furthest from pulley. Position arm across neck with elbow bent 30° to 45° outward.
CBRearDeltPull.execution: Keeping elbows pointed high, pull stirrup out to side, maintaining fixed elbow position throughout exercise. Return to original position and repeat. Repeat with other arm.
CBRearDeltPull.comments: Upper arm should travel in horizontal path at shoulder height (not downward) to minimize

CBRearDeltRow.name: Cable Rear Delt Row
CBRearDeltRow.preparation: Sit slightly forward on bench or platform in order to grasp cable bar attachment. With elbow width overhand grip, straighten torso upright and slide hips back until knees are only   slightly bent.
CBRearDeltRow.execution: Pull cable attachment toward upper chest, just below neck, with elbows up out to sides until elbows travel slightly behind back. Keep upper arms horizontal, perpendicular to trunk. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
CBRearDeltRow.comments: Elbow width is determined when elbows are raised at height of shoulders out to sides. The relatively powerful

CBRearDeltRowStirrups.name: Cable Rear Delt Row (stirrups)
CBRearDeltRowStirrups.preparation: On dual pulley seated row machine, sit slightly forward on seat or bench in order to grasp both cable attachments. Place feet on vertical platform. Position torso upright and slide hips back until knees are only slightly bent and cable taut. Point elbows outward.
CBRearDeltRowStirrups.execution: Pull stirrups out to sides, keeping elbows at shoulder height until elbows travel slightly behind back. Allow wrists to follow elbows. Keep upper arms horizontal, perpendicular to trunk. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.
CBRearDeltRowStirrups.comments: Dual pulley cables should be positioned approximately shoulder height or not much lower.   The relatively powerful

CBRearLateralRaise.name: Cable Rear Lateral Raise
CBRearLateralRaise.preparation: Stand with cable columns to each side. Grasp left stirrup with right hand and right stirrup with left hand. Bend knees and bend over at hips, so torso is approximately horizontal with back straight. Point elbows outward with arms slightly bent.
CBRearLateralRaise.execution: Raise upper arms to sides until elbows are shoulder height. Maintain upper arms perpendicular to torso and slight bend in elbows as arms are raised to sides. Lower and repeat.
CBRearLateralRaise.comments: Upper arm should travel perpendicular to torso to minimize

CBSeatedRearDeltPull.name: Cable Seated Reverse Fly
CBSeatedRearDeltPull.preparation: Sit on seat facing twin pulley cables positioned approximately shoulder height. Grasp stirrup cable attachment in each hand. Straighten lower back upright so cable is taut. Point elbows outward with arms slightly bent.
CBSeatedRearDeltPull.execution: Keeping elbows pointed high, pull stirrups out to sides, maintaining slightly bent elbow position throughout exercise. Return to original position and repeat.
CBSeatedRearDeltPull.comments: Upper arms should travel in horizontal path at shoulder height (not downward) to minimize

CBSeatedRearDeltRowStirrups.name: Cable Seated Rear Delt Row (stirrups)
CBSeatedRearDeltRowStirrups.preparation: Sit on seat facing twin pulley cables positioned shoulder height. Grasp stirrup cable attachment in each hand. Straighten lower back upright so arms and shoulders are positioned straight forward with cable taut. Point elbows outward.
CBSeatedRearDeltRowStirrups.execution: Pull stirrups out to sides, keeping elbows at shoulder height until elbows travel slightly behind back. Allow wrists to follow elbows. Keep upper arms horizontal, perpendicular to trunk. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.

CBSeatedRearLateralRaise.name: Cable Seated Rear Lateral Raise
CBSeatedRearLateralRaise.preparation: Sit at edge of bench with feet of floor ahead of knees. Rest torso on thighs. Reach under legs and grasp stirrup cable attachments, right hand holding left stirrup, left hand holding right stirrup.
CBSeatedRearLateralRaise.execution: Pull stirrups out to sides until elbows are shoulder height. Maintain upper arms perpendicular to torso and fixed elbow position (10° to 30° angle) throughout exercise. Lower until arms contact sides of legs. Repeat.
CBSeatedRearLateralRaise.comments: Upper arm should travel in perpendicular path to torso to minimize

CBStandingCrossRow.name: Cable Standing Cross Row
CBStandingCrossRow.preparation: Stand between two shoulder-high cable pulleys (adjustable cross-over machine). Grasp right stirrup with left hand and left stirrup with right hand. Step back until cables are angled back 30° to 45°. Position both elbows at height of shoulders, one over other.
CBStandingCrossRow.execution: Pull both cable attachments by moving elbows back to sides. Keep upper arms horizontal, perpendicular to trunk. Return and repeat.
CBStandingCrossRow.comments: becomes involved if elbows drop below shoulders.

CBStandingRearDeltRowRope.name: Cable Standing Rear Delt Row (with rope)
CBStandingRearDeltRowRope.preparation: Stand facing rope attachment on high pulley cable. Grasp each end of rope just above enlarged ends. Step back with one foot so arms and shoulders are positioned straight forward with cable taut. Point elbows outward.
CBStandingRearDeltRowRope.execution: Pull rope to upper chest or neck, keeping elbows at shoulder height until elbows travel slightly behind back. Keep upper arms perpendicular to trunk. Return until arms are extended forward. Repeat.

CBStandingRearDeltRowStirrups.name: Cable Standing Rear Delt Row (stirrups)
CBStandingRearDeltRowStirrups.preparation: Stand facing twin pulley cables positioned shoulder height. Grasp stirrup cable attachment in each hand. Step back with one foot so arms and shoulders are positioned straight forward with cable taut. Point elbows outward.
CBStandingRearDeltRowStirrups.execution: Pull stirrups out to sides, keeping elbows at shoulder height until elbows travel slightly behind back. Allow wrists to follow elbows. Keep upper arms horizontal, perpendicular to trunk. Return until arms are extended and shoulders are stretched forward. Repeat.

CBStandingReverseFly.name: Cable Reverse Fly
CBStandingReverseFly.preparation: Stand facing twin pulley cables positioned close together and approximately shoulder height. Grasp stirrup cable attachment in each hand. Step back away from machine so cable is taut. Stand with feet staggered. Point elbows outward with arms straight or slightly bent.
CBStandingReverseFly.execution: Pull stirrups out to sides, maintaining stiff elbow position throughout exercise. Return to original position and repeat.
CBStandingReverseFly.comments: Upper arms should travel in horizontal path at shoulder height (not downward) to minimize

CBSupineRearLateralRaise.name: Cable Supine Reverse Fly
CBSupineRearLateralRaise.preparation: With bench between two high pulleys to each side, grasp left stirrup with right hand and right stirrup with left hand. Lie on bench with pulleys to each side of shoulders. Arms should be crossed above upper chest with elbows slightly bent.
CBSupineRearLateralRaise.execution: Pull upper arms down to sides until elbows are shoulder height. Maintain upper arms perpendicular to torso and fixed elbow position (just slightly bent) as arms are pulled down to sides. Return arms to original position and repeat.
CBSupineRearLateralRaise.comments: Upper arm should travel perpendicular to torso to minimize

DBInclineRearDeltRow.name: Dumbbell Incline Rear Delt Row
DBInclineRearDeltRow.preparation: Lie chest down on elevated bench. Grasp dumbbells below.
DBInclineRearDeltRow.execution: Keeping upper arm perpendicular to torso and dumbbells just below elbows, pull dumbbells up until elbows are just above shoulders. Return and repeat.
DBInclineRearDeltRow.comments: If upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunk,

DBLyingRearDeltRaise.name: Dumbbell Side Lying Rear Delt Raise
DBLyingRearDeltRaise.preparation: Lie on side with legs separated for support. Grasp dumbbell in front of chest, palm facing down, arm extended forward with slight bend.
DBLyingRearDeltRaise.execution: Raise dumbbell from floor until it travels above shoulder. Return dumbbell to floor at original position. Repeat.
DBLyingRearDeltRaise.comments: Maintain fixed elbow position straight or slightly bent and keep upper arm perpendicular to trunk throughout exercise.

DBLyingRearDeltRow.name: Dumbbell Lying Rear Delt Row
DBLyingRearDeltRow.preparation: Lie chest down on elevated bench. Grasp dumbbells below.
DBLyingRearDeltRow.execution: Keeping upper arm perpendicular to torso and dumbbells just below elbows, pull dumbbells up until elbows are just above shoulders. Return and repeat.
DBLyingRearDeltRow.comments: If upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunk,

DBLyingRearLateralRaise.name: Dumbbell Lying Rear Lateral Raise
DBLyingRearLateralRaise.preparation: Lie chest down on elevated bench. Grasp dumbbells below to each side.
DBLyingRearLateralRaise.execution: Raise upper arms to sides until elbows are shoulder height. Maintain upper arms perpendicular to torso and fixed elbow position (10° to 30° angle) throughout exercise. Maintain height of elbows above wrists by raising "pinkie" side up. Lower and repeat.

DBOneArmRearLateralRaise.name: Dumbbell Lying One Arm Rear Lateral Raise
DBOneArmRearLateralRaise.preparation: With dumbbell in one hand, lie chest down on elevated bench. Position palm forward (thumb up) with elbow straight or slightly bent.
DBOneArmRearLateralRaise.execution: Raise upper arm to side until elbow is shoulder height. Maintain upper arms perpendicular to torso with elbow straight throughout exercise. Maintain palm forward position. Lower and repeat.
DBOneArmRearLateralRaise.comments: Bench should be horizontal and be high enough to prevent dumbbell from touching floor. Upper arm should travel in perpendicular path to torso to minimize latissimus dorsi involvement. Bench should be high enough to prevent dumbbells from hitting floor and close to horizontal. Lying at 45° is not sufficient angle to target rear deltoids. This exercise AKA "prone full can" has been suggested to exercise supraspinatus muscle in rehabilitation settings (Blackburn TA, et al. 1990; Reinold MM, et al. 2007). See exercise performed on

DBRearDeltRow.name: Dumbbell Rear Delt Row
DBRearDeltRow.preparation: Kneel over side of bench with arm and leg to side. Grasp dumbbell.
DBRearDeltRow.execution: Pull dumbbell up out to side with upper arm perpendicular to trunk until upper arm is just beyond horizontal. Lower and repeat.
DBRearDeltRow.comments: If upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunk,

DBRearLateralRaise.name: Dumbbell Rear Lateral Raise
DBRearLateralRaise.preparation: Grasp dumbbells to each side. Bend knees and bend over through hips with back flat, close to horizontal. Position elbows with slight bend and palms facing together.
DBRearLateralRaise.execution: Raise upper arms to sides until elbows are shoulder height. Maintain upper arms perpendicular to torso and fixed elbow position (10° to 30° angle) throughout exercise. Maintain height of elbows above wrists by raising "pinkie finger" side up. Lower and repeat.

LVInclineRearDeltRowPL.name: Lever Incline Rear Delt Row (plate loaded)
LVInclineRearDeltRowPL.preparation: Lie chest low on inclined platform and grasp forward lever handles with wide overhand grip.
LVInclineRearDeltRowPL.execution: Pull lever with elbows forward  out to sides until upper arms are just beyond parallel, keeping upper arm perpendicular to torso. Return and repeat.
LVInclineRearDeltRowPL.comments: If upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunk,

DBSeatedRearLateralRaise.name: Dumbbell Seated Rear Lateral Raise
