DBSeatedRearLateralRaise.preparation: Sit on edge of bench with feet placed beyond knees. Bend over and rest torso on thighs. Grasp dumbbells with each hand under legs. Position elbows with slight bend with palms facing together behind ankles (as shown) or just to sides of ankles.
DBSeatedRearLateralRaise.execution: Raise upper arms to sides until elbows are shoulder height. Maintain upper arms perpendicular to torso and fixed elbow position (10° to 30° angle) throughout exercise. Maintain elbows height above wrists by raising "pinkie finger" side up. Lower and repeat.

LVLyingRearLateralRaise.name: Lever Lying Rear Lateral Raise
LVLyingRearLateralRaise.preparation: Lie on machine with chest against padding. Position arms between padded lever arms with elbows below shoulders.
LVLyingRearLateralRaise.execution: Pull arms up until elbows are beyond back. Lower and repeat.
LVLyingRearLateralRaise.comments: Upper arm should travel in perpendicular path to torso. At lower portion of exercise, keep elbows pointed outward below shoulders. At upper portion of exercise, keep elbows pointed outward to sides of shoulders. Legs may be kept together, extending off end, or bent straddling bench as demonstrated.

LVRearDeltFlyGriplessPecDeck.name: Lever Seated Reverse Fly (on pec deck)
LVRearDeltFlyGriplessPecDeck.preparation: Sit on machine with chest against vertical pad. Position arms against padded lever arms at height of shoulders.
LVRearDeltFlyGriplessPecDeck.execution: Pull arms back until elbows are beyond back. Return and repeat.
LVRearDeltFlyGriplessPecDeck.comments: Can be performed on certain pec deck machines as shown if their range of motion and design are adequate, although

LVLyingRearLateralRaiseH.name: Lever Lying Rear Lateral Raise (plate loaded)
LVLyingRearLateralRaiseH.preparation: Lie on machine with chest against padding. Position arms between padded lever arms with elbows below shoulders.
LVLyingRearLateralRaiseH.execution: Pull arms up until elbows are beyond back. Return and repeat.
LVLyingRearLateralRaiseH.comments: Upper arm should travel in perpendicular path to torso. At lower portion of exercise, keep elbows pointed outward below shoulders. At upper portion of exercise, keep elbows pointed outward to sides of shoulders. Legs may be kept together, extending off end (as shown), or bent straddling.

LVRearDeltRaise.name: Lever Rear Delt Raise (plate loaded)
LVRearDeltRaise.preparation: Stand between lever handles facing away from machine. Squat down and grasp lever handles to each side. Stand up with arms straight to sides.
LVRearDeltRaise.execution: Pull lever up as far as possible allowing elbows to travel up behind body to each side. Lower until arms are straight and repeat.

LVRearDeltRow.name: Lever Seated Rear Delt Row
LVRearDeltRow.preparation: Place seat at low position. Sit on seat with chest against pad and grasp upper handles.
LVRearDeltRow.execution: Pull lever with elbows up out to sides until upper arms are just beyond parallel, keeping upper arm horizontal, perpendicular to torso. Return and repeat.
LVRearDeltRow.comments: If upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunk,

LVRearDeltRowC.name: Lever Seated Rear Delt Row (plate loaded)
LVRearDeltRowC.preparation: Place seat at low position. Sit on seat with chest against pad and grasp upper handles.
LVRearDeltRowC.execution: Pull lever with elbows up out to sides until upper arms are just beyond parallel, keeping upper arm horizontal, perpendicular to torso. Return and repeat.
LVRearDeltRowC.comments: If upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunk,

LVRearLateralRaise.name: Lever Seated Reverse Fly (parallel grip)
LVRearLateralRaise.preparation: Sit on machine with chest against pad. Grasp parallel handles with thumbs up at shoulder height. Slightly bend elbows and internally rotate shoulders so elbows are also at height of shoulders.
LVRearLateralRaise.execution: Keeping elbows pointed high, pull handles apart and to rear until elbows are just behind back. Return and repeat.
LVRearLateralRaise.comments: Keep elbows raised at same height of shoulders to minimize

LVRearDeltRowHammer.name: Lever Seated Rear Delt Row (plate loaded)
LVRearDeltRowHammer.preparation: Place seat at low position. Sit on seat with chest against pad and grasp upper handles.
LVRearDeltRowHammer.execution: Pull lever with elbows up out to sides until upper arms are just beyond parallel, keeping upper arm horizontal, perpendicular to torso. Return and repeat.
LVRearDeltRowHammer.comments: If upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunk,

LVRearLateralRaiseOnExtArmLatRsMch.name: Lever Rear Lateral Raise (on extended arm kneeling lateral raise machine)
LVRearLateralRaiseOnExtArmLatRsMch.preparation: Stand on platform facing lateral raise machine. Bend knees and bend over at hips with back flat close to horizontal. With arms straight or slightly bent, grasp lever handles with each hand.
LVRearLateralRaiseOnExtArmLatRsMch.execution: Maintaining torso position, raise handles to sides until upper arm is shoulder height. Lower and repeat.
LVRearLateralRaiseOnExtArmLatRsMch.comments: Platform height should allow pivot point of shoulders to be aligned with lever fulcrum. Upper arm should travel in perpendicular path to torso to minimize relatively powerful

LVRearLateralRaiseOnLatRsMch.name: Lever Rear Lateral Raise (on lateral raise machine)
LVRearLateralRaiseOnLatRsMch.preparation: Stand on platform facing lateral raise machine. Bend knees and bend over at hips with back flat close to horizontal. With elbows bent under shoulders, position back of upper arms against arm pads.
LVRearLateralRaiseOnLatRsMch.execution: Maintaining torso position, raise upper arms to sides until elbows are shoulder height. Lower and repeat.
LVRearLateralRaiseOnLatRsMch.comments: Platform height should allow pivot point of shoulders to be aligned with lever fulcrum. Upper arm should travel in perpendicular path to torso. At lower portion of exercise, keep elbows pointed outward below shoulders. At upper portion of exercise, keep elbows pointed outward to sides of shoulders. Knees are bent in effort to keep low back straight (See

LVReverseFlyOverhand.name: Lever Seated Reverse Fly (overhand grip)
LVReverseFlyOverhand.preparation: Sit on machine with chest against pad. Grasp horizontal handles with overhand grip at shoulder height. Internally rotate shoulders so elbows are also at height of shoulders.
LVReverseFlyOverhand.execution: Keeping elbows pointed high, pull handles apart and to rear until elbows are just behind back Return and repeat.
LVReverseFlyOverhand.comments: Keep elbows raised at same height of shoulders to minimize

LVReverseFlyPronated.name: Lever Seated Reverse Fly (pronated parallel grip)
LVReverseFlyPronated.preparation: Sit in machine with chest against pad. Grasp parallel handles from inside with thumbs down at shoulder height.
LVReverseFlyPronated.execution: Keeping elbows pointed high, pull handles apart and to rear until elbows are just behind back. Return and repeat.
LVReverseFlyPronated.comments: Pronated grip will internally rotate shoulders so elbows are kept at height of shoulders. Preventing elbows from dropping below shoulders will minimize

LVSeatedRearDeltFly.name: Lever Seated Reverse Fly (gripless)
LVSeatedRearDeltFly.preparation: Sit on machine with back against vertical pad and roller pads in front of body. Place feet forward on foot bars. Cross both arms in front of body situated between roller pads. Position arms one on top of another, shoulder height.
LVSeatedRearDeltFly.execution: Pull arms apart and back until elbows are slightly beyond back. Return to starting position and repeat.
LVSeatedRearDeltFly.comments: To maintain hips and back against pad during lift, legs must push into foot bar while keeping spine ridged. If apparatus is unavailable, a similar movement can be performed on certain

LVSeatedRearLateralRaise.name: Lever Seated Rear Lateral Raise (plate loaded)
LVSeatedRearLateralRaise.preparation: Sit on seat with feet placed on platform ahead of knees. Rest torso on thighs. Reach under legs and grasp lever handles on each side.
LVSeatedRearLateralRaise.execution: Pull lever handles out to sides until elbows are shoulder height. Maintain upper arms perpendicular to torso and fixed elbow position (10° to 30° angle) throughout exercise. Lower and repeat.
LVSeatedRearLateralRaise.comments: Upper arm should travel in perpendicular path to torso to minimize

SMRearDeltRow.name: Smith Rear Delt Row
SMRearDeltRow.preparation: Stand near low smith bar. Bend knees and bend over bar with back straight. Grasp bar with wide   overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
SMRearDeltRow.execution: Keeping upper arm perpendicular to torso, pull bar up toward upper chest until upper arms are just beyond parallel to floor. Return and repeat.
SMRearDeltRow.comments: If upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunk,

LVTBarRearDeltRow.name: Lever T-Bar Rear Delt Row (plate loaded)
LVTBarRearDeltRow.preparation: Straddle lever bar facing handles. Bend knees slightly and bend over handles with back straight. Grasp wide grip handles with overhand grip. With arms extended, position torso just high enough to allow weight to make contact with floor.
LVTBarRearDeltRow.execution: With elbows out to sides, pull bar up toward upper chest until elbows are same height as shoulders or just beyond, keeping upper arm perpendicular to torso. Return and repeat.
LVTBarRearDeltRow.comments: If upper arm travels closer than perpendicular to trunk,

STRearDeltRow.name: Suspended Rear Delt Row
STRearDeltRow.preparation: Grasp suspension handles and momentarily step back until arms are extended forward and straight. While keeping arms straight and shoulders back, step forward so body reclines back behind suspension handles.
STRearDeltRow.execution: Position body and legs straight at desired angle hanging from handles with arms straight. Internally rotate shoulders so elbows are positioned directly outwards.
STRearDeltRow.comments: Pull body up while keeping elbows pointed directly out to each side and body and legs straight. Pull until elbows are directly lateral to each side without allowing elbows to drop. Return until arms are extended straight and shoulders are stretched forward, maintaining high elbow position. Repeat.

STReverseFly.name: Suspended Reverse Fly
STReverseFly.preparation: Grasp suspension handles and momentarily step back until arms are extended forward and straight. While keeping arms straight and shoulders back, step forward so body reclines back behind suspension handles. Position body and legs straight at desired angle hanging from handles with arms straight. Internally rotate shoulders so elbows are positioned directly outwards with arms straight or slightly bent. Shoulder should be positioned approximately 90° relative to torso position.
STReverseFly.execution: Pull handles out to sides while keeping stiff elbow position and maintaining shoulder at 90° plane to torso throughout exercise. Raise up until upper arms are in-line to one another. Return to original position in same plane and repeat.
STReverseFly.comments: Upper arms should travel in transverse path at shoulder level without allowing elbows to drop to minimize

BB45BackExtension.name: Barbell 45° Back Extension (on hyperextension apparatus)
BB45BackExtension.preparation: Position thighs prone on padding. Hook heels on platform lip or under padded brace. Place barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides.
BB45BackExtension.execution: Lower body by bending waist until fully flexed. Raise, or extend waist until torso is parallel to legs. Repeat.
BB45BackExtension.comments: Position pad high enough to evenly distribute body weight on thigh but not so high that range of motion is limited; abdomen should not press on top side of pad when upper body is lowered. Begin with body weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

BB45Hyperextension.name: Barbell 45° Hyperextension
BB45Hyperextension.preparation: Position thighs prone on padding. Hook heels on platform lip or under padded brace. Place barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides.
BB45Hyperextension.execution: Raise upper body until hips and waist are fully extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is approximately perpendicular to legs. Repeat.
BB45Hyperextension.comments: Position pad high enough to evenly distribute body weight on thigh but not so high that range of motion is limited; abdomen should not press on top side of pad when upper body is lowered. Begin with body weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

BBBackExtension.name: Barbell Back Extension (on hyperextension apparatus)
BBBackExtension.preparation: Position thighs prone on large pad and lower legs under padded bar. Place barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides.
BBBackExtension.execution: Lower body by bending waist until fully flexed. Raise or extend waist until torso is parallel to legs. Repeat.
BBBackExtension.comments: Adjust lower leg brace so pressure is evenly distributed on thigh pad. Begin with body weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

BBDeadlift.name: Barbell Deadlift
BBDeadlift.preparation: With feet flat beneath bar, squat down and grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip.
BBDeadlift.execution: Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return and repeat.

BBBentKneeGoodMorning.name: Barbell Bent Knee Good-morning
BBBentKneeGoodMorning.preparation: Position barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides.
BBBentKneeGoodMorning.execution: Bend hips to lower torso forward until parallel to floor. Bend knees slightly during descent. Raise torso until hips are extended. Repeat.

BBBlockPull.name: Barbell Block Pull
BBBlockPull.preparation: With barbell on blocks, position feet shoulder width or slightly narrower beneath bar. Squat down and grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip.
BBBlockPull.execution: Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return and repeat.
BBBlockPull.comments: Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. Grip strength and strength endurance often limit ability to perform multiple reps at heavy resistances. Gym chalk, wrist straps, grip work, and mixed grip can be used to enhance grip. Mixed grip indicates one hand holding with overhand grip and other hand holding with underhand grip.

BBDeficitDeadlift.name: Barbell Deficit Deadlift
BBDeficitDeadlift.preparation: Stand on weight plate, bumper plate, or shallow elevated platform with loaded bar above feet. Squat down and grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip.
BBDeficitDeadlift.execution: Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return weights to floor by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Repeat.
BBDeficitDeadlift.comments: Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. Grip strength and strength endurance often limit ability to perform multiple reps at heavy resistances. Gym chalk, wrist straps, grip work, and mixed grip can be used to enhance grip. Mixed grip indicates one hand holding with overhand grip and other hand holding with underhand grip.

BBRackPull.name: Barbell Rack Pull
BBRackPull.preparation: In power rack, with barbell on safety bar in low position, place feet shoulder width or slightly narrower beneath bar. Squat down and grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip.
BBRackPull.execution: Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return and repeat.
BBRackPull.comments: Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. Grip strength and strength endurance often limit ability to perform multiple reps at heavy resistances. Gym chalk, wrist straps, grip work, and mixed grip can be used to enhance grip. Mixed grip indicates one hand holding with overhand grip and other hand holding with underhand grip. Barbell Rack Pull emphasizes mid portion of

BBStiffLegDeadlift.name: Barbell Stiff Leg Deadlift
BBStiffLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance on shallow platform with feet flat beneath bar. Bend knees and bend over with lower back straight. Grasp barbell with shoulder width overhand or mixed grip, shoulder width or slightly wider. Lift weight to standing position.
BBStiffLegDeadlift.execution: Lower bar to top of feet by bending hips. Bend knees slightly during descent and keep waist straight, flexing only slightly at bottom. With knees bent, lift bar by extending at hips until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Extend knees at top if desired. Repeat.
BBStiffLegDeadlift.comments: Lower back may bend slightly during full hip flexion. Erector Spinae is exercised isometrically if low back does articulate as with

BBHyperextension.name: Barbell Hyperextension
BBHyperextension.preparation: Position thighs prone on large pad and lower legs under padded brace. Place barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides.
BBHyperextension.execution: Raise upper body until hips and waist are fully extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is vertical. Repeat.
BBHyperextension.comments: Adjust lower leg brace so pressure is evenly distributed on thigh pad. Begin with body weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

BBStraightLegDeadlift.name: Barbell Straight Leg Deadlift
BBStraightLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance on shallow platform with feet flat beneath bar. Bend knees and bend over with lower back straight. Grasp barbell with shoulder width overhand or mixed grip, shoulder width or slightly wider. Lift weight to standing position.
BBStraightLegDeadlift.execution: With knees straight, lower bar toward top of feet by bending hips and waist. Lift bar by extending waist and hip until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
BBStraightLegDeadlift.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

BBSumoBlockPull.name: Barbell Sumo Block Pull
BBSumoBlockPull.preparation: With barbell on blocks, position feet under bar with very wide stance. Squat down and grasp bar between legs with shoulder width mixed grip. Face forward while positioning shoulders upward with arms straight, chest high, hips low, and back straight.
BBSumoBlockPull.execution: Pull bar up by driving feet outward while pulling chest up. Extend knees when bar passes knees. At top of lift, when torso is upright, drive shoulders back and chest up. Return weight to blocks by bending hips back and knees pointed outward, while keeping chest high and back straight. Repeat.
BBSumoBlockPull.comments: Use shoulder width grip since narrower than shoulder width grip will make it more difficult to lockout at top. Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight, and knees pointed out same direction as feet. Also, keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. With wide stance, push feet out to sides and not down to prevent knees from buckling inward. Pushing knees out will allow hips to travel toward bar more quickly while improving leverage. Barbell Sumo Block Pull emphasizes mid portion of

BBSumoDeadlift.name: Barbell Sumo Deadlift
BBSumoDeadlift.preparation: Position feet under bar with very wide stance. Squat down and grasp bar between legs with shoulder width mixed grip. Face forward while positioning shoulders upward with arms straight, chest high, hips low, and back straight.
BBSumoDeadlift.execution: Pull bar up by driving feet outward while pulling chest up. Extend knees when bar passes knees. At top of lift, when torso is upright, drive shoulders back and chest up. Return weight to floor by bending hips back and knees pointed outward, while keeping chest high and back straight. Repeat.

BW45HyperextensionArmsCrossed.name: 45° Hyperextension (arms crossed)
BW45HyperextensionArmsCrossed.preparation: Position thighs prone on padding. Hook heels on platform lip or under padded brace. Cross arms across chest.
BW45HyperextensionArmsCrossed.execution: Raise upper body until hips and waist are fully extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is approximately perpendicular to legs. Repeat.
BW45HyperextensionArmsCrossed.comments: Position pad high enough to evenly distribute body weight on thigh but not so high that range of motion is limited; abdomen should not press on top side of pad when upper body is lowered. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back. Full range of motion will vary from person to person.

BW45HyperextensionArmsUp.name: 45° Hyperextension (arms up)
BW45HyperextensionArmsUp.preparation: Place arms parallel extending upward to sides of head.
BW45HyperextensionArmsUp.execution: Raise upper body until hips and waist are extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is approximately perpendicular to legs. Repeat.
BW45HyperextensionArmsUp.comments: Position pad high enough to evenly distribute body weight on thigh but not so high that range of motion is limited; abdomen should not press on top side of pad when upper body is lowered. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back. Full range of motion will vary from person to person.

BW45HyperextensionNeck.name: 45° Hyperextension (hands behind neck)
BW45HyperextensionNeck.execution: Raise upper body until hips and waist are extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is approximately perpendicular to legs. Repeat.
BW45HyperextensionNeck.comments: Adjust lower leg brace so pressure is evenly distributed on thigh pad and full range of motion is permitted; abdomen should not press on side of pad when upper body is lowered. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back. Full range of motion will vary from person to person.

BW45HyperextensionHips.name: 45° Hyperextension (hands behind hips)
BW45HyperextensionHips.preparation: Raise upper body until hips and waist are extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is approximately perpendicular to legs. Repeat.
BW45HyperextensionHips.execution: Position pad high enough to evenly distribute body weight on thigh but not so high that range of motion is limited; abdomen should not press on top side of pad when upper body is lowered. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back. Full range of motion will vary from person to person.
BW45HyperextensionHips.comments: Begin with arms in low position and gradually position arms in higher position to allow lower back adequate

BWAlternatingBirdDog.name: Alternating Bird Dog
BWAlternatingBirdDog.execution: Kneel on mat on all fours with legs and hands slightly apart.

BWAlternatingBirdDogExBall.name: Alternating Bird Dog (on exercise ball)
BWAlternatingBirdDogExBall.preparation: Lay on top of exercise ball with legs and hands slightly apart. Place chest down so torso is wrapped over ball.
BWAlternatingBirdDogExBall.execution: Raise left arm and torso upward beside head while raising right leg up behind body. Lower arm, torso, and leg to original position and repeat. Repeat by raising and lowering right arm and left leg in same manner. Repeat by alternating between opposite sides.
BWAlternatingBirdDogExBall.comments: Lift leg and arm deliberately with no jerking. Also see

BWBirdDog.name: Bird Dog
BWBirdDog.execution: Kneel on mat on all fours with legs and hands slightly apart.

BWBirdDogExBall.name: Bird Dog (on stability ball)
BWBirdDogExBall.preparation: Lay on top of exercise ball with legs and hands slightly apart. Place chest down so torso is wrapped over ball.
BWBirdDogExBall.execution: Raise arm and torso upward beside head while raising leg on opposite side up out behind body. Lower arm, torso, and leg to original position and repeat. Perform movement with opposite arm and leg.
BWBirdDogExBall.comments: Lift leg and arm deliberately with no jerking. Also see

BWHangingHyperextension.name: Hanging Hyperextension
BWHangingHyperextension.preparation: Stand behind bar facing elevated platform positioned slightly away on other side of bar. Grasp bar with slightly wider than shoulder width grip. Walk body under bar and position back of heels on elevated platform. With legs extended forward, hang under bar with arms straight and hips bent just above floor.
BWHangingHyperextension.execution: Raise hips up as high as possible by extending hips and spine. Lower hips to original position just above floor. Repeat.
BWHangingHyperextension.comments: Platform should be high enough to allow hips to flex without buttocks contacting floor. Full range of motion will vary from person to person. Adductor Magnus may only assist at initial phase hip extension depending on degree of hip flexion at bottom of movement. Also see

BWHyperextensionBall.name: Back Extension (on stability ball, arms down)
BWHyperextensionBall.preparation: Lie prone on ball with feet against base of wall. Place arms to sides or clasp hands behind hips or low back.
BWHyperextensionBall.execution: Raise torso off of ball by hyperextending spine. Lower torso onto ball allowing spine to flex. Repeat.
BWHyperextensionBall.comments: If no wall is available, hips can be positioned lower on ball and toes can be positioned out wide on floor for balance. Synergists only work partial range of motion through terminal extension.

BWHyperextensionBallArmsUp.name: Back Extension (on stability ball, arms up)
BWHyperextensionBallArmsUp.preparation: Lie prone on ball with feet against base of wall. Place arms parallel out over floor beyond head.
BWHyperextensionBallArmsUp.execution: Raise torso off of ball and hands over head by hyperextending spine. Lower torso onto ball allowing spine to flex with arms being lowered toward floor. Repeat.
BWHyperextensionBallArmsUp.comments: If no wall is available, hips can be positioned lower on ball and toes can be positioned out wide on floor for balance. Synergists only work partial range of motion through terminal extension.

BWHyperextensionBallArmsCrossed.name: Back Extension (on stability ball, arms crossed)
BWHyperextensionBallArmsCrossed.preparation: Lie prone on ball, with front of feet apart on floor or with feet against base of wall. Cross arms, hands in front of shoulders.
BWHyperextensionBallArmsCrossed.execution: Raise torso off of ball by hyperextending spine. Lower torso onto ball allowing spine to flex. Repeat.
BWHyperextensionBallArmsCrossed.comments: If no wall is available, hips can be positioned lower on ball and toes can be positioned out wide on floor for balance.

BWHyperextensionHead.name: Hyperextension (hands on head)
BWHyperextensionHead.preparation: Position thighs prone on large pad and lower legs under padded brace. Place hands behind neck or to sides of head.
BWHyperextensionHead.execution: Raise upper body until hips and waist are extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is vertical. Repeat.
BWHyperextensionHead.comments: Adjust lower leg brace so pressure is evenly distributed on thigh pad and full range of motion is permitted; abdomen should not press on side of pad when upper body is lowered. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back. Full range of motion will vary from person to person.

BWHyperextensionHips.name: Hyperextension (hands behind hips)
BWHyperextensionHips.preparation: Position thighs prone on large pad and lower legs under padded brace. Clasp hands behind hips or low back.
BWHyperextensionHips.execution: Raise upper body until hips and waist are extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is vertical. Repeat.
BWHyperextensionHips.comments: Adjust lower leg brace so pressure is evenly distributed on thigh pad and full range of motion is permitted; abdomen should not press on side of pad when upper body is lowered. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back. Full range of motion will vary from person to person.

BWHyperextensionX.name: Hyperextension (arms crossed)
BWHyperextensionX.preparation: Position thighs prone on large pad and lower legs under padded brace. Cross arms on chest.
BWHyperextensionX.execution: Raise upper body until hips and waist are extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is vertical. Repeat.
BWHyperextensionX.comments: Adjust lower leg brace so pressure is evenly distributed on thigh pad and full range of motion is permitted; abdomen should not press on side of pad when upper body is lowered. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings and low back. Full range of motion will vary from person to person.

BackPlank.name: Rear Bridge
BackPlank.preparation: Sit on mat or floor with legs bent and feet on floor or mat. Place hands back to sides on floor or mat so torso is reclined back slightly.
BackPlank.execution: Raise hips up off floor until hips are straight. Hold position.

CBStiffLegDeadlift.name: Cable Stiff Leg Deadlift
CBStiffLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand between two very low pulleys with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp stirrup attachments to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
CBStiffLegDeadlift.execution: Bow forward by bending hips. Bend knees slightly during descent and keep waist straight, flexing low back at bottom. With knees slightly bent, raise torso by extending at waist, then hips, gradually extending knees until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
CBStiffLegDeadlift.comments: Lower back may bend slightly during hip flexion phase. Erector Spinae is exercised isometrically if low back does articulate as with

CBStraightLegDeadlift.name: Cable Straight Leg Deadlift
CBStraightLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand between two very low pulleys with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp stirrup attachments to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
CBStraightLegDeadlift.execution: With knees straight, bow forward by bending hips. Bend waist as stirrups approach lowest position. Lift dumbbells by extending hips and waist until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
CBStraightLegDeadlift.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

ContraLateralSuperman.name: Contralateral Superman
ContraLateralSuperman.preparation: Lie prone on mat with legs together and arms extended out on floor approximately parallel.
ContraLateralSuperman.execution: Raise left arm and shoulder and right leg up off floor. Lower arm and shoulder and leg to floor. Repeat by raising and lowering right arm and shoulder and left leg. Repeat by alternating between opposite sides.
ContraLateralSuperman.comments: Lift legs and arms deliberately with no jerking. Also see bilateral movement:

DBOneArmStraightLegDeadlift.name: Dumbbell One Arm Straight Leg Deadlift
DBOneArmStraightLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or wide stance. Grasp dumbbell to side. Place opposite hand to side or behind low back.
DBOneArmStraightLegDeadlift.execution: With knees straight, lower dumbbell between feet by bending hips and twisting waist, so shoulder of weighted side is turned forward. Allow hips to fall back and waist to bend as dumbbell approaches floor. Lift dumbbell upward and back to side by extending hips and waist until standing upright. Pull shoulder back if rounded. Repeat. Perform exercise with opposite arm.
DBOneArmStraightLegDeadlift.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

DBStraightLegDeadlift.name: Dumbbell Straight Leg Deadlift
DBStraightLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance. Grasp dumbbells to sides.
DBStraightLegDeadlift.execution: With knees straight, lower dumbbells to top or sides of feet by bending hips. Allow hips to fall back and bend waist as dumbbell approaches feet. Lift dumbbells by extending hips and waist until standing upright. Pull shoulders back if rounded. Repeat.
DBStraightLegDeadlift.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

LVBackExtension.name: Lever Back Extension
LVBackExtension.preparation: Sit in machine with feet on platform, back under padded lever, and hips against back of seat.
LVBackExtension.execution: Extend lower hips and low back until extended. Return and repeat.

LVBackExtensionMedEx.name: Lever Back Extension
LVBackExtensionMedEx.preparation: Sit on seat and secure seat belt. Place feet on foot platform with knees bent approximately 135°. Position leg braces securely on legs. Release lever and grasp handles to each side. Lean completely forward and position back pad against back.
LVBackExtensionMedEx.execution: Extend spine until hyperextended. Return and repeat.
LVBackExtensionMedEx.comments: Exercise is performed on MedEx isolated lumbar spine apparatus. See

LVBackExtensionN.name: Lever Back Extension
LVBackExtensionN.preparation: Sit on machine with back against padded lever. Push hips back against back of seat by pushing feet against platform. Arch back in "C" shape.
LVBackExtensionN.execution: Extend spine until hyperextended. Return and repeat.
LVBackExtensionN.comments: To avoid hip movement, push hips back into seat by pushing feet into platform throughout exercise. Position foot platform, so small space remains between edge of seat and back of lower thigh. Use seat belt if it becomes difficult to stabilize hips. See

LVDeadlift.name: Lever Deadlift (plate loaded)
LVDeadlift.preparation: Stand in between lever handles. Squat down with feet flat and grasp handles to sides.
LVDeadlift.execution: Lift lever by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return and repeat.

LVKneelingBackExtension.name: Lever Kneeling Back Extension
LVKneelingBackExtension.preparation: Slide back under lever pad and kneel on lower pad. Grasp handles and position feet on foot bars. Make sure knees are against knee pad and hips are against upper thigh pad.
LVKneelingBackExtension.execution: Extend spine until hyperextended. Return and repeat.
LVKneelingBackExtension.comments: Apparatus shown does not allow for full spinal flexion, only allowing for last half of spinal extension.

LVPullBackExtension.name: Lever Pull Back Extension
LVPullBackExtension.preparation: Sit on machine positioning back of hips against back pad and feet against foot bar with knees bent slightly. Push hips back against back of seat by pushing feet against foot bar. Reach forward and grasp handles with both hands.
LVPullBackExtension.execution: Pull lever back until spine hyperextends while keeping hips pushed back against pad. Return and repeat.
LVPullBackExtension.comments: To avoid hip movement, push hips back into seat by pushing feet into foot bar throughout exercise. Apparatus should be adjusted so knees remain slightly bent when hips are pushed back. See

LVStiffLegDeadlift.name: Lever Stiff Leg Deadlift (plate loaded)
LVStiffLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand between lever handles with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp handles to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
LVStiffLegDeadlift.execution: Bow forward by bending hips. Bend knees slightly during descent and keep waist straight, flexing low back at bottom. With knees slightly bent, raise torso by extending at waist, then hips, gradually extending knees until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
LVStiffLegDeadlift.comments: Lower back may bend slightly during hip flexion phase. Erector Spinae is exercised isometrically if low back does articulate as with

LVStraightLegDeadlift.name: Lever Straight Leg Deadlift (plate loaded)
LVStraightLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand between lever handles with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp handles to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
LVStraightLegDeadlift.execution: With knees straight, bow forward by bending hips. Bend waist as stirrups approach lowest position. Lift lever by extending hips and waist until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
LVStraightLegDeadlift.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

RearDeclinePlank.name: Decline Rear Bridge
RearDeclinePlank.preparation: Lie supine on mat with arms to sides. Place feet flat on floor or mat with knees bent.
RearDeclinePlank.execution: Raise hips up off floor until hips are straight. Hold position.

RearInclinePlank.name: Incline Rear Bridge
RearInclinePlank.preparation: Sit on mat with legs straight and placed together. Place hands back to sides on floor or mat so torso is reclined back slightly.
RearInclinePlank.execution: Raise hips up off floor until hips are straight. Hold position.

SMBentKneeGoodMorning.name: Smith Bent Knee Good-morning
SMBentKneeGoodMorning.preparation: Position bar on back of shoulders. Grasp bar to sides. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
SMBentKneeGoodMorning.execution: Bend hips to lower torso forward until parallel to floor. Bend knees slightly during descent. Raise torso until hips are extended. Repeat.

SMDeadlift.name: Smith Deadlift
SMDeadlift.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance with feet flat beneath bar. Grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider mixed grip or slightly wider. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
SMDeadlift.execution: Squat down to lower bar by bending hips and knees. Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return and repeat.
SMDeadlift.comments: Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. See

SMStiffLegDeadlift.name: Smith Stiff Leg Deadlift
SMStiffLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance on elevated platform with thigh against bar. Grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
SMStiffLegDeadlift.execution: With knees slightly bent, Lower bar toward top of feet by bending hips. Keep waist straight, flexing only slightly at bottom. Lift bar by extending at hips until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Extend knees at top if desired. Repeat.
SMStiffLegDeadlift.comments: Lower back may bend slightly during full hip flexion. Erector Spinae is exercised

SMStraightLegDeadlift.name: Smith Straight Leg Deadlift
SMStraightLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance on elevated platform with thigh against bar. Grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
SMStraightLegDeadlift.execution: With knees straight, lower bar toward top of feet by bending hips. After hips can no longer flex, bend waist as bar approaches top of feet. Lift bar by extending waist and hip until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
SMStraightLegDeadlift.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

STHyperextension.name: Suspended Hyperextension
STHyperextension.preparation: Grasp suspension handles and momentarily step back until arms are extended forward and straight. While keeping arms straight and shoulders back, step forward so body reclines back behind suspension handles. Fold at hips onto heels, allowing rear end to fall far back with arms and shoulders stretched forward.
STHyperextension.execution: Drive hips forward until hips are straight, while keeping arms and shoulders straight. Near top of motion, reach back with arms over head and hyperextend spine. While keeping arms over head, lower body with hips falling back down to starting position and repeat.
STHyperextension.comments: An alternative mount involves stepping back with suspension handles in hands until arms are pulled forward about 45° (give or take) from resting position. At this point, recline body back, then fold at hips, allowing rear end to fall far back with arms and shoulders stretched forward. Dismounting can be achieved by walking backward until body is upright. This exercise can be performed on TRXⓇ style suspension trainer or adjustable length gymnastics rings.

STPullThrough.name: Suspended Pull Through
STPullThrough.preparation: Sit on floor with feet under suspension trainer loops in low position. Reach and grasp bottom of loops and lay back supine. Raise legs and place heels in loops with soles contacting handles (or ankles through loops as shown). Extend legs out straight. Sit up and place hands on floor to sides at desired distance from suspension trainer. Raise hips from floor, supporting upper body with arms.
STPullThrough.execution: Pull hips back while flexing spine in C shape. Raise hips up high by straightening spine and hips until straight.
STPullThrough.comments: This exercise can be performed on TRXⓇ style suspension trainer. See

Superman.name: Superman
Superman.preparation: Lie prone on mat with legs together and arms extended out on floor approximately parallel.
Superman.execution: Slowly raise upper body and legs off floor. Return upper body and legs to floor and repeat.
Superman.comments: Lift legs and upper body slowly with no jerking or fast movements. Also see

SingleLegDeclineRearBridge.name: Single Leg Decline Rear Bridge
SingleLegDeclineRearBridge.preparation: Lie supine on mat with arms to sides. Place one foot flat on floor or mat with knee bent. Keep other leg straight. Place arms out to sides of body for stability.
SingleLegDeclineRearBridge.execution: While keeping leg straight inline with body, raise hips up off floor until hip of bent leg is straight. Hold position. Change position and repeat hold on opposite side.

TBDeadlift.name: Trap Bar Deadlift
TBDeadlift.execution: Stand with feet shoulder width or narrower in trap bar, weight to each side. Squat down with feet flat, low back taut. Grasp handles to sides.

TBStiffLegDeadlift.name: Trap Bar Stiff Leg Deadlift
TBStiffLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand on platform under loaded trap bar. Squat down and grasp handles to sides.

TBStraightLegDeadlift.name: Trap Bar Straight Leg Deadlift
TBStraightLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand on platform under loaded trap bar. Squat down and grasp handles to sides.

Wt45BackExtension.name: Weighted 45° Back Extension (on hyperextension apparatus)
Wt45BackExtension.preparation: Position thighs prone on padding. Hook heels on platform lip or under padded brace. Hold weight to chest or behind neck.
Wt45BackExtension.execution: Lower body by bending waist until fully flexed. Raise, or extend waist until torso is parallel to legs. Repeat.
Wt45BackExtension.comments: Position pad high enough to evenly distribute body weight on thigh but not so high that range of motion is limited; abdomen should not press on top side of pad when upper body is lowered. Begin with body weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

Wt45Hyperextension.name: Weighted 45° Hyperextension
Wt45Hyperextension.preparation: Position thighs prone on padding. Hook heels on platform lip or under padded brace. Hold weight to chest or behind neck.
Wt45Hyperextension.execution: Raise upper body until hips and waist are fully extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is approximately perpendicular to legs. Repeat.
Wt45Hyperextension.comments: If weight is positioned behind head, neck extensors act as stabilizers:

WtBackExtension.name: Weighted Back Extension (on hyperextension apparatus)
WtBackExtension.preparation: Position thighs prone on large pad and lower legs under padded brace. Hold weight to chest or behind neck.
WtBackExtension.execution: Lower body by bending waist until fully flexed. Raise, or extend waist until torso is parallel to legs. Repeat.
WtBackExtension.comments: Adjust lower leg brace so pressure is evenly distributed on thigh pad. Begin with body weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

WtBallHyperextension.name: Weighted Back Extension (on stability ball)
WtBallHyperextension.preparation: Lie prone on ball. Position toes out wide on floor for balance. Hold weight under chin or behind neck.
WtBallHyperextension.execution: Raise torso off of ball by hyperextending spine. Lower torso onto ball allowing spine to flex. Repeat.
WtBallHyperextension.comments: Movement can be made easier by using

WtHyperextension.name: Weighted Hyperextension
WtHyperextension.preparation: Position thighs prone on large pad and lower legs under padded brace. Hold weight to chest or behind neck.
WtHyperextension.execution: Raise upper body until hips and waist are fully extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until mild stretch is felt or torso is vertical. Repeat.
WtHyperextension.comments: If weight is positioned behind head, neck extensors act as stabilizers:

ASSingleLegCalfRaiseSelf.name: Self-assisted Single Leg Calf Raise
ASSingleLegCalfRaiseSelf.preparation: Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with heels and arches extending off. Place hands on support for assistance. Lift one leg to rear by bending knee.
ASSingleLegCalfRaiseSelf.execution: Raise heel by extending ankle as high as possible, assisting with upper body as little as possible. Lower heel by bending ankle until calf is stretched. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
ASSingleLegCalfRaiseSelf.comments: Keep knee straight throughout exercise or bend knee slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knee is bent slightly during stretch. Clip shows use of pulling assistance from high support. If support is lower, assist by

ASSingleLegCalfRaiseSelfFoot.name: Self-assisted Single Leg Calf Raise (with opposite leg)
ASSingleLegCalfRaiseSelfFoot.preparation: Position toes and ball of foot on calf block with heels and arches extending off. Place hand or hands on support for balance. Raise one ankle by bending knee forward, keeping forefoot on platform.
ASSingleLegCalfRaiseSelfFoot.execution: Raise body upward as high as possible by extending lower ankle while straightening knee of assisting leg. Lower heel by bending ankle while bending knee of assisting leg forward. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg positioning.
ASSingleLegCalfRaiseSelfFoot.comments: Keep knee of exercised leg straight throughout exercise. On assisting leg, keep ankle high and only assist minimal, just enough to raise body in a steady motion. See

BBStandingCalfRaise.name: Barbell Standing Leg Calf Raise
BBStandingCalfRaise.preparation: Set barbell on power rack upper chest height with calf block under barbell. Position back of shoulders under barbell with both hands to sides. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. Lean barbell against rack and raise from supports by extending knees and hips. Support barbell against verticals with both hands to sides.
BBStandingCalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
BBStandingCalfRaise.comments: Notice barbell makes contact with only non-painted surface (plastic or metal surface). Exercise step that will not overturn can be used as calf block. Position rack just below lowest range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

BWSingleLegCalfRaise.name: Single Leg Calf Raise
BWSingleLegCalfRaise.preparation: Position toes and balls of feet on calf block or elevation with heels and arches extending off. Place hand or hands on support for balance. Lift one leg to rear by bending knee.
BWSingleLegCalfRaise.execution: Raise heel by extending ankle as high as possible. Lower heel by bending ankle until calf is stretched. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
BWSingleLegCalfRaise.comments: Keep knee straight throughout exercise or bend knee slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knee is bent slightly during stretch. See

BWSingleLegForwardAngledCalfRaise.name: Single Leg Forward Angled Calf Raise
BWSingleLegForwardAngledCalfRaise.preparation: Stand facing mid-thigh to hip high vertical bar. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Step back so body is angled forward with body straight and arms extended approximately perpendicular to body. Feet should be pointed forward. Lift one leg to rear by bending knee.
BWSingleLegForwardAngledCalfRaise.execution: Raise heel by extending ankle as high as possible. Allow body to travel forward and upward in same direction as body is orientated. Lower heel allowing foot to come back down flat on floor. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
BWSingleLegForwardAngledCalfRaise.comments: Keep knee straight throughout exercise or bend knee slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knee is bent slightly during stretch.

BWStandingCalfRaise.name: Standing Calf Raise
BWStandingCalfRaise.preparation: Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. Place hand on support for balance.
BWStandingCalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
BWStandingCalfRaise.comments: Exercise step that will not overturn can be used as calf block. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

CBOneArmSingleLegCalfRaise.name: Cable One Arm Single Leg Calf Raise
CBOneArmSingleLegCalfRaise.preparation: Stand facing low pulley with platform on floor. Bend over and grasp stirrup attachment with one hand. Stand on edge of platform and grasp support bar for balance. Position toes and balls of feet on platform with arches and heels extending off. Lift one leg up off of floor.
CBOneArmSingleLegCalfRaise.execution: Raise heel by extending ankle as high as possible. Lower heel by bending ankle until calf is stretched. Repeat.
CBOneArmSingleLegCalfRaise.comments: Calf block or exercise step that will not overturn can be used as platform. Keep knee straight throughout exercise or bend knee slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

CBSingleLegCalfRaise.name: Cable Single Leg Calf Raise
CBSingleLegCalfRaise.preparation: Kneel before low pulley and attach cable belt or dip belt to cable. Stand on edge of platform and grasp support bar for balance. Position toes and balls of feet on platform with arches and heels extending off. Lift one leg up off of floor.
CBSingleLegCalfRaise.execution: Raise heel by extending ankle as high as possible. Lower heel by bending ankle until calf is stretched. Repeat.
CBSingleLegCalfRaise.comments: A short chain may be used to add length to cable so belt can be more easily attached to cable as long as it is short enough to allow full range of motion. Calf block or exercise step that will not overturn can be used as platform. A short chain may be used, so belt can be more easily attached to cable as long as it is short enough to allow full range of motion. Keep knee straight throughout exercise or bend knee slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

CBStandingCalfRaise.name: Cable Standing Calf Raise
CBStandingCalfRaise.preparation: Place cable belt or dip belt around waist. Kneel before low pulley and attach belt to cable. Stand on calf block and grasp support bar for balance. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off.
CBStandingCalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
CBStandingCalfRaise.comments: Chain may be used to add length to cable so belt can be more easily attached to cable as long as it is short enough to allow full range of motion. Exercise step that will not overturn can be used as calf block. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch.   See

DBSingleLegCalfRaise.name: Dumbbell Single Leg Calf Raise
DBSingleLegCalfRaise.preparation: Grasp dumbbell in one hand to side. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. Place hand on support for balance. Lift other leg to rear by bending knee.
DBSingleLegCalfRaise.execution: Raise heel by extending ankle as high as possible. Lower heel by bending ankle until calf is stretched. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
DBSingleLegCalfRaise.comments: Exercise step that will not overturn can be used as calf block. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knee is bent slightly during stretch. Use lighter load if you need to assist with hands used for support or

DBStandingCalfRaise.name: Dumbbell Standing Calf Raise
DBStandingCalfRaise.preparation: Grasp dumbbell in one hand to side. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. Place hand on support for balance.
DBStandingCalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
DBStandingCalfRaise.comments: Exercise step that will not overturn can be used as calf block. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. If holding heavy dumbbell becomes too difficult, try

LV45CalfPress.name: Lever 45° Calf Press (plate loaded)
LV45CalfPress.preparation: Sit on seat with back on padded support. Place feet on platform. Grasp handles to sides and extend hips and knees. Place toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform with heels and arches extending off.
LV45CalfPress.execution: Push platform by extending ankles as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
LV45CalfPress.comments: Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

LV45CalfRaise.name: Lever 45° Calf Raise
LV45CalfRaise.preparation: Sit on machine with low back against padding and grasp handles to sides. Position toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform or foot bar with arches and heels extending off. Straighten knees.
LV45CalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
LV45CalfRaise.comments: When finished, place feet back on platform, engage dock lever (if it automatically disengaged), and lower seat to original position. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

LV45CalfRaisePL.name: Lever 45° Calf Raise (plate loaded)
LV45CalfRaisePL.preparation: Sit on machine with low back against padding and grasp handles to sides. Place feet high on platform and straighten knees. Position toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform with arches and heels extending off.
LV45CalfRaisePL.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
LV45CalfRaisePL.comments: When finished, place feet back on platform, engage dock lever (if it automatically disengaged), and lower seat to original position. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch.   See

LVAlternatingSeatedCalfExt.name: Lever Alternating Calf Extension
LVAlternatingSeatedCalfExt.preparation: Sit on seat and position forefeet on pedals. Grasp handles to sides and straighten knees.
LVAlternatingSeatedCalfExt.execution: Push left pedal by extending ankle as far as possible while allowing right pedal to return back until calf is stretched. Reverse motion by pushing right pedal and allowing left pedal to return back. Continue to alternate motion.
LVAlternatingSeatedCalfExt.comments: Position seat to allow full range of motion. Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch.

LVDonkeyCalfRaise.name: Lever Donkey Calf Raise
LVDonkeyCalfRaise.preparation: Position lower back and hips under padded lever. Place forearms on supports. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. Straighten knees.
LVDonkeyCalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
LVDonkeyCalfRaise.comments: Position lever just below lowest range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

LVDonkeyCalfRaisePL.name: Lever Donkey Calf Raise (plate loaded)
LVDonkeyCalfRaisePL.preparation: Position lower back and hips under padded lever. Place forearms on supports. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. Straighten knees.
LVDonkeyCalfRaisePL.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
LVDonkeyCalfRaisePL.comments: Position lever just below lowest range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

LVForwardAngledCalfRaise.name: Lever Forward Angled Calf Raise
LVForwardAngledCalfRaise.preparation: Place shoulders under padded lever. Position toes and balls of feet on top of calf block with arches and heels extending off. Grasp handles or sides of padded lever. Stand erect by extending hips and knees.
LVForwardAngledCalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
LVForwardAngledCalfRaise.comments: If possible, position lever just below lowest range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

LVSeatedCalfExtension.name: Lever Calf Extension
LVSeatedCalfExtension.preparation: Sit on seat and position forefeet on horizontal foot bar. Grasp handles to sides and straighten knees.
LVSeatedCalfExtension.execution: Push lever by extending ankles as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
LVSeatedCalfExtension.comments: Position seat to allow full range of motion. Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch (as shown).

LVSeatedCalfExtensionBi.name: Lever Calf Extension (bilateral)
LVSeatedCalfExtensionBi.preparation: Sit on seat and position forefeet on lever platform or foot pedals. Grasp handles to sides and straighten knees.
LVSeatedCalfExtensionBi.execution: Push lever by extending ankles as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
LVSeatedCalfExtensionBi.comments: Position seat to allow full range of motion. Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch (as shown).

LVSeatedCalfExtensionHammer.name: Lever Calf Extension (plate loaded)
LVSeatedCalfExtensionHammer.preparation: Sit on seat and position forefeet on lever platform. Grasp handles to sides and straighten knees.
LVSeatedCalfExtensionHammer.execution: Push lever by extending ankle as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
LVSeatedCalfExtensionHammer.comments: Position seat to allow full range of motion. Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. Also known as Rotary Calf Extension. See

LVSeatedCalfPress.name: Lever Seated Calf Press
LVSeatedCalfPress.preparation: Place seat away from platform. Sit on seat with lower back against back of seat. Place toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform with heels and arches extending off. Grasp handles to sides and straighten knees.
LVSeatedCalfPress.execution: Push lever by extending ankles as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
LVSeatedCalfPress.comments: Position seat back yet not so far that weight bottoms out (weight stack hits bottom) during stretch. Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

LVSeatedCalfPressH.name: Lever Seated Calf Press (plate loaded)
LVSeatedCalfPressH.preparation: Place seat away from platform. Sit on seat with lower back against back of seat. Place toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform(s) with heels and arches extending off. Grasp handles to sides and straighten knees.
LVSeatedCalfPressH.execution: Push lever platform(s) by extending ankles as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
LVSeatedCalfPressH.comments: Position seat back yet not so far that lever bottoms out during stretch. Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

LVStandingCalfRaise.name: Lever Standing Calf Raise
LVStandingCalfRaise.preparation: Place shoulders under padded lever. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. Grasp handles or sides of padded lever. Stand erect by extending hips and knees.
LVStandingCalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
LVStandingCalfRaise.comments: If possible, position lever just below lowest range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

LVStandingCalfRaiseBelt.name: Lever Standing Calf Raise (belt loaded)
LVStandingCalfRaiseBelt.preparation: Place lever belt or dip belt around waist. Kneel before lever and attach belt. Stand on calf block and grasp support bar for balance. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off.
LVStandingCalfRaiseBelt.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
LVStandingCalfRaiseBelt.comments: Chain with attachment can be preattached to lever so belt can be more easily attached as long as it is short enough to allow full range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch.   See

LVStandingCalfRaisePL.name: Lever Standing Calf Raise (plate loaded)
LVStandingCalfRaisePL.preparation: Place shoulders under padded lever. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. Grasp handles or sides of padded lever. Stand erect by extending hips and knees.
LVStandingCalfRaisePL.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
LVStandingCalfRaisePL.comments: If available, position lever or chain just below lowest range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

LVVCalfRaiseH.name: Lever Calf Raise (on v-squat machine, plate loaded)
LVVCalfRaiseH.preparation: Position shoulders under shoulder pads with back against back pad. Place feet on platform shoulder width apart. Extend hips and knees. Position toes and balls of feet on nearest edge of platform with arches and heels extending off.
LVVCalfRaiseH.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
LVVCalfRaiseH.comments: Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

SBStandingCalfRaise.name: Safety Barbell Standing Leg Calf Raise
SBStandingCalfRaise.preparation: Stand facing safety barbell on rack upper chest height and calf block on floor just below. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. Place hands on bar to each sides or on vertical rack bars. Position head in yoke with padded bar around shoulders. Dismount bar from rack by standing erect with safety bar, away yet close to rack.
SBStandingCalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
SBStandingCalfRaise.comments: Position rack just below lowest range of motion. Calf block should be positioned so safety bar is close to but does not make contact with rack. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

SL45AlternatingCalfPress.name: Sled 45° Alternating Calf Press
SL45AlternatingCalfPress.preparation: Sit on seat with back on padded support. Grasp handles to sides. Place toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform with heels and arches extending off.
SL45AlternatingCalfPress.execution: Push sled by extending ankles as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
SL45AlternatingCalfPress.comments: Lower weight back into starting position if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. Exercise can also be performed with

SL45CalfPress.name: Sled 45° Calf Press
SL45CalfPress.preparation: Sit on seat with back on padded support. Place feet on platform. Grasp handles to sides and extend hips and knees. Place toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform with heels and arches extending off.
SL45CalfPress.execution: Push sled by extending ankles as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
SL45CalfPress.comments: Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. Movement can also be performed on

SL45CalfPressPL.name: Sled 45° Calf Raise (plate loaded)
SL45CalfPressPL.preparation: Sit on machine with lower back against padding and grasp handles to sides. Position toes and balls of feet on foot of platform with arches and heels extending off. Straighten knees.
SL45CalfPressPL.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
SL45CalfPressPL.comments: Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. Also known as Sled Donkey Calf Raise. See

SL45CalfRaise.name: Sled 45° Calf Raise
SL45CalfRaise.preparation: Sit on machine with lower back against padding and grasp handles to sides. Position toes and balls of feet on foot platform with arches and heels extending off. Straighten knees.
SL45CalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
SL45CalfRaise.comments: Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. Also known as Sled Donkey Calf Raise. See

SLDonkeyCalfRaise.name: Sled Donkey Calf Raise
SLDonkeyCalfRaise.preparation: Position lower back and hips under upper pad. Place forearms on supports. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. Straighten knees.
SLDonkeyCalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
SLDonkeyCalfRaise.comments: Position upper pad just below lowest range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

SLForwardAngledCalfRaise.name: Sled Forward Angled Calf Raise
SLForwardAngledCalfRaise.preparation: Lie forward so chest is on pad and shoulders are under padded bars. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. Grasp handles or sides of padded bars. Stand erect by extending hips and knees. Release lever if available.
SLForwardAngledCalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
SLForwardAngledCalfRaise.comments: Sled can be positioned just below lowest range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

SLHackCalfPress.name: Sled Hack Calf Press
SLHackCalfPress.preparation: Lie supine on sled with shoulders against pad and place feet on platform. Grasp handles to sides and straighten knees. Place toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform with heels and arches extending off.
SLHackCalfPress.execution: Push sled up away from platform by extending ankles as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
SLHackCalfPress.comments: Not all Hack Squat machines have platform with opened lower end allowing for this movement, but some platforms may accommodate calf block, see

SLLyingCalfPress.name: Sled Lying Calf Press
SLLyingCalfPress.preparation: Position sled away from platform. Lie supine on sled with shoulders against pad and place feet on platform. Grasp handles to sides and straighten knees. Place toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform with heels and arches extending off.
SLLyingCalfPress.execution: Push sled away from platform by extending ankles as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
SLLyingCalfPress.comments: Position sled back yet not so far that weight bottoms out during stretch. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

SLLyingCalfPressPL.name: Sled Lying Calf Press (plate loaded)
SLLyingCalfPressPL.preparation: Position sled away from platform. Lie supine on sled with shoulders against pad and place feet on platform. Grasp handles to sides and straighten knees. Place toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform with heels and arches extending off.
SLLyingCalfPressPL.execution: Push sled away from platform by extending ankles as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
SLLyingCalfPressPL.comments: If sled bottoms out on dock lever, disengage it to allow full range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

SLSeatedCalfPress.name: Sled Seated Calf Press
SLSeatedCalfPress.preparation: Place seat away from platform. Sit on seat and place feet on platform. Grasp handles to sides and extend hips and knees. Place toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform with heels and arches extending off.
SLSeatedCalfPress.execution: Push sled by extending ankles as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
SLSeatedCalfPress.comments: Position seat back yet not so far that weight bottoms out during stretch. Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

SLStandingCalfRaise.name: Sled Standing Calf Raise
SLStandingCalfRaise.preparation: Place shoulders under padded bars. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. Grasp handles or sides of padded bars. Stand erect by extending hips and knees.
SLStandingCalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
SLStandingCalfRaise.comments: Position sled just below lowest range of motion. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. Also see exercise on

SLSeatedCalfPressLyingLP.name: Sled Seated Calf Press (on lying leg press)
SLSeatedCalfPressLyingLP.preparation: Place sled away from platform. Lean firm pad upright against what would normally be shoulder pads. Sit on sled with back and hips against added pad and hands on sides of sled. Place toes and balls of feet on lower portion of platform with heels and arches extending off. Extend hips and knees so legs are straight.
SLSeatedCalfPressLyingLP.execution: Push sled by extending ankles as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
SLSeatedCalfPressLyingLP.comments: Position sled back yet not so far that weight bottoms out during stretch. Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

SLVerticalCalfPress.name: Sled Vertical Calf Press
SLVerticalCalfPress.preparation: Lie on back pad. Place feet on platform. Grasp handles to sides and extend hips and knees. Place toes and balls of feet on platform with heels and arches extending off.
SLVerticalCalfPress.execution: Push sled by extending ankles as far as possible. Return by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
SLVerticalCalfPress.comments: Reposition stance if feet slip. Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. See

SMDonkeyCalfRaise.name: Smith Donkey Calf Raise
SMDonkeyCalfRaise.preparation: Engage both safety stops mid height so bar will be just above in lowest range of motion. Place calf block under bar. Position padded surface of tall bench or
SMDonkeyCalfRaise.execution: in front of smith machine for arm rest. Place stiffly padded board within arms reach. Step on calf block while standing between smith bar and arm rest. Situate padded board on back of hips while bending under smith bar. Arrange smith bar above upper hips or lower waist with padded board in between. Place forearms on supports. Lift bar off of safety stops by straighten knees. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off.
SMDonkeyCalfRaise.comments: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.

SMStandingCalfRaise.name: Smith Standing Leg Calf Raise
SMStandingCalfRaise.preparation: Position bar on upper chest height and place calf block under bar. Position back of shoulders under bar and grasp bar to sides. Position toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. Disengage bar by rotating bar back. Stand erect by extending knees and hips.
SMStandingCalfRaise.execution: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.
SMStandingCalfRaise.comments: Keep knees straight throughout exercise or bend knees slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knees are bent slightly during stretch. Also see alternative form:

STSingleLegForwardAngledCalfRaise.name: Suspended Single Leg Forward Angled Calf Raise
STSingleLegForwardAngledCalfRaise.execution: Raise heel by extending ankle as high as possible. Allow body to travel forward and upward in same direction as body is orientated. Lower heel allowing foot to come back down flat on floor. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
STSingleLegForwardAngledCalfRaise.comments: Keep knee of supporting leg straight throughout exercise or bend knee slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knee is bent slightly during stretch.

SVSingleLeg45CalfPress.name: Sled Single Leg 45° Calf Press
SVSingleLeg45CalfPress.preparation: Sit on seat with back on padded support. Place feet on platform. Grasp handles to sides and extend hips and knees. With one foot, place toes and ball of foot on lower portion of platform with heels and arches extending off. Position other foot on floor within machine.
SVSingleLeg45CalfPress.execution: Push sled by extending ankle as far as possible. Return by bending ankle until calf is stretched. Repeat.
SVSingleLeg45CalfPress.comments: Reposition stance if foot slips by first securing platform with foot of resting leg. Keep knee straight throughout exercise or bend knee slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knee bends slightly during stretch. Movement can also be performed on

WTDonkeyCalfRaise.name: Weighted Donkey Calf Raise
