WTDonkeyCalfRaise.preparation: Stand on edge of platform, toes and balls of feet on calf block with arches and heels extending off. Bend over and grasp knee high bar (as shown) or place forearms on thigh high surface (see
WTDonkeyCalfRaise.execution: ). Allow training partner to mount hips or lower back from bench.
WTDonkeyCalfRaise.comments: Raise heels by extending ankles as high as possible. Lower heels by bending ankles until calves are stretched. Repeat.

WTSingleLegCalfRaise.name: Weighted Single Leg Calf Raise
WTSingleLegCalfRaise.preparation: Hang weight from dip belt around waist. Position toes and ball of foot on calf block end of platform with heel and arch extending off. Place hand or hands on support for balance. Lift other leg to rear by bending knee.
WTSingleLegCalfRaise.execution: Raise heel by extending ankle as high as possible. Lower heel by bending ankle until calf is stretched. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
WTSingleLegCalfRaise.comments: Keep knee straight throughout exercise or bend knee slightly only during stretch. Quadriceps serve as synergist muscle if knee is bent slightly during stretch. Use lighter load if you need to assist with hands used for support. See

ASSquatSelf.name: Self-assisted Squat
ASSquatSelf.preparation: Stand in front of horizontal bar positioned at height of upper abdomen to lower chest.  Place hands on horizontal bar with arms extended forward.
ASSquatSelf.execution: While holding onto horizontal bar, squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Stand up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Return to standing position and repeat.
ASSquatSelf.comments: Exercise can also be performed by placing hands on sturdy piece of furniture or railing. If assistance is needed, push down onto horizontal bar or furniture. Keep head facing forward, back straight, chest high, and feet flat on surface. Apply equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

ASSquatSelfST.name: Self-assisted Squat (on suspension trainer)
ASSquatSelfST.preparation: Stand in front of suspension trainer handles positioned at height of upper abdomen to lower chest.  Grasp suspension trainer handles with arms extended forward.
ASSquatSelfST.execution: While holding onto suspension trainer handles, squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Stand up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Return to standing position and repeat.
ASSquatSelfST.comments: Exercise can also be performed by placing hands on sturdy piece of furniture or

ASSingleLegSquatSelfPole.name: Self-assisted Single Leg Reclining Squat (pole)
ASSingleLegSquatSelfPole.preparation: Stand with feet behind vertical pole. Grasp pole with both hands, waist to hip height. Balance on one leg with opposite leg raised up off of floor to side of pole.
ASSingleLegSquatSelfPole.execution: Squat down while keeping leg elevated off of floor. With arms slightly flexed, lean back slightly while only allowing knee to travel slightly forward. Keep back straight and supporting knee pointed same direction as supporting foot. Descend to lowest position. Raise body back up to original position while keeping knee behind bar and arms slightly flexed until knee and hip of supporting leg is straight. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.
ASSingleLegSquatSelfPole.comments: Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement, yet only extend forward slightly. Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength and

ASStepDownSelf.name: Self-assisted Step-down
ASStepDownSelf.preparation: Stand with one foot on bench or elevated surface. Position foot on elevated surface to side and forward of straight knee.
ASStepDownSelf.execution: Stand on bench by straightening leg and pushing body upward. Step down returning foot off of bench to floor and repeat. Continue with opposite position.
ASStepDownSelf.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Knee of exercised leg should point same direction as foot. Exercise can also be performed by placing travelling foot onto and off of bench next to foot of exercised leg (See

AsSingleLegSquatLegSelf.name: Self-assisted Single Leg Squat (leg wrapped)
AsSingleLegSquatLegSelf.preparation: Stand with hand on hip height elevated surface or other tall, sturdy structure for support. Stand on one leg by wrapping leg around back of supporting leg so top of lifted foot is on outside of supporting leg's ankle.
AsSingleLegSquatLegSelf.execution: Squat down by bending knee forward and hip back behind. Keep back straight and supporting knee pointed same direction as foot supporting. Descend until thigh is just past parallel to floor. Return to standing position with minimal assistance from wrapped leg. Stand to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg are straight. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
AsSingleLegSquatLegSelf.comments: Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement.

AsSingleLegSquatSelf.name: Self-assisted Single Leg Squat (bar)
AsSingleLegSquatSelf.preparation: Stand behind horizontal bar, lower chest to waist height. Place finger tips or inside base of thumbs on bar, hold with just enough contact for balance and self-assistance. Balance on one leg with opposite leg extended forward off of ground.
AsSingleLegSquatSelf.execution: Squat down as far as possible while keeping leg elevated off of floor. Keep back straight and supporting knee pointed same direction as supporting foot. Raise body back up to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg is straight. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.
AsSingleLegSquatSelf.comments: Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength and

BBBentKneeGoodMorning.name: Barbell Bent Knee Good-morning
BBBentKneeGoodMorning.preparation: Position barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides.
BBBentKneeGoodMorning.execution: Keeping back straight, bend hips to lower torso forward until parallel to floor. Bend knees slightly during descent. Raise torso until hips are extended. Repeat.
BBBentKneeGoodMorning.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow adequate

BBBlockPull.name: Barbell Block Pull
BBBlockPull.preparation: With barbell on blocks, position feet shoulder width or slightly narrower beneath bar. Squat down and grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip.
BBBlockPull.execution: Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return and repeat.
BBBlockPull.comments: Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. Grip strength and strength endurance often limit ability to perform multiple reps at heavy resistances. Gym chalk, wrist straps, grip work, and mixed grip can be used to enhance grip. Mixed grip indicates one hand holding with overhand grip and other hand holding with underhand grip.

BBBoxSquat.name: Barbell Box Squat
BBBoxSquat.preparation: From rack with barbell at upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders. Grasp barbell to sides. Dismount bar from rack and back up until contact is made with box immediately behind. Stand with wide stance with feet flared out slightly.
BBBoxSquat.execution: Sit back onto box by bending hips back while bending knees, keeping shins nearly perpendicular or knees slightly behind ankles. Lower rear end back onto box in controlled manner. Rock torso back slightly. Once torso rocks forward, immediately stand back up rapidly by driving hips upward, keeping knees above ankles and chest high until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
BBBoxSquat.comments: Try to keep knees from traveling forward while reaching rear end back onto squat box. Ideally, knees could be behind ankles. In this position, greater stretch reflex can be created through hips (via

BBDeadlift.name: Barbell Deadlift
BBDeadlift.preparation: With feet flat beneath bar squat down and grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip.
BBDeadlift.execution: Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return weights to floor by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Repeat.
BBDeadlift.comments: Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. Grip strength and strength endurance often limit ability to perform multiple reps at heavy resistances. Gym chalk, wrist straps, grip work, and mixed grip can be used to enhance grip. Mixed grip indicates one hand holding with overhand grip and other hand holding with underhand grip.

BBDeficitDeadlift.name: Barbell Deficit Deadlift
BBDeficitDeadlift.preparation: Stand on weight plate or shallow elevated platform with loaded bar above feet. Squat down and grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip.
BBDeficitDeadlift.execution: Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return weights to floor by bending hips back, while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Repeat.
BBDeficitDeadlift.comments: Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. Grip strength and strength endurance often limit ability to perform multiple reps at heavy resistances.

BBFrontSquat.name: Barbell Front Squat
BBFrontSquat.preparation: From rack with barbell upper chest height, position bar in front of shoulders. Cross arms and place hands on top of barbell with upper arms parallel to floor. Dismount bar from rack.
BBFrontSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
BBFrontSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

BBFullSquat.name: Barbell Full Squat
BBFullSquat.preparation: From rack with barbell upper chest height, position barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Dismount bar from rack.
BBFullSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until knees and hips are fully bent. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
BBFullSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement.

BBHackSquat.name: Barbell Hack Squat
BBHackSquat.preparation: Position barbell just behind legs. With feet flat on floor, squat down and grasp barbell from behind with overhand grip.
BBHackSquat.execution: Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Squat down by bending knees forward while allowing hips to bend back behind, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are close to parallel to floor and bar is behind lower leg. Repeat.
BBHackSquat.comments: Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

BBHipThrust.name: Barbell Hip Thrust
BBHipThrust.preparation: Sit on floor with long side of bench behind back. Roll barbell back and center over hips. Position upper back on corner of bench. Place feet on floor approximately shoulder width with knees bent. Grasp bar to each side.
BBHipThrust.execution: Raise bar upward by extending hips until straight. Lower and repeat.
BBHipThrust.comments: Use bench of lower height 16" to 18" (40 to 46 cm) allowing torso to be angled approximately 45º. Bench may need to be secured so it does not slide on floor.

BBLateralStepUp.name: Barbell Lateral Step-up
BBLateralStepUp.preparation: Stand between two benches, one to each side. Position bar on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides.
BBLateralStepUp.execution: Lift leg and place foot on bench to side and forward of straight knee. Stand on bench by straightening leg and pushing body upward. Step down returning feet to original position. Repeat with opposite leg, alternating between legs.
BBLateralStepUp.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Stepping knee should point same direction as foot. A modest degree of

BBLunge.name: Barbell Lunge
BBLunge.preparation: bar from floor or dismount bar from rack. From rack with barbell upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides.
BBLunge.execution: Lunge forward with first leg. Land on heel, then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by forcibly extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat by alternating lunge with opposite leg.

BBRearLunge.name: Barbell Rear Lunge
BBRearLunge.preparation: From rack with barbell upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides. Dismount bar from rack.
BBRearLunge.execution: Step back with one leg while bending supporting leg. Plant forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward supporting leg and return rear leg next to supporting leg. Repeat movement with opposite legs alternating between sides.

BBRackPull.name: Barbell Rack Pull
BBRackPull.preparation: In power rack, with barbell on safety bar in low position, place feet shoulder width or slightly narrower beneath bar. Squat down and grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip.
BBRackPull.execution: Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return and repeat.
BBRackPull.comments: Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. Grip strength and strength endurance often limit ability to perform multiple reps at heavy resistances. Gym chalk, wrist straps, grip work, and mixed grip can be used to enhance grip. Mixed grip indicates one hand holding with overhand grip and other hand holding with underhand grip.

BBSeatedGoodMorning.name: Barbell Seated Good-morning
BBSeatedGoodMorning.preparation: Position barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Sit on end of bench or corner of box secured to floor. Position feet apart on floor with knees slightly bent.
BBSeatedGoodMorning.execution: Keeping back straight, bend torso forward as low as possible by bending hips. Raise torso until torso is upright. Repeat.
BBSeatedGoodMorning.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow adequate

BBSideLunge.name: Barbell Side Lunge
BBSideLunge.preparation: bar from floor or dismount bar from rack. From rack with barbell upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides.
BBSideLunge.execution: Lunge to one side with first leg. Land on heel, then on forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of lead leg, keeping knee pointed same direction of foot. Return to original standing position by forcibly extending hip and knee of lead leg. Repeat by alternating lunge with opposite leg.
BBSideLunge.comments: Keep torso upright during lunge. Flexible

BBSideSplitSquat.name: Barbell Side Split Squat
BBSideSplitSquat.preparation: Place bar on back of shoulders and grasp barbell on each side. Stand with feet wide apart; foot of lead leg angled out to side.
BBSideSplitSquat.execution: Lower body toward side of angled foot by bending knee and hip of lead leg while keeping opposite leg only slightly bent. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of lead leg. Repeat.
BBSideSplitSquat.comments: Keep torso upright and knee of lead leg pointed same direction of foot. Flexible

BBSingleLegSplitSquat.name: Barbell Single Leg Split Squat
BBSingleLegSplitSquat.preparation: Stand facing away from bench. Position bar on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides. Extend leg back and place top of foot on bench.
BBSingleLegSplitSquat.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

BBSingleLegSquat.name: Barbell Single Leg Squat
BBSingleLegSquat.preparation: Stand with arms extended out in front holding barbell. Balance on one leg with opposite leg extended forward off of ground.
BBSingleLegSquat.execution: Squat down as far as possible while keeping leg elevated off of floor. Keep   supporting knee pointed same direction as foot supporting. Raise body back up to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg is straight. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
BBSingleLegSquat.comments: Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength and

BBSingleLegStiffLegDeadlift.name: Barbell Single Leg Stiff-leg Deadlift
BBSingleLegStiffLegDeadlift.preparation: Hold barbell down in front, arms straight with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand grip. Stand with feet together. Lift leg slightly so foot is just off floor.
BBSingleLegStiffLegDeadlift.execution: Lower bar to floor while raising lifted leg back behind. Keep back straight and knee of supporting leg slightly bent. Keep hip and knee of lifted leg extended throughout movement. Once stretch is felt or barbell contacts floor, return to original position by raising torso while lowering lifted leg. Straighten knee of supporting leg as torso becomes upright. Repeat.
BBSingleLegStiffLegDeadlift.comments: Throughout lift, keep arms and back straight. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings. Full range of motion will vary from person to person. Those with

BBSplitSquat.name: Barbell Split Squat
BBSplitSquat.preparation: Position barbell on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides. Stand with feet far apart; one foot forward and other foot behind.
BBSplitSquat.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg. Allow heel of rear foot to rise up while knee of rear leg bends slightly until it almost makes contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
BBSplitSquat.comments: Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Heel of rear foot can be kept elevated off floor throughout movement. Keep torso upright during squat;

BBSquat.name: Barbell Squat (low bar)
BBSquat.preparation: From rack with barbell at upper chest height, position bar low on back of shoulders. Grasp barbell to sides. Dismount bar from rack and stand with wide stance.
BBSquat.comments: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Extend hips and knees until legs are straight. Return and repeat.

BBSquatChains.name: Barbell Squat (with chains)
BBSquatChains.preparation: Stand facing barbell, racked upper chest height, with thick chains hanging to floor on each side. Position bar low on back of shoulders. Grasp barbell to sides and position elbows back. Dismount bar from rack and stand with wide stance.
BBSquatChains.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet.   Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Extend hips and knees until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
BBSquatChains.comments: Chains provide increasing resistance as barbell moves away from floor. Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

BBStepUp.name: Barbell Step-up
BBStepUp.preparation: Stand facing side of bench. Position bar on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides.
BBStepUp.execution: Place foot of first leg on bench. Stand on bench by extending hip and knee of first leg and place foot of second leg on bench. Step down with second leg by flexing hip and knee of first leg. Return to original standing position by placing foot of first leg to floor. Repeat first step with opposite leg alternating first steps between legs.
BBStepUp.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Forward knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Stepping distance from bench emphasizes Gluteus Maximus; stepping close to bench emphasizes Quadriceps.

BBStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.name: Barbell Straight-back Stiff-leg Deadlift
BBStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.execution: from floor with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip. Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance.
BBStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.comments: With back straight, lower bar to top of feet by bending hips. Bend knees slightly during descent and keep waist straight. Place weight onto floor. With knees still bent, lift bar by straightening hips until standing upright. Pull shoulders back if rounded. Extend knees at top if desired. Repeat.

BBStiffLegDeadlift.name: Barbell Stiff Leg Deadlift
BBStiffLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance on 5" to 8" (13-20 cm) platform with feet flat beneath bar. Bend over and grasp barbell with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip.
BBStiffLegDeadlift.execution: With knees bent, lift bar by extending at hips until standing upright. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Extend knees at top if desired. Lower bar to top of feet by bending hips. Bend knees slightly during descent and keep waist straight, flexing only slightly at bottom. Repeat.
BBStiffLegDeadlift.comments: Throughout lift keep arms and back straight. Lower back may bend slightly during full hip flexion. Quadriceps can be kept bent throughout movement. See

BBWalkingLunge.name: Barbell Walking Lunge
BBWalkingLunge.preparation: Position barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides.
BBWalkingLunge.execution: Step forward with first leg. Land on heel, then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Stand on forward leg with assistance of rear leg. Lunge forward with opposite leg. Repeat by alternating lunge with opposite legs.

BBSumoBlockPull.name: Barbell Sumo Block Pull
BBSumoBlockPull.preparation: With barbell on blocks, position feet under bar with very wide stance. Squat down and grasp bar between legs with shoulder width mixed grip. Face forward while positioning shoulders upward with arms straight, chest high, hips low, and back straight.
BBSumoBlockPull.execution: Pull bar up by driving feet outward while pulling chest up. Extend knees when bar passes knees. At top of lift, when torso is upright, drive shoulders back and chest up. Return weight to blocks by bending hips back and knees pointed outward, while keeping chest high and back straight. Repeat.
BBSumoBlockPull.comments: Use shoulder width grip, since narrower than shoulder width grip will make it more difficult to lockout at top. Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight, and knees pointed out same direction as feet. Also, keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. With wide stance, push feet out to sides and not down to prevent knees from buckling inward. Pushing knees out will allow hips to travel toward bar more quickly while improving lev   erage.

BBSumoDeadlift.name: Barbell Sumo Deadlift
BBSumoDeadlift.preparation: Position feet under bar with very wide stance. Squat down and grasp bar between legs with shoulder width mixed grip. Face forward while positioning shoulders upward with arms straight, chest high, hips low, and back straight.
BBSumoDeadlift.execution: Pull bar up by driving feet outward, while pulling chest up. Extend knees when bar passes knees. At top of lift, when torso is upright, drive shoulders back and chest up. Return weight to floor by bending hips back and knees pointed outward, while keeping chest high and back straight. Repeat.
BBSumoDeadlift.comments: Use shoulder width grip since narrower than shoulder width grip will make it more difficult to lockout at top. Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight, and knees pointed out same direction as feet. Also, keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. With wide stance, push feet out to sides and not down to prevent knees from buckling inward. Pushing knees out will allow hips to travel toward bar more quickly while improving leverage.

BWAlternatingStepDown.name: Alternating Step-down
BWAlternatingStepDown.preparation: Stand on bench or narrow platform, with feet side by side.
BWAlternatingStepDown.execution: Step down with first foot to side of elevated surface onto floor. Stand back up on elevated surface by straightening upper leg and pushing body upward. Place foot to original position next to opposite foot. Step down and back up with opposite leg in same manner. Repeat by alternating between sides.
BWAlternatingStepDown.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Stepping knee should point same direction as foot. A modest degree of

BBZercherSquat.name: Barbell Zercher Squat
BBZercherSquat.preparation: From rack with barbell upper waist height position, forearms under bar and in front of bar with elbows shoulder width apart. Cross wrists and pull bar in, close against body. Lift barbell from rack. Step back with wide stance, feet pointing out 20-30°.
BBZercherSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight, hands close to body, and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are near parallel. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
BBZercherSquat.comments: Turning knuckles up places bar more on

BWHalfSquat.name: Half Squat
BWHalfSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend to height which allows prescribed number of reps at suggested intensity, short of thighs descending just past parallel to floor. Stand up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Return to standing position and repeat.
BWHalfSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight, chest high, and feet flat on surface. Apply equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Arms positioned forward allow torso to be positioned more upright. See

BWLateralStepUp.name: Lateral Step-up
BWLateralStepUp.preparation: Stand between two benches, one to each side.
BWLateralStepUp.execution: Lift leg and place foot on bench to side and forward of straight knee. Stand on bench by straightening leg and pushing body upward. Step down returning feet to original position. Repeat with opposite leg, alternating between legs.
BWLateralStepUp.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Stepping knee should point same direction as foot. A modest degree of

BWLunge.name: Lunge
BWLunge.preparation: Stand with hands on hips or in front of body.
BWLunge.execution: Lunge forward with first leg. Land on heel, then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by forcibly extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat by alternating lunge with opposite leg.
BWLunge.comments: Weighted versions of this exercise would normally be considered auxiliary in context of other basic exercises (ie: Barbell Squat, Sled Leg Press). However, in the context of 'body weight' only program, this exercise can be considered basic.

BWRearLunge.name: Rear Lunge
BWRearLunge.preparation: Stand with hands on hips or in front of body.
BWRearLunge.execution: Step back with one leg while bending supporting leg. Plant forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward supporting leg and return rear leg next to supporting leg. Repeat movement with opposite legs alternating between sides.

BWReverseHyperextension.name: Reverse Hyper-extension
BWReverseHyperextension.preparation: Lay torso and waist on bench and grasp handles. Feet should be above floor with legs straight.
BWReverseHyperextension.execution: Raise legs by extending hips as high as possible until legs are nearly straight. Lower legs to original position. Repeat.

BWLyingHipExtension.name: Single Leg Hip Bridge
BWLyingHipExtension.preparation: Lie on floor or mat. Place one leg straight and bend the other leg with foot flat on floor or mat. Place arms down on mat to each side of hips.
BWLyingHipExtension.execution: Raise body by extending hip of bent leg, keeping extended leg and hip straight. Return to original position by lowering body with extended leg and hip straight. Repeat and continue with opposite sides.

BWReverseHyperextensionBall.name: Reverse Hyper-extension (on stability ball)
BWReverseHyperextensionBall.preparation: Lay prone with waist on stability ball. Grasp secure anchor or bar near floor. Feet should be above floor with legs straight.
BWReverseHyperextensionBall.execution: Holding firmly on anchor, extend legs upward by lifting and straightening leg as high as possible. Lower legs to original position with thighs close to stability ball. Repeat.
BWReverseHyperextensionBall.comments: Since knee is initially bent significantly, hamstrings are not significantly involved. Also see

BWSingleLegBoxSquat.name: Single Leg Box Squat (pistol)
BWSingleLegBoxSquat.preparation: Stand in front of adjustable height bench or box. Extend arms out in front of body. Balance on one leg with opposite leg extended forward off of ground.
BWSingleLegBoxSquat.execution: Squat down while keeping leg elevated off of floor. Keep back straight and supporting knee pointed same direction as foot supporting. Once bottocks makes contact with bench or box, raise body back up to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg is straight. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.
BWSingleLegBoxSquat.comments: Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength. Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Weighted versions of this exercise would normally be considered auxiliary in context of other basic exercises (ie: Barbell Squat, Sled Leg Press). However, in the context of 'body weight' only program, this exercise can be considered basic. Also known as Bench Pistol Squat or Single Leg Bench Squat.

BWSingleLegHalfSquat.name: Single Leg Half Squat
BWSingleLegHalfSquat.preparation: Stand with arms in front of body either extended or close to torso. Balance on one leg and bend raised leg back at knee.
BWSingleLegHalfSquat.execution: Squat down to challenging depth while keeping raised leg from contacting floor. Keep back straight and supporting knee pointed same direction as foot supporting. Stand back up to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg are straight. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
BWSingleLegHalfSquat.comments: Allow torso to lean forward slightly while hips travel to back and knee travels forward. Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength.

BWSingleLegPartialBoxSquat.name: Single Leg Partial Box Squat (pistol)
BWSingleLegPartialBoxSquat.preparation: Stand facing away from box, platform, or adjustable height bench positioned just behind legs. Extended arms out in front of body. Balance on one leg with opposite leg extended forward off of ground.
BWSingleLegPartialBoxSquat.execution: Squat down while keeping leg elevated off of floor. Keep back straight and supporting knee pointed same direction as foot supporting. Once buttock makes contact with bench or box, raise body back up to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg is straight. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.
BWSingleLegPartialBoxSquat.comments: Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Partial range of motion, as name implies, can be considered hips descending to height above knee. Weighted versions of this exercise would normally be considered auxiliary in context of other basic exercises (ie: Barbell Squat, Sled Leg Press). However, in the context of 'body weight' only program, this exercise can be considered basic. Also known as Pistol Box Squat (partial).

BWSingleLegRecliningSquat.name: Single Leg Reclining Squat (bar)
BWSingleLegRecliningSquat.preparation: Stand behind horizontal bar, lower chest to upper waist height. Grasp bar with both hands. Place feet slightly forward and lean back with arms straight. Balance on one leg with opposite leg extended forward off of ground.
BWSingleLegRecliningSquat.execution: While reclining back, squat down as far as possible while keeping leg elevated off of floor. Keep back straight and supporting knee pointed same direction as suppor ting foot. Raise body back up to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg is straight. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.
BWSingleLegRecliningSquat.comments: Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength and

BWSingleLegSplitSquat.name: Single Leg Split Squat
BWSingleLegSplitSquat.preparation: Stand facing away from bench. Extend leg back and place top of foot on bench.
BWSingleLegSplitSquat.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

BWSingleLegStiffLegDeadlift.name: Single Leg Stiff-leg Deadlift
BWSingleLegStiffLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with feet together and hands just in front of thighs. Lift leg slightly so foot is just off floor.
BWSingleLegStiffLegDeadlift.execution: Lower torso forward and downward while raising lifted leg back behind. Keep back straight and knee of supporting leg slightly bend. Keep hip and knee of lifted leg extended throughout movement. Once stretch is felt or hands contact floor, return to original position by raising torso while lowering lifted leg. Straighten knee of supporting leg as torso becomes upright. Repeat.
BWSingleLegStiffLegDeadlift.comments: Throughout lift, keep arms and back straight. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings. Full range of motion will vary from person to person. Those with

BWSingleLegSquat.name: Single Leg Squat (pistol)
BWSingleLegSquat.preparation: Stand with arms extended out in front. Balance on one leg with opposite leg extended forward off of ground.
BWSingleLegSquat.execution: Squat down as far as possible while keeping leg elevated off of floor. Keep back as straight as possible and supporting knee pointed same direction as foot supporting. Raise body back up to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg is straight. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.
BWSingleLegSquat.comments: Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength and

BWSplitSquat.name: Split Squat
BWSplitSquat.preparation: Stand with hands on hips. Position feet far apart; one foot forward and other foot behind.
BWSplitSquat.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg. Allow heel of rear foot to rise up while knee of rear leg bends slightly until it almost makes contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
BWSplitSquat.comments: Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Heel of rear foot can be kept elevated off floor throughout movement as shown. Keep torso upright during squat;

BWSingleLegSquatLegBack.name: Single Leg Squat (with leg back)
BWSingleLegSquatLegBack.preparation: Stand with arms extended out in front.
BWSingleLegSquatLegBack.execution: Balance on one leg and bend raised leg back at knee.
BWSingleLegSquatLegBack.comments: Squat down as far as possible while keeping raised leg from contacting floor as far down as possible. Keep back straight and supporting knee pointed same direction as foot supporting. In lowest position, gently place elevated lower leg on floor. Raise body back up with minimal assistance from raised leg on floor. Stand to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg are straight. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

BWSquat.name: Squat
BWSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet.   Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Squat up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
BWSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight, chest high, and feet flat on surface; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Arms positioned forward allows torso to be positioned more upright. See

BWStepDown.name: Step-down
BWStepDown.preparation: Stand with one foot on bench or elevated surface. Position foot on elevated surface to side, forward of straight knee.
BWStepDown.execution: Stand on bench by straightening leg and pushing body upward. Step down returning foot off of bench to floor and repeat. Continue with opposite position.
BWStepDown.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Knee of exercised leg should point same direction as foot. See

BWStepUp.name: Step-up
BWStepUp.preparation: Stand facing side of bench, step or platform.
BWStepUp.execution: Place foot of first leg on bench. Stand on bench by extending hip and knee of first leg and place foot of second leg on bench. Step down with second leg by flexing hip and knee of first leg. Return to original standing position by placing foot of first leg to floor. Repeat first step with opposite leg, alternating first steps between legs.
BWStepUp.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Lead knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Stepping distance from bench emphasizes Gluteus Maximus; stepping close to bench emphasizes Quadriceps.

CBBentOverHipExtension.name: Cable Bent-over Hip Extension
CBBentOverHipExtension.preparation: Attach ankle cuff to low pulley. With cuff on one ankle, grasp ballet bar with both hands and step far back with other foot. Arms remain extended to support body leaning forward. Leg with ankle cuff attached in slightly bent with foot off floor.
CBBentOverHipExtension.execution: Pull cable attachment back by extending hip. Return leg to original position and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
CBBentOverHipExtension.comments: Spinal stabilization through the sagittal plane is not significant as it is in

CBBarSquat.name: Cable Bar Squat
CBBarSquat.preparation: Adjust cable pulleys to medium low positions. Kneel under attached cable bar while supporting it with both hands. Position body in lower squat position with cable bar on top of shoulders, both feet flat on floor with mid feet in line with both pulleys, knees positioned same direction as feet, back straight and angled forward, and hands grasping bar to each side.
CBBarSquat.execution: Stand up by extending hips and knees until legs are straight. Squat back down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend slightly forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Return and repeat.
CBBarSquat.comments: Position height of cable bar so moving weight plates make contact with unused weight stack at bottom of squat when hips are slightly lower or same height as knees. Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

CBLunge.name: Cable Split Squat (belt)
CBLunge.preparation: Facing low pulley, kneel to attach cable belt or dip belt around waist. Place hand(s) on ballet bar or machine (not on guide rod!) for balance. Stand away from pulley with one leg forward and opposite leg to rear.
CBLunge.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg. Allow heel of rear foot to rise up while knee of rear leg bends slightly until it almost makes contact with floor. Return to original straddle position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with legs in opposite position.
CBLunge.comments: Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Heel of rear foot can be kept elevated off floor throughout movement as shown. Keep torso upright during squat;

CBLungeOneArm.name: Cable One Arm Split Squat
CBLungeOneArm.preparation: Face low pulley and grasp stirrup attachment with one hand. Stand away from pulley with one leg forward and opposite leg to rear. Place other hand on hip or on support to side.
CBLungeOneArm.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg. Allow heel of rear foot to rise up while knee of rear leg bends slightly until it almost makes contact with floor. Return to original straddle position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with legs in opposite position.
CBLungeOneArm.comments: Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Heel of rear foot can be kept elevated off floor throughout movement as shown. Keep torso upright during squat;

CBGluteKickback.name: Cable Glute Kickback
CBGluteKickback.preparation: Attach ankle cuff to low pulley. With cuff on one ankle, grasp ballet bar with both hands and step far back with other foot. Arms remain extended to support body leaning forward. Leg with ankle cuff attached is flexed at hip and knee.
CBGluteKickback.execution: Pull cable attachment back by extending hip and knee. Return leg to original position and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
CBGluteKickback.comments: Spinal stabilization through the sagittal plane is not significant as it is in

CBLungeTwoArm.name: Cable Split Squat
CBLungeTwoArm.preparation: Stand between two very low cable pulleys. Grasp stirrup attachments with each hand. Place one leg far forward and opposite leg far back to rear.
CBLungeTwoArm.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg. Allow heel of rear foot to rise up while knee of rear leg bends slightly until it almost makes contact with floor. Return to original straddle position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with legs in opposite position.
CBLungeTwoArm.comments: Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Heel of rear foot can be kept elevated off floor throughout movement as shown. Keep torso upright during squat;

CBRearLunge.name: Cable Rear Lunge
CBRearLunge.preparation: Stand between two very low pulleys with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp stirrup attachments to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
CBRearLunge.execution: Step back with one leg while bending supporting leg. Plant forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward supporting leg and return rear leg next to supporting leg. Repeat movement with opposite legs alternating between sides.

CBRearStepdownLunge.name: Cable Rear Step-down Lunge
CBRearStepdownLunge.preparation: Stand on upper platform with stirrups grasped to sides.
CBRearStepdownLunge.execution: Extend one leg back on forefoot. Lower body on other leg by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with lower platform. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat by alternating rear lunge with opposite leg.

CBSingleLegSplitSquatOneArm.name: Cable One Arm Single Leg Split Squat
CBSingleLegSplitSquatOneArm.preparation: Stand between bench and low pulley cable. Grasp cable stirrup with one hand. Facing low pulley, extend leg back and place top of foot or forefoot on bench. Place other hand on hip or support to side.
CBSingleLegSplitSquatOneArm.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

CBSingleLegSplitSquat.name: Cable Single Leg Split Squat
CBSingleLegSplitSquat.preparation: Facing away from bench, stand between two very low pulleys with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp stirrup attachments to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides. Extend leg back and place top of foot on bench.
CBSingleLegSplitSquat.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

CBSquat.name: Cable Squat
CBSquat.preparation: Stand with feet shoulder width or slightly wider on platform between very low and close pulley cables. Squat down with knees slightly beyond foot and shoulder above feet. Grasp stirrups to each side with arms straight.
CBSquat.execution: Keeping chest high and back straight, raise stirrups by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Squat down until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Return and repeat.
CBSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight, chest high, arms straight to sides, and feet flat on platform; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

CBSquatBelt.name: Cable Belt Squat
CBSquatBelt.preparation: Place pin on lightest weight. Place belt around waist. Pull cable from pulley and attach to front of belt. Step onto platform and grasp pole. Squat or sit on platform and select desired weight. Stand with feet shoulder width or wider to each side of cable. Place both hands on pole at waist height.
CBSquatBelt.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet.   Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Squat up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
CBSquatBelt.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight, chest high, and feet flat on surface; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. When finished, squat or sit and place pin into lightest weight setting. Step off of platform and unclip cable from belt. Also known as

CBStandingHipExtension.name: Cable Standing Hip Extension
CBStandingHipExtension.preparation: Attach ankle cuff to low pulley. With cuff on one ankle, grasp ballet bar with both hands and step back with other foot. Elbows remain straight. Attached leg is straight and foot is slightly off floor.
CBStandingHipExtension.execution: Pull cable attachment back by extending hip. Return leg to original position. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

CBStepUp.name: Cable Step-up
CBStepUp.preparation: Stand behind elevated platform and low and close pulley cables to sides. Grasp stirrups at each side of platform. Stand upright with arms straight down at sides.
CBStepUp.execution: Place foot of first leg on elevated platform. Stand on elevated platform by extending hip and knee of first leg and place foot of second leg on bench. Step down with second leg by flexing hip and knee of first leg. Return to original standing position by placing foot of first leg to lower position. Repeat first step with opposite leg alternating first steps between legs.
CBStepUp.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Forward knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Stepping distance from bench emphasizes Gluteus Maximus; stepping close to bench emphasizes Quadriceps.

CBStiffLegDeadlift.name: Cable Stiff Leg Deadlift
CBStiffLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand on elevated platform between two very low pulleys with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp stirrup attachments to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
CBStiffLegDeadlift.execution: Bow forward by bending hips. Bend knees slightly during descent and keep waist straight, flexing low back at bottom. With knees slightly bent, raise torso by extending at waist, then hips, gradually extending knees until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
CBStiffLegDeadlift.comments: Lower back may bend slightly during hip flexion phase. Target muscle is exercised isometrically if lower back does not bend. Begin with light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow adequate

CBStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.name: Cable Straight-back Stiff-leg Deadlift
CBStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand between two very low pulleys with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp stirrup attachments to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
CBStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.execution: With back straight, bow forward by bending hips and bend knees slightly during descent. Raise torso by extending hips while gradually extending knees until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
CBStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.comments: Do not stand behind pulleys. Throughout lift, keep arms and back straight. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings. When finished with set, dismount by lowering weight with knees bent and low back straight. Full range of motion will vary from person to person. Those with

DBLunge.name: Dumbbell Lunge
DBLunge.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides.
DBLunge.execution: Lunge forward with first leg. Land on heel then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by forcibly extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat by alternating lunge with opposite leg.

DBLateralStepUp.name: Dumbbell Lateral Step-up
DBLateralStepUp.preparation: Stand between two benches, one to each side. Hold dumbbells in each hand down to sides
DBLateralStepUp.execution: Lift leg and place foot on bench to side and forward of straight knee. Stand on bench by straightening leg and pushing body upward. Step down returning feet to original position. Repeat with opposite leg alternating between legs.
DBLateralStepUp.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Stepping knee should point same direction as foot. A modest degree of

DBRearLunge.name: Dumbbell Rear Lunge
DBRearLunge.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides.
DBRearLunge.execution: Step back with one leg while bending supporting leg. Plant forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward supporting leg and return rear leg next to supporting leg. Repeat movement with opposite legs alternating between sides.

DBFrontSquat.name: Dumbbell Front Squat
DBFrontSquat.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides. Clean dumbbells up to shoulders so side of each dumbbell rests on top of each shoulder. Balance dumbbells on shoulder by holding on to dumbbells with elbows flaring outward. Position feet shoulder width or slightly narrower apart.
DBFrontSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet.   Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
DBFrontSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight, chest high, and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

DBSideLunge.name: Dumbbell Alternating Side Lunge
DBSideLunge.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides.
DBSideLunge.execution: Lunge to one side with first leg. Position closest dumbbell behind thigh and opposite dumbbell to front. Land on heel then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of lead leg, keeping knee pointed same direction of foot. Return to original standing position by forcibly extending hip and knee of lead leg. Repeat by alternating lunge with opposite leg.
DBSideLunge.comments: Keep torso upright during lunge. Flexible

DBSideLunge2.name: Dumbbell Side Lunge
DBSideLunge2.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides.
DBSideLunge2.execution: Lunge to one side with first leg. Position closest dumbbell behind thigh and opposite dumbbell to front. Land on heel then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of lead leg, keeping knee pointed same direction of foot. Return to original standing position by forcibly extending hip and knee of lead leg. Repeat by

DBSingleLegSplitSquat.name: Dumbbell Single Leg Split Squat
DBSingleLegSplitSquat.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides facing away from bench. Extend leg back and place top of foot on bench.
DBSingleLegSplitSquat.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

DBSquat.name: Dumbbell Squat
DBSquat.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides.
DBSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet.   Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
DBSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

DBStepDown.name: Dumbbell Step Down
DBStepDown.preparation: Hold dumbbells in each hand down to sides and stand with one foot on bench. Position foot on bench to side, forward of straight knee.
DBStepDown.execution: Stand on bench by straightening leg and pushing body upward. Step down returning foot off of bench to floor and repeat. Continue with opposite position.
DBStepDown.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Knee of exercised leg should point same direction as foot. Exercise can also be performed by placing traveling foot onto and off of bench next to foot of exercised leg. See

DBSplitSquat.name: Dumbbell Split Squat
DBSplitSquat.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides. Stand with feet far apart; one foot forward and other foot behind.
DBSplitSquat.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg. Allow heel of rear foot to rise up while knee of rear leg bends slightly until it almost makes contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
DBSplitSquat.comments: Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Heel of rear foot can be kept elevated off floor throughout movement as shown. Keep torso upright during squat;

DBSingleLegSquat.name: Dumbbell Single Leg Squat
DBSingleLegSquat.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides. Balance on one leg with opposite leg extended forward off of ground.
DBSingleLegSquat.execution: Squat down as far as possible while keeping leg elevated off of floor. Keep   supporting knee pointed same direction as foot supporting. Raise body back up to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg is straight. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
DBSingleLegSquat.comments: Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength and

DBSingleLegStiffLegDeadlift.name: Dumbell Single Leg Stiff-leg Deadlift
DBSingleLegStiffLegDeadlift.preparation: Hold dumbbell in each hand. Position dumbbells down in front of upper thighs with arms straight. Stand with feet together. Lift leg slightly so foot is just off floor.
DBSingleLegStiffLegDeadlift.execution: Lower dumbells to floor while raising lifted leg back behind. Keep back straight and knee of supporting leg slightly bend. Keep hip and knee of lifted leg extended throughout movement. Once stretch is felt or dumbells contacts floor, return to original position by raising torso while lowering lifted leg. Straighten knee of supporting leg as torso becomes upright. Repeat.
DBSingleLegStiffLegDeadlift.comments: Throughout lift, keep arms and back straight. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings. Full range of motion will vary from person to person. Those with

DBStepUp.name: Dumbbell Step-up
DBStepUp.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides facing side of bench.
DBStepUp.execution: Place foot of first leg on bench. Stand on bench by extending hip and knee of first leg and place foot of second leg on bench. Step down with second leg by flexing hip and knee of first leg. Return to original standing position by placing foot of first leg to floor. Repeat first step with opposite leg, alternating first steps between legs.
DBStepUp.comments: Keep torso upright during exercise. Forward knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Stepping distance from bench emphasizes Gluteus Maximus; stepping close to bench emphasizes Quadriceps.

DBWalkingLunge.name: Dumbbell Walking Lunge
DBWalkingLunge.preparation: Stand with dumbbells grasped to sides.
DBWalkingLunge.execution: Step forward with first leg. Land on heel then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Stand on forward leg with assistance of rear leg. Lunge forward with opposite leg. Repeat by alternating lunge with opposite legs.

LV45LegPress.name: Lever 45° Leg Press (plate loaded)
LV45LegPress.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place feet slightly high on platform. Extend hips and knees. Release dock lever and grasp handles to sides.
LV45LegPress.execution: Flex hips and knees to lower lever until hips are completely flexed. Push platform by extending knees and hips. Repeat.
LV45LegPress.comments: Adjust safety brace and back support to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to bend at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasize Quadriceps. Also see

LVAlternatingLegPress.name: Lever Alternating Seated Leg Press (plate loaded)
LVAlternatingLegPress.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place feet on slightly high on platform. Grasp handles to sides.
LVAlternatingLegPress.execution: Push one platform away by extending knee and hip. Return to original position. Repeat with opposite leg. Continue by alternating between sides.
LVAlternatingLegPress.comments: Adjust seat and back support to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to bend at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. This exercise may be performed by alternating (as described), simultaneous, or in simultaneous-alternating fashion.

LVAlternatingKneelingHipExtRoll.name: Lever Alternating Kneeling Hip Extension
LVAlternatingKneelingHipExtRoll.preparation: Kneel on lowest (shin) pad with roller pad behind lower thighs. Position midsection on middle pad. Place forearms on padded arm rest and grip handles.
LVAlternatingKneelingHipExtRoll.execution: Keeping one leg on shin pad, extending hip of other leg and push roller pad back. Raise roller pad up until hip is completely extended. Return leg to original position. Repeat with opposite leg. Continue alternating between each side.
LVAlternatingKneelingHipExtRoll.comments: Exercise can be performed with one leg, then other leg. See

LVAlternatingLyingHipExtension.name: Lever Alternating Lying Hip Extension
LVAlternatingLyingHipExtension.execution: Lie on bench with knees legs over pads. Align hip joints with lever fulcrum. Strap hips down with belt. Extend both hips with feet toward floor.

LVAlternatingSingleLegSplitVSquat.name: Lever Alternating Single Leg Split V-Squat
LVAlternatingSingleLegSplitVSquat.preparation: Position shoulders under shoulder pads with back against back pad. Place feet slightly forward on platform. Squeeze hand lever. Keeping hand lever squeezed, squat down by bending hips and knees until hip or knee is short of complete flexion. Release hand lever and raise up on sled just slightly until weight stack is engaged (click is heard). Raise lever by extending knees and hips.
LVAlternatingSingleLegSplitVSquat.execution: Transfer right foot back to inside of rear vertical platform. Lower lever by flexing hips and knees until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Raise lever by extending knees and hips until knee is straight. Return right foot to original position by other foot. Repeat with opposite leg movement and continue alternating between sides.
LVAlternatingSingleLegSplitVSquat.comments: When finished, keep both feet forward and descend lever downward. Squeeze hand lever at bottom of movement to disengage weight stack. Keep hand lever squeezed until sled is raised and legs are straight. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Push with both heel and forefoot. Do not allow forward heel to raise off of platform.

LVAlternatingLyingLegPress.name: Lever Alternating Lying Leg Press
LVAlternatingLyingLegPress.preparation: Lie on machine with shoulder under pads. Place feet slightly high on individual lever platforms. Grasp handles to sides. Push both lever platforms away by extending knees and hips so knees are straight.
LVAlternatingLyingLegPress.execution: Lower one lever platform toward body by bending knee and hip until weight taps or nearly taps unused portion of weight stack. Push lever platform away by extending knee and hip. Repeat with opposite leg. Continue by alternating between sides.
LVAlternatingLyingLegPress.comments: Adjust bench to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to bend at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. This exercise may be performed by alternating (as described), simultaneous, or in simultaneous-alternating fashion.

LVBBRearLunge.name: Lever Barbell Rear Lunge (plate loaded)
LVBBRearLunge.preparation: With bar upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Place feet under bar or slightly forward. Straighten legs so weight is lifted. Disengage bar by rotating bar back. Place feet slightly forward.
LVBBRearLunge.execution: Step back with one leg while bending supporting leg. Plant forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward supporting leg and return rear leg next to supporting leg. Repeat movement with opposite legs alternating between sides.

LVBBSingleLegSplitSquat.name: Lever Barbell Single Leg Split Squat (plate loaded)
LVBBSingleLegSplitSquat.preparation: Place bench behind smith bar. With bar upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Place foot slightly forward under bar. Extend other leg back and place top of foot on bench. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
LVBBSingleLegSplitSquat.execution: Lower body by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

LVBBSplitSquat.name: Lever Barbell Split Squat (plate loaded)
LVBBSplitSquat.preparation: With bar upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Place one foot forward and forefoot of other leg further back. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
LVBBSplitSquat.execution: Lower body on other leg by flexing knees and hips of of both legs until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original straddled position by extending hips and knees of both legs. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

LVBBSquat.name: Lever Barbell Squat (plate loaded)
LVBBSquat.preparation: With bar upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Place feet slightly forward. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
LVBBSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet.   Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
LVBBSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

LVBentOverHipExtension.name: Lever Bent-over Hip Extension
LVBentOverHipExtension.preparation: Step up onto platform. Position belly on wide pad, forearms on padded arm rest, and grip handles. Position bottom of foot on foot lever with lower leg under pad.
LVBentOverHipExtension.execution: Push foot lever back by extending hip. Return leg to original position. Repeat. Reposition and continue with opposite leg.
LVBentOverHipExtension.comments: Stabilizers may not be significantly activated if hips are securely supported by apparatus. Despite apparatus' similarity to rear kick exercise, it is actually hip extension exercise due to the isolated hip movement which is apparent with lack of knee articulation.

LVBentOverRearKick.name: Lever Bent-over Glute Kickback
LVBentOverRearKick.preparation: Lean over padded surface and grasp handles. Bend knee and position foot against lever platform or pedal.
LVBentOverRearKick.execution: Push platform or pedal back by extending leg. Return leg to original position. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

LVDeadlift.name: Lever Deadlift (plate loaded)
LVDeadlift.preparation: Stand between lever handles to sides. Squat down with feet flat and grasp handles to sides.
LVDeadlift.execution: Lift lever by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return weight by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Repeat.
LVDeadlift.comments: Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Exercise can also be performed

LVBentOverRearKickPL.name: Lever Bent-over Glute Kickback (plate loaded)
LVBentOverRearKickPL.preparation: Lean over wide padded area, place forearms on padded arm rest, and grip handles. Bend knee and position foot against lever platform.
LVBentOverRearKickPL.execution: Push platform back by extending leg back. Return leg to original position. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
LVBentOverRearKickPL.comments: Stabilizers may not be significantly activated if hips are securely supported by apparatus.

LVFrontSquatPL.name: Lever Front Squat
LVFrontSquatPL.preparation: Step onto platform facing padded levers. Squat down to place shoulders under padded lever. Place feet shoulder width apart on platform. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Release support lever if it does not disengage by itself.
LVFrontSquatPL.execution: Lower lever by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Lift lever up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Repeat.
LVFrontSquatPL.comments: If available, re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting. Model shown uses foot pedal near base of platform to reengage support lever. Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on platform; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

LVFullSquatPL.name: Lever Full Squat (plate loaded)
LVFullSquatPL.preparation: Squat down to place shoulders under padded lever. Place feet shoulder width apart slightly in front of shoulders. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Release support lever.
LVFullSquatPL.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until knees and hips are fully bent. Lift lever up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Repeat.
LVFullSquatPL.comments: If available, re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting. Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

LVHackPress.name: Lever Hack Press (plate loaded)
LVHackPress.preparation: Sit on seat with back of hips against back pad. Place feet on platform shoulder width or slightly wider. Extend hips and knees. Disengage dock lever if it does not automatically disengage.
LVHackPress.execution: Lower seat by flex hips and knees until either is near complete flexion. Raise seat by extending knees and hips. Repeat.
LVHackPress.comments: When finished, engage dock lever, and lower seat to starting position. If insufficient hip flexibility forces pelvis to pull away from back pad at lower portions of movement, only lower sled just short of spinal articulation. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasize Quadriceps. Also see

LVHipThrustPL.name: Lever Hip Thrust
LVHipThrustPL.preparation: Lie on apperatuse with knees bent and feet on foot platform shoulder width or slightly narrower apart. Position hips just below padded bar or adjustable belt. Lock padded bar or tighten adjustable belt snuggly above hips.
LVHipThrustPL.execution: Raise weight upward by extending hips until straight. Lower and repeat.
LVHipThrustPL.comments: Use resistance which allows full hip extension.

LVHackSquat.name: Lever Hack Squat (plate loaded)
LVHackSquat.preparation: Position shoulders under shoulder pad and back on back pad. Place feet slightly high on platform. Extend hips and knees and release dock lever if available.
LVHackSquat.execution: Lower lever by bending hips and knees, until knees are just short of complete flexion. Raise sled by extending knees and hips. Repeat.
LVHackSquat.comments: If insufficient hip flexibility forces pelvis to pull away from back pad at lower portions of movement, only lower sled just short of spinal articulation. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform. Push with both heel and forefoot. If available, re-engage dock lever in extended position before dismounting. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasize Quadriceps. Also see similar exercise

LVKneelingHipExtension.name: Lever Kneeling Glute Kickback
LVKneelingHipExtension.preparation: Kneel on machine by placing one knee on lower pad. Rest torso on middle pad, place forearms on padded arm rest, and grip handles. Position other foot of other leg up to lever platform.
LVKneelingHipExtension.execution: Push platform back by extending leg back. Return leg to original position and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

LVHipThrust.name: Lever Hip Thrust (on lying leg curl machine)
LVHipThrust.preparation: Sit on floor facing padded roller with back against edge of thigh pad. Position back of shoulders on thigh pad and hips under padded roller. Place feet on floor or slightly elevated platform approximately shoulder width with knees bent. Place hands on roller pad or postion bend arms above chest.
LVHipThrust.execution: Raise padded roller upward by extending hips until straight. Lower and repeat.
LVHipThrust.comments: To increase range of motion, feet can be placed on slightly elevated surface such as aerobic step or Bosa® balance trainer.

LVKneelingHipExtensionRoller.name: Lever Kneeling Hip Extension
LVKneelingHipExtensionRoller.preparation: Kneel on lowest (shin) pad with roller pad behind lower thighs. Position midsection on middle pad. Place forearms on padded arm rest and grip handles.
LVKneelingHipExtensionRoller.execution: Keeping one leg on shin pad, extend hip of other leg and push roller pad back. Raise roller pad up until hip is completely extended. Return leg to original position and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

LVLyingHipExtension.name: Lever Lying Hip Extension
LVLyingHipExtension.preparation: With leg lever positioned in the lower position, lie supine on machine with legs over padded bar. Align hip joints with lever fulcrum. Strap hips down with belt if available. Release leg lever and adjust until leg lever is in upper position. Grasp handles to sides of head.
LVLyingHipExtension.execution: Push padded leg bar down until hips are extended. Return and repeat.

LVLyingHipExtensionH.name: Lever Lying Hip Extension (plate loaded)
LVLyingHipExtensionH.preparation: Lie on bench with knees legs over pads. Align hip joints with lever fulcrum. Strap hips down with belt. Grasp handles at each side.
LVLyingHipExtensionH.execution: Extend hips and knees until legs are straight. Return to original position by flexing hips and knees. Repeat.
LVLyingHipExtensionH.comments: Erector Spinae could be exercised dynamically as a synergist, particularly if

LVLyingLegPress.name: Lever Lying Leg Press (custom - plate loaded)
LVLyingLegPress.preparation: Lie supine on padded platform. Place hands on bars above head or to sides. Place feet flat on lever platform with hips and knees bent.
LVLyingLegPress.execution: Push lever platform by extending hips and knees until knees are straight. Lower lever platform by flexing hips and knees until knees are just short of complete flexion. Repeat.
LVLyingLegPress.comments: Adjust machine to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to rise at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasize Quadriceps. Unique apparatus is designed and built by

LVReverseHyperextension.name: Lever Reverse Hyper-extension (plate loaded)
LVReverseHyperextension.preparation: Place one leg in strap so it is positioned above ankle. Step up onto step built on side of apparatus with other foot. Lay torso and waist on bench and grasp handles. Place stepping foot inside of strap, just in front of leg already in strap. Position legs side by side. Feet should be above floor with legs hanging straight down.
LVReverseHyperextension.execution: Raise lever by extending hips as high as possible with legs nearly straight. Lower legs to original position. Repeat.
LVReverseHyperextension.comments: Taller individuals may be able to place both legs into strap and position torso on bench without using steps. Some individuals may be able to articulate both through the hips and through the lower back (i.e. lumbar spine), in which case, Erector Spinae also becomes synergist. Movement can be performed

LVLyingLegPressH.name: Lever Lying Leg Press (plate loaded)
LVLyingLegPressH.preparation: Climb up steps to top of machine. Lie supine on horizontal padded platform with shoulders against pad. Place feet equally spaced and slightly high on platform. Grip handles above shoulder pads.
LVLyingLegPressH.execution: Push lever platform away by extending hips and knees until knees are straight. Return lever platform by flexing hips and knees until knees are just short of complete flexion or until hips are completely flexed. Repeat.
LVLyingLegPressH.comments: Adjust shoulder pads to allow full range of motion without forcing hips to rise at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Push with both heel and forefoot and do not allow heels to raise off of platform. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasize Quadriceps.

LVRearLunge.name: Lever Rear Lunge (plate loaded)
LVRearLunge.preparation: Stand between lever handles to sides. Squat down with feet flat on floor and grasp lower handles to sides. Lift lever by extending hips and knees to full extension. Position both feet slightly forward.
LVRearLunge.execution: Step back with one leg while bending supporting leg. Plant forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting leg   until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward supporting leg and return rear leg next to supporting leg. Repeat movement with opposite legs alternating between sides.

LVPowerRunnerPL.name: Lever Power Runner (plate loaded)
LVPowerRunnerPL.preparation: Place forefeet into pedals. Squat down and position shoulders forward in padded yoke. Grasp handles to sides. Push one pedal back by extending knee and hip so one leg is straight while the other remains forward.
