LVPowerRunnerPL.execution: Push forward pedal back by extending leg while allowing other pedal to come forward by bending opposite leg. Continue pedalling by alternating between sides.
LVPowerRunnerPL.comments: Adjust yoke position to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to bend at waist. Also see

LVSeatedLegPress.name: Lever Seated Leg Press
LVSeatedLegPress.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place feet slightly high on platform. Grasp handles to sides.
LVSeatedLegPress.execution: Extend knees and hips until knees are fully extended. Return until hips are completely flexed. Repeat.
LVSeatedLegPress.comments: Adjust seat and back support to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to bend at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasize Quadriceps.

LVSeatedLegPressH.name: Lever Seated Leg Press (plate loaded)
LVSeatedLegPressH.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place feet slightly high on platform. Grasp handles to sides.
LVSeatedLegPressH.execution: Push platform(s) away by extending knees and hips until knees are fully extended. Return until hips are completely flexed. Repeat.
LVSeatedLegPressH.comments: Adjust seat and back support to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to bend at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasize Quadriceps.

LVSingleLeg45LegPress.name: Lever Single Leg 45° Leg Press
LVSingleLeg45LegPress.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place one foot mid height to high up on platform. Place outside of resting foot on lower surface with knee positioned out for greater clearance. Push platform up by extending hip and knee. Release dock lever and grasp handles to sides.
LVSingleLeg45LegPress.execution: Lower platform by bending leg until knee is just short of complete flexion. Return by extending knee and hip. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
LVSingleLeg45LegPress.comments: Lower platform enough to achieve full range of motion without forcing pelvis to bend at waist. On exercised leg, keep pointed same direction as foot . Also, do not allow heel to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. For alternative view, see

LVSingleLegLegPress.name: Lever Single Leg Seated Leg Press
LVSingleLegLegPress.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place one foot slightly high on platform and other foot on floor below platform.
LVSingleLegLegPress.execution: Push platform away by extending hip and knee. Return by bending leg until knee or hip is just short of complete flexion. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
LVSingleLegLegPress.comments: Adjust back support back to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing pelvis to bend at waist. Keep knee pointed same direction as foot. Do not allow heel to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot.

LVSingleLegLyingLegPress.name: Lever Single Leg Lying Leg Press (custom - plate loaded)
LVSingleLegLyingLegPress.preparation: Lie supine on padded platform. Place hands on bars above head or to sides. Place one foot on platform and other foot on floor below platform.
LVSingleLegLyingLegPress.execution: Push platform away by extending hip and knee. Return by bending leg until knee or hip is just short of complete flexion. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
LVSingleLegLyingLegPress.comments: Adjust machine to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing pelvis to bend at waist. Keep knee pointed same direction as foot. Do not allow heel to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Unique apparatus is designed and built by

LVSingleLegSplitSquat.name: Lever Single Leg Split Squat (plate loaded)
LVSingleLegSplitSquat.preparation: Stand between lever handles to sides. Extend leg back and place top of foot on cross bar. Squat down and grasp handles to sides.
LVSingleLegSplitSquat.execution: With chest high, lift lever by extending hips and knees to full extension. Return until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

LVSingleLegPressH.name: Lever Single Leg Seated Leg Press (plate loaded)
LVSingleLegPressH.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place one foot slightly high on platform and other foot near floor below platform or off to side.
LVSingleLegPressH.comments: Push platform away by extending hip and knee. Return by bending leg until knee or hip is just short of complete flexion. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

LVSingleLegSplitVSquat.name: Lever Single Leg Split V-Squat
LVSingleLegSplitVSquat.preparation: Position shoulders under shoulder pads with back against back pad. Place one foot forward on platform. Place other foot against rear vertical platform. Squeeze hand lever. Keeping hand lever squeezed, squat down by bending hips and knees until hip or knee is short of complete flexion. Release hand lever and raise up on sled just slightly until weight stack is engaged (click is heard).
LVSingleLegSplitVSquat.execution: Raise lever by extending knees and hips. Lower lever by flexing hips and knees until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg positions.
LVSingleLegSplitVSquat.comments: Squeeze hand lever at bottom of movement to disengage weight stack. Keep hand lever squeezed until sled is raised and legs are straight. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow  forward heel to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot.

LVSingleLegSquat.name: Lever Single Leg Squat (plate loaded)
LVSingleLegSquat.preparation: Stand between handles facing away from fulcrum. Grasp both handles to sides and stand upright. Cross lower leg above knee of supporting leg.
LVSingleLegSquat.execution: Bend knee forward slightly while allowing hips to bend back behind, keeping back straight and knee pointed same direction of foot. Squat down as low as possible. Extend knee and hip until leg is straight. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
LVSingleLegSquat.comments: Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength and

LVSingleLegStandingLegPress.name: Lever Standing Glute Kickback
LVSingleLegStandingLegPress.preparation: Step on left platform with left foot. Grasp handle bars to each side. Place right foot on highest lever platform.
LVSingleLegStandingLegPress.execution: Push platform down by extending leg until straight. Return leg to original position. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg positions.
LVSingleLegStandingLegPress.comments: With greater resistances, more effort is required to pull on handle bars to keep body from rising upward.

LVSingleLegVSquat.name: Lever Split V-Squat
LVSingleLegVSquat.preparation: Position shoulders under shoulder pads with back against back pad. Place feet on platform, shoulder or hip width apart, slightly forward. Squeeze hand lever. Keeping hand lever squeezed, squat down by bending hips and knees until knees or hips are just short of complete flexion. Release hand lever and raise up on sled just slightly until weight stack is engaged (click is heard). Raise sled by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Place one leg back behind platform with toes pointed downward over floor.
LVSingleLegVSquat.execution: Squat down with knee pointed same direction as foot. Allow leg to bend behind with forefoot on floor. Descend until forward hip is near complete flexion. Raise sled by extending knee and hip until leg is straight. Repeat. Continue with other leg.
LVSingleLegVSquat.comments: Squeeze hand lever at bottom of movement to disengage weight stack. Keep hand lever squeezed until sled is raised and leg is straight. If insufficient hip flexibility forces pelvis to pull away from back pad at lower portions of movement, only lower sled just short of spinal articulation. Keep knee pointed same directions as foot. Do not allow heel to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly forward on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly back on platform emphasize Quadriceps. See manufacturer's suggested foot placement for

LVSlidingSplitSquatPL.name: Lever Sliding Split Squat (plate loaded)
LVSlidingSplitSquatPL.preparation: Stand with one foot on stationary platform under foot pad and other foot back on sliding platform. Squat down and grasp handles to sides. Stand upright with arms straight to sides.
LVSlidingSplitSquatPL.execution: Lower lever downward by sliding platform back and squatting down on forward leg. Keep chest high as hips descend to knee height. Lift sliding forward and extending hips and knee to full extension. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.

LVSplitSquat.name: Lever Split Squat (plate loaded)
LVSplitSquat.preparation: Stand between lever handles to sides. Place forefoot of one foot on floor to rear and other foot slightly forward. Squat down and grasp handles to sides.
LVSplitSquat.execution: With chest high, lift lever by extending hips and knees to full extension. Return until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

LVSquatPL.name: Lever Squat (plate loaded)
LVSquatPL.preparation: Squat down to place shoulders under padded lever. Place feet shoulder width apart slightly in front of shoulders. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Release support lever.
LVSquatPL.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend by bending knees and hip until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Lift lever up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Repeat.
LVSquatPL.comments: If available, re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting. Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

LVSquat.name: Lever Squat
LVSquat.preparation: Squat down to place shoulders under padded lever. Place feet shoulder width apart slightly in front of shoulders.
LVSquat.execution: Raise lever up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Return and repeat.
LVSquat.comments: Lever height should be adjusted to accommodate full range, allowing hips to descend same height or slightly lower than knees. Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

LVStandingHipExtension.name: Lever Standing Hip Extension
LVStandingHipExtension.preparation: Stand on platform facing to one side and grasp bar for support. Place leg nearest machine on padded roller while standing on other leg.
LVStandingHipExtension.execution: Lower lever by extending hip. Return until knee is higher than hip. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

LVSquatPL3.name: Lever Squat (plate loaded)
LVSquatPL3.preparation: Squat down to place shoulders under padded lever. Place feet shoulder width or marginally wider apart, slightly in front of shoulders. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Release support lever.
LVSquatPL3.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend by bending knees and hip until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Lift lever up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Repeat.
LVSquatPL3.comments: If available, re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting. Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

LVStandingHipExtensionTech.name: Lever Standing Hip Extension (with abdominal pad)
LVStandingHipExtensionTech.preparation: Stand on platform so front of hips are against edge of abdominal pad. Position flexed leg over padded roller while standing on other leg. Grasp handles with both hands.
LVStandingHipExtensionTech.execution: Extend lever back by extending hip and straightening leg. Return by flexing hip and knee. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
LVStandingHipExtensionTech.comments: Shorter individuals should stand on higher platform and may be bent over more. Stabilizers may not be significantly activated if hips are securely supported by apparatus.

LVStiffLegDeadlift.name: Lever Stiff Leg Deadlift (plate loaded)
LVStiffLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand between lever handles with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp handles to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
LVStiffLegDeadlift.execution: Bow forward by bending hips. Bend knees slightly during descent and keep waist straight, flexing low back at bottom. With knees slightly bent, raise torso by extending at waist, then hips, gradually extending knees until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
LVStiffLegDeadlift.comments: Lower back may bend slightly during hip flexion phase. Target muscle is exercised isometrically if lower back does not bend. Begin with light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow adequate

LVStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.name: Lever Straight-back Stiff-leg Deadlift (plate loaded)
LVStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand between lever handles with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp handles to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
LVStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.execution: With back straight, bow forward by bending hips and bend knees slightly during descent. Raise torso by extending hips while gradually extending knees until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
LVStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.comments: Do not stand behind handles. Throughout lift, keep arms and back straight. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch throughout hamstrings. When finished with set, dismount by lowering weight with knees bent and low back straight. Full range of motion will vary from person to person. Those with

LVVSquat.name: Lever V-Squat
LVVSquat.preparation: Position shoulders under shoulder pads with back against back pad. Place feet on platform, shoulder or hip width apart. Squeeze hand lever. Keeping hand lever squeezed, squat down by bending hips and knees until knees or hips are just short of complete flexion. Release hand lever and raise up on sled just slightly until weight stack is engaged (click is heard).
LVVSquat.execution: Raise lever by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Squat down with knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until knees or hips are near complete flexion. Repeat.
LVVSquat.comments: Squeeze hand lever at bottom of movement to disengage weight stack. Keep hand lever squeezed until sled is raised and legs are straight. If insufficient hip flexibility forces pelvis to pull away from back pad at lower portions of movement, only lower sled just short of spinal articulation. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly forward on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly back on platform emphasize Quadriceps.

LVVSquatH.name: Lever V-Squat (plate loaded)
LVVSquatH.preparation: Position shoulders under shoulder pads with back against back pad. Place feet on platform, shoulder or hip width apart. Extend hips and knees and release lever if available.
LVVSquatH.execution: Bend knees forward slightly while allowing hips to bend back behind, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until hips are just short of complete flexion. Raise sled by extending knees and hips. Repeat.
LVVSquatH.comments: If available, re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting. If insufficient hip flexibility forces pelvis to pull away from back pad at lower portions of movement, only lower sled just short of spinal articulation. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform. Push with both heel and forefoot. Also see

LungeAndRearLunge.name: Barbell Alternating Lunge & Rear Lunge
LungeAndRearLunge.preparation: Stand facing rack with barbell at upper chest height and short platform behind. Position bar on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides. Dismount bar from rack and step back. Stand with feet slightly narrower than shoulder width apart.
LungeAndRearLunge.execution: Lunge forward with right leg. Land on heel, then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of right front leg until knee of rear left leg is almost in contact with floor. Forcibly extending hip and knee of forward right leg to return to original standing position.
LungeAndRearLunge.comments: Step back with right leg while bending supporting left leg. Plant right forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting left leg until knee of rear right leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of supporting left leg and return rear right leg next to supporting leg. Repeat movement with opposite legs alternating between sides.

LungeRearLunge.name: Barbell Alternating Lunge To Rear Lunge
LungeRearLunge.preparation: Stand facing rack with barbell at upper chest height and short platform behind. Position bar on back of shoulders and grasp barbell to sides. Dismount bar from rack and step back. Stand with feet slightly narrower than shoulder width apart.
LungeRearLunge.execution: Lunge forward with right leg. Land on heel, then forefoot. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of right front leg until knee of rear left leg is almost in contact with floor. Forcibly extending hip and knee of forward right leg to return to upright position. Instead of returning right foot to side of left foot, instead continue to step back with right leg while bending supporting left leg. Plant right forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting left leg until knee of rear right leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to standing position by extending hip and knee of supporting left leg and return rear right leg next to supporting leg. Repeat movement with opposite legs alternating between sides.

SBSquat.name: Safety Barbell Squat
SBSquat.preparation: Standing facing safety barbell on rack upper chest height. Position head in yoke with padded bar around shoulders. Hands can be placed on ends of yoke (as shown) or on safety bar out to sides. Dismount bar from rack and step back.
SBSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend slightly forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Stand by extending hips and knees until legs are straight. Repeat.
SBSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Exercise can also be performed

SBSquatHandles.name: Safety Barbell Squat (long handles)
SBSquatHandles.preparation: Standing facing safety barbell on rack upper chest height. Position head in yoke with padded bar around shoulders. Grasp ends of handles. Dismount bar from rack and step back.
SBSquatHandles.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend slightly forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Stand with or without assistance of arms, extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Repeat.
SBSquatHandles.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Exercise can also be performed

SBSquatSelfSpot.name: Safety Barbell Squat (self-spotting)
SBSquatSelfSpot.execution: Stand facing safety barbell on rack upper chest height. Place hands vertical rack supports. Position head in yoke with padded bar around shoulders. Dismount bar from rack and step back so body is upright at arms length from supports.

SL45LegPress.name: Sled 45° Leg Press
SL45LegPress.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place feet slightly high on platform. Extend hips and knees. Release dock lever and grasp handles to sides.
SL45LegPress.execution: Lower sled by flexing hips and knees until knees are just short of complete flexion or until hips are completely flexed. Return by extending knees and hips. Repeat.
SL45LegPress.comments: Adjust safety brace and back support to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to bend at waist. A wide stance may allow for deeper range of motion as shown. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasize Quadriceps. See exercise performed on

SLAlternating45LegPress.name: Sled Alternating 45° Leg Press
SLAlternating45LegPress.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place feet slightly high on individual platforms. Grasp handles to sides. Push both platforms away by extending knees and hips so knees are straight. Release dock lever and grasp handles to sides.
SLAlternating45LegPress.execution: Lower one platform toward body by bending knee and hip until knees are just short of complete flexion or until hips are completely flexed. Push platform away by extending knee and hip. Repeat with opposite leg. Continue by alternating between sides.
SLAlternating45LegPress.comments: Adjust safety brace and back support to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to bend at waist. Wide stance may allow for deeper range of motion. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasize Quadriceps. See exercise performed

SLHackPress.name: Sled Hack Press
SLHackPress.preparation: Sit on sled with back of hips against back pad. Place feet on platform shoulder width or slightly wider. Extend hips and knees. Release dock lever(s).
SLHackPress.execution: Lower sled by flexing hips and knees until either is near complete flexion. Raise sled by extending knees and hips. Repeat.
SLHackPress.comments: If available, re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting. If insufficient hip flexibility forces pelvis to pull away from back pad at lower portions of movement, only lower sled just short of spinal articulation. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasize Quadriceps.

SLHackSquat.name: Sled Hack Squat
SLHackSquat.preparation: Lie supine on platform with shoulders against pad. Place feet high up on platform. Extend hips and knees. Release dock levers.
SLHackSquat.execution: Lower sled by flexing hips and knees until hips are completely flexed. Raise sled by extending knees and hips. Repeat.
SLHackSquat.comments: If available, re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting. If insufficient hip flexibility forces pelvis to pull away from back pad at lower portions of movement, only lower sled just short of spinal articulation. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasize Quadriceps.

SLKneelingHipExtension.name: Sled Kneeling Glute Kickback
SLKneelingHipExtension.preparation: Kneel on machine by placing knees on lower pad and feet against bars to rear, if available. Place forearms on padded armrest, and grip handles. Position one foot up so middle of sole is positioned under foot bar.
SLKneelingHipExtension.execution: Push foot bar up by extending leg   back as far as possible. Return leg to original position and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

SLLyingLegPress.name: Sled Lying Leg Press
SLLyingLegPress.preparation: Lie supine on platform with shoulders against pad. Place feet slightly high on platform.
SLLyingLegPress.execution: Extend hips and knees. Return until hips are completely flexed. Repeat.
SLLyingLegPress.comments: Adjust machine to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to rise at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot.

SLLyingLegPressPL.name: Sled Lying Leg Press (plate loaded)
SLLyingLegPressPL.preparation: Lie supine on platform with shoulders against pad. Place feet slightly high on platform. Extend hips and knees. Release dock lever and grasp handles to sides.
SLLyingLegPressPL.execution: Bring sled toward platform by flexing hips and knees until knees are just short of complete flexion or until hips are completely flexed. Return by extending knees and hips. Repeat.
SLLyingLegPressPL.comments: If available, re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting. Allow for full range of motion without forcing hips to rise at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasize Quadriceps.

SLRearLunge.name: Sled Rear Lunge
SLRearLunge.preparation: Position shoulders under padded bars handles. Place feet under bar or just slightly forward. Straighten legs so weight is lifted. Disengage dock lever(s) if available. Place feet slightly forward.
SLRearLunge.execution: Step back with one leg while bending supporting leg. Plant forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward supporting leg and return rear leg next to supporting leg. Repeat movement with opposite legs, alternating between sides.
SLRearLunge.comments: If available, re-engage dock lever(s) in extended position before dismounting. Keep torso upright during lunge;

SLSeatedLegPress.name: Sled Seated Leg Press
SLSeatedLegPress.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place feet slightly high on platform. Grasp handles to sides.
SLSeatedLegPress.execution: Extend knees and hips until knees are fully extended. Return until hips are completely flexed. Repeat.
SLSeatedLegPress.comments: Adjust seat and back support to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing hips to bend at waist. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing feet slightly high on platform emphasize Gluteus Maximus. Placing feet slightly lower on platform emphasize Quadriceps.

SLSingleLeg45LegPress.name: Sled Single Leg 45° Leg Press
SLSingleLeg45LegPress.preparation: Sit on machine with back on padded support. Place one foot high up on platform and other foot on floor below platform. Extend hip and knee. Release dock lever and grasp handles to sides.
SLSingleLeg45LegPress.execution: Lower sled by bending leg until knee is just short of complete flexion. Return by extending knee and hip. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
SLSingleLeg45LegPress.comments: Adjust safety brace and back support to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing pelvis to bend at waist. Keep knee pointed same direction as foot. Do not allow heel to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot.

SLSingleLegLyingLegPress.name: Sled Single Leg Lying Leg Press
SLSingleLegLyingLegPress.preparation: Lie supine on platform with shoulders against pad. Place foot slightly high on platform. Position other leg with lower leg parallel to platform.
SLSingleLegLyingLegPress.execution: Push platform by extending knee and hip until knee is straight. Return by bending hip and knee of supporting leg until knee is just short of complete flexion or until hip is completely flexed. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
SLSingleLegLyingLegPress.comments: Allow for full range of motion without forcing hips to bend at waist. Keep knee pointed same directions as foot. Do not allow heel to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing foot slightly high on platform emphasizes Gluteus Maximus. Placing foot slightly lower on platform emphasizes Quadriceps.

SLSingleLegHackSquat.name: Sled Single Leg Hack Squat
SLSingleLegHackSquat.preparation: Lie supine on platform with shoulders against pad. Place feet high up on platform. Extend hips and knees. Cross lower leg above knee of supporting leg. Release dock lever(s).
SLSingleLegHackSquat.execution: Lower sled by flexing hips and knee of supporting leg until knees are just short of complete flexion. Raise sled by extending knee and hips. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
SLSingleLegHackSquat.comments: If available, re-engage dock lever(s) in extended position before dismounting. Adjust machine to accommodate near full range of motion without forcing pelvis to rise at waist. Keep knee pointed same direction as feet. Do not allow heel to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot.

SLSingleLegLyingLegPressPL.name: Sled Single Leg Lying Leg Press (plate loaded)
SLSingleLegLyingLegPressPL.preparation: Lie supine on platform with shoulders against pad. Place feet slightly high on platform. Prop one leg up, on support if available. Extend hip and knee of leg positioned on platform. Release dock lever and grasp handles to sides if available.
SLSingleLegLyingLegPressPL.execution: Bring sled toward platform by flexing hip and knee of supporting leg until knee is just short of complete flexion or until hip is completely flexed. Return by extending knee and hip. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
SLSingleLegLyingLegPressPL.comments: If available, re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting. Allow for full range of motion without forcing hips to rise at waist. Keep knee pointed same directions as foot. Do not allow heel to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot. Placing foot slightly high on platform emphasizes Gluteus Maximus. Placing foot slightly lower on platform emphasizes Quadriceps.

SLSquat.name: Sled Squat
SLSquat.preparation: Squat down to place shoulders under padded bars. Lean back against back pad if available. Place feet shoulder width apart, slightly in front of shoulders.
SLSquat.execution: If hand or lever lock is available, disengage weight, squat to lowest position and re-engage lock. Lift sled by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Lower sled by bending knees forward slightly while allowing hips to bend back behind, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Return and repeat.
SLSquat.comments: On apparatuses with hand or lever lock, return sled to very bottom, disengage weight, return sled to mid-upper position, and re-engage weight before stepping out. Some Sled Squat apparatuses have back pads like the one shown, whereas,

SLSingleLegVerticalLegPress.name: Sled Single Leg Vertical Leg Press
SLSingleLegVerticalLegPress.preparation: Lie on declined back pad with hips under weighted sled. Place both feet on platform. Raise weight by extending hips and knees. Place foot down off of foot platform. Release dock levers and grasp handles to sides.
SLSingleLegVerticalLegPress.execution: Lower sled by flexing leg until knees are just short of complete flexion or just before hips raise up from pad. Push weight up by extending knee and hip. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.
SLSingleLegVerticalLegPress.comments: Re-engage support lever in extended position before dismounting.

SLStandingHipExtension.name: Sled Standing Glute Kickback
SLStandingHipExtension.preparation: Straddle sled and place foot on pedal. Place chest on pad and grasp handles.
SLStandingHipExtension.execution: Push platform back by extending leg   back until straight. Return leg to original position. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

SLVerticalLegPress.name: Sled Vertical Leg Press
SLVerticalLegPress.preparation: Lie on declined back pad with hips under weighted sled. Place feet on platform. Raise weight by extending hips and knees. Release dock levers and grasp handles to sides.
SLVerticalLegPress.execution: Lower sled by flexing hips and knees until knees are just short of complete flexion or just before hips raise up from pad. Return by extending knees and hips. Repeat.
SLVerticalLegPress.comments: is required for fuller range of motion through knee. Lower weight just short of hips, leaving back support. Keep knees pointed same directions as feet. Do not allow heels to raise off of platform, pushing with both heel and forefoot, or center of feet if platform is shorter than length of feet.

SMBentKneeGoodMorning.name: Smith Bent Knee Good-morning
SMBentKneeGoodMorning.preparation: Position bar on back of shoulders. Disengage bar by rotating bar back. Grasp bar to sides.
SMBentKneeGoodMorning.execution: Bend hips to lower torso forward until parallel to floor. Bend knees slightly during descent. Raise torso until hips are extended. Repeat.
SMBentKneeGoodMorning.comments: Begin with light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow adequate

SMFrontSquat.name: Smith Front Squat
SMFrontSquat.preparation: With bar upper chest height, grasp bar with overhand shoulder width grip. Position bar on front of shoulders with elbows forward and wrists hyperextended. Place feet slightly forward. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
SMFrontSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward   , keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
SMFrontSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefeet and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Also see

SMDeadlift.name: Smith Deadlift
SMDeadlift.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance with feet flat beneath bar. Grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider mixed grip or slightly wider. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
SMDeadlift.execution: Return weight toward floor by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return and repeat.
SMDeadlift.comments: Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Keep bar close to body to improve mechanical leverage. See

SMHackSquat.name: Smith Hack Squat
SMHackSquat.preparation: Stand with back of thighs or gluteus against bar. Grasp bar from behind with overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
SMHackSquat.execution: Squat down by bending knees forward while allowing hips to bend back behind, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are too close to parallel to floor and bar is behind lower leg. Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Repeat.
SMHackSquat.comments: Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

SMRearLunge.name: Smith Rear Lunge
SMRearLunge.preparation: With bar upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Place feet under bar or slightly forward. Straighten legs so weight is lifted. Disengage bar by rotating bar back. Place feet slightly forward.
SMRearLunge.execution: Step back with one leg while bending supporting leg. Plant forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward supporting leg and return rear leg next to supporting leg. Repeat movement with opposite legs, alternating between sides.

SMSingleLegSplitSquat.name: Smith Single Leg Split Squat
SMSingleLegSplitSquat.preparation: Place bench behind smith bar. With bar upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Place foot slightly forward under bar. Extend other leg back and place top of foot on bench. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
SMSingleLegSplitSquat.execution: Lower body by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

SMSingleLegSquat.name: Smith Single Leg Squat
SMSingleLegSquat.execution: With bar upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Place feet slightly forward and cross lower leg above knee of supporting leg. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
SMSingleLegSquat.comments: Bend knee slightly forward while allowing hips to bend, keeping back straight and knee pointed same direction of foot. Descend until thigh of supporting leg is just past parallel to floor. Extend knee and hip until leg is straight. Return and repeat.

SMSplitSquat.name: Smith Split Squat
SMSplitSquat.preparation: With bar upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Place one foot forward and forefoot of other leg further back. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
SMSplitSquat.execution: Lower body on other leg by flexing knees and hips of both legs until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original straddled position by extending hips and knees of both legs. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

SMSquat.name: Smith Squat
SMSquat.preparation: With bar upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Place feet slightly forward. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
SMSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet.   Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
SMSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

SMStiffLegDeadlift.name: Smith Stiff Leg Deadlift
SMStiffLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance on elevated platform with thigh against bar. Grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
SMStiffLegDeadlift.execution: With knees slightly bent, lower bar toward top of feet by bending hips. Keep waist straight, flexing only slightly at bottom. Lift bar by extending at hips until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Extend knees at top if desired. Repeat.
SMStiffLegDeadlift.comments: Lower back may bend slightly during full hip flexion. Target muscle is exercised isometrically if lower back does not bend. Begin with light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow adequate

SMStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.name: Smith Straight-back Stiff-leg Deadlift
SMStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance with thigh against bar. Grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
SMStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.execution: With knees bent, lower bar toward top feet by bending hips and keeping waist straight. Lift bar by extending at hips until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Extend knees at top if desired. Repeat.
SMStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.comments: Throughout lift, keep arms and back straight. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch. Full range of motion will vary from person to person depending on

SMWideSquat.name: Smith Wide Squat
SMWideSquat.preparation: With bar upper chest height, position bar on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides. Place feet wide, pointing outward 45° to 30°. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
SMWideSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
SMWideSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

STHipBridge.name: Suspended Hip Bridge
STHipBridge.preparation: Sit on floor facing suspension trainer loops in low position. Grasp bottom of loops, then lay supine. Raise legs and place heels in loops with soles contacting handles. Lie down supine on mat so knees and hips are bent with suspension straps hanging vertical. Place arms off to sides.
STHipBridge.execution: Raise hips up by extending hips until fully extended. Lower hips until hips and back make contact with mat. Repeat.

STSingleLegSplitSquatSelfAss.name: Suspended Single Leg Split Squat (self-assisted)
STSingleLegSplitSquatSelfAss.preparation: Grasp one or both suspension trainer handle(s) in lower position hanging. Stand facing   nearby fixed support and hold with one hand for balance. With other hand, secure foot in loop(s) from behind while balancing on one leg. With both hands, hold lightly on fixed support for balance and minimal assistance if needed.
STSingleLegSplitSquatSelfAss.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of supporting leg. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.

STSingleLegSquat.name: Suspended Single Leg Squat
STSingleLegSquat.preparation: Grasp suspension handles and momentarily step back until arms are extended forward and straight. While keeping arms straight and shoulders back, step forward so body reclines back behind suspension handles. Position body and legs straight at desired angle hanging from handles with arms straight. Balance on one leg with opposite leg extended forward off of ground.
STSingleLegSquat.execution: Squat down as far as possible while keeping leg elevated off of floor. Keep supporting knee pointed same direction as foot supporting. Raise body back, up to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg is straight. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.
STSingleLegSquat.comments: Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Dismounting can be achieved by placing elevated leg down and walking backward until body is upright. This exercise can be performed on TRXⓇ style suspension trainer or adjustable length gymnastics rings. Also known as Suspended Pistol Squat.

STSplitSquat.name: Suspended Single Leg Split Squat
STSplitSquat.preparation: Grasp one or both suspension trainer handle(s) in lower position. Step and face away from suspension trainers. Balance on one leg while raising foot from behind and slipping single foot in loop(s). Release handle with hand and position leg back so it is supported behind body by suspension trainer. Place hands on hips and maintain balance throughout exercise.
STSplitSquat.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

TBDeadlift.name: Trap Bar Deadlift
TBDeadlift.preparation: Stand with feet shoulder width or narrower in trap bar, weight to each side. Squat down with feet flat and grasp handles to sides.
TBDeadlift.execution: Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return weight to floor by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Repeat.
TBDeadlift.comments: Throughout lift, keep hips low, shoulders high, arms and back straight. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

STSquat.name: Suspended Reclining Squat
STSquat.preparation: Stand in front of suspension trainer handles positioned at height of upper abdomen to lower chest. Grasp suspension trainer handles and step back with arms extended forward until suspension straps are taut. While leaning back, step forward with both feet. Recline back with feet apart with arms and body straight.
STSquat.execution: While reclined back and holding onto suspension trainer handles, squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward while keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are perpendicular to body's angle of movement. Stand up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Return to reclined standing position with body straight. Repeat.
STSquat.comments: Apply equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

TBSquat.name: Trap Bar Squat
TBSquat.preparation: Stand on platform under loaded trap bar. Squat down until thighs are just past parallel to floor with knees pointed same direction as feet and feet flat on platform. Grasp handles to sides. Posture chest up with back arched tightly.
TBSquat.execution: Lift weight upward by extending knees and hips until straight. Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded. Return weight to floor by bending hips back, while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Repeat.
TBSquat.comments: An inverted squared open-ended trap bar is used in this demonstration. Keep head facing forward, back straight and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

TBStiffLegDeadlift.name: Trap Bar Stiff Leg Deadlift
TBStiffLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand on platform under loaded trap bar. Squat down and grasp handles to sides.

TBStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.name: Trap Bar Straight-back Stiff-leg Deadlift
TBStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with feet shoulder width or narrower in trap bar, weight to each side. Squat down with feet flat and grasp handles to sides.
TBStrBackStiffLegDeadlift.comments: With back straight, lower bar toward floor by bending at hips. Bend knees slightly during descent and keep waist straight. Place weight onto floor. With knees still bent, lift bar by extending at hips until standing upright. Pull shoulders back if rounded. Extend knees at top if desired. Repeat.

WTFrontSquat.name: Weighted Front Squat
WTFrontSquat.preparation: Stand with feet shoulder width or slightly narrower apart. Holding weight plate upper chest height with both hands.
WTFrontSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
WTFrontSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight, chest high, and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

WtReverseHyperextension.name: Weighted Reverse Hyper-extension
WtReverseHyperextension.preparation: Place sandbag or medicine ball between ankles. Lay torso and waist on bench and grasp handles. Feet should be above floor with legs straight.
WtReverseHyperextension.execution: Raise weight by extending hips as high as possible until legs are nearly straight. Lower legs to original position. Repeat.

WtSingleLegSquat.name: Weighted Single Leg Squat
WtSingleLegSquat.preparation: Stand with arms extended out in front, holding medicine ball or weight plate. Balance on one leg with opposite leg extended forward off of ground.
WtSingleLegSquat.execution: Squat down as far as possible while keeping leg elevated off of floor. Keep supporting knee pointed same direction as foot supporting. Raise body back up to original position until knee and hip of supporting leg is straight. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
WtSingleLegSquat.comments: Supporting knee should point same direction as foot throughout movement. Range of motion will be improved with greater leg strength and

WtSquat.name: Weighted Belt Squat
WtSquat.preparation: Place weight on dip belt around waist. Step up onto boxes or benches spaced apart; foot on each bench. Arms can be extended forward throughout exercise.
WtSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward slightly, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet.   Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Squat up by extending knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
WtSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight, chest high, and feet flat on surface; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

ASHamstringRaiseSelf.name: Self-assisted Inverse Leg Curl
ASHamstringRaiseSelf.preparation: Place elevated platform in front of glute-hamstring apparatus. Adjust padded supports and kneel upright in apparatus. Position knees against large roller pad or near-upper side of padded hump (depending on model), ankles between padded supports, and feet on platform.
ASHamstringRaiseSelf.execution: Lower body with hips straight by slowly straightening knees. Position hands forward, ready to push body weight back up off of surface. Control descent only with hamstrings as low as possible before catching body by quickly placing hands on elevated platform and rapidly pushing off against platform, just enough to assist hamstrings in raising body upward. Return to upright kneeling position and repeat.
ASHamstringRaiseSelf.comments: This movement is also known as Self-assisted Hamstring Raise. To keep exercise challenging, push off only hard enough to minimally assist raising of body with hamstrings only.

ASHamstringRaiseSelfFloor.name: Self-assisted Inverse Leg Curl (on floor)
ASHamstringRaiseSelfFloor.preparation: Kneel on floor. Position ankles under fixed bar or pad and knees on thick dense pad. Kneel upright with hips straight. Extend arms out to sides with elbow pointing back and slightly bent. Position hands slightly forward with palms facing forward or slightly toward floor.
ASHamstringRaiseSelfFloor.execution: Lower body with hips straight by slowly straightening knees. Control descent only with hamstrings as low as possible. Only when body begins to fall, touch down with tensed finger tips out to each side. Once fingers make contact with floor, control remaining descent with assistance of arms. Allowing chest to come very close to floor, rapidly push off against floor, again just enough to assist hamstrings in raising body upward. Return to upright kneeling position and repeat.
ASHamstringRaiseSelfFloor.comments: This movement is also known as Self-assisted Hamstring Raise on Floor. Bar or pad height should be only just high enough to position ankles underneath, allowing room for vertical orientation of feet with toes on floor.

ASInverseLegCurlBands.name: Band-assisted Inverse Leg Curl
ASInverseLegCurlBands.preparation: Place resistance band around each shoulder with other end anchored to bar just behind head or shoulders. Position arms behind hips or crossed on chest.
ASInverseLegCurlBands.execution: This is an advanced exercise performed on Glute Ham Raise Apparatus. This movement is also known as Band-assisted Hamstring Raise.

BB45HipExtension.name: Barbell 45° Back Raise (on hyperextension apparatus)
BB45HipExtension.preparation: Position thighs prone on upper padding of 45-degree hyper-extension apparatus. Hook heels on platform lip or under padded brace. Place barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides.
BB45HipExtension.execution: Lower body by bending hips until fully flexed. Raise or extend hips until torso is parallel to legs. Repeat.
BB45HipExtension.comments: Position pad high enough to evenly distribute body weight on thigh but not so high that range of motion is limited; abdomen should not press on top side of pad when upper body is lowered.

BB45Hyperextension.name: Barbell 45° Hyperextension
BB45Hyperextension.preparation: Position thighs prone on padding. Hook heels on platform lip or under padded brace. Place barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides.
BB45Hyperextension.execution: Raise upper body until hip and waist are fully extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until fully flexed. Repeat.
BB45Hyperextension.comments: Position pad high enough to evenly distribute body weight on thigh but not so high that range of motion is limited; abdomen should not press on top side of pad when upper body is lowered.

BBGluteHamRaise.name: Barbell Glute-Ham Raise
BBGluteHamRaise.preparation: Place ankles between ankle roller pads with feet on vertical platform and position knees on pad with lower thighs against large padded hump. If barbell can safely be placed on horizontal handles, grasp barbell in upright position and place behind shoulders. If barbell is placed on floor, lower torso by extending knees and flexing hips, then position barbell on back of shoulders. Grasp bar to sides.
BBGluteHamRaise.execution: From lower position, raise torso by extending hips until fully extended. Continue to raise body by flexing knees until body is upright. Lower body by straightening knees until body is horizontal. Continue to lower torso by bending hips until body is upside down. Repeat.

BBGoodMorning.name: Barbell Good-morning
BBGoodMorning.preparation: Position barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides.
BBGoodMorning.execution: Keeping back straight, bend hips to lower torso forward until parallel to floor. Raise torso until hips are extended. Repeat.
BBGoodMorning.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow adequate

BBHamstringRaise.name: Barbell Inverse Leg Curl
BBHamstringRaise.preparation: Adjust padded supports and kneel upright in apparatus. Position knees against large roller pad or near-upper side of padded hump, ankles between padded supports, and feet on platform. Place barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides.
BBHamstringRaise.execution: Lower body until horizontal by straightening knees. Raise body by flexing knees only allowing hips to bend slightly. Repeat.
BBHamstringRaise.comments: This is an advanced exercise performed on Glute Ham Raise Apparatus. This movement is also known as Barbell Hamstring Raise. Exercise can be performed

BBHipExtension.name: Barbell Back Raise (on hyperextension apparatus)
BBHipExtension.preparation: Stand in hyper-extension apparatus. Position thighs prone on large pad and lower leg under padded bar. Place barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides.
BBHipExtension.execution: Lower body by bending hips until fully flexed. Raise, or extend hips until torso is parallel to legs. Repeat.
BBHipExtension.comments: Adjust lower leg brace so pressure is evenly distributed on thigh pad.

BBHyperextension.name: Barbell Hyperextension
BBHyperextension.preparation: Position thighs prone on large pad and lower leg under padded brace. Place barbell on back of shoulders and grasp bar to sides.
BBHyperextension.execution: Raise upper body until hip and waist are fully extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until fully flexed. Repeat.
BBHyperextension.comments: Adjust lower leg brace so pressure is evenly distributed on thigh pad. Begin with body weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

BBStrBackStrLegDeadlift.name: Barbell Straight-back Straight-leg Deadlift
BBStrBackStrLegDeadlift.execution: from floor with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand or mixed grip. Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance.
BBStrBackStrLegDeadlift.comments: With knees and back straight, lower bar by bending hips until hamstrings are tight, or just before lower back bends. Lift bar by extending hips until upright. Pull shoulders slightly back at top of lift if rounded. Repeat.

BBStraightLegDeadlift.name: Barbell Straight Leg Deadlift
BBStraightLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance on shallow platform with feet flat beneath bar. Bend knees and bend over with lower back straight. Grasp barbell with shoulder width overhand or mixed grip, shoulder width or slightly wider. Lift weight to standing position.
BBStraightLegDeadlift.execution: With knees straight, lower bar toward top of feet by bending hips. After hips can no longer flex, bend waist as bar approaches top of feet. Lift bar by extending waist and hip until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
BBStraightLegDeadlift.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

BWBallLegCurl.name: Straight Hip Leg Curl (on stability ball)
BWBallLegCurl.preparation: Lie supine on floor with lower legs on exercise ball. Extended arms out to sides. Straighten low back, knees, and hips, raising back and hips off of floor.
BWBallLegCurl.execution: Keeping hips and low back straight, bend knees, pulling heels toward rear end. Allow feet to rollup on to ball. Lower to original position by straightening knees. Repeat.

BWBallSingleLegStraightHipLegCurl.name: Single Leg Straight Hip Leg Curl (on stability ball)
BWBallSingleLegStraightHipLegCurl.preparation: Lie supine on floor with lower legs on exercise ball. Extended arms out to sides. Straighten low back, knees, and hips, raising back and hips off of floor.
BWBallSingleLegStraightHipLegCurl.execution: Keeping hips and low back straight, bend knee, pulling heel toward rear end while keeping other leg extended straight so it raises upward. Allow foot to rollup on to ball. Lower to original position by straightening knee until other leg makes contact with ball. Repeat.
BWBallSingleLegStraightHipLegCurl.comments: Keep hips straight throughout movement. Knee of rising straight leg will be kept close to knee of bending leg.

BWGluteHamRaiseHead.name: Glute-Ham Raise (hands behind neck)
BWGluteHamRaiseHead.preparation: Place ankles between ankle roller pads with feet on vertical platform and position knees on pad with lower thighs against large padded hump. Position behind neck.
BWGluteHamRaiseHead.execution: From upright position, lower body by straightening knees until body is horizontal. Continue to lower torso by bending hips until body is upside down. Raise torso by extending hips until fully extended. Continue to raise body by flexing knees until body is upright. Repeat.
BWGluteHamRaiseHead.comments: Movement can be made easier by placing arms further down away from head.

BWGluteHamRaiseHips.name: Glute-Ham Raise (hands behind hips)
BWGluteHamRaiseHips.preparation: Place ankles between ankle roller pads with feet on vertical platform and position knees on pad with lower thighs against large padded hump. Position hands behind hips.
BWGluteHamRaiseHips.execution: From upright position, lower body by straightening knees until body is horizontal. Continue to lower torso by bending hips until body is upside down. Raise torso by extending hips until fully extended. Continue to raise body by flexing knees until body is upright. Repeat.
BWGluteHamRaiseHips.comments: Movement can be made easier by having partner assist in raise by pulling up on shoulders (from front) or chest (from side).

BWHamstringRaise.name: Inverse Leg Curl
BWHamstringRaise.preparation: Adjust padded supports and kneel upright in apparatus. Position knees on near-upper side of padded hump, ankles between padded supports, and feet on platform. Place arms behind back, across chest, or bent beside head depending on desired intensity.
BWHamstringRaise.execution: Lower body until horizontal by straightening knees. Raise body by flexing knees only allowing hips to bend slightly. Repeat.
BWHamstringRaise.comments: This is an advanced exercise performed on Glute Ham Raise Apparatus. This movement is also known as Hamstring Raise.

BWHangingHamstringBridge.name: Hanging Hamstring Bridge
BWHangingHamstringBridge.preparation: Stand behind bar facing elevated platform positioned slightly away on other side of bar. Grasp bar with slightly wider than shoulder width grip. Walk body under bar and position back of heels on elevated platform. With legs extended forward, hang under bar with arms straight and hips bent just above floor.
BWHangingHamstringBridge.execution: Raise hips up as high as possible by extending hips. Lower hips to original position just above floor. Repeat.
BWHangingHamstringBridge.comments: Platform should be high enough to allow hips to flex without buttocks contacting floor. Full range of motion will vary from person to person. Adductor Magnus may only assist at initial phase hip extension depending on degree of hip flexion at bottom of movement. Also see

BWHangingHamstringBridgeCurl.name: Hanging Hamstring Bridge Curl
BWHangingHamstringBridgeCurl.preparation: Stand behind bar facing elevated platform positioned slightly away on other side of bar. Grasp bar with slightly wider than shoulder width grip. Walk body under bar and position back of heels on elevated platform. With legs extended forward, hang under bar with arms straight and hips bent just above floor.
BWHangingHamstringBridgeCurl.execution: Raise hips by extending hips. Before full hip extension, pull body toward feet by bending knees and hips. Roll onto feet until knees are fully flexed. Return body to original position by extending knees, then lowering hips to original position just above floor. Repeat.
BWHangingHamstringBridgeCurl.comments: Platform should be high enough to allow hips to flex without buttocks contacting floor. Full range of motion will vary from person to person.

BWHangingLegCurl.name: Hanging Leg Curl
BWHangingLegCurl.execution: Straighten and raise body off of floor keeping heels on floor.
BWHangingLegCurl.comments: Pull body toward feet by bending knees and hips. Roll onto feet until knees are fully flexed. Return body to original position by extending knees and hips. Repeat.

BWHangingStraightHipLegCurl.name: Hanging Straight Hip Leg Curl
BWHangingStraightHipLegCurl.preparation: Lay supine under fixed horizontal bar. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Straighten and raise body off of floor keeping heels on floor.
BWHangingStraightHipLegCurl.execution: Pull body toward feet by bending knees while keeping hips straight. Roll onto feet until knees are fully flexed. Return body to original position by extending knees. Repeat.
BWHangingStraightHipLegCurl.comments: Positioned bar so back is slightly above floor once grip is established. Keep low back and hips straight throughout movement. With hips fully extended, Hamstrings enter

BWSingleLeg45Hyperextension.name: Single Leg 45° Hyperextension
BWSingleLeg45Hyperextension.preparation: Position thighs prone on padding. Hook one heel under platform lip or padded brace. Position other leg just above. Place arms to side, crossed on chest, or behind neck
BWSingleLeg45Hyperextension.execution: Raise upper body until hips and waist are fully extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until fully flexed. Repeat.
BWSingleLeg45Hyperextension.comments: Movement can be made easier by placing arms further down to sides, away from head or performing exercise with both legs.

BWSingleLegHangingHamstringBridge.name: Single Leg Hanging Hamstring Bridge
BWSingleLegHangingHamstringBridge.preparation: Stand behind bar facing elevated platform positioned slightly away on other side of bar. Grasp bar with slightly wider than shoulder width grip. Walk body under bar. Position back of heel on elevated platform. Place other foot on or just over floor so leg is bent. Hang under bar with arms straight and hips bent just above floor.
BWSingleLegHangingHamstringBridge.execution: Raise hips up as high as possible by extending hip and spine. Maintain bent position of lower leg allowing it to rise with hips. Lower hips along with bent lower leg to original position and repeat. Continue with legs in opposite position.
BWSingleLegHangingHamstringBridge.comments: Platform should be high enough to allow hip to flex without buttocks contacting floor. Full range of motion will vary from person to person. Adductor Magnus may only assist at initial phase hip extension depending on degree of hip flexion at bottom of movement.

BWSingleLegHangingHamstringBridgeCurl.name: Single Leg Hanging Hamstring Bridge Curl
BWSingleLegHangingHamstringBridgeCurl.preparation: Raise hip and bent lower leg up by extending hip of elevated leg. Maintain bent position of lower leg allowing it to rise with hips. Before full hip extension, pull body toward foot by bending knee and hip of elevated leg. Roll onto foot until knee is fully flexed. Return body to original position by extending knee, then lowering hips and bent lower leg to original position just above floor. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg position.
BWSingleLegHangingHamstringBridgeCurl.execution: Platform should be high enough to allow hip to flex without buttocks contacting floor. Full range of motion will vary from person to person.
BWSingleLegHangingHamstringBridgeCurl.comments: Adductor Magnus may only assist at initial phase hip extension depending on degree of hip flexion at bottom of movement. Preventing full extension of hip allows hamstrings to remain in a mechanically strong position as it approaches full flexion by reducing

BWWheelLegCurl.name: Leg Curl (on power wheel)
BWWheelLegCurl.preparation: Lie supine on floor with feet strapped onto power wheel. Extended arms out to sides. Straighten knees and hips.
BWWheelLegCurl.execution: Keeping hips and low back straight, bend knees, pulling heels toward rear end. Raise up until lower legs are vertical. Lower to original position by straightening knees. Repeat.
BWWheelLegCurl.comments: Keep hips straight throughout movement. With hips fully extended, Hamstrings enter

CBBentOverLegCurl.name: Cable Bent-over Leg Curl
CBBentOverLegCurl.preparation: Attach ankle cuff to low pulley. With cuff on one ankle, grasp ballet bar with both hands and step far back with other foot. Elbows remain straight to support body leaning forward. Attached foot is stretched off floor.
CBBentOverLegCurl.execution: Pull cable attachment back and up slightly by flexing knee. Raise knee slightly by flexing hip until knee is fully flexed. Return by straightening knee and lowering knee slightly to original position. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
CBBentOverLegCurl.comments: Raise knee very slightly as knee is flexing and return as weight is lowered. Keep hip from sagging or from being pulled forward. Heavier resistances can tear apart standard leather ankle cuffs.

CBLyingLegCurl.name: Cable Lying Leg Curl
CBLyingLegCurl.preparation: Attach two ankle cuffs to low pulley attachment. With cuffs on both ankles lie prone on flat bench with knees just beyond edge of bench. Grip under side or base of bench for support.
CBLyingLegCurl.execution: Raise ankles to glutes by flexing knees. Lower ankles until knees are straight. Repeat.
CBLyingLegCurl.comments: Keep torso on bench to reduce hyperextension of lower back.

CBStandingLegCurl.name: Cable Standing Leg Curl
CBStandingLegCurl.execution: to low pulley. With foot harness on one ankle, grasp support bar with both hands and step back with other foot. Elbows remain straight to support body. Attached foot is slightly off floor.
CBStandingLegCurl.comments: Pull cable attachment back by flexing knee until knee is fully flexed. Return by straightening knee to original position and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

CBStrBackStrLegDeadlift.name: Cable Straight-back Straight-leg Deadlift
CBStrBackStrLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand between two very low pulleys with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp stirrup attachments to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
CBStrBackStrLegDeadlift.execution: With knees and back straight, bow forward by bending hips until hamstrings are tight, or just before lower back bends. Raise body upright by extending hips until standing. Pull shoulders back slightly at top of lift if rounded. Repeat.
CBStrBackStrLegDeadlift.comments: Throughout lift, keep arms, knees, and back straight. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch. Full range of motion will vary from person to person depending on

CBStraightLegDeadlift.name: Cable Straight Leg Deadlift
CBStraightLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand between two very low pulleys with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp stirrup attachments to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
CBStraightLegDeadlift.execution: With knees straight, bow forward by bending hips. Bend waist as stirrups approach lowest position. Lift stirrups by extending hips and waist until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
CBStraightLegDeadlift.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

DBStrBackStrLegDeadlift.name: Dumbbell Straight-back Straight-leg Deadlift
DBStrBackStrLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance. Grasp dumbbells to each side.
DBStrBackStrLegDeadlift.execution: With knees straight, lower dumbbells by bending hips until hamstrings are tight, or just before lower back bends. Lift dumbbells by extending hips until straight. Pull shoulders back slightly at top of lift if rounded. Repeat.
DBStrBackStrLegDeadlift.comments: Throughout lift, keep arms, knees, and back straight. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch. Full range of motion will vary from person to person depending on

DBStraightLegDeadlift.name: Dumbbell Straight Leg Deadlift
DBStraightLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance. Grasp dumbbells to sides.
DBStraightLegDeadlift.execution: With knees straight, lower dumbbells to top or sides of feet by bending hips. Bend waist as bar approaches feet. Lift dumbbells by extending hips and waist until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
DBStraightLegDeadlift.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

LVAlternatingLyingLegCurl.name: Lever Alternating Lying Leg Curl
LVAlternatingLyingLegCurl.preparation: Facing bench, stand between bench and lever pads. Lie prone on bench with knees just beyond edge of bench and lower legs under lever pads. Grasp handles.
LVAlternatingLyingLegCurl.execution: Raise lever pad to back of thighs by flexing one knee. Lower lever pads until knee is straight and repeat with opposite leg. Continue to alternate between sides.
LVAlternatingLyingLegCurl.comments: Keep torso on bench to reduce hyperextension of lower back. Most machines are angled at user's hip to position hamstring in more favorable mechanical position. If angle is at much greater angle than one illustrated, Rectus Femoris will less likely be involved as Antagonist Stabilizer.

LVAlternatingLyingLegCurlH.name: Lever Alternating Lying Leg Curl (plate loaded)
LVAlternatingLyingLegCurlH.preparation: Facing bench, stand between bench and lever pads. Lie prone on bench with knees just beyond edge of bench and lower legs under lever pads. Grasp handles.
LVAlternatingLyingLegCurlH.execution: Raise one lever pad to back of thigh by flexing knee. Lower lever pad until knee is straight. Raise and lower other leg pad. Continue by alternating legs.
LVAlternatingLyingLegCurlH.comments: Keep torso on bench to reduce hyperextension of lower back. Most machines are angled at user's hip to position hamstring in more favorable mechanical position. If angle at hip is significantly bent, Rectus Femoris will less likely be involved as Antagonist Stabilizer.

LVAlternatingLyingLegCurlPL.name: Lever Alternating Lying Leg Curl (plate loaded)
LVAlternatingLyingLegCurlPL.preparation: Lie prone on bench with knees just beyond edge of bench and lower legs under lever pads. Grasp handles.
LVAlternatingLyingLegCurlPL.execution: Raise lever pad to back of thigh by flexing knee. Lower lever pad until knee is straight. Raise and lower lever pad with opposite leg. Continue by alternating legs.
LVAlternatingLyingLegCurlPL.comments: Keep torso on bench to reduce hyperextension of low back. As one leg raises lever, other knee may need to be bent slightly to avoid contact with lower leg extension pad, as demonstrated. Some plate loaded non-commercial machines may be angled at user's hip to position hamstring in more favorable mechanical position. See

LVAlternatingStandingLegCurl.name: Lever Alternating Standing Leg Curl
LVAlternatingStandingLegCurl.preparation: Stand in machine with lower pads behind lower legs, upper pads in front of thighs, and lever fulcrum between knees. Bend over and grasp handles for support if available.
LVAlternatingStandingLegCurl.execution: Raise left foot slightly off of floor or platform. Raise lever up with left leg, bending knee as high as possible. Return lever until knee is straight. Shift body weight to left foot and raise right foot slightly off of floor or platform. Raise lever up with right leg, bending knee as high as possible. Continue alternating movement between legs.

LVAlternationgBentOverLegCurl.name: Lever Alternating Bent-over Leg Curl
LVAlternationgBentOverLegCurl.preparation: Stand in machine with lower pads behind lower legs, upper pads in front of thighs, and lever fulcrum between knees. Bend over, placing forearms on pads, and grasp handles.
LVAlternationgBentOverLegCurl.execution: Raise left foot slightly off of floor or platform. Raise lever up with left leg, bending knee as high as possible. Return lever until knee is straight. Shift body weight to left foot and raise right foot slightly off of floor or platform. Raise lever up with right leg, bending knee as high as possible. Continue alternating movement between legs.

LVBentOverLegCurl.name: Lever Bent-over Leg Curl
LVBentOverLegCurl.preparation: Stand in machine with lower pads behind lower legs, upper pads in front of thighs, and lever fulcrum between knees. Bend over, placing forearms on pads, and grasp handles. Stand with body weight shifted on foot of resting leg and raise foot of exercising leg slightly off of floor or platform.
LVBentOverLegCurl.execution: Raise lever up by bending knee as high as possible. Return lever until knee is straight. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

LVKneelingLegCurl.name: Lever Kneeling Leg Curl
LVKneelingLegCurl.preparation: Mount machine by placing supporting knee on horizontal pad and other leg under roller pad with knee against vertical pad. Grip handles and place forearm on padded arm rest.
LVKneelingLegCurl.execution: Raise ankle to back of thigh by flexing knee. Lower ankle until knee is straight. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

LVKneelingLegCurlH.name: Lever Kneeling Leg Curl (plate loaded)
LVKneelingLegCurlH.preparation: Mount machine by placing supporting knee on horizontal pad and other leg under roller pad with knee against vertical pad. Grip handles and place forearm on padded arm rest.
LVKneelingLegCurlH.execution: Raise ankle to back of thigh by flexing knee. Lower ankle until knee is straight. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

LVLyingLegCurl.name: Lever Lying Leg Curl
LVLyingLegCurl.preparation: Facing bench, stand between bench and lever pads. Lie prone on bench with knees just beyond edge of bench and lower legs under lever pads. Grasp handles.
LVLyingLegCurl.execution: Raise lever pad to back of thighs by flexing knees. Lower lever pads until knees are straight. Repeat.
LVLyingLegCurl.comments: Keep torso on bench to reduce hyperextension of lower back. Most machines are angled at user's hip to position hamstring in more favorable mechanical position. If this angle is sharp (as shown), Rectus Femoris is less likely involved as Antagonist Stabilizer.

LVLyingLegCurlH.name: Lever Lying Leg Curl (plate loaded)
LVLyingLegCurlH.preparation: Facing bench, stand between bench and lever pads. Lie prone on bench with knees just beyond edge of bench and lower legs under lever pads. Grasp handles.
LVLyingLegCurlH.execution: Raise lever pad to back of thighs by flexing knees. Lower lever pads until knees are straight. Repeat.
LVLyingLegCurlH.comments: Keep torso on bench to reduce hyperextension of lower back. Most machines are angled at user's hip to position hamstring in more favorable mechanical position. If angle is at much greater angle than one illustrated, Rectus Femoris will less likely be involved as Antagonist Stabilizer.

LVLyingLegCurlPL.name: Lever Lying Leg Curl (plate loaded)
LVLyingLegCurlPL.preparation: Facing bench, stand between bench and lever pads. Lie prone on bench with knees just beyond edge of bench and lower legs under lever pads. Grasp handles.
LVLyingLegCurlPL.execution: Raise lever pad to back of thighs by flexing knees. Lower lever pads until knees are straight. Repeat.
LVLyingLegCurlPL.comments: Keep torso on bench to reduce hyperextension of low back. Some plate loaded non-commercial machines may be angled at user's hip to position hamstring in more favorable mechanical position. See

LVLyingLegCurlRevHyperMachPL.name: Lever Lying Leg Curl (on reverse hyper-extension machine, plate loaded)
LVLyingLegCurlRevHyperMachPL.preparation: Place lower legs between pads with feet on bar. Lay torso and waist on bench and grasp handles.
LVLyingLegCurlRevHyperMachPL.execution: Raise lever back and up by flexing knees. Lower lever until knees are straight. Repeat.

LVSeatedLegCurl.name: Lever Seated Leg Curl
LVSeatedLegCurl.preparation: Sit on apparatus with back against padded back support. Place back of lower legs on top of far padded lever. Secure lap pad on thighs just above knees. Grasp handles on lap support.
