LVSeatedLegCurl.execution: Pull far padded lever toward back of thighs by flexing knees. Return lever until knees are straight. Repeat.
LVSeatedLegCurl.comments: Position back of seat so knees are aligned with fulcrum of lever. Position lever pad so it makes contact with lowers leg just above ankles. Place leg closest to lever in machine first, followed by further leg.

LVSeatedLegCurlH.name: Lever Seated Leg Curl (plate loaded)
LVSeatedLegCurlH.preparation: Sit on apparatus with back against padded back support. Push hand lever to lower leg pads. Place legs in between pads. Release hand lever gradually. Grasp handles to sides with each hand.
LVSeatedLegCurlH.execution: Pull lever to back of thighs by flexing knees. Return lever until knees are straight. Repeat.
LVSeatedLegCurlH.comments: Position back of seat so knees are aligned with fulcrum of lever.

LVSingleLegSeatedLegCurl.name: Lever Single Leg Seated Leg Curl
LVSingleLegSeatedLegCurl.preparation: Sit on seat with back against padded back support. Position back of lower leg on top of far padded lever and other leg bent over lap pad. Secure lap pad against thigh just above knee. Grasp handles on lap support.
LVSingleLegSeatedLegCurl.execution: Pull far padded lever toward back of thighs as far as possible by flexing knee. Return padded lever until knee is straight. Change legs and repeat for opposite leg.
LVSingleLegSeatedLegCurl.comments: Position back of seat so knee is aligned with fulcrum of lever. Position lever pad so it makes contact with lower leg just above ankle. Place leg closest to lever in/on machine first, followed by further leg. Keep resting leg down throughout exercise as not to interfere with movement of lever.

LVSingleLegSeatedLegCurlHammer.name: Lever Single Leg Seated Leg Curl (plate loaded)
LVSingleLegSeatedLegCurlHammer.preparation: Sit on seat with back against padded back support. Push hand lever to lower leg pads. Place one leg in between pads. Place other leg on top of upper most pad bar. Release hand lever gradually. Grasp handles to sides with each hand.
LVSingleLegSeatedLegCurlHammer.execution: Pull padded lever to back of thighs as far as possible by flexing knee. Return padded lever until knee is straight. Change legs and repeat for opposite leg.
LVSingleLegSeatedLegCurlHammer.comments: Allow resting leg on top to ride bar down and up throughout exercise.

LVStandingLegCurl.name: Lever Standing Leg Curl
LVStandingLegCurl.preparation: Stand in machine with one or both legs between pads depending upon machine's design. Position exercising leg with lever pad behind lower leg and upper pad in front of lower thigh. Bend over and grasp handles for support if available. Stand with body weight shifted on foot of resting leg and raise foot of exercising leg slightly off of floor or platform.
LVStandingLegCurl.execution: Pull lever up to back of thigh by flexing knee. Return lever until knee is straight. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

LVStandingLegCurlLegExt.name: Lever Standing Leg Curl (on leg extension)
LVStandingLegCurlLegExt.preparation: Place platform to one side of padded lever. Have additional padded board in hand. Facing machine, stand to one side of padded roller. Place far leg on elevated platform. Position closest leg into apparatus by placing back of lower leg against lever roller. Place extra padded board between knee and edge of seat. Position knee forward securely against padded board and edge of seat. Bend over seat by bending hips and support torso with arms.
LVStandingLegCurlLegExt.execution: Pull lever to back of thigh by flexing knee. Return lever until knee is straight. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
LVStandingLegCurlLegExt.comments: A leg extension with padded rollers with access to both sides is required. If needed, raise body slightly by raising heel so lever fulcrum closer to knee articulation. Disregard calf as stabilizer if this is not necessary.

LVStandingLegCurlMultiHip.name: Lever Standing Leg Curl (on multi-hip machine)
LVStandingLegCurlMultiHip.preparation: Adjust platform to highest position or lever fulcrum to lowest position so fulcrum is at height of knee. If necessary, place extra elevation near end of platform to stand on, so knee is aligned with fulcrum. Adjust padded roller approximately 45° downward. Step on extra elevation facing padded roller. Place leg closest to lever over roller. Bend over at hips and grasp bar. Slightly extend hip to lower roller so knee maintains alignment with fulcrum.
LVStandingLegCurlMultiHip.execution: Pull padded roller to glutes by flexing knee. Lower padded roller until knee is straight. Repeat. Reposition roller pad lever and continue with opposite leg.
LVStandingLegCurlMultiHip.comments: Taller individuals may only be able to perform this exercise on standard multi-hip machine if adjustments are not sufficient to position knee at same height of fulcrum. If needed, raise body slightly by raising heel for proper knee alignment. Disregard calf as stabilizer if this is not necessary. Maintain knee position to lever throughout exercise. Shorter individuals may find it difficult to position body high enough even with elevation.

LVStrBackStrLegDeadlift.name: Lever Straight-back Straight-leg Deadlift (plate loaded)
LVStrBackStrLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand between lever handles with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp handles to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
LVStrBackStrLegDeadlift.execution: With knees and back straight, bow forward by bending hips until hamstrings are tight, or just before lower back bends. Raise body upright by extending hips until standing. Pull shoulders back slightly at top of lift if rounded. Repeat.
LVStrBackStrLegDeadlift.comments: Throughout lift, keep arms, knees, and back straight. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch. Full range of motion will vary from person to person depending on

LVStraightLegDeadlift.name: Lever Straight Leg Deadlift (plate loaded)
LVStraightLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand between lever handles with shoulder width or narrower stance. Squat down and grasp handles to each side. Stand upright with arms straight down to sides.
LVStraightLegDeadlift.execution: With knees straight, bow forward by bending hips. Bend waist as stirrups approach lowest position. Lift lever by extending hips and waist until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
LVStraightLegDeadlift.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

LVStraightLegLyingHipExtension.name: Lever Straight-leg Lying Hip Extension
LVStraightLegLyingHipExtension.preparation: Lie on bench and place back of lower legs against leg pad. Position hips in line with fulcrum. Grasp bottom sides of bench to keep body from moving under resistance.
LVStraightLegLyingHipExtension.execution: With knees straight, extend lever downward until hips are extended. Return lever to upright position without allowing back of hips to raise up off of bench. Repeat.
LVStraightLegLyingHipExtension.comments: Throughout lift, knees straight and back of hips on bench. Hip may tend to raise up when legs are pulled up. Full range of motion will vary from person to person depending on

SMGoodMorning.name: Smith Good-morning
SMGoodMorning.preparation: Position bar on back of shoulders. Grasp bar to sides. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
SMGoodMorning.execution: Bend hips to lower torso forward until parallel to floor. Raise torso until hips are extended. Repeat.
SMGoodMorning.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow adequate

SMStrBackStrLegDeadlift.name: Smith Straight-back Straight-leg Deadlift
SMStrBackStrLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance with thigh against bar. Grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
SMStrBackStrLegDeadlift.execution: With knees and back straight, lower bar by bending hips until hamstrings are tight, or just before lower back bends. Lift bar by extending hips until straight. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
SMStrBackStrLegDeadlift.comments: Throughout lift, keep arms, knees, and back straight. Do not pause or bounce at bottom of lift. Do not lower weight beyond mild stretch. Full range of motion will vary from person to person depending on

SMStraightLegDeadlift.name: Smith Straight Leg Deadlift
SMStraightLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or narrower stance on elevated platform with thigh against bar. Grasp bar with shoulder width or slightly wider overhand grip. Disengage bar by rotating bar back.
SMStraightLegDeadlift.execution: With knees straight, lower bar toward top of feet by bending hips. After hips can no longer flex, bend waist as bar approaches top of feet. Lift bar by extending waist and hip until standing upright. Pull shoulders back slightly if rounded. Repeat.
SMStraightLegDeadlift.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

STHamstringRunner.name: Suspended Hamstring Runner
STHamstringRunner.preparation: Sit on floor facing suspension trainer loops in low position. Grasp bottom of loops, then lay supine. Raise legs and place heels in loops with soles contacting handles. Extend one leg out straight, keep other leg bent so knee is pointing up. Place arms on floor off to sides. Lift low back and hips off of floor so one leg is straight with back and other leg bent, so foot of bent leg is close to knee of straight leg.
STHamstringRunner.execution: Simultaneously alternate leg positions by straightening bent leg while bending straight knee. Repeat.
STHamstringRunner.comments: This exercise can be performed on TRXⓇ style suspension trainer. See

STHangingLegCurl.name: Suspended Hanging Leg Curl
STHangingLegCurl.preparation: Lay supine under suspension trainer and grasp handles. Straighten and raise body off of floor keeping heels on floor.
STHangingLegCurl.execution: Pull body toward feet by bending knees and hips. Roll onto feet until knees are fully flexed. Return body to original position by extending knees and hips. Repeat.
STHangingLegCurl.comments: This exercise can be performed on TRXⓇ style suspension trainer or adjustable length gymnastics rings. Positioned handles so back is slightly above floor once grip is established. Keep low back straight, maintaining approximate height from floor throughout movement. Hamstrings seemingly acts as a dynamic stabilizer, since it shortens through knee, while it lengthens through hip. However, net contraction actually appears to occur, since hip flexes only about 50%, while knee flexes nearly 100%, allowing hamstrings to remain in a mechanically strong position throughout movement.

STHangingStraightHipLegCurl.name: Suspended Hanging Straight Hip Leg Curl
STHangingStraightHipLegCurl.preparation: Lay supine under suspension trainer and grasp handles. Straighten and raise body off of floor keeping heels on floor.
STHangingStraightHipLegCurl.execution: Pull body toward feet by bending knees while keeping hips and back straight. Roll onto feet until knees are fully flexed. Return body to original position by extending knees maintaining straight hip position. Repeat.
STHangingStraightHipLegCurl.comments: This exercise can be performed on TRXⓇ style suspension trainer or adjustable length gymnastics rings. Positioned handles so back is slightly above floor once grip is established. Keep low back and hips straight throughout movement. With hips fully extended, Hamstrings enter

STHyperextension.name: Suspended Hyperextension
STHyperextension.preparation: Grasp suspension handles and momentarily step back until arms are extended forward and straight. While keeping arms straight and shoulders back, step forward so body reclines back behind suspension handles. Fold at hips onto heels, allowing rear end to fall far back with arms and shoulders stretched forward.
STHyperextension.execution: Drive hips forward until hips are straight, while keeping arms and shoulders straight. Near top of motion, reach back with arms over head and hyperextend spine. While keeping arms over head, lower body with hips falling back down to starting position and repeat.
STHyperextension.comments: An alternative mount involves stepping back with suspension handles in hands until arms are pulled forward about 45° (give or take) from resting position. At this point, recline body back, then fold at hips, allowing rear end to fall far back with arms and shoulders stretched forward.

STLegCurl.name: Suspended Leg Curl
STLegCurl.preparation: Sit on floor facing suspension trainer loops in low position. Grasp bottom of loops, then lay supine. Raise legs and place heels in loops with soles contacting handles. Extend legs out and place arms on floor off to sides. Straighten low back, knees, and hips, raising back and hips off of floor.
STLegCurl.execution: Pull heels toward rear end by bending knees and hips simultaneously. Lower body to original position by straightening knees and hips. Repeat.
STLegCurl.comments: Keep low back straight, maintaining approximate height from floor throughout movement. Hamstrings seemingly acts as a dynamic stabilizer, since it shortens through knee, while it lengthens through hip. However, net contraction actually appears to occur, since hip flexes only about 50%, while knee flexes nearly 100%, allowing hamstrings to remain in a mechanically strong position throughout movement.

STSingleLegStraightHipLegCurl.name: Suspended Single Leg Straight Hip Leg Curl (on bench)
STSingleLegStraightHipLegCurl.preparation: Sit on floor or bench facing suspension trainer loop in low position. Place heel in loop with sole contacting handle. Lie down and extend both legs out straight. If lying on floor, place arms on floor off to sides. If lying on bench, grasp end or sides of bench with each hand. Straighten low back, knees, and hips, raising back and hips off of floor or bench with both legs together.
STSingleLegStraightHipLegCurl.execution: Bend knee of leg in suspension trainer while keeping other leg extended. Continue pulling heel toward rear end while keeping hips and low back straight. Raise up until lower leg is vertical or fully flexed. Lower body to original position by straightening knee until leg is straight and next to extended leg, maintaining straight hip position throughout movement. Repeat.
STSingleLegStraightHipLegCurl.comments: Keep hips straight throughout movement. With hip fully extended, Hamstrings enter

STStraightHipLegCurl.name: Suspended Straight Hip Leg Curl
STStraightHipLegCurl.preparation: Sit on floor facing suspension trainer loops in low position. Grasp bottom of loops, then lay supine. Raise legs and place heels in loops with soles contacting handles. Extend legs out and place arms on floor off to sides. Straighten low back, knees, and hips, raising back and hips off of floor.
STStraightHipLegCurl.execution: Bend knees, pulling heels toward rear end while keeping hips and low back straight. Raise up until lower legs are vertical or fully flexed. Lower body to original position by straightening knees, maintaining straight hip position. Repeat.
STStraightHipLegCurl.comments: Keep hips straight throughout movement. With hips fully extended, Hamstrings enter

TBStrBackStrLegDeadlift.name: Trap Bar Straight-back Straight-leg Deadlift
TBStrBackStrLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand with feet shoulder width or narrower in trap bar, weight to each side. Squat down with feet flat and grasp handles to sides.
TBStrBackStrLegDeadlift.comments: With knees and back straight, lower bar by bending hips until hamstrings are tight, or just before lower back bends. Lift bar by extending hips until upright. Pull shoulders slightly back at top of lift if rounded. Repeat.

TBStraightLegDeadlift.name: Trap Bar Straight Leg Deadlift
TBStraightLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand on platform under loaded trap bar. Squat down and grasp handles to sides.

WT45HipExtension.name: Weighted 45° Back Raise (on hyperextension apparatus)
WT45HipExtension.preparation: Position thighs prone on padding of 45-degree hyper-extension apparatus. Hook heels on platform lip or under padded brace. Hold weight to chest or behind neck.
WT45HipExtension.execution: Lower body by bending hips until fully flexed. Raise or extend hips until torso is parallel to legs. Repeat.
WT45HipExtension.comments: Exercise can be performed without added weight until more resistance is needed. If weight is positioned behind head, neck extensors act as stabilizers.

WTGluteHamRaise.name: Weighted Glute-Ham Raise
WTGluteHamRaise.preparation: Place ankles between ankle roller pads with feet on vertical platform and position knees on pad with lower thighs against large padded hump. Position weight plate against upper chest or behind neck.
WTGluteHamRaise.execution: From upright position, lower body by straightening knees until body is horizontal. Continue to lower torso by bending hips until body is upside down. Raise torso by extending hips until fully extended. Continue to raise body by flexing knees until body is upright. Repeat.
WTGluteHamRaise.comments: Weight can be positioned closer (easier) or further away (harder) from hips to adjust intensity; see

WTHamstringRaise.name: Weighted Inverse Leg Curl
WTHamstringRaise.preparation: Adjust padded supports and kneel upright in apparatus. Position knees against large roller pad or near-upper side of padded hump, ankles between padded supports, and feet on platform. Hold weight to chest or behind neck.
WTHamstringRaise.execution: Lower body until horizontal by straightening knees. Raise body by flexing knees, only allowing hips to bend slightly. Repeat.
WTHamstringRaise.comments: This is an advanced exercise performed on Glute Ham Raise Apparatus. This movement is also known as Weighted Hamstring Raise. Exercise can be performed

WTHipExtension.name: Weighted Back Raise (on hyperextension apparatus)
WTHipExtension.preparation: Stand in hyper-extension apparatus. Position thighs prone on large pad and lower leg under padded bar. Hold weight to chest or behind neck.
WTHipExtension.execution: Lower body by bending hips until fully flexed. Raise or extend hips until torso is parallel to legs. Repeat.
WTHipExtension.comments: Exercise can be performed without added weight until more resistance is needed. If weight is positioned behind head, neck extensors act as stabilizers

Wt45Hyperextension.name: Weighted 45° Hyperextension
Wt45Hyperextension.preparation: Position thighs prone on padding. Hook heels under platform lip or padded brace. Hold weight to chest or behind neck.
Wt45Hyperextension.execution: Raise upper body until hips and waist are fully extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until fully flexed. Repeat.
Wt45Hyperextension.comments: If weight is positioned behind head, neck extensors act as stabilizers

WtHyperextension.name: Weighted Hyperextension
WtHyperextension.preparation: Position thighs prone on large pad and lower leg under padded bar. Hold weight to chest or behind neck.
WtHyperextension.execution: Raise upper body until hips and waist are fully extended. Lower body by bending hips and waist until fully flexed. Repeat.
WtHyperextension.comments: If weight is positioned behind head, neck extensors act as stabilizers.

BWBentKneeSideBridgeHipAbduction.name: Bent Knee Side Bridge Hip Abduction
BWBentKneeSideBridgeHipAbduction.preparation: Lie on side with legs bent back 90 degrees, one leg on top of the other. Place forearm under shoulder perpendicular to body.
BWBentKneeSideBridgeHipAbduction.execution: Keeping shank of lower leg on mat or floor, raise hips up off ground while raising upper leg upward away from lower leg. Return to original position and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
BWBentKneeSideBridgeHipAbduction.comments: Keep knees bent throughout exercise. Exercise can be performed on mat or towel or cushioning can be placed under forearm. See

BWSideBridgeHipAbduction.name: Side Bridge Hip Abduction
BWSideBridgeHipAbduction.preparation: Lie on side with legs straight, one leg on top of the other. Place forearm under shoulder perpendicular to body.
BWSideBridgeHipAbduction.execution: Keeping side of bottom foot on ground, raise hips up off ground while raising upper leg upward away from lower leg. Return to original position and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
BWSideBridgeHipAbduction.comments: Keep feet pointed forward. Exercise can be performed on mat or towel or cushioning can be placed under forearm. See

BWAngledSideBridgeHipAbduction.name: Angled Side Bridge Hip Abduction
BWAngledSideBridgeHipAbduction.preparation: Grasp vertical bar with one hand and turn to side. Position feet out away from vertical bar with arm supporting body extended out to side. Legs should be straight and positioned side by side. Supporting arm should be approximately vertical to body and other arm can be placed on hips. Lower hips downward to floor until slight stretch is felt.
BWAngledSideBridgeHipAbduction.execution: Keeping foot closest to bar on ground, raise hips upward and away from bar while raising leg furthest from bar upward away from lower leg. Return to original position with hips sagging downward and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.

CBHipAbduction.name: Cable Hip Abduction
CBHipAbduction.preparation: Stand in front of low pulley facing to one side. Attach cable cuff to far ankle. Step out away from stack and grasp ballet bar. Stand on near foot and allow far leg to cross in front.
CBHipAbduction.execution: Move leg to opposite side of low pulley by abduction hip. Return and repeat. Turn around and continue with opposite leg.

CBLyingHipInternalRotation.name: Cable Lying Hip Internal Rotation
CBLyingHipInternalRotation.preparation: Attach cable ankle cuff to ankle, furthest low pulley. Step near foot over cable and lie prone perpendicular to cable. Bend knee 90° so attached ankle crosses over resting straight leg nearest pulley. Adjust positioning of legs slightly away from cable pulley so slight stretch is felt in hip.
CBLyingHipInternalRotation.execution: Keeping knee of attached leg bent approximately 90°, pull cable attachment away from pulley by rotating hip as far as possible. Return leg to original position toward pulley and repeat. Place ankle cuff on opposite leg and continue lying opposite direction.
CBLyingHipInternalRotation.comments: Exercise name is somewhat counter-intuitive since direction of rotation is relative to movement of hip, or thigh, not bent leg. For example, in this exercises,

CBSeatedHipInternalRotation.name: Cable Seated Hip Internal Rotation
CBSeatedHipInternalRotation.preparation: Sit on bench or chair with low pulley to side. Attach cable ankle cuff to ankle furthest pulley. Place foot of stationary leg just forward of foot attached to cable. Grasp bench and handle bar on cable column if available. Position thighs of both legs side by side, perpendicular to cable. Raise foot attached to cable slightly off of floor.
CBSeatedHipInternalRotation.execution: Keeping knee of attached leg bent approximately 90°, pull cable attachment away from pulley by rotating hip as far as possible. Return foot behind stationary foot and toward pulley. Repeat. Place ankle cuff on opposite leg and continue facing opposite direction.
CBSeatedHipInternalRotation.comments: Height of knee on exercising leg may require subtle adjustment during movement to permit clearance of traveling foot above floor. Gluteus Maximus will be activated as stabilizer on heavier loads when participant pushes stationary foot onto floor, thereby anchoring lower body as hip abductors keep thighs in place.

DBLyingHipAbduction.name: Dumbbell Lying Hip Abduction
DBLyingHipAbduction.preparation: Lie on side on floor or mat. Extend top leg down straight and position lower leg back underneath. Grasping dumbbell with hand of arm furthest from floor, position dumbbell as low as possible on top side of thigh.
DBLyingHipAbduction.execution: Raise weighted leg up off ground as high as possible, keeping dumbbell positioned on side of upper thigh. Return to leg to floor and repeat. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.
DBLyingHipAbduction.comments: Do not allow upper hip to fall behind upper hip throughout movement. See

LVKneelingHipInternalRotationHipAbductio.name: Lever Kneeling Hip Internal Rotation (on hip abduction machine)
LVKneelingHipInternalRotationHipAbductio.preparation: Kneel backwards on seated abduction machine with outsides of ankles positioned on inside of each leg pad. Reach down to disengage and pull lever brace to position feet together as close as possible. Engage lever into locked position. Place hands on back pad.
LVKneelingHipInternalRotationHipAbductio.execution: Pull levers apart as far as possible with legs by externally rotating hips. Return until feet make contact, then repeat.
LVKneelingHipInternalRotationHipAbductio.comments: Since this movement becomes more difficult as levers are pulled apart, a criteria for lever angle or weight stack height can be used to ensure full range of motion is achieved each repetition. See

LVSeatedHipAbduction.name: Lever Seated Hip Abduction
LVSeatedHipAbduction.preparation: Sit on machine with legs inside of side pads. If available, place heels on foot bars. Release and pull lever brace to position legs together. Engage lever into locked position. Lie back and grasp bars to sides.
LVSeatedHipAbduction.execution: Move legs apart as far as possible. Return and repeat.
LVSeatedHipAbduction.comments: Mount machine with leg levers apart. Use lever to position legs together. See

LVSeatedHipAbductionH.name: Lever Seated Hip Abduction (plate loaded)
LVSeatedHipAbductionH.preparation: Stand near side of apparatus. Place one leg onto far padded lever and sit on seat. Lift other leg onto other padded lever. Lean back onto back pad. Grasp handles to sides.
LVSeatedHipAbductionH.execution: Move legs away from one another as far as possible. Return and repeat.

LVLyingHipAbduction.name: Lever Lying Hip Abduction
LVLyingHipAbduction.preparation: Sit in machine with heels on bars or legs inside of side pads. Lie back on back pad. Pull in on lever to position legs together. Release lever into position and grasp bars to sides.
LVLyingHipAbduction.execution: Move legs away from one another by abduction hip. Return and repeat.

LVStandHipAbduction.name: Lever Standing Hip Abduction
LVStandHipAbduction.preparation: Adjust platform so lever fulcrum is same height as hip articulation. Adjust roller in low position. Face machine and grasp bars to sides. Place outside of thigh against roller pad and shift body weight to opposite leg.
LVStandHipAbduction.execution: Raise leg against roller pad to side by abduction hip. Return and repeat. Reposition roller pad lever and continue with opposite leg.

STHipAbduction.name: Suspended Hip Abduction
STHipAbduction.preparation: Sit on floor facing suspension trainer loops in low position. Grasp bottom of loops, then lay supine. Raise legs and place heels in loops with soles contacting handles. Extend legs out and place arms on floor off to sides. Straighten low back, knees, and hips, raising back and hips off of floor.
STHipAbduction.execution: Pull legs apart as far as possible. Return by placing legs together and repeat.

WtLyingHipAbduction.name: Weighted Lying Hip Abduction
WtLyingHipAbduction.preparation: Sit on floor or mat with bar, plates loaded on one side. Sit on hip with knees bent and place bar on outside of shoe with weight plate(s) positioned beyond foot. Holding on to opposite end of bar, lie on side with weighted leg extended out straight and lower leg bent underneath.
WtLyingHipAbduction.execution: Raise weighted leg up off ground as high as possible. Balance bar on side of foot while holding onto closest side of bar. Return to floor and repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
WtLyingHipAbduction.comments: Do not allow upper hip to fall behind upper hip throughout movement. See

CBHipAdduction.name: Cable Hip Adduction
CBHipAdduction.preparation: Stand in front of low pulley facing to one side. Attach cable cuff to near ankle. Step out away from stack with wide stance and grasp ballet bar. Stand on far foot and allow near leg to be Pulled toward low pulley.
CBHipAdduction.execution: Move near leg just in front of far leg by abduction hip. Return and repeat. Turn around and continue with opposite leg.
CBHipAdduction.comments: Notice cable pulley in use is out of view to left. Exerciser is holding on to ballet bar above opposite cable pulley, not in use. See

CBLyingHipAdduction.name: Cable Lying Hip Adduction
CBLyingHipAdduction.preparation: Stand or sit in front of low pulley and attach cable cuff to ankle. Step away from pulley toward opposite pull, pulling weight plates up just far enough get next to opposite cable pulley. Attach other cable cuff to opposite ankle. Sit so hips are between both low pulley cables to each side. Lie down on back and lift legs up vertically.
CBLyingHipAdduction.execution: Lower legs apart out to each side until stretch is felt in inner thigh. Raise legs together. Return and repeat.

LVSeatedHipAdduction.name: Lever Seated Hip Adduction
LVSeatedHipAdduction.preparation: Sit in machine with legs outside of vertical center pads. If available, place heels on foot bars. Disengage and pull lever brace to position legs apart until slight stretch is felt. Engage lever into locked position. Lie back and grasp bars to sides.
LVSeatedHipAdduction.execution: Move legs together. Return and repeat.
LVSeatedHipAdduction.comments: Mount machine with leg levers together. Use lever to extend legs apart. See

LVSeatedHipAdductionH.name: Lever Seated Hip Adduction (plate loaded)
LVSeatedHipAdductionH.preparation: Sit on seat and lift one leg onto padded lever. Lean back onto back pad. Grasp handles attatched to leg levers. Push handles together and raise other leg onto other padded lever. Release leg lever handles and grasp other handles to each side.
LVSeatedHipAdductionH.execution: Move legs together until leg levers make contact. Allow legs to seperate far apart until slight stretch and repeat.

LVLyingHipAdduction.name: Lever Lying Hip Adduction
LVLyingHipAdduction.preparation: Sit in machine with legs outside of vertical center pads. If available, place heels on foot bars. Lie back on back pad. Disengage and pull lever brace to position legs apart until slight stretch is felt. Engage lever into locked position. Lie back and grasp bars to sides.
LVLyingHipAdduction.execution: Move legs together. Return and repeat.
LVLyingHipAdduction.comments: Mount machine with leg levers together. Use lever to extend legs apart. See

LVStandHipAdduction.name: Lever Standing Hip Adduction
LVStandHipAdduction.preparation: Adjust platform so lever fulcrum is same height as hip articulation. Adjust roller pad to side position. Face machine and grasp bars to sides. Place inside of thigh on roller pad and remain standing on supporting leg.
LVStandHipAdduction.execution: Move leg toward and across supporting leg Return and repeat. Reposition roller pad lever and continue with opposite leg.

WTLyingHipAdduction.name: Weighted Lying Hip Adduction
WTLyingHipAdduction.preparation: Sit on floor or mat with bar, weight plates loaded on one side. Sit on hip with knees bent and place bar on inside of shoe with weight plate beyond foot. Holding on to opposite end of bar, lie on side with weighted leg extended out straight and upper leg extended behind.
WTLyingHipAdduction.execution: Raise weighted leg up off floor as high as possible while balanciong bar inside of foot and holding onto nearest side of bar. Return to floor and repeat. Repeat and continue with opposite leg.

CBLyingHipExternalRotation.name: Cable Lying Hip External Rotation
CBLyingHipExternalRotation.preparation: Attach cable ankle cuff to ankle, nearest low pulley. Lie prone with legs slightly apart and knee of attached leg bent 90°. Adjust position of legs slightly away from cable pulley so slight stretch is felt in hip.
CBLyingHipExternalRotation.execution: Keeping knee of attached leg bent approximately 90°, pull cable attachment toward opposite knee by rotating hip. Return until slight stretch is felt in hip, then repeat. Place ankle cuff on opposite leg and continue lying opposite direction.
CBLyingHipExternalRotation.comments: Exercise name is somewhat counter-intuitive since direction of rotation is relative to movement of hip, or thigh, not bent leg. For example, in this exercises,

CBSeatedHipExternalRotation.name: Cable Seated Hip External Rotation
CBSeatedHipExternalRotation.preparation: Sit on bench or chair with low pulley to side. Attach cable ankle cuff to ankle, nearest pulley. Place far stationary foot slightly forward. Grasp lower thigh of leg with attached cuff, position it along side thigh of stationary leg while keeping foot slightly above floor.
CBSeatedHipExternalRotation.execution: Keeping knee of attached leg bent approximately 90°, pull cable attachment under thigh of stationary leg by rotating hip. Return until slight stretch is felt in hip, then repeat. Place ankle cuff on opposite leg and continue facing opposite direction.
CBSeatedHipExternalRotation.comments: Height of knee on exercising leg may require subtle adjustment during movement to permit clearance of traveling foot above floor. Gluteus Maximus will be activated as stabilizer on heavier loads when participant pushes stationary foot onto floor thereby anchoring lower body as hip adductors keep thighs together. Upper body muscles can also assist in keeping thigh of exercising leg along side stationary leg. Exercise name is somewhat counter-intuitive since direction of rotation is relative to movement of hip, or thigh, not bent leg. For example, in this exercises,

LVKneelingHipExternalRotationHipAdductio.name: Lever Kneeling Hip External Rotation (on hip adduction machine)
LVKneelingHipExternalRotationHipAdductio.preparation: Kneel backwards on seated adduction machine with insides of ankles positioned on outside of each leg pad. Reach down to disengage and pull lever brace to position feet apart until slight stretch is felt. Engage lever into locked position. Place hands on back pad.
LVKneelingHipExternalRotationHipAdductio.execution: Push levers together with legs by externally rotating hips. Return until slight stretch is felt in hip, then repeat.
LVKneelingHipExternalRotationHipAdductio.comments: Exercise name is somewhat counter-intuitive since direction of rotation is relative to movement of hips, or thighs, not bent legs. For example, in this exercises,

BWHangingLegRaise.name: Hanging Leg Raise
BWHangingLegRaise.preparation: Grasp and hang from high bar with slightly wider than shoulder width overhand grip.
BWHangingLegRaise.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until hips are completely flexed or knees are well above hips. Return until hips and knees are extended downward. Repeat.

BWHangingLegRaiseAbStrap.name: Hanging Leg Raise (with ab straps)
BWHangingLegRaiseAbStrap.preparation: Stand below ab straps hanging from high bar. Place upper arms in straps and grasp straps above.
BWHangingLegRaiseAbStrap.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until hips are completely flexed or knees are well above hips. Return until hips and knees are extended downward. Repeat.
BWHangingLegRaiseAbStrap.comments: Exercise can be performed without ab straps, by

BWHangingStraightLegRaise.name: Hanging Straight Leg Raise
BWHangingStraightLegRaise.preparation: Grasp and hang from high bar with slightly wider than shoulder width overhand grip.
BWHangingStraightLegRaise.execution: With knees straight, raise legs by flexing hips until hips are completely flexed or knees are well above hips. Return until hips are extended downward. Repeat.

BWInclineLegRaise.name: Incline Leg Raise
BWInclineLegRaise.preparation: Lie supine on incline board with torso elevated. Grasp feet hooks or sides of board for support.
BWInclineLegRaise.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until hips are completely flexed. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

BWInclineLegRaiseArmPads.name: Incline Leg Raise (arms on pads)
BWInclineLegRaiseArmPads.preparation: Lie back on incline board. Grasp handles and place forearms on arm pads to each side.
BWInclineLegRaiseArmPads.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until hips are flexed. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

BWInclineStraightLegRaise.name: Incline Straight Leg Raise
BWInclineStraightLegRaise.preparation: Sit on incline board. Lie supine on incline board with torso elevated. Grasp feet rollers or sides of board for support.
BWInclineStraightLegRaise.execution: With knees straight, raise legs by flexing hips until hips are completely flexed. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

BWJackKnifeBall.name: Jack-knife on Ball
BWJackKnifeBall.preparation: Kneel with chest or waist on exercise ball. Dive over top and place hands on floor with arms extended down supporting upper body. While keeping body horizontal, walk hands further away from ball until shins are positioned on top of ball. With arms vertical and straight, support body off of floor with body straight. See suggested
BWJackKnifeBall.comments: Bend hips and knees, allowing shins to roll over top of ball. Pull knees toward chest until heels are under or near glutes. Return by extending hips and knees to original position. Repeat.

BWInclineStraightLegRaiseArmPads.name: Incline Straight Leg Raise (arms on pads)
BWInclineStraightLegRaiseArmPads.preparation: Lie back on incline board. Grasp handles and place forearms on arm pads to each side.
BWInclineStraightLegRaiseArmPads.execution: With knees straight, raise legs by flexing hips until hips are flexed. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

BWJackKnifeWheel.name: Jack-knife on Power Wheel
BWJackKnifeWheel.execution: kneel on floor. Place hands shoulder width apart on floor. With arms vertical and straight, support body off of floor while rolling

BWKneelingWheelRollout.name: Wheel Rollout
BWKneelingWheelRollout.preparation: Kneel on floor or mat. Grasp handles on wheel to each side with overhand grip. Position wheel near front of knees and lean over wheel with arms extended downward, supporting upper body.
BWKneelingWheelRollout.execution: With arms straight, roll wheel out as far as possible. Lower body gently to floor extending arms forward. Raise body back up by flexing hips and pulling arms back to original position. Return until hips are extended. Repeat.
BWKneelingWheelRollout.comments: Keep elbows straight or nearly straight throughout exercise. Also known as Wheel Kneeling Rollout. Rectus Abdominis and Obliques practically contract

BWLyingLegRaise.name: Lying Leg Raise (on bench)
BWLyingLegRaise.preparation: Lie supine on bench. Place hands under lower buttock on each side to support pelvis.
BWLyingLegRaise.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until thighs are completely flexed. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

BWLyingLegRaiseFloor.name: Lying Leg Raise (on floor)
BWLyingLegRaiseFloor.preparation: Lie supine on mat or floor. Place hands under lower buttock on each side to support pelvis.
BWLyingLegRaiseFloor.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until thighs are completely flexed. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

BWPikeDiscs.name: Pike on Discs
BWPikeDiscs.preparation: Kneel on floor with forefeet on
BWPikeDiscs.execution: . Place hands shoulder width apart on floor. With arms vertical and straight, support body off of floor while sliding

BWPikeWheel.name: Pike on Power Wheel
BWPikeWheel.execution: kneel on floor. Place hands shoulder width apart on floor. With arms vertical and straight, support body off of floor while rolling

BWScissorKick.name: Lying Scissor Kick
BWScissorKick.preparation: Lie supine on bench or mat. Place hands under lower buttock on each side to support pelvis. Raise one leg up vertical with knee nearly straight. If lying on floor, raise other leg slightly off of floor.
BWScissorKick.execution: Keeping knees nearly straight, simultaneously change positions of legs so vertical leg is lowered while lower leg is raised vertically. Continue alternating leg positions.

BWRomanChairSitup.name: Roman Chair Sit-up
BWRomanChairSitup.preparation: Sit on chair or bench with lower leg secured under low over hang or heavy bar. Place hands on waist, chest, neck, or head depending upon desired difficulty.
BWRomanChairSitup.execution: Lower body back until hips are almost extended. Raise body by flexing hips until torso is upright. Repeat.
BWRomanChairSitup.comments: Feet must be propped securely to prevent injury. Exercise can also be performed on

BWSeatedLegRaise.name: Seated Leg Raise
BWSeatedLegRaise.preparation: Sit on edge of bench with legs extended to floor. Place weight between ankles or use no weight. Grasp edge of bench. Lean torso back and balance body weight on edge of bench.
BWSeatedLegRaise.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees while pulling torso slightly forward to maintain balance. Return by extending hips and knees and lean torso back to counter balance. Repeat.
BWSeatedLegRaise.comments: Heels may make contact with floor to maintain balance at bottom of movement. Rectus Abdominis and Obliques only

BWSimAltLyingLegRaise.name: Lying Simultaneous Alternating Leg Raise
BWSimAltLyingLegRaise.preparation: Lie supine on bench or mat. Place hands under lower buttock on each side to support pelvis. Raise bent leg up so lower leg is approximately horizonal above hip. If lying on floor, raise other leg slightly off of floor.
BWSimAltLyingLegRaise.execution: Simultaneously change positions of legs, lowering and straightening raised leg down just above floor while raising and bending lower leg to opposite position. Continue alternating leg positions.

BWSimAltStraightLegRaise.name: Lying Simultaneous Alternating Straight Leg Raise
BWSimAltStraightLegRaise.preparation: Lie supine on bench or mat. Place hands under lower buttock on each side to support pelvis. Raise one leg up vertically with knee nearly straight. If lying on floor, raise other leg slightly off of floor.
BWSimAltStraightLegRaise.execution: Keeping knees nearly straight, simultaneously change positions of legs so vertical leg is lowered while lower leg is raised vertically. Continue alternating leg positions.

BWStraightLegRaise.name: Lying Straight Leg Raise
BWStraightLegRaise.preparation: Lie supine on bench or mat. Place hands under lower buttock on each side to support pelvis.
BWStraightLegRaise.execution: Keeping knees straight, raise legs by flexing hips until hips are completely flexed. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

BWVerticalLegRaise.name: Vertical Leg Raise
BWVerticalLegRaise.preparation: Position forearms on padded parallel bars with hands on handles, and back on vertical pad.
BWVerticalLegRaise.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until hips are completely flexed or knees are well above hips. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

BWVerticalLegRaisePB.name: Vertical Leg Raise (on parallel bars)
BWVerticalLegRaisePB.preparation: Stand between parallel bars and grip bar on each side with overhand grip. Lift body off floor and balance body upright with arms straight.
BWVerticalLegRaisePB.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until hips are completely flexed. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

BWVerticalStraightLegRaise.name: Vertical Straight Leg Raise
BWVerticalStraightLegRaise.preparation: Position forearms on padded parallel bars with hands on handles, and back on vertical pad.
BWVerticalStraightLegRaise.execution: With knees straight, raise legs by flexing hips until thighs are just pass parallel to floor. Return until hips are extended. Repeat.

CBAssistedKneelingWheelRollout.name: Cable Assisted Wheel Rollout
CBAssistedKneelingWheelRollout.preparation: With ab wheel attached to cable via double looped strap attachment, straddle cable facing away from low pulley. Kneel with both knees on mat. Grasp handles on wheel to each side with overhand grip. Position wheel near front of knees and lean over wheel with arms extended downward, supporting upper body.
CBAssistedKneelingWheelRollout.execution: With arms straight, roll wheel out as far as possible. Lower body gently to floor extending arms forward. Raise body back up by flexing hips and pulling arms back to original position. Return until hips are extended. Repeat.
CBAssistedKneelingWheelRollout.comments: Keep elbows straight or nearly straight throughout exercise. Exercise can be performed

CBLyingLegRaise.name: Cable Lying Leg Raise
CBLyingLegRaise.preparation: Attach cable ankle straps to both ankles, then attach ankle straps to cable. Lie supine on floor or mat, back far enough so cable is taut. Grasp support behind head.
CBLyingLegRaise.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until thighs are just past perpendicular to torso or before hips raise off of bench. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

CBLyingLegRaiseBench.name: Cable Lying Leg Raise (on bench)
CBLyingLegRaiseBench.preparation: Attach cable ankle straps to both ankles. Sit on end of bench facing pulley at bench height. Attach cable to both ankle straps. Lie supine on bench until cable is taut. Grasp sides of bench behind head.
CBLyingLegRaiseBench.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until thighs are past perpendicular to torso or before hips raise off of bench. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.
CBLyingLegRaiseBench.comments: Training partner or trainer may need to assist attaching ankle cuffs to cable. Ankle cuffs may also be attached to cable pulley in lowest position when feet are on floor, but assistance may be needed to raise pulley to bench height.

CBStandingLegRaise.name: Cable Standing Leg Raise
CBStandingLegRaise.preparation: Attach cable ankle cuff to one ankle. Stand facing away from low pulley. Step  forward  with opposite leg so leg with cuff is pulled back. Grasp lateral bars or other prop for support.
CBStandingLegRaise.execution: Raise knee by flexing hip while allowing lower leg to bend back under resistance. When thigh is just beyond horizontal, lower leg until hip and knee is extended. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
CBStandingLegRaise.comments: Also known as Cable Standing Knee Raise. See

CBLyingStraightLegRaise.name: Cable Lying Straight Leg Raise
CBLyingStraightLegRaise.preparation: Attach cable ankle straps to both ankles, then attach ankle straps to cable. Lie supine on floor, mat, or bench back far enough so cable is taut. Grasp support behind head.
CBLyingStraightLegRaise.execution: With knees straight, raise legs by flexing hips until thighs are just past perpendicular to torso or before hips raise off of mat. Return until hips are extended. Repeat.

CBStandingStraightLegRaise.name: Cable Standing Straight Leg Raise
CBStandingStraightLegRaise.preparation: Stand facing away from low pulley. Place foot in cable boot or foot harness. Grasp lateral bars or other prop for support. Stand forward on free leg, allowing leg attached to cable to be pulled back.
CBStandingStraightLegRaise.execution: Raise leg upward by flexing hip while keeping knee straight. Raise leg as high as possible. Lower leg to original starting position. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
CBStandingStraightLegRaise.comments: Since knee of moving leg is straight and waist flexion is impeded by standing leg, range of motion will be limit to

LVHipFlexion.name: Lever Hip Flexion
LVHipFlexion.preparation: Stand on platform facing to one side and grasp bar for support. Position front of leg nearest to machine against padded roller while standing on other leg.
LVHipFlexion.execution: Raise lever by flexing hip until knee is higher than hip. Return until hip is extended. Repeat. Continue with opposite leg.
LVHipFlexion.comments: Machine must be adjusted to align hip with lever fulcrum. Rectus Abdominis and Obliques only

LVVerticalLegRaise.name: Lever Vertical Leg Raise
LVVerticalLegRaise.preparation: Grasp handles slightly to front and stand on foot bar with knees slightly bent and hips against pad.
LVVerticalLegRaise.execution: With back straight, raise legs as high as possible by flexing hips. Return and repeat.
LVVerticalLegRaise.comments: Exercise is typically performed without added resistance. Rectus Abdominis and Obliques only

LVLyingLegRaiseN.name: Lever Lying Leg Raise
LVLyingLegRaiseN.preparation: Sit on end of bench with both legs over padded lever and hips aligned with fulcrum. Strap legs onto padded lever. Lie supine on bench. Grasp handles near head.
LVLyingLegRaiseN.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips until they are completely flexed. Lower legs until hips are extended. Repeat.

STMountainClimber.name: Suspended Mountain Climber
STMountainClimber.preparation: Sit on floor facing suspension trainer loops in low position. Place right foot in left lower loop. Cross left leg over right leg placed in right lower loop. Turn body to right and place hands on floor, shoulder width apart. Turn body to kneel on hands and knees. Reposition hands (shoulder width or slightly wider) at desired distance from suspension trainer so that body is square with suspension trainer straps. With arms straight, raise knees from ground so body is supported by arms and suspension trainer. Bend one leg so knee is pointing down while keeping other leg extended out straight.
STMountainClimber.execution: Simultaneously alternate leg positions by straightening bent leg behind, while bending straight leg forward. Repeat.
STMountainClimber.comments: Attempt to straighten hip each stroke, while maintaining approximate height of hips from floor throughout movement. Dismount by removing straps, while kneeling or after sitting on one side of hip before rotating body to seated position. See

STPike.name: Suspended Pike
STPike.preparation: Sit on floor facing suspension trainer loops in low position. Place right foot in left lower loop. Cross left leg over right leg placed in right lower loop. Turn body to right and place hands on floor shoulder width apart. Turn body to kneel on hands and knees. Reposition hands (shoulder width or slightly wider) at desired distance from suspension trainer so that body is square with suspension trainer straps. With arms straight, raise knees from ground, so body is supported by arms and suspension trainer.
STPike.execution: Raise rear end up as high as possible by bending hips. Pull feet toward hands, while keeping knees straight. Return by extending hips to original straight body position. Repeat.
STPike.comments: Keep arms straight with shoulders positioned above hands. Dismount by removing straps while kneeling or after sitting on one side of hip before rotating body to seated position. See

WtHangLegRaise.name: Weighted Hanging Leg Raise
WtHangLegRaise.preparation: Place weight between ankles or use no weight. Grasp and hang from high bar.
WtHangLegRaise.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until hips are completely flexed or knees are well above hips. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

WtDeclineSitup.name: Weighted Decline Sit-up
WtDeclineSitup.preparation: Sit on apparatus with lower leg secured under padded bar. Hold weight in front of chest (as shown) or
WtDeclineSitup.comments: Lower body back until hips are almost extended. Raise body by flexing hips until torso is upright. Repeat.

WtHangingStraightLegRaise.name: Weighted Hanging Straight Leg Raise
WtHangingStraightLegRaise.preparation: Place weight between ankles or use no weight. Grasp and hang from high bar.
WtHangingStraightLegRaise.execution: With knees straight, raise legs by flexing hips until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Return until hips are extended downward. Repeat.

WtInclineLegRaise.name: Weighted Incline Leg Raise
WtInclineLegRaise.preparation: Sit on incline board. Place weight between feet or use no weight. Lie supine on incline board with torso elevated. Grasp feet hooks or sides of board for support.
WtInclineLegRaise.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until hips are completely flexed. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

WtInclineStraightLegRaise.name: Weighted Incline Straight Leg Raise
WtInclineStraightLegRaise.preparation: Sit on incline board. Place weight between ankles. Lie supine on incline board with torso elevated. Grasp feet hooks or sides of board for support.
WtInclineStraightLegRaise.execution: With knees straight, raise legs by flexing hips until thighs are just past perpendicular to torso. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

WtInclineLegRaiseArmPads.name: Weighted Incline Leg Raise (arms on pads)
WtInclineLegRaiseArmPads.preparation: Sit on bottom edge of incline board and place weight between feet. Lie back on incline board. Grasp handles and place forearms on arm pads to each side.
WtInclineLegRaiseArmPads.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until hips are completely flexed. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

WtInclineStraightLegRaiseArmPads.name: Weighted Incline Straight Leg Raise (arms on pads)
WtInclineStraightLegRaiseArmPads.preparation: Sit on bottom edge of incline board and place weight between feet. Lie back on incline board. Grasp handles and place forearms on arm pads to each side.
WtInclineStraightLegRaiseArmPads.execution: With knees straight, raise legs by flexing hips until hips are flexed. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

WtLyingLegRaise.name: Weighted Lying Leg Raise
WtLyingLegRaise.preparation: Sit on end of bench. Place weight between feet. Lie supine on bench. Grasp bench on each side behind head for support.
WtLyingLegRaise.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until hips are completely flexed. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.
WtLyingLegRaise.comments: Exercise can be performed without added weight until more resistance is needed (see

WtSeatedLegRaise.name: Weighted Seated Leg Raise
WtSeatedLegRaise.preparation: Sit on edge of bench with legs extended to floor. Place weight between ankles. Grasp edge of bench. Lean torso back and balance bodyweight on edge of bench.
WtSeatedLegRaise.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees while pulling torso slightly forward to maintain balance. Return by extending hips and knees and lean torso back to counter balance. Repeat.
WtSeatedLegRaise.comments: Heels may make contact with floor to maintain balance at bottom of movement. Rectus Abdominis and Obliques only

WtRomanChairSitup.name: Weighted Roman Chair Sit-up
WtRomanChairSitup.preparation: Sit on apparatus with lower leg secured under padded bar. Hold weight to front of chest or behind neck or use no weight.
WtRomanChairSitup.execution: Lower body back until hips are almost extended. Raise body by flexing hips until torso is upright. Repeat.

WtVerticalLegRaisePB.name: Weighted Vertical Leg Raise (on parallel bars)
WtVerticalLegRaisePB.preparation: Place weight between ankles. Stand between parallel bars and grip bar on each side with overhand grip. Lift body off floor and balance body upright with arms straight.
WtVerticalLegRaisePB.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

WtVerticalLegRaise.name: Weighted Vertical Leg Raise
WtVerticalLegRaise.preparation: Place weight between ankles or use no weight. Position forearms on padded parallel bars with hands on handles, and back on vertical pad.
WtVerticalLegRaise.execution: Raise legs by flexing hips and knees until hips are completely flexed or knees are well above hips. Return until hips and knees are extended. Repeat.

WtVerticalStraightLegRaise.name: Weighted Vertical Straight Leg Raise
WtVerticalStraightLegRaise.preparation: Place weight between ankles or use no weight. Position forearms on padded parallel bars with hands on handles, and back on vertical pad.
WtVerticalStraightLegRaise.execution: With knees straight, raise legs by flexing hips until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Return until hips are extended. Repeat.

CBSeatedExternalRotation.name: Cable Seated Shoulder External Rotation
CBSeatedExternalRotation.preparation: Sit with side to low pulley. Grasp dumbbell cable attachment with far arm. Position elbow against side and forearm across belly.
CBSeatedExternalRotation.execution: Pull cable attachment away from body by externally rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Turn around and continue with opposite arm.
CBSeatedExternalRotation.comments: Maintain elbow against side and fixed elbow position (90° angle) throughout exercise. Exercise may be performed

CBStandingExternalRotation.name: Cable Standing Shoulder External Rotation
CBStandingExternalRotation.preparation: Stand with side to elbow height cable pulley. Grasp stirrup attachment with far arm. Position elbow against side and forearm across belly.
CBStandingExternalRotation.execution: Pull cable attachment away from body as far as possible by externally rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Turn around and continue with opposite arm.
CBStandingExternalRotation.comments: Maintain elbow against side and fixed elbow position (90° angle) throughout exercise. Exercise may be performed seated on chair with pulley lowered to elbow height or

DBLyingExternalRotation.name: Dumbbell Lying Shoulder External Rotation
DBLyingExternalRotation.preparation: Lie on side with legs separated for support. Grasp dumbbell and position elbow against side and forearm across belly.
DBLyingExternalRotation.execution: Lift dumbbell by rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Flip over and continue with opposite arm.
DBLyingExternalRotation.comments: Maintain elbow against side and fixed elbow position (90° angle) throughout exercise. Placing towel roll under arm increase infraspinatus and teres minor EMG signal activity compared to no towel roll (Wilk KE 2002), although subsequent study found no significant difference (Reinold MM 2004). Also see

DBInclineExternalRotation.name: Dumbbell Incline Shoulder External Rotation
DBInclineExternalRotation.preparation: Lie high up on low incline bench or reverse on decline bench on side with arm pit over leg pad (as demonstrated). Position legs lower on bench for support. Grasp dumbbell and position elbow against side and forearm across belly.
DBInclineExternalRotation.execution: Lift dumbbell upright above elbow by rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Flip body over and continue with opposite arm.
DBInclineExternalRotation.comments: Maintain elbow against side and fixed elbow position (90° angle) throughout exercise. Position incline as low as possible so dumbbell can still be aligned against gravity.

CBUprightExternalRotation.name: Cable Upright Shoulder External Rotation
CBUprightExternalRotation.preparation: Stand facing low to medium height cable pulley. Grasp stirrup attachment and position bent elbow shoulder height out to side with forearm in line with cable.
CBUprightExternalRotation.execution: Pull stirrup up and back as far as possible. Return by lowering stirrup to original position. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
CBUprightExternalRotation.comments: Wrist may be kept straighter throughout movement than what is shown. Also, keep elbow at shoulder height and bent at right angle. Height of cable pulley is dependent upon:

DBProneExternalRotation.name: Dumbbell Prone External Rotation
DBProneExternalRotation.preparation: Lie supine on bench with legs either on bench or down to each side. Grasp dumbbell with one hand and position forearm vertically with upper arm perpendicular to body.
DBProneExternalRotation.execution: Lift dumbbell forward and upward by externally rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Grasp with opposite hand, position bent arm out to side of body, and perform with other arm.
DBProneExternalRotation.comments: Maintain fixed 90° angle elbow position directly lateral to shoulder throughout exercise. Also see

DBProneInclineExternalRotation.name: Dumbbell Prone Incline External Rotation
DBProneInclineExternalRotation.preparation: Lie supine on incline bench with legs extended down to each side. Grasp dumbbell with one hand and position forearm vertically with upper arm perpendicular to body.
DBProneInclineExternalRotation.execution: Lift dumbbell forward and upward by externally rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Grasp with opposite hand, position bent arm out to side of body, and perform with other arm.
DBProneInclineExternalRotation.comments: Maintain fixed 90° angle elbow position directly lateral to shoulder throughout exercise. Lower Trapezius acts as stabilizer at lower bench angles whereas Upper Trapezius may act as stabilizer and higher bench angles. Also see

DBSeatedExternalRotation.name: Dumbbell Seated Shoulder External Rotation
DBSeatedExternalRotation.preparation: Sit on bench. Place foot on other side of bench and other foot on floor with knees bent. Place upper elbow on knee with dumbbell positioned above knee.
DBSeatedExternalRotation.execution: Lower dumbbell downward toward lower leg by rotating shoulder until slight stretch is felt. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
DBSeatedExternalRotation.comments: Throughout movement, keep bent elbow (approximately 90°) in front of body, chest or shoulder height.

DBUprightExternalRotation.name: Dumbbell Upright Shoulder External Rotation
DBUprightExternalRotation.preparation: Stand or sit with dumbbell positioned out to side of head; bend elbow, shoulder height with dumbbell above elbow.
DBUprightExternalRotation.execution: Lower dumbbell forward by rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
DBUprightExternalRotation.comments: Throughout movement, keep bent elbow (approximately 90°) out to side, shoulder height.

DBUprightExternalRotationSupport.name: Dumbbell Upright Shoulder External Rotation (with support)
DBUprightExternalRotationSupport.preparation: Stand or sit with side against chest height platform. With dumbbell in hand, position upper arm horizontally on platform, elbow bent so forearm is upright.
DBUprightExternalRotationSupport.execution: Lower dumbbell forward by rotating shoulder. Return and repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
DBUprightExternalRotationSupport.comments: Throughout movement, keep bent elbow (approximately 90°) out to side, shoulder height.

LVShoulderExternalRotationPL.name: Lever Shoulder External Rotation (plate loaded)
LVShoulderExternalRotationPL.preparation: Lie supine on section of bench nearest pads to each side. Position body so shoulders and elbows are aligned to fulcrum on each side. Place wrists or back of hands on under upper set of pads to each side.
LVShoulderExternalRotationPL.execution: Pull both lever arms back and down as far as possible to each side of head by simultaneously rotating upper arms. Lower lever arms to original position and repeat.
LVShoulderExternalRotationPL.comments: Those with shorter forearms whose wrists do not make contact with pad would utilize

LVExternalRotation.name: Lever Shoulder External Rotation
LVExternalRotation.preparation: Place elbow on forearm pad and grasp handle with upper arm to side of body and forearm against body.
LVExternalRotation.execution: Pull lever away from body. Return and repeat. Adjust lever to opposite side and repeat with other arm.
LVExternalRotation.comments: Adjust lever and body orientation to achieve full range of motion.

LVUprightExternalRotation.name: Lever Upright Shoulder External Rotation
LVUprightExternalRotation.preparation: Lever should be forward with lever handle down. Push elbow pad forward with forearm, grasp handle with overhand grip. Sit on seat with arm pads and lever to side and position in elbow pad at shoulder height. With opposite hand, grasp seat handle if available, for added stability.
LVUprightExternalRotation.execution: Pull lever handle upward and back as far as possible by rotating upper arm. Lower lever to original position. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
LVUprightExternalRotation.comments: Exercise can also be performed with

STShoulderExternalRotation.name: Suspended Shoulder External Rotation
STShoulderExternalRotation.preparation: Grasp suspension handles and position bent elbows to each sides of waist.
STShoulderExternalRotation.execution: Step back until suspension straps are taut. While keeping bent elbows to side, step forward slightly so body reclines back behind suspension handles.
STShoulderExternalRotation.comments: Pull handles apart from each side, while keeping fixed elbow position and body and legs straight throughout movement. Raise forward so handles are to each side of body. Return back until handles come back together in front of body. Repeat.

KBAlternatingSwingFlipCatch.name: Kettlebell Alternating Swing Flip Catch
KBAlternatingSwingFlipCatch.comments: As kettlebell approaches shoulder height decelerate handle so kettlebell begins to tilt back. Release kettlebell allowing it to gain height and flip end over end. As soon as kettlebell handle rotates back to top, grasp kettlebell handle with opposite hand. Return kettlebell between legs. Fold at hips while bending knees so forearm makes contact with inner thigh. Allow kettlebell to swing back under hips.

KBBentKneeWindmill.name: Kettlebell Bent-knee Windmill
KBBentKneeWindmill.preparation: Raise kettlebell overhead. Stand with left arm fully extended upward, supporting kettlebell and right arm down to side. Stand with legs far apart with feet angled slightly out to the sides.
KBBentKneeWindmill.execution: Bend over to right side and bend right knee. Reach toward arch of right foot with right hand. Keep left knee straight and kettlebell balanced over left shoulder with both arms extended. Slide right forearm along inner side of right lower leg until finger tips contact floor along side arch of foot. Raise back up to original position, maintaining balance of kettlebell overhead above left shoulder. Repeat. Continue movement on opposite side.
KBBentKneeWindmill.comments: Exercise emphasizes load balance and shoulder mobility. Since weight is shifted more to bent leg, those hip articulations are emphasized over the straight leg. Also see slightly more challenging

KBClean.name: Kettlebell Clean
KBClean.preparation: Straddle kettlebell with feet slightly wider apart than shoulder width. Squat down with arm extended downward between legs and grasp kettlebell handle with overhand grip. Position shoulder over kettlebell with taut low back and trunk close to vertical.
KBClean.execution: Pull kettlebell up off floor by extending hips and knees. Once kettlebell is off of ground, vigorously raise shoulder above kettlebell while keeping it close to body. Jump upward extending body. Raise shoulder and pull kettlebell upward with arm allowing elbow to bend out to side, keeping kettlebell close to body. Drop under kettlebell, rotating arm under kettlebell. Catch kettlebell on outside of arm with wrist straight while moving into partial squat position. Extend both legs.
KBClean.comments: Drop kettlebell by pulling elbow back. Immediately hop upward with elbow pointed outward continuing to hold on to kettlebell handle as it falls. Decelerate decent of kettlebell as heels make contact with ground and arm straightens. Lower kettlebell to ground between legs while squatting down with taut lower back and trunk close to vertical.

KBDeadlift.name: Kettlebell Deadlift
KBDeadlift.preparation: Stand between two kettlebells. Squat down with feet flat and grasp handles to sides. Position shoulders over kettlebells with taut low back.
KBDeadlift.execution: Pull kettlebells up off floor by extending hips and knees. Stand upright with chest high. Lower kettlebells to original position while squatting down with taut lower back.
KBDeadlift.comments: Keep feet flat on floor, hips low, and back taut throughout lift. Knees should point sam   e direction as feet throughout movement. Do not jerk weight from floor. See

KBCleanAndJerk.name: Kettlebell Clean and Press
KBCleanAndJerk.execution: Straddle kettlebell with feet slightly wider apart than shoulder width. Squat down with arm extended downward between legs and grasp kettlebell handle with overhand grip. Position shoulder over kettlebell with taut low back and trunk close to vertical.

KBFarmersWalk.name: Kettlebell Farmer's Walk
KBFarmersWalk.preparation: Squat down between two heavy kettlebells and grasp one in each hand. Deadlift kettlebells from floor using legs. Stand holding kettlebells with arms straight down to sides.
KBFarmersWalk.execution: Walk for distance while counting laps.
KBFarmersWalk.comments: Suggested lifting and lower technique from floor will be similar to

KBFrontSquat.name: Kettlebell Front Squat
KBFrontSquat.preparation: Hold two kettlebells in front of shoulders, one with each arm positioned close to body. Stand with feet shoulder width or slightly wider.
KBFrontSquat.execution: Bend knees slightly forward while allowing hips to bend back behind, keeping back taut and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
KBFrontSquat.comments: Wrist supporting kettlebell should be held straight. Keep head facing forward, back straight, chest high, arms straight to sides, and feet fl   at on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

KBGobletSquat.name: Kettlebell Goblet Squat
KBGobletSquat.preparation: Stand with shoulder width or wider stance. Hold kettleball by horns over chest with both hands.
KBGobletSquat.execution: Squat down by bending hips back while allowing knees to bend forward, keeping back straight and knees pointed same direction as feet. Descend until thighs are just past parallel to floor. Extend knees and hips until legs are straight. Return and repeat.
KBGobletSquat.comments: Keep head facing forward, back straight, chest high, and feet flat on floor; equal distribution of weight through forefoot and heel. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. See

KBOverheadRearLunge.name: Kettlebell Overhead Rear Lunge
KBOverheadRearLunge.preparation: kettlebell over head. Stand with arm fully extended upward supporting kettlebell.
KBOverheadRearLunge.execution: Step back with leg on opposite side of kettlebell while bending supporting leg. Plant forefoot far back on floor. Lower body by flexing knee and hip of supporting leg until knee of rear leg is almost in contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward supporting leg and return rear leg next to supporting leg. Repeat. Clean and Jerk weight with opposite arm and lunge on other leg.

KBOverheadSplitSquat.name: Kettlebell Overhead Split Squat
KBOverheadSplitSquat.preparation: kettlebell over head. Stand with feet far apart; leg on side of kettlebell should be placed behind and opposite foot should be positioned forward. Arm should be fully extended upward supporting kettlebell.
KBOverheadSplitSquat.execution: Squat down by flexing knee and hip of front leg. Allow heel of rear foot to rise up while knee of rear leg bends slightly, until it almost makes contact with floor. Return to original standing position by extending hip and knee of forward leg. Repeat. Clean and Jerk weight with opposite arm and squat with other leg forward.
KBOverheadSplitSquat.comments: Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Heel of rear foot can be kept elevated off floor throughout movement as shown. Keep torso upright during squat;

KBPress.name: Kettlebell Press
KBPress.execution: from floor and position in front of chest with kettlebell against outside of arm. Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder's width apart.
KBPress.comments: Press kettlebell upward until arm is extended overhead. Lower to front of chest and repeat. Reposition kettlebell to opposite arm and continue.

KBSnatch.name: Kettlebell Snatch
KBSnatch.preparation: Stand behind kettlebell with feet slightly wider apart than shoulder width. Bend over at hip with knees bent and back straight. Extend arm downward and grasp kettlebell handle with overhand grip. Lift kettlebell off of floor and pull forearm against inner thighs while keeping hips and knees bent with low back taut.
KBSnatch.execution: Drive hips forward, torso upright, and knees straight so kettlebell is pushed forward and upward. As kettlebell begins to swing forward vigorously raise shoulder above kettlebell. As kettlebell begins to swing up past the hips, pull kettlebell toward body slightly with elbow pointing outward. As the kettlebell continues to rise slightly, decelerate rise of handle allowing kettlebell to rotate in hand into inverted position. Punch kettlebell upward in an overhead straight arm position with kettlebell positioned behind forearm.
KBSnatch.comments: Swing kettlebell forward and downward. As kettlebell is swung to lower position, fold at hips while bending knees. Allow forearm to make contact with inner thigh, swing kettlebell back under hips, and repeat movement. To stop exercise, place kettlebell on floor. Continue with opposite arm.

KBStraightLegDeadlift.name: Kettlebell Straight-leg Deadlift
KBStraightLegDeadlift.preparation: Stand straddling kettlebell. With knees straight, bend over and grasp kettlebell handle.
KBStraightLegDeadlift.execution: Lift kettlebell upward and back to side by extending hips and waist until standing upright. Pull shoulder back if rounded. With knees straight, lower kettlebell between feet by bending hips and twisting waist so shoulder of weighted side is turned forward. Allow hips to fall back and waist to bend as kettlebell approaches floor. Repeat. Perform exercise with opposite arm.
KBStraightLegDeadlift.comments: Begin with very light weight and add additional weight gradually to allow lower back adequate

KBSplitSnatch.name: Kettlebell Split Snatch
KBSplitSnatch.preparation: Stand behind kettlebell with feet slightly wider apart than shoulder width. Bend over at hip with knees bent and back straight. Extend arm downward and grasp kettlebell handle with overhand grip. Lift kettlebell off of floor and pull forearm against inner thighs while keeping hips and knees bent with low back taut.
KBSplitSnatch.execution: Drive hips forward, torso upright, and knees straight so kettlebell is pushed forward and upward. As kettlebell begins to swing forward vigorously raise shoulder above kettlebell. As kettlebell begins to swing up past the hips, pull kettlebell toward body with elbow pointing outward and initiate jump into split position. As kettlebell continues to rise, decelerate rise of handle allowing kettlebell to rotate in hand into inverted position. Land on feet in lunge position. Punch kettlebell upward in overhead straight arm position with kettlebell positioned behind forearm.
KBSplitSnatch.comments: Stand up and begin positioning feet together while swinging kettlebell downward from overhead.

KBSumoDeadlift.name: Kettlebell Sumo Deadlift
KBSumoDeadlift.preparation: Straddle kettlebell with feet slightly wider apart than shoulder width. Squat down with arms extended downward between legs and grasp kettlebell handle with overhand grip with both hands. Position shoulders over kettlebell with taut low back and trunk close to vertical.
KBSumoDeadlift.execution: Pull kettlebell up off floor by extending hips and knees. Stand upright with chest high. Lower kettlebell to ground between legs while squatting down with taut lower back and trunk close to vertical.
KBSumoDeadlift.comments: Keep feet flat on floor, hips low, and back taut thoughout lift. Knees should point same direction as feet throughout movement. Do not jerk weight from floor. Also see

KBSwing.name: Kettlebell Swing
KBSwing.preparation: Stand behind kettlebell with feet slightly wider apart than shoulder width. Bend over at hip with knees bent and back straight. Extend arm downward and grasp kettlebell handle with overhand grip. Lift kettlebell off of floor and pull forearm against inner thighs while keeping hips and knees bent with low back taut.
KBSwing.execution: Drive hips forward, torso upright, and knees straight so kettlebell is pushed forward and upward. Allow kettlebell to swing back down. As kettlebell approaches lower position, fold at hips while bending knees. Forearm makes contact with inner thigh permitting kettlebell to   swing back under hips. Immediately repeat movement and continue to swing kettlebell. Maintain shoulder to eye level height swings.
KBSwing.comments: Swing kettlebell back down between legs. Allow kettlebell to swing forward, but do not extend hips and knees (as would be required to continue the swing). Slow kettlebell's swing and place on floor in original deadlift posture.

KBTurkishGetup.name: Kettlebell Turkish Get-up
KBTurkishGetup.preparation: Lie supine on floor with kettlebell positioned next to right upper arm. Grasp handle with bent right arm.
KBTurkishGetup.comments: Keep arm supporting kettlebell fully extended over shoulder throughout movement except when lifting and lowering it from floor in lying position. In seated position, keep chest high with spine extended.

KBTwoArmOverheadSwing.name: Kettlebell Two Arm Overhead Swing
KBTwoArmOverheadSwing.preparation: Stand behind kettlebell with feet slightly wider apart than shoulder width. Bend over at hip with knees bent and back straight. Extend arms downward and grasp kettlebell handle with both hands using overhand grip. Lift kettlebell off of floor and pull forearms against inner thighs while keeping hips and knees bent with low back taut.
KBTwoArmOverheadSwing.execution: Drive hips forward, torso upright, and knees straight so kettlebell is pushed forward and upward overhead. Allow kettlebell to swing back down. As kettlebell approaches lower position, fold at hips while bending knees. Forearms make contact with inner thighs permitting kettlebell to swing back under hips. Immediately repeat movement and continue to swing kettlebell.
KBTwoArmOverheadSwing.comments: Swing kettlebell back down between legs. Allow kettlebell to swing forward but do not extend hips and knees (as would be required to continue the swing). Slow kettlebell's swing and place on floor in original deadlift posture.

KBTwoArmSwing.name: Kettlebell Two Arm Swing
KBTwoArmSwing.preparation: Stand behind kettlebell with feet slightly wider apart than shoulder width. Bend over at hip with knees bent and back straight. Extend arms downward and grasp kettlebell handle with both hands using overhand grip. Lift kettlebell off of floor and pull forearms against inner thighs while keeping hips and knees bent with low back taut.
KBTwoArmSwing.execution: Drive hips forward, torso upright, and knees straight so kettlebell is pushed forward and upward. Allow kettlebell to swing back down. As kettlebell approaches lower position, fold at hips while bending knees. Forearms make contact with inner thighs permitting kettlebell to swing back under hips. Immediately repeat movement and continue to swing kettlebell. Maintain shoulder to eye level height swings.
KBTwoArmSwing.comments: Swing kettlebell back down between legs. Allow kettlebell to swing forward but do not extend hips and knees (as would be required to continue the swing). Slow kettlebell's swing and place on floor in original deadlift posture.
