KBWindmill.name: Kettlebell Windmill
KBWindmill.preparation: Raise kettlebell over head. Stand with left arm fully extended upward supporting kettlebell and right arm extended out to side. Stand with legs far apart with feet angled slightly out to the sides.
KBWindmill.execution: Bend over to right side with knees straight. Reach toward toes of left foot with right hand. Keep knees straight and kettlebell balanced over left shoulder with both arms extended. Touch left foot. Raise back up to original position, maintaining balance of kettlebell over head above left shoulder. Repeat. Continue movement on opposite side.
KBWindmill.comments: Exercise emphasizes load balance, shoulder mobility, and hamstring flexibility. Also see

KBTwoArmSwingCatch.name: Kettlebell Two Arm Swing Catch
KBTwoArmSwingCatch.comments: As kettlebell rises vertically in front of chest, pull kettlebell inward slightly and quickly release grip. Immediately rotate wrists while pointing bent elbows downward. As kettlebell begins to fall back down, grasp kettlebell handle with both hands with underhand grip. Immediately bend over at hips while bending knees. Allow arms to straighten and forearms to make contact with inner thighs while kettlebell swings back under hips.

ASChinupBand.name: Band-assisted Chin-up
ASChinupBand.preparation: Grab each side of hanging exercise band with both hands. Stretch exercise band down and step onto bottom inside of band with one foot. Stretch band down further by extending leg straight down. Reach up and grasp bar with underhand shoulder width grip while keeping banded leg straight.
ASChinupBand.execution: Pull body up until elbows are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
ASChinupBand.comments: At conclusion of set, step down with free foot at bottom of exercises. Dismount band by grasping each side of exercise band, stretch exercise band down, and step out. Continuing to hold on to each side of band while allowing band to contract to normal length.

ASNeutralGripPullupFootBand.name: Band-assisted Neutral Grip Pull-up
ASNeutralGripPullupFootBand.execution: Pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
ASNeutralGripPullupFootBand.comments: Special angled pull-up bar assembly is shown.

ASNeutralGripChinupBand.name: Band-assisted Neutral Grip Chin-up
ASNeutralGripChinupBand.preparation: Grab each side of hanging exercise band with both hands. Stretch exercise band down and step onto bottom inside of band with one foot. Stretch band down further by extending leg straight down. Reach up and grasp bars angled inward with underhand shoulder width grip while keeping banded leg straight.
ASNeutralGripChinupBand.execution: Pull body up until elbows are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
ASNeutralGripChinupBand.comments: At conclusion of set, step down with free foot at bottom of exercises. Dismount band by grasping each side of exercise band, stretch exercise band down, and step out. Continuing to hold on to each side of band while allowing band to contract to normal length.

ASOpenCenteredPullupBand.name: Band-assisted Open Centered Pull-up
ASOpenCenteredPullupBand.preparation: Grab each side of hanging exercise band with both hands. Stretch exercise band down and place bent knee inside of band. Stretch band down further by pointing knee downward. Reach up and grasp bars to each side with wide overhand grip.
ASOpenCenteredPullupBand.execution: Pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
ASOpenCenteredPullupBand.comments: Range of motion will decrease if grip is

ASParallelGripPullupBand.name: Band-assisted Parallel Grip Pull-up
ASParallelGripPullupBand.execution: Pull body up until elbow are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
ASParallelGripPullupBand.comments: To increase difficulty, use thinner band or place bent knee onto bottom inside of band. See video Band-assisted

ASPullupBand.name: Band-assisted Pull-up
ASPullupBand.preparation: Grab each side of hanging exercise band with both hands. Stretch exercise band down and step onto bottom inside of band with one foot. Stretch band down further by extending leg straight down. Reach up and grasp bar with overhand wide grip while keeping banded leg straight.
ASPullupBand.execution: Pull body up until chin is above bar. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
ASPullupBand.comments: Free foot can be placed on top of foot in band for safety in case band slips from foot. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

ASRearPullupBand.name: Band-assisted Rear Pull-up
ASRearPullupBand.preparation: Grasp middle of hanging exercise band and pull down to side of leg. Lift foot and hook band under heel. Stretch band down further by extending leg straight down. Face perpendicular under pullup bar and position band behind body. Pull band apart and place other foot onto band so both feet are together inside of band. Reach up and grasp pull-up bar with overhand wide grip while keeping legs straight.
ASRearPullupBand.execution: Pull body up until bar touches back of neck. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
ASRearPullupBand.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

ASRearPullupSelf.name: Self-assisted Rear Pull-up
ASRearPullupSelf.preparation: Grasp bar with overhand wide grip. Position forefeet on floor just behind low bar or on bench just behind high bar.
ASRearPullupSelf.execution: Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. If necessary, use minimal assistance of lower body to control descent allowing knees to bend. Pull body up until bar touches back of neck, again with minimal assistance from lower body. Repeat.
ASRearPullupSelf.comments: If bar is too low, knees may need to spread apart at bottom of motion (as shown) to achieve full range of motion. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

AsChinupPartner.name: Partner-assisted Pull-up
AsChinupPartner.preparation: Step up and grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Bend knees so partner can assist from behind.
AsChinupPartner.execution: Pull body up until chin is just above bar. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
AsChinupPartner.comments: Partner can assist as needed by pulling ankles or top feet up from behind. Exercise can be used until

AsCloseGripChinup.name: Machine-assisted Parallel Close Grip Pull-up (standing)
AsCloseGripChinup.preparation: Step up and grasp parallel grips. Step down onto assistance lever or platform.
AsCloseGripChinup.execution: Pull body up until elbow are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.

AsChinupSelf.name: Self-assisted Pull-up
AsChinupSelf.preparation: Stand facing fixed horizontal bar at neck height. Grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Position feet forward on floor, slightly in front of bar.
AsChinupSelf.execution: Lower body under bar until arms and shoulders are fully extended. If necessary, use minimal assistance of lower body to control descent, allowing knees and hips to bend, keeping flat on floor. Pull body up until chin is just above bar, again with minimal assistance from legs. Repeat.
AsChinupSelf.comments: If lower body is used for assistance,

AsCloseGripChinupKneeling.name: Machine-assisted Parallel Close Grip Pull-up
AsCloseGripChinupKneeling.preparation: Step up and grasp parallel grips. Kneel on padded platform and lower body down with arm extended.
AsCloseGripChinupKneeling.execution: Pull body up until elbows are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.

AsPullupKneeling.name: Machine-assisted Pull-up
AsPullupKneeling.preparation: Step up and grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Kneel on padded platform and lower body down with arm extended.
AsPullupKneeling.execution: Pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.

AsPullupOpen.name: Machine-assisted Pull-up (open-centered bar, standing)
AsPullupOpen.preparation: Step up and grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Step down onto assistance lever or platform.
AsPullupOpen.execution: Pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
AsPullupOpen.comments: Some assisted machines require you to

AsPullupOpenKneeling.name: Machine-assisted Pull-up (open-centered bar)
AsPullupOpenKneeling.preparation: Step up and grasp bar with wide overhand grip. Kneel on padded platform and lower body down with arm extended.
AsPullupOpenKneeling.execution: Pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.

AsRearPullupPartner.name: Partner-assisted Rear Pull-up
AsRearPullupPartner.preparation: Step up and grasp bar with overhand wide grip. Bend knees so partner can assist from behind.
AsRearPullupPartner.execution: Pull body up until bar touches back of neck. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
AsRearPullupPartner.comments: Partner can assist as needed by pulling ankles or top feet up from behind. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

AsUnderhandChinup.name: Machine-assisted Chin-up
AsUnderhandChinup.preparation: Step up and grasp bar with underhand shoulder width grip. Kneel onto platform or step onto bar.
AsUnderhandChinup.execution: Pull body up until elbows are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.

AsUnderhandChinupSelf.name: Self-assisted Chin-up
AsUnderhandChinupSelf.preparation: Stand facing fixed horizontal bar at neck height. Grasp bar with underhand grip shoulder width. Position feet forward on floor, slightly in front of bar.
AsUnderhandChinupSelf.execution: Lower body under bar until arms and shoulders are fully extended. If necessary, use minimal assistance of lower body to control descent, allowing knees and hips to bend, keeping flat on floor. Pull body up until elbows are to sides, again with minimal assistance from lower body. Repeat.
AsUnderhandChinupSelf.comments: If lower body is used for assistance,

AsUnderhandChinupPartner.name: Partner-assisted Chin-up
AsUnderhandChinupPartner.preparation: Step up and grasp bar with underhand shoulder width grip. Bend knees so partner can assist from behind.
AsUnderhandChinupPartner.execution: Pull body up until elbows are to sides or chin is just above bar. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
AsUnderhandChinupPartner.comments: Partner can assist as needed by pulling ankles or top feet up from behind. Also see

BBBentArmPullover.name: Barbell Bent Arm Pullover
BBBentArmPullover.preparation: Lie upper back perpendicular on bench. Flex hips slightly. Grasp barbell from behind and position over chest with elbows bent approximately 90°.
BBBentArmPullover.execution: With elbow bent, lower bar over and just behind head until upper arm is approximately parallel to torso. Return and repeat.
BBBentArmPullover.comments: Keep elbows bent approximately 90° throughout exercise. Keep hips from raising up significantly. Either straight barbell or EZ barbell can be used. Also see

BBPullover.name: Barbell Pullover
BBPullover.preparation: Lie upper back perpendicular on bench. Flex hips slightly. Grasp barbell from behind and position over chest with elbows bent slightly.
BBPullover.execution: With elbows bent slightly, lower bar over and beyond head until shoulders are fully flexed or upper arms are approximately parallel to torso. Return and repeat.
BBPullover.comments: Lower body extending off of bench acts as counter balance to resistance and keeps upper back fixed on bench. Avoid hips from raising up significantly. Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility. Keep elbows fixed at small bend throughout exercise. Either straight barbell or EZ barbell can be used. Also see

BWCloseGripChinup.name: Parallel Close Grip Pull-up
BWCloseGripChinup.preparation: Step up and grasp parallel bars.
BWCloseGripChinup.execution: Pull body up until elbow are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
BWCloseGripChinup.comments: To decrease difficulty, use assisted version of this exercise.

BWNeutralGripChinup.name: Neutral Grip Chin-up
BWNeutralGripChinup.preparation: Reach up and grasp bars angled inward with underhand shoulder width grip.
BWNeutralGripChinup.execution: Pull body up until elbows are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
BWNeutralGripChinup.comments: To decrease difficulty, use assisted version of exercise.

BWPullupN.name: Neutral Grip Pull-up
BWPullupN.preparation: Step up and grasp bar with neutral grip.
BWPullupN.execution: Pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
BWPullupN.comments: Special angled pull-up bar assembly is shown.

BWPullup.name: Pull-up
BWPullup.preparation: Step up and grasp bar with overhand wide grip.
BWPullup.execution: Pull body up until chin is above bar. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
BWPullup.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

BWPullupOpen.name: Pull-up (open-centered bar)
BWPullupOpen.preparation: Reach up and grasp bars to each side with wide overhand grip.
BWPullupOpen.execution: Pull body up until neck reaches height of hands. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
BWPullupOpen.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

BWRearPullup.name: Rear Pull-up
BWRearPullup.preparation: Step up and grasp bar with overhand wide grip.
BWRearPullup.execution: Pull body up until bar touches back of neck. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
BWRearPullup.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

BWUnderhandChinup.name: Chin-up
BWUnderhandChinup.preparation: Step up and grasp bar with underhand shoulder width grip.
BWUnderhandChinup.execution: Pull body up until elbows are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
BWUnderhandChinup.comments: To decrease difficulty, use assisted version of exercise.

CBAlternatingCloseGripPulldown.name: Cable Alternating Close Grip Pulldown
CBAlternatingCloseGripPulldown.preparation: Grasp stirrups in each hand. Sit with thighs under supports.
CBAlternatingCloseGripPulldown.execution: Pull down one cable attachment to side of chest. Return until arm and shoulder is fully extended. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.

CBAlternatingPulldown.name: Cable Alternating Pulldown
CBAlternatingPulldown.preparation: Grasp stirrups in each hand. Sit with thighs under supports.
CBAlternatingPulldown.execution: Pull down one cable attachment to front side shoulder. Return until arm and shoulder are fully extended. Repeat with opposite arm, alternating between sides.

CBAlternatingStandingPulldown.name: Cable Alternating Standing Pulldown
CBAlternatingStandingPulldown.preparation: Grasp stirrups in each hand. Lean forward and step back with one foot so stance is staggered. Position hands with underhand or neutral grip.
CBAlternatingStandingPulldown.execution: Pull down one cable attachment to front of shoulder. Return until arm and shoulder are fully extended. Repeat movement with opposite arm, alternating between sides.
CBAlternatingStandingPulldown.comments: Video shows appartus with stirrups attached to dual pulley.

CBCloseGripPulldown.name: Cable Close Grip Pulldown
CBCloseGripPulldown.preparation: Grasp parallel cable attachment. Sit with thighs under supports.
CBCloseGripPulldown.execution: Pull down cable attachment to upper chest. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
CBCloseGripPulldown.comments: Exercise can be performed with V-Bar or Multi-exercise Bar.

CBBentoverPullover.name: Cable Bent-over Pullover
CBBentoverPullover.preparation: Face high pulley and grasp revolving cable attachment with arm slightly bent. Place one foot slightly back and bend over at hip until shoulder is fully flexed (upper arms at sides of head).
CBBentoverPullover.execution: With elbows fixed approximately 30°, pull cable attachment down until upper arms are to sides. Return attachment overhead. Repeat.
CBBentoverPullover.comments: Fix elbows approximately 30° throughout exercise. Also known as Straight Arm Pulldown.

CBCloseGripPulldownStirrups.name: Cable Close Grip Pulldown (stirrups)
CBCloseGripPulldownStirrups.preparation: Grasp stirrups in each hand. Sit with thighs under supports.
CBCloseGripPulldownStirrups.execution: Pull down cable attachments to sides of chest. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.

CBFrontPulldown.name: Cable Pulldown
CBFrontPulldown.preparation: Grasp cable bar with wide grip. Sit with thighs under supports.
CBFrontPulldown.execution: Pull down cable bar to upper chest. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
CBFrontPulldown.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

CBFrontPulldownProLatBar.name: Cable Pulldown (pro lat bar)
CBFrontPulldownProLatBar.preparation: Grasp pro lat bar with wide parallel grip. Sit with thighs under supports.
CBFrontPulldownProLatBar.execution: Pull down cable bar to upper chest. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
CBFrontPulldownProLatBar.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

CBKneelingBentoverPullover.name: Cable Kneeling Bent-over Pulldown
CBKneelingBentoverPullover.preparation: Kneel on mat slightly away from high pulley. Grasp cable rope attachment with both hands. Sit with hips back and bend down by flexing hips so torso is bent over at approximately 30º angle. Allow resistance on cable pulley to pull arms upward with elbows bent.
CBKneelingBentoverPullover.execution: Pull cable rope down until elbows are back and inside of rope attachment is behind neck. Return attachment over head until shoulder is completely flexed upward. Repeat.
CBKneelingBentoverPullover.comments: Keep hips and torso in same position throughout movement.

CBOneArmKneelingPulldown.name: Cable One Arm Kneeling Pulldown
CBOneArmKneelingPulldown.preparation: Grasp stirrup in one hand and kneel on floor.
CBOneArmKneelingPulldown.execution: Pull down cable attachment to side of chest. Return until arm and shoulder is fully extended, allowing shoulder to raise. Repeat and continue with other arm.
CBOneArmKneelingPulldown.comments: Muscles listed as Stabilizers become Synergists if

CBOneArmPulldown.name: Cable One Arm Pulldown
CBOneArmPulldown.preparation: Grasp stirrup in one hand. Sit with thighs under supports.
CBOneArmPulldown.execution: Pull down cable attachment to side of chest. Return until arm and shoulder is fully extended, allowing shoulder to raise. Repeat and continue with other arm.
CBOneArmPulldown.comments: Muscles listed as Stabilizers become Synergists if

CBParallelCloseGripChinup.name: Cable Parallel Close Grip Pull-up
CBParallelCloseGripChinup.preparation: Place dip belt around waist. Kneel as close as possible to low pulley or lever and attach hook to dip belt in front between legs. Step up and grasp close grip p   arallel bars with hands facing inward. Lift legs off of steps or floor.
CBParallelCloseGripChinup.execution: Pull body up until elbow are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
CBParallelCloseGripChinup.comments: If weight bottoms out at bottom of movement, attach cable on chain links nearer ends of dip belt.

CBParallelGripChinup.name: Cable Parallel Grip Pull-up
CBParallelGripChinup.preparation: Place dip belt around waist. Kneel as close as possible to low pulley or lever and attach hook to dip belt in front between legs. Step up and grasp parallel bars with hands facing inward. Lift legs off of steps or floor.
CBParallelGripChinup.execution: Pull body up until elbow are to sides. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
CBParallelGripChinup.comments: This particular apparatus could arguably be referred to as lever machine since dip belt attaches to lever arm, although relatively free movement between lever and dip belt offers qualities similar to cable machine. If weight bottoms out at bottom of movement, attach cable on chain links nearer ends of dip belt.

CBParallelGripPulldown.name: Cable Parallel Grip Pulldown
CBParallelGripPulldown.preparation: Grasp parallel cable attachment. Sit with thighs under supports.
CBParallelGripPulldown.execution: Pull down cable attachment to upper chest. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
CBParallelGripPulldown.comments: Parallel Grip Cable Attachment is shorter than

CBPulldownStirrups.name: Cable Pulldown (stirrups)
CBPulldownStirrups.preparation: Grasp stirrups in each hand. Sit with thighs under supports.
CBPulldownStirrups.execution: Pull down cable attachments to front sides of shoulders. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.

CBPullover.name: Cable Pullover
CBPullover.preparation: Lie upper back perpendicular on bench. Flex hips slightly, so hips are slightly lower than torso. Grasp revolving barbell cable attachment from behind. Pull to position cable attachment over chest. Fix elbows with small bend.
CBPullover.execution: Lower cable attachment toward pulley with elbows bent only slightly. Lower until shoulders are fully flexed or upper arms are in-line with upper torso. Raise cable attachment over head and continue toward lower body until cable becomes very close to head. Repeat.
CBPullover.comments: Lower body extending off of bench acts as counter balance to resistance and keeps upper back fixed on bench. Avoid hips from raising up significantly. Actual range of motion is dependent upon individual shoulder flexibility. Keep elbows fixed at small bend throughout exercise.

CBPullup.name: Cable Pull-up
CBPullup.preparation: Place dip belt around waist. Kneel close to low pulley or lever and attach hook to dip belt. Step up and grasp bars with overhand wide grip. Lift legs off of steps or floor.
CBPullup.execution: Pull body up until chin is above bar. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
CBPullup.comments: If weight bottoms out at bottom of movement, attach cable on chain links nearer ends of dip belt. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

CBRearPulldown.name: Cable Rear Pulldown
CBRearPulldown.preparation: Grasp cable bar with wide grip. Sit with thighs under supports.
CBRearPulldown.execution: Pull cable bar down behind neck. Return until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
CBRearPulldown.comments: Range of motion will be compromised if grip is

CBRearPullup.name: Cable Rear Pull-up
CBRearPullup.preparation: Place dip belt around waist. Kneel close to low pulley or lever and attach hook to dip belt. Step up and grasp bars with overhand wide grip. Lift legs off of steps or floor.
CBRearPullup.execution: Pull body up until bar touches back of neck. Lower body until arms and shoulders are fully extended. Repeat.
CBRearPullup.comments: If weight bottoms out at bottom of motion, attach cable on chain links nearer ends of dip belt. Range of motion will be compromised if grip is
